title: Amazing experience!
text:
I had an amazing stay at the Empire Hotel!
Great location (you can’t do better: by the park, Lincoln center, some many choices of restaurants and shops), very friendly staff, clean rooms. Would definitely come back everytime I’m in town!
Special shoutout to Steven who has been super nice during my stay.

title: Excellent customer service thanks Niya!
text: Had a great experience today and the absolute best support from Niya who helped me book my room! She understands the importance of great customer service. And the room was  beautiful and clean, my girlfriend and I really loved it. Thanks again for a great experience.

title: Great stay
text:
Pasquale and Fatima were a great help at the front desk! Very accommodating and friendly. 

I stay at the empire frequently and would recommend it for a great ny stay, close to the park and great restaurants. 

Thanks Empire, Pasquale, Fatima and team!

title: Amazing experience and staff especially Steven
text: We were spending our honeymoon, and the staff was amazing! Especially Steven, who was extremely professional and genuinely helpful with all the details. Thank you for an amazing experience. The lobby, room, location and everything is phenomenal.

title: Amazing concierge Niya, unsecured wifi and some ppl are perks about it
text:
I'm going to start with the best part of  my experience and that was walking into the beautiful lobby and having Niya check me in. I had an important meeting the next day so even though I live in nyc, I decided to stay near my appointment the night before. I've gone to the rooftop since my college days but never stayed at the hotel so I was SO EXCITED when Niya upgraded me to a room with a view of Lincoln Center! She was so cheery, helpful and made the check-in a breeze! She was super helpful with all my questions and I Def recommend seeking her out if you need anything. 

Now the not-so-great. First, their wifi is NOT secure, it's not password protected and my more knowledgeable friends confirmed that I should not use it - that's how data breaches and stolen PWs happen! When I asked about the password and questioned the security, the absolute opposite person of Niya asked if I was CIA and what was I doing that was so secretive that I needed a password protected connection. He was beyond rude and just challenged me asking repeatedly what I was doing online that I needed secure wifi. It was embarrassing. 

The room was a deluxe king and I loved the view although the windows could use a cleaning and only open a couple of inches. It's definitely due for a makeover but the location, lobby, rooftop, view and Niya absolutely made the experience and I woke up energized and ready for my meeting!

title: Great Stay! Ty Steven! 🫶🏼
text: My girlfriends & I came to the empire for a quick two day exploration trip on the way to Europe & it did not disappoint. We stayed at the empire because it seemed to be close to everything. The hotel was gorgeous & at check in Steven was the absolute best. Not our first time in nyc but he was able to give us recommendations on things to do as we had no specific plans. The rooms were lovely with the exception of a slight issue with the shower head which was resolved super quick after we got to our room. Would absolutely come back next time we are in the city for the convenience & Steven’s customer service alone. Hilarious & charming Steven is a keeper! & the entire staff is super friendly and accommodating as well. See you soon!

title: Not the luxury we were expecting.  Plenty of cheaper rooms elsewhere in the city with must better service.
text:
Customer service is horrible!
We come to NYC three or four times a year and typically stay in Hilton or Marriott properties.  
Because we had a Metropolitan Opera membership discount, we sprung for a corner suite at the Embassy—an “upgrade” if you will. 

It took over 3 hours to get onto our room.  We tried to take a lesser room as people with smaller rooms were strolling right in.  Finally, after 3 hours and 20 minutes, we were told that it would be only be 10-15 minutes more—thirty minutes ago.

Writing in real time: Just got into our corner suite.  As we were changing our clothes, housekeeping comes barreling through the door with a bed scarf. 

What was supposed to be a one-day trip to the opera (a la “Pretty Woman”) turned into sleeping in the lobby with loud, annoying jazz blaring.

title: Spectacular Stay
text: The hotel was lovely and the customer service was incredible! Stephen at the front desk took great care of me and made the trip really special. He went the extra mile to make me feel welcome and make our NYC experience spectacular! Looking forward to staying here again next trip!

title: Thank you for the stay
text: Steven was an excellent guest advisor!  Helped us and was super nice! The room was amazing and the views were awesome. Loved the space and the huge TVs. This is a great place for families. Will definitely come back! Thanks for an amazing stay and thank you Steven for making our trip even easier!

title: Pretty, but………..
text: The lobby is beautiful, the rooms overall look was fine, but there were issues. The water in our shower was brown every time we turned it on. We can away with bed bug bites galore. The AC/ heat  never regulated we ended up just opening the windows.

title: Amazing hotel 🏨!!!
text: Went for a romantic getaway…Beautiful hotel 🏨….Five stars ⭐️ all the way!  Steps from Lincoln center and all the midtown Manhattan attractions!!  Rooftop bar was a plus!! Steven at the front desk was very accommodating!! Perfect city 🌃 weekend🩷

title: Exceptional.
text: The room was very nice and clean, with a jazzy feel. We stayed for only one night but the staff were incredibly accommodating and polite. The location was fantastic, very central. A special call out to manager Adam, who made sure our stay comfortable, safe and enjoyable.

title: Absolutely first rate
text: For service and convenience the Empire is hard to beat. Pasquale and his crew have become like members of our extended family. We have gone to New York frequently over the years, and we have stayed in many different hotels. Once we discovered the Empire we would not stay anywhere else.

title: Easy and Good First Time at this hotel
text: The staff is tremendous especially Fatima who registered me into the hotel snd Dennis who took care of my baggage and airport cab.  Room had two small issues and housekeeping got both resolved immediately.  Housekeeping staff were very nice and helpful.  Location is perfect for anything from shopping and of course Lincoln Center events.

title: No sleep
text: I was in room 304. The corridors and room are VERY dark, the furniture was worn, no view, but all of that could be overlooked. What I can't overlook is that the heater in the room would not turn off/ could not change the temperature and it became sweltering hot. It also made horrible squealing and banging sounds all night so I got NO sleep and had to work in the morning. I was very disappointed. It wasn't the pleasant experience I had hoped for. I told front desk staff in the morning and they were nice about it. I hope they fix the issue for future guests.

title: Perfectly located next to the Lincoln Center
text: I stay at the Empire Hotel a lot because it is so convenient to SAB and NYCB. It is literally across the road from the Lincoln Center, so you can’t beat the location. The suites are very spacious with great views of the Lincoln Center. I had a minor issue with a blind not working in my room and the manager, Adam Maikarfi, was great and quickly resolved the issue. He is a pleasure to deal with and was incredibly friendly and professional. The front desk staff are always very helpful and polite. If you book directly, you can get a 1 pm check out for free and they will also hold your luggage for you too after you check out. The only downside is that they don’t have a loyalty rewards program but after speaking with the manager, Adam, he assured me there are perks for repeat customers if you flag that with them. Another plus is that they are also pet friendly! If you have a student at SAB or Julliard, you can’t beat this hotel!!

title: My regular hotel in New York
text: The hotel is located in on old building, but it is very clean. The location next to Cenral Park and opposite the Lincoln Center is ideal. The staff is friendly and helpful. Especially house keeping works well. The bed is made daily with mangled white sheets. There are plenty of pillows. In the bathroom daily clean, white fluffy towels. I recommend.

title: Great Help!
text: The front desk team was extremely helpful!  We had to navigate some corporate card issues and they were patient, helpful, and courteous throughout the process.  This is a recurring trip and we are definitely looking at returning.  Kudos to Adam, Steve and the whole team.

title: One of the best neighborhoods in NYC
text: The front desk staff was outstanding.  Niya, in particular,  was super!  She went out of her way to accommodate our requests promptly and professionally.  The lobby is beautiful and elegant and gives a feeling of the wonderful neighborhood (great restaurants and coffee shops).  Parking is convenient too, but you don't need to drive anyway!.  Taxis and subways are easier and more economical.  If you're an opera/symphony/ballet lover, as we are, this is the best hotel to stay in. It's just outside one of the most culturally rich districts in the world!  Thanks for a wonderful stay.  Niya is a keeper :)

title: The EMPIRE has fallen!!!!!!!!!
text:
Bed was fine. Clean. Service people nice. Fitness Room was awesome. BUT, heat didn't work. someone else was at desk same time I was. Heat either all ON, or all OFF.  Hello, its winter!  Always book through hotels.com OR you will be charged double if you book direct. Then, on top of that, Empire will charge a $150 fee, that oops, they forget to reimburse. So not only did they overcharge for an unheated room, then they billed an extra $150.  That is if they can find you reservation in the first place!!!!!!!! small extras: The bathroom hook, in TINY bathroom,  is 7ft up in the air...as well as the complimentary face mirror!  The desk and chair looks like it was chewed by a dog.  And good luck finding a plug.  No full restaurant or breakfast! ( i was traveling with a 90 y.o... we had to go out into the rainy, windy, cold for breakfast!!)

Stayed 3 nights, 2 rooms, and they treated EACH room, each night as a separate reservation! we had to checkout and checkin EACH day!!  WTF

title: Excellent staff, wonderful hotel
text: We had an amazing time at the Empire Hotel!  My husband and I were immediately warmly greeted when we arrived and the front desk staff went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful.  They were kind, helpful, and really elevated our experience at every turn.  We will happily be staying here again!

title: Steven at the front desk was extremely helpful
text:
Hotel was in an excellent location for that particular stay . 
Lobby was pretty . Steven at the front desk was amazing . So helpful and cheerful. As well as the servers in the rooftop restaurant 
Room was gloomy and extremely old and worn .floor was uneven , had to watch our steps . Especially the bump up to go to the bathroom.

title: I❤️NY (and the Empire Hotel)
text: We had a fabulous stay at the Empire Hotel.  All hotel staff were friendly and helpful.  Avree went above and beyond when we had some issues with our reservation.  The rooftop bar was cozy and offered great night views.  Loved the proximity to everything on the Upper Westside and Midtown.  Close to everything you need for a quintessential New York experience.

title: Great location.
text: At the Empire March 1-3 for events at Lincoln Center.  Nice place, though rooms are small and some could use some touching up.  Extremely convenient location.  Front desk staff very helpful, especially Steven, who expedited my check-in.  The only problem - with the in-room safe - was resolved within an hour.

title: Hotel across from Lincoln Center
text: First time in this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by the good size of the rooms, though the bathroom is quite small and needs urgent update. The location is fantastic if you want to attend shows at the Lincoln Center or stroll along Central Park. It also has a nice rooftop for drinks and small dishes.

title: Exceptional Experience! My New 'Go To' when in NYC!
text:
Stayed at the Empire Hotel while on a quick trip to NYC. From the moment we checked in with Steven and Yessica, we knew our stay would be enjoyable! Hospitality at its best. From our warm welcome at the front desk, Denis the pleasant Bell Hop and the staff at the rooftop bar (Btw the pear martinis are a must try).

Slept like a baby, the rooms are modern, clean and cozy!

Definitely my go to when I visit the city,

title: Nice hotel - good location
text:
A beautiful hotel, with a good location in NYC.  Clean an well maintained, with friendly and helpful staff throughout.  

We had booked a family room, 2 doubles and one sofa, with a view of the city.  There were some issues before arrival, which the hotel could amend their procedure to prevent future stress for travellers. The hotel tried to take the first nights payment before arrival, but there were issues as it was a foreign card, that the bank blocked for fraud prevention.  Unfortunately they left it until the day before to take the payment, so I woke at 6am to an email from the hotel saying the payment hadn't gone through, and I had until 9am the following day (day of arrival) to update my method.

I ended up speaking to the hotel at approx 2am their time, trying various cards, which wouldn't go through for fraud prevention, but was limited on time as I had to catch my flight.  Luis assured me he would note it, and the reservation would not be cancelled.  Travelling from France, it was a long day, and we wouldn't be arriving until 9-10pm.  We didn't want to arrive and have nowhere to stay.  

After landing at JFK at 6.30pm, I had an email saying I had to call by 4pm or the reservation would be cancelled.  Again, panicking, I called the hotel, with limited signal, afraid we had no where to stay.  Thankfully it was all ok.  

To prevent this happening in the future, the hotel could attempt the payment a few days in a advance, so travellers are not restricted with time deadlines, when they have no access to emails/calls on long flights.

We were told we had been upgraded, which was nice, but actually we didn't feel it was an upgrade.  The room was maybe a slight bit bigger, but there was no view.  It just overlooked the hotel windows opposite, so felt slightly disappointed that we thought we were going to have city views from our room.  It made the room very dark.  It was late and had already been a long day, so we just went with it.

We had booked as a family of 3 adults and two children, but there were only 2 bath towels in the room, and no bedding for the sofa bed, which we had to request.  Housekeeping was hit and miss, some days we would be left 5 towels, other days 2.  Sometimes a hand towel, sometimes not...  One day we left the do not disturb sign up, as we did not want housekeeping in, but she knocked on our door early evening, and asked why.  We said it was fine but she was trying to get in.  She asked for rubbish, which I said I would get, as people were getting changed, and she was still trying to get in our room.  It was quite comical, but a little annoying.

The rooftop bar was very nice and had a nice atmosphere to it too.

Overall, a pleasant stay, but we would have preferred the room with the city view that we had booked.

title: A bit of home away from home
text: Our stay at the Empire was very enjoyable: loved the decorations, beds are comfortable and the staff is professionnal. I would be remissed if I did not reconize the work of Steve who was very helpful, friendly and welcoming. He made our stay that much more special.

title: Home away from Home!
text:
Special thanks to Kate, Niya and Steven  service was top tier 
Very accommodating . Staff really knows how to make guests feel welcomed.
Checking in was a breeze room was comfortable. I may have found a new hotel to travel too. Overall exceeded my expectations

title: Clean and convenient but not very comfortable
text: It's convenient if your trip requires access to Lincoln Center , west side of manhattan etc . Rooms and bathroom are clean but really small and the room temp is hard to control . We sweated through the night which makes for grumpy morning . Front desk and bell staff are very welcoming and nice

title: Convenient location, Great Customer Service!
text: Excellent customer service from Niya, Very efficient and kind, Room was okay not the best  only thing I wish they provided was coffee I found that very odd for a known hotel not have that type of amenity but other than that, it was great. I look forward to staying with you guys more in the future Thanks!

title: Great service
text: Ariel was very warm and welcoming! I was very well received upon my check-in. That said, I wish my room came with an informational packet to explain how to get access to the many amenities offered by this hotel. Overall otherwise, a wonderful stay!

title: Great hotel at a great price!
text:
I had an absolutely delightful stay at the Empire Hotel! My room was extremely comfortable, with plenty of amenities and space to move around. I had a great view of Lincoln Center and was close to the theater district to transportation.
The front desk, agent, Steven, was outstanding. He was able to help me find a room that fit my needs precisely, and he was friendly and welcoming.
I can’t wait till my next trip to New York City and to stay once more of the empire!

title: Stay
text: My stay was so good down to the check in and check out. The level of care and accommodation was extremely up to par. There was a lovely receptionist, Niya, who helped me with my check in. I appreciate how she got me checked in early, Accommodated my every need, very professional and knowledgeable. she a nice young lady. definitely will visit again.

title: Best experience
text: The doorman Jose helped me with my bags was very nice. There was a few people at the front desk and surprisingly one receptionist . Niya was very pleasant and knowledgeable with the questions that were being thrown at her. Watching her handle that with such grace was amazing. When it became my turn, she greeted me with a smile also checked me in early which was a PLUS! She's an absolute sweetheart :)

title: Exceeded expectation
text: Naya was extremely kind and knowledgeable with the questions that my partner and I had. We  are so thankful to have been helped by her today and it enhanced our trip for my birthday and we will hopefully be greeted by her whenever we do questions on a reservation.

title: Short stay - brilliant in every sense
text:
I travelled for work, so a short stay. The hotel was brilliant in every sense. 
Well located, comfortable rooms and the staff could not have been more accommodating, particularly Steven and Niya who were a treat at the front desk because they were so helpful and funny. 
Highly recommended.

title: Perfect night
text: My husband and I had tickets to the Opera. The Empire Hotel is right across the street. Perfect location!!. When we arrived Fetina and Sara checked us in very fast and upgraded our room. They were amazing. The room was very comfortable. The mattress the pillows excellent!! Great experience 🩷 very recommend

title: Отель понравился. Соотношение цена качество меня вполне устроило
text: Нормальный отель . За свою стоимость просто отличный.  Питание, пляж, анимация довольно не плохие. Бытовых проблем вообще нет. Уборка смена белья полотенец без проблем.Бары работают стабильно. Очередей особо не бывает. Что бы что то кончалось в баре тоже не наблюдал. Анимация развлекает. Различные шоу каждый день.

title: Great experience with two small children
text: I traveled to NYC with my 4 and 7 year olds and we had an amazing stay at The Empire. Steven at concierge helped us have a smooth check-in after arriving late in the evening. The following morning, we asked for a room upgrade for more space and a bathtub and we were easily accommodated. The staff was courteous, the beds and pillows were comfortable and the location was perfect. We were able to walk to the playground in Central Park as well as the Natural History Museum. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Great customer service!
text: I was helped by the nicest front desk team,Aviree, Steven, and D'Angelo.  They worked with me to get the right room and listened to my needs,all with a smile. Thanks to them, my stay was outstanding. The Empire Hotel will be at the top of my list on my next New York trip.

title: Avree was wonderful!!!
text: I love Avree is so wonderful helpful and professional! We need millions of Avree in NYC she weren’t above and beyond to help me finding the places that I need to go too! I was just very glad 😀 she was there to help me really great customer service!

title: This place is a mess
text: This place is a mess. They’ve renovated the common areas, but rooms are terrible. The furniture is literally falling apart. There is mold on the headboard. the HVAC system is non-functional. I had to use a hand towl for a bath mat. They are “out” of dental kits.  Will never stay here again.

title: Fabulous NYC Hotel
text: Excellent big clean room, fun, accessible location, and friendly, knowledgable staff. Avree at check in was immediately engaging and capable and it created a great feeling right away. The decor is super mid as well. Don’t know how to write more but there it is

title: Great stay!
text: I had a great stay!  Steven at the front desk was very helpful and let me check in early.  The hotel is very close to Fordham University, so I didn’t have to walk far to meet my daughter during my visit.  Room has everything you need to be comfortable and safe.

title: Unprofessional staff
text: The front desk staff seemed to refuse bookings from Hotel.com and requested guests to provide additional bookings info while they should have the info in their system, said we should book directly, charged additional $68 for 2 minutes early check in.

title: Third time here
text:
Great, quiet location adjacent to Lincoln Center.  Friendly staff.

Easy to get to Central Park.

Great rooftop bar with views up Broadway.  

Halls are a bit dark,

Not enough outlets.  One big issue is the lack of coffee.  No coffee in the room.  No coffee in the hotel.

title: It's all about the location, but that's it!
text: You can't beat the location close to Lincoln Ctr, Central Park, great restaurants, easy subway access, and a relatively safe area. The lobby is beautiful and a nice place to visit with friends. The accommodations, however, were disappointing. Although the bed was comfortable, the room decor (carpet, walls, curtains, etc.) was dark, drab, and outdated. The furniture was outdated and in rough condition with stained cushions. The bathroom, although clean, was tiny (barely big enough to get by the open door), had minimal space to put anything, and had peeling paint on the ceiling, moldings, and door. The rain shower head did not work. The refrigerator did not work. Minimal staff interaction, but everyone was nice. There's got to be a better place in the area at a similar reasonable price.

title: Gossip Girl Nostalgia This Is Not
text:
If I’m honest I booked this hotel being a huge Gossip Girl fan and expected to walk in feeling nostalgic but instead I felt underwhelmed. The door staff weren’t the best, all standing around talking and the queue to check in was too long with only 1 member of staff on duty. The lobby is lovely and decorated ornately and then you’re plunged back in time from the second you enter the lift. The hallways were dark and smelt damp, the room was small with no closet and the bathroom was probably the worst I’ve ever experienced. Doors falling off, mold in the shower and only enough towels for 1 rather than 3. Disappointed was an understatement! 
To cheer ourselves up we thought we’d head to the icon rooftop bar only to find it was under construction. 
Overall, we were very disappointed and although we loved NYC I would not stay here again.

title: Exceptional staff hospitality !
text: Such a beautiful hotel, we’re staying here on a girls trip to New York and are super happy with our room. The staff is great, Steven at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. He helped us get checked in even though we arrived early. He joked with us while we waited for our room to be ready, and even gave us suggestions for brunch in the area, thank you Steven for helping our trip off to a great start !

title: Great service from Steven and Niya
text: Steven and Niya were extremely helpful despite being the only two at the front desk and it being so busy. they were so accommodating and managed to help me with a room upgrade that made the stay so much better! I am super appreciative of their assistance and making my trip all that much better. excellent service!

title: Excellent
text: I arrived early on a Friday morning after a red eye flight and Steven and Kate were able to get me right into my room. Excellent front desk service and much appreciated!!  I’ve had to wait hours and hours to get into my room early at other NYC hotels!!

title: Old hotel. Bad value for your money.
text: The room is extremely dated, old. Although we took the corner suite, which should be luxurious, we got old room, with loud/noisy air conditioning. The carpets were dusty and felt like got out directly from the eighties. Some of the chairs were torn. The bed was uncomfortable. To conclude - poor experience, not recommended.

title: Best Customer Service
text: The Hotel customer service was amazing. A big shout out to Steven from the front desk for making my experience unbelievable, from a smooth & quick check in process , to offering me water, recommending us places to eat and making sure everything was ready to surprise my girlfriend on valentines. Thank you once again.

title: Great price, location, ambiance and Staff
text:
This is a great hotel in a great location. The front desk and manager were excellent and provided amazing service. Adam, Daniel, Sarah, Samantha, Tommy and Niya. 
They all Did a great job helping us with everything that we needed. 
Things were comfortable and clean, the lobby is fantastic and provided A wonderful ambience to have a great weekend. 
Highly recommend, the people, well priced well located well done. 
Chana Alisa

title: Excellent experience
text: Excellent experience overall! Hotel was beautiful, comfortable, and clean! The service and staff were all exceptional. They were able to check us in three hours early without any fuss or even request! I would stay here again in a heart beat!

title: The fall of the hotel Empire
text: Front desk is extremely solicitous and professional. Stephen at the front desk was extra helpful. However, the climate control in the room did not work effectively. It was very hot, and though we tried to put the air on, the room never really got very cool. Also, the shower didn’t work and we had to call the engineer. he did come right away so that’s good but the room is a little tired and not kept up very well. The lobby is beautiful and its great location.

title: Great service!
text: Steven at the front desk was great and offered us a little upgrade as they had the availability. The valet parking was incredibly helpful for getting in and out of the hotel. We  had a nice view from our room. The rooftop restaurant was delicious and our cocktails were wonderful. Felt like a lovely sanctuary in the city. A great experience overall.

title: Repeat stay did not disappoint
text: Fantastic location and value. I traveled solo to see an event at the Lincoln Center so wanted to stay close by. The hotel is a little worn but my room was clean and comfortable. Steven at the front desk was very helpful. This was my second stay. Good price for the neighborhood.

title: amazing staff and the best location
text: I came to New York for a business trip and absolutely loved the hotel, location, and the staff.  Reception personnel were very friendly and polite and Steven was absolutely amazing with all the help, answers to all my questions, and all the assistance I needed. Thank you Steven for being so professional and having all the answers! it made my trip much more pleasant! The room was nice, the location was perfect, the rooftop has stunning views and tasty drinks! Prices are reasonable as well. will come back again!

title: Empire hotel
text: The hotel front desk provided fast and efficient service during my stay. Steven was exceptionally quick with the check in process as I was running late for a dinner while also providing me with necessary information. The environment was also notably clean, contributing to a pleasant experience overall. Would absolutely be back to the empire.

title: Would stay here again
text: The staff was extremely friendly upon arrival and Steven at the front desk even upgraded our room and we were allowed to check-in early. The rooftop bar was a fun atmosphere, and the location is excellent. I will be staying here again in the future when I return to the city.

title: Can’t complain at all!
text: Super helpful and friendly staff, happy to help. My room was in great condition and I happened to be a lucky “guest of the day” and got upgraded to a Suite for free. Crazy. Steven at the front desk was especially charismatic. I will be coming here again next time I’m in NYC.

title: Ballet Show and great vibes
text: Steven was so nice ! When I walked in he was very welcoming and funny! The entire staff was soo welcoming and I really enjoyed my stay! And I would definitely stay here again! I loved the view of the city and I was able to walk to all my destinations!

title: Rundown room with cockroaches, helpful staff
text:
I don't typically write reviews as I am relatively easy to please and don't often complain.  However, I feel compelled to write this one.  

While the location of the Empire is great and the staff are helpful, my room was very rundown and I killed two cockroaches in my room, and observed another cockroach in the hotel lobby.  I understand that it is New York City and you may see the occasional pest, but this felt out of the ordinary.  In terms of the condition of my room, the wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the frame of the bed was peeling apart, and there was a chunk missing from the molding on the wall.  

When I complained to the front desk about having killed the first cockroach, they were relatively dismissive.  They did send housekeeping to clean it up and when I asked if they could offer next steps, they said they weren't sure what I meant.  I asked if they could spray or offer a room change, and they said they would spray.  The person from housekeeping was very kind and arrived promptly.  After I killed a second cockroach, they were much more responsive and when I checked out, gave me a partial refund for the inconvenience, which was very appreciated.

title: Residence Fee?!
text:
I stayed here over the weekend.  The room was run down very small.  TV looked like it was manufactured in 2005. 

 This hotel charges a “residence fee” of $19.95 + tax per night for their amenities which is outside of their advertised rate.  This included items that are standard for a hotel (bell hop service, rooftop bar, gym, WiFi, etc.).  I did not have use for any of these amenities and asked to have the charge removed, which the hotel refused to do claiming it was required for all guests.  If the charge is non-negotiable then why is it not included in the rate when I booked the hotel? Basically it is a way for the hotel to advertise lower rates on the comparison sites and squeeze additional money from their customers.  This practice is anticompetitive, consumer damaging, and causes guests to have bad experiences with the hotel.  I will not be staying at The Empire or any other hotel that engages in this practice.

title: Thank you Steven !!!!
text: My best friend and I came from Connecticut to celebrate my best friend’s bday and we decided to get the Empire Hotel. When, we got to the Empire Hotel Steven greeted us with a warm welcome! As we got to our room there was an issue in the room that needed to be resolve. We came back downstairs to Steven without hesitation he was apologetic, kind and assisted immediately with the issue and upgraded us to a suite! Thank you so much Steven!!!!

title: The absolute BEST customer service: STEVEN
text:
My five star review is solely based on customer service alone! 
Steven helped me at the front desk and made my stay the absolute best. He was extremely patient in answering all my questions and worked to accommodate my needs during my business trip! 

I would come back to the Empire Hotel again the next time I’m in town for business, solely based on his customer service alone. THANK YOU STEVEN and everyone at the Empire Hotel. You’ve got a loyal guest for life!

title: Great place
text: Excellent location. Most welcoming by Yessica and Fatima. They answered the many questions I had. Lovely room. Just what I wanted.  Restaurants nearby. All types. I plan to come to New York a few times per year and will always stay at the Empire.

title: A MUST-STAY hotel in a GREAT LOCATION with AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!
text:
Our daughter had a big audition with a nearby performing arts college. Prior to the trip, the college recommended places to stay and the Empire Hotel was on the list. We are soooo happy that it was recommended because we loved everything about it! The location is perfect, as it is just across the street from Lincoln Center (easy to navigate to for cab drivers and walking directions). Central Park was also very close and the theater district was about a 15 minute walk south. Within 5 minutes walk to the north (the upper west side) were TONS of delicious restaurants and cafes. And, the world famous PJ Clarke's is on the corner at the base of the hotel, too! The area was very safe and the hotel is BEAUTIFUL! The room was spacious with very trendy decor. But, the real main event was the front desk staff. We arrived a few hours earlier than normal check-in and were just expecting to store our bags and go explore the area, but Pasquale said that our room was ready. YAY! We headed up and it seems that there was miscommunication with housekeeping and the room was not actually ready. We went back downstairs to notify Pasquale and he was very apologetic, gave us extra bottles of water and said that he would call or text us when the room was ready. (Again, we were early so we never actually expected for the room to be ready in the first place and we felt very grateful for his kindness.) 
After exploring, we found out from Pasquale and D'Angeli that our room had been upgraded due to our patience!!! The customer service here is AMAZING! We were so grateful to them both for this grand gesture. They went above and beyond.
After 3 wonderful nights at the Empire Hotel, we found out on our last day that our flight home was a bit delayed. Yessica offered us a 1pm check-out at no extra charge, which was lovely and enabled us to have a more leisurely morning before braving the airport mayhem. This top notch customer service will have us coming back again and I love that return guests get a discount at booking by using a special code for the next stay...even more incentive! I will recommend this hotel to any friends and family traveling to NYC and I hope to see Pasquale, D'Angeli and Yessica again soon!

title: Lovely Stay in an Excellent Location + Great Service
text:
Our family of 4 enjoyed our stay at the Empire between Christmas and New Years. 

First the PROs:
1. Fantastic location adjacent to Lincoln Center! Within minutes of the subway, buses, food, Central Park, etc.  Another perk is it's around the corner from a TKTs outpost, where you can line up for discount Broadway tickets inside a comfortable building lobby rather than Times Square (and sleep in more before lining up!) Starbucks is in between the lobby and TKTs so you can get provisions on the way for standing in line.
2. Impressive service. Everyone we encountered from the doormen, front desk staff, to housekeeping were friendly and helpful.  For example, when we checked in, we saw that the blackout roman shades in our room were inoperable, so it was as dark as night and we could not look outside. When I asked at the front desk, she immediately switched me to the adjacent room where the blinds worked fine. When I spilled some coffee on the bedspread they immediately switched out all the bedding. I've been in large chain hotels where these kind of requests would take hours or not be addressed at all. 
3.  While it's an older building, the hotel has been recently renovated with an interesting, contemporary vibe. 

CONS:
As I work in architecture my first impressions are typically of the building itself. Some people would not be bothered by these observations but I'll share in case the Hotel can address them to improve customer experience. Some things I realize are hard to address in a prewar building:
1. The HVAC runs on old radiators so the room gets hot and stuffy.  This is not unusual in NYC though. The bathroom has no ventilation (no vent or exhaust fan). We had to leave our window open a bit most of the time, which worked fine. The lobby generally smelled musty also from lack of ventilation. Maybe a light fragrance could be piped in?
2. The renovation construction quality could've been better. It looked like a hook or makeup mirror was missing in the bathroom but the hole was there. The shower tile grout was messy or missing in spots, and there was tons of caulking around the doors to fill gaps. More aesthetic issues, but it could feel more upscale if it was addressed.
3. While I expected a tiny bathroom in Manhattan, the usability could be improved. The sink does not have a rim that is level or wide enough to put anything down and there's no counter. There is a wall shelf that is about 3-4" deep. The toilet tank and seat lids are sloped, so anything you put there besides clothes slide off. So there's nowhere to put down anything wider than 3". A 10-12" deep shelf above the toilet tank could easily address this. 
4. Like most hotels, it would really help to have more than a single robe hook in the bathroom. For a family of 4 there's nowhere to hang a toiletry bag or other towel if one person hangs a towel there. 

In spite of the bathroom inconveniences, overall I'd still recommend the hotel and visit again. The staff always made us feel that we had a welcome base as we explored and the city and the room was otherwise comfortable.

title: Best hotel
text: Very please with my stay so far. The Staff are  professional and friendly especially yessica Pasquale who was a big help for me. My fight was rescheduled due to bad weather and I had to extend my stay for one more night.

title: Not as expected
text:
Good things hotels location, price and staff very freindly.

Bsd things Room very run down, air conditioning poor and room was very hot, double glazing window blown so glass was steamed up, wall paper falling off, nails sticking out window sill, bathroom mouldy, bathroom door rotten and peeling paint, rusty shower pole to name a few, double bed room very small. The complete hotel was very hot, it was like the heating was stuck on.

It's a shame as prices good, hopefully the

title: Small room
text: Room was very small for two queen beds. No where to put luggage accept the floor. Water heater broke down. Had to wait for repairs to get hot water. Would not recommend. This hotel charges to much to have this type of issues.

title: Always a Wonderful Experience!
text: Every time I stay at The Empire Hotel it is a wonderful experience. Adam is The Best Manager! He goes above and beyond to make sure all guests are comfortable, relaxed and happy with their stay. I am a frequent goes and I am so grateful for Adam for accommodating my requests and always being so kind. Yessica is also so nice and always asks if there is anything else I need to let her know. Both Adam & Yessica are absolute Gems! I am so grateful I found this great team at The very comfortable and very lovely Empire Hotel.

title: Tiny, rundown room with several non-functional things.
text:
Horrible, horrible, very small room:
- Couldn't close the bathroom door without getting in the shower.
- Window blinds very broken.
- Minifridge non-functional and loud.
- 1 foot clearance on one side and the foot of the bed.
- Tricky to operate the HVAC system.
- Very run down.

Unless you are exclusively going to performances at Lincoln Square, location is -- at best -- mediocre.

The only good thing was the staff.

Overall, far worse than a typical Manhattan hotel room in an older building. Which is reaaaallly saying something.

title: In need of upgrade and a deep clean
text:
The hotel is very well located within walking distance of Central Park, mid-town and most of NYCs attractions. The tube is nearly a few hundred yards away providing access to the wider area. Around the hotel are many great breakfast options.

The hotel itself needs upgrading. We were very concerned reading many of the reviews before arriving. We had booked several months in advance and the more recent reviews raised concerns about a lack of cleanliness. It was not as bad as we had feared but certainly, there is no attention to detail and many areas are never cleaned. We did not have any unexpected guests as many had written but can understand how this may occur. The air conditioning in our room only partially worked and was very loud creating issues with sleeping. Thankfully walking everywhere tired our kids who did manage to sleep most of the time. Our room was inward-facing with no views and consequentially very dark. It felt quite oppressive with the correspondingly dark decor. We would recommend anybody staying requests a street view room following our experience. 
Overall deserving of three stars but no more. We would look to stay elsewhere when next returning to NYC

title: Wonderful Experience
text: The Empire Hotel was a fantastic experience. Managers Adam and Erika were extremely helpful with my check in and room requests. The hotel was lovely and the housekeeping staff are amazing - a wonderful location to enjoy NYC at The Empire!

title: NO!!
text:
NO!!!!
Great location but that's where it ends......
No Room -- We had to upgrade for $50 per day to make it big enough to turn around in for two people.
No room service.
No Vending machines.
No in-room coffee makers.
No microwave.
No decent thermostat setting - We stayed uncomfortably hot, even in December.
No service when asked for silverware to eat food.
Bottom Line: NO!!! 
No.  Never again.  And we used to love this hotel.

title: Best choice for the Lincoln Center goers
text:
Planned to come to the city for the opera evening at the Met and needed the place close to Lincoln center. TripAdvisor showed the perfect hotel. Except the rating was too low. Despite all odds i gave it a try…. Here is the unbiased review.
+Location. The location is as good as is gets if you are planning to attend a performance at Lincoln center. The hotel is just a minute walk, literally across the road. Some  good restaurants like Bar Boloud and Boloud Sud are also a minute away, Columbus circle 5min walk, Central Park a block away, Broadway a step out.
+Staff. Everyone from managers at the reception to housekeeping services were professional and helpful. No BS, no delays, everything run smoothly from check-in to check-out.
+Dogs. Empire Hotel has a dog friendly policy, and not towards small dogs only. Big four-legged companions are welcomed as well.
Rooms. Yes, rooms could benefit greatly from thoughtful renovation. But even with the tired decor, the bed linen was fresh and crisp, towels in the bathroom white and fluffy. As a frequent guest of the hotels worldwide I appreciate crisp linen and towels more than fresh wallpaper.
Air con. Yes it is loud. However if you are not a finicky sleeper you would have no problem at all. Pity you can’t open the window, fresh air always helps. Alas, I just turned the air con off (I still got the noise, but the temperature was ok). 
Overall Empire Hotel was an excellent choice for the purpose. At the price of $200/night I couldn’t ask for more at such location. If you want a spacious newer room with modern appliances be prepared to pay at least twice of the that price elsewhere.
I would like to say special thanks for Pasquale at the reception for his professionalism, kindness and curtesy. And I certainly will be back next time I am in the city.

title: Some Care Some Don't
text:
Check in was great.  NIYA couldn't have been more helpful.  In fact as a return guest she was able to upgrade us to a street facing room.  Get this if you can.  Otherwise your window might open up on an airshaft.  Lobby is as great as the picture and, I hear, that the rooftop bar with small bits of food is fabulous.  Didn't go. We're not bar people.  The rooms are small.  Well it is New York.  They do need a little upgrading but comfortable.  Location is great with Lincoln Center just across the street.
Downside--the evening people at the front desk didn't seem to care about the problem we were having.  Around 9:15 PM we started hearing what appeared to be drilling coming from the next room.  This was going on and off for over an hour.  I recorded the soulnd.  No one came up.  Called the front desk again. They claim someone came up to the floor and didn't hear any noise and went back down.  Didn't knock on my door to hear my problem and the noise I recorded.  You think they would have.  The only thing I figured, since the wall didn't fall down, was that the neighbor was taking a shower or two or three.  For over an hour???.   Really noisy. Figured it was the shower when we also heard it in the morning.  Clean people.  So, there you have it.  You will enjoy your stay.

title: You get what you pay for.
text: This was my third stay here and I don’t think I’ll return. The price and location are good. The housekeeper did an excellent job. On the negatives…..heating/cooling ….we switched rooms once as it was about 85 degrees. Second room was better. Mezzanine level is a furnace. Walls are paper thin so noise control is bad. No paper, pen, ice bucket, coffee in the rooms. Yes Starbucks is next door but should one have to go next door and pay $5 for coffee? No option for cold water….sometimes I saw bottled water at registration but sometimes not. The stench on some of the floors and especially the “fitness room” was horrible….like sewage….and this has been the case all three visits. The gym had no towels one visit and the water cooler is about 10 years old. Front desk pleasant enough but completely overwhelmed. My daughter asked for a quilt and a stained one was brought to the room.

title: Great location, comfortable, clean room
text: After we booked this hotel thru RCI we started to get worried after reading the reviews.  We were pleasantly surprised after checking in...the room was small but very comfortable and clean.  The staff was really helpful.  Nice bar on rooftop.  Great location.   Overall great value, especially considering the location directly across from Lincoln center.   We will definitely be back.

title: The Empire Hotel
text:
Hello!
The Hotel has always been amazing..Fantastic front desk people who definitely go the EXTRA mile.. I am truly grateful. Niya and Adam are exceptional. The Hotel has a VERY cool location as well near Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle.
My best,
John Mathews

title: Overnight Stay
text: Had a wonderful time at the Empire Hotel in NY.  Although the room was small, it was okay because I was travelling solo.  Most importantly, it was clean.  Will definitely stay there when I return to Manhattan.   Give a 5 Star rating to Ariel G for the excellent customer service he showed me during my stay.

title: Nice Stay at the Empire Hoteal
text: We had a lovely time at the Empire Hotel while visiting New York.  Zee, the Bellman for much of the weekend, particularly stood out for his excellence dealing with Taxis, Valet, Traffic, Luggage and Rain.

title: Highly recommend!
text:
Always an outstanding experience from check in to check out!
Highly recommend!!
Can’t wait until our next stay!!
The Empire Hotel is our go to location whenever we are in the City.
The entire staff works so hard to enhance our stay.

title: Excellent service (grazie, Pasquale!)!
text: Wonderful service from Pasquale-- so welcoming and friendly! The hotel is very festive, especially as it's the holiday season. Thank you for being so accommodating. This is the perfect location on the Upper West Side right across from Lincoln Center and near Central Park. Grazie, Christina

title: Wonderful Christmas time visit…we’ll be back!
text:
We visited at Christmas time, choosing the Empire for its price…of course, not cheap, but reasonable for December in Manhattan!  I was afraid it might be a bit too far from the action, but the location provided us with nice walks to and from Broadway shows and mid-town sights! We never needed a cab, subway, or bus!  The staff was all around friendly and accommodating; the room small but clean with the 2 beds we requested.  There’s a lovely rooftop bar/ restaurant, open late for views of Lincoln Center ( reservations suggested, but they try to accommodate walk-ins.). There’s a Starbucks on the first floor of the building, so we ordered breakfast online, picked it up and enjoyed in the lovely hotel lobby.

We could not have enjoyed our stay more!

title: Bravo! An experience like no other at the Empire Hotel
text: Excellent hotel with a superb staff. Shout out to Samantha and Steven, who went above and beyond to ensure my family had an excellent experience. Would definetely recommend this hotel to everybody! A true sample of excellent hospitality.

title: Good location, poorly run and maintained
text:
It’s a shame that a hotel with such a great location is so poorly run.
I checked into my first room and the door was open, blinds broken. After calling down to the front desk, I was given a new and bigger room, which I appreciated.
However the AC unit in this new room was broken. It could not keep a cool temperature all night, and made a lot of noise while it was at it. After a bad night’s sleep I asked the front desk to take a look while I was out. 
When I returned that night, I didn’t see any indication anyone had fixed the unit, but waited to see if the unit functioned more normally. It did not.
When I asked the front desk about this the following morning, they told me someone had indeed visited the room and it turned out the unit was not easily fixable. No one told me this, much less offered to change my room again because of the issue.
The front desk said they would switch me to yet another room and that they could move my things. I had to run to work meetings so said I could pack when I return in the evening. They said I must pack my bags at that moment or risk losing the room change due to availability in the evening, which made no sense to me, but I did it anyway (this made me late to work). 
In both these rooms, I should add, the doors didn’t align with their frames properly, leaving gaps - making it easy to hear everything in the halls.
My new room was an upgrade - again, appreciated, but one of the AC units in the room was also very noisy. 
I also observed several other guests in line with issues - booking confusion, room availability issues, being told they could upgrade only to be told several minutes later the upgrade they were promised was not available. 
It’s clear this hotel is poorly maintained and not well run. Despite its great location, it is best to avoid.

title: Saved by the Empire Hotel!
text: We were dealing with a nightmare Airbnb situation and reached out late one evening to the Empire Hotel for a 2am rescue.  Niya, Tyra and Erica Kostic saved our vacation!  Look no further than the Empire Hotel for top of the line service and accommodations...they really know how to take care of their guests!

title: Well located
text:
The one personal touch in the one-night stay was an earnest bell-man named Zee.
But the bed was very comfortable and the location is incredible convenient if you like to be in the Lincoln Center hub - street noise is inevitable. We asked for a quiet room, which might have been impossible, but the convenience is great.

title: 5 stars - wish I could give 10!
text: Ariel and D'Angeli and Christian were amazing! I had never felt more welcome - I really love this hotel! The lobby has a great vibe and I love how spacious the rooms are - Definitely get a King Size bed - the beds are to die for!

title: Weekend getaway
text:
Wonderful location, but rooms are in poor condition.  The curtains were torn and not functioning and it was impossible to control the thermostat.  It was unbearably hot for the two nights that we stayed.
The only redeeming feature is the convenient location to Lincoln Center.  
Overpriced for this facility.

title: Hitting High Notes
text: We had a great and comfortable stay. It’s perfect for an evening when you going to the Opera or Ballet or a show at Lincoln Center. We had a couple of minor issues that got handled well. Hotel manager, Maggie and Bell staffer, Lee were wonderful in handling everything. Thank you!

title: Cannot recommend. Old, shabby, dirty, half working.
text:
Was here for WOBI 2023. Only booked this hotel as it was the conference hotel for WOBI. Otherwise, I would have gone to one of my gotos. 
SHAME on WOBI for picking this hotel. This is supposed to be a high-end conference, and while it is next to Lincoln Centre, it just doesn't meet any standards.
While the staff is lovely and the location is wonderful, as others have noted it just doesn't meet standards.
Main issues: 
1. The heating/cooling system and LOUD and half works. 
2. Smelly showers.
3. Pillow had stains on it!
Do I need to go on? 
This hotel has so much potential but they need a major investment.

title: Rooms really need some TLC
text: The lobby is so much better than the rooms themselves. They were tiny (to be expected, it’s New York) but they were really dated. It was freezing and I couldn’t make the heater work in the room (it was super old and the knob was turned on but nothing happened). Worn down furniture. No coffee in room, but honestly I was happy to have an excuse to leave to the Starbucks around the corner.

title: Great location, disappointing room
text:
Despite a great location and welcoming staff, I was truly disappointed in my stay at the Empire. The lobby and rooftop bar/pool are lovely, but once I stepped into my room, it was clear it had not been maintained and were in desperate need of a refresh.

I’m used to small NYC hotel rooms, but this was extreme. I could barely maneuver around my bed and with the door shut in the bathroom, I could not even turn around. Curtains were dusty, the carpet was hard, even the iron was rusty. Peeling wallpaper, water stains, woodwork that looked like it had been chewed on completed the look. Despite a thermostat, I did not have control over the heat and my room was consistently 80 degrees, with the window open.

My room key was also demagnetized 4x in 2 days. Reception told me not to put it in my wallet, next to my phone, or to go thru mags, not an easy request and an issue I’ve never had at other hotels.

title: Above Expectations for Family Trip
text: I read reviews beforehand so went into our stay with low expectations and was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are very small, but our family of four didn’t feel cramped since we spent very limited time in the room. The beds were firm and standard size for a double bed, the room was clean, the window shades were fully functional. My only complaint was that our 11th floor room was extremely hot (due to heat rising from the other rooms, because it was cold outside) and would not cool down below 76 despite having the A/C set on 65 (the lowest setting). I requested a high floor for the view so didn’t complain, but if we ever stayed here again, I would request a lower floor for sure. The staff was amazing- everyone we interacted with was helpful and kind.

title: Showing its age
text:
Stayed here five years ago and enjoyed it but the property has obviously been in decline since. At my recent stay in room 140 it is showing significant signs of wear - the door latch was snapped off, paint was chipped throughout and the window blinds didn’t operate. 

The entry card stopped working multiple times and check in seem perplexed as to which room to put me in. While this hotel is in a good location, until the maintenance is improved I suggest it is avoided as there are better properties at a similar price point nearby.

title: Disappoinging
text: I had planned the perfect weekend for my wife and myself.  I had booked a corner suite at The Empire Hotel back in the spring.  I had called the hotel directly several times before arriving, checking to see that we had the corner suite.  I called the day before and was told the suite was ours.  My wife and I arrive on Friday afternoon ontly to be told the suite was not available and that they would downgrade me with a junior suite.  I had no options.  Where would you go on a weekend in Manhattan and find a good room?  The front desk was stoic.  I'm sure they were very well trained at fielding problems--I should have heeded the 1 star reviews of this hotel.  So, we get our room, with 2 beds, and a heat problem.  Mind you, it is 40 degrees outside, yet our room was 80 when we walked in.  I immediately turn on the air conditioning unit, full blast all weekend and the temperature never dropped below 75.  The exterior walls had two pillars from floor to ceiling, which inside housed heat ducts.  The walls were constantly very warm, heating the room and that was that.  My picture perfect room was interior facing, looking at other windows outside.  I had paid in full the corner suite overlooking Lincoln Center.  Do not book with this supposed 4 star hotel.  It's really only a 2.5 at best.

title: Exceptional service, luxurious comfort, and an overall delightful experience
text: The front desk clerk Samantha at the Empire Hotel epitomizes exceptional customer service, seamlessly blending professionalism with genuine warmth. Their attentiveness and efficiency contribute to a delightful experience, complementing the hotel's luxurious ambiance. Together, they create a memorable stay that leaves guests feeling valued and well-cared-for.

title: Shocking absence of any coffee
text:
Perfect location  to visit the MET. The staff was absolutely super. TV and bed were fine.
But pretentious Art Deco décor .. that is a bit overwhelming in the small rooms and narrow hall ways.  
And Beware .. there no food or drink, except bottled water, available in the entire place.  If you want coffee in the AM, you have to get up, get dressed and go stand in line next door at the Starbucks.  It might be helpful to announce that ahead of time to potential guests, so they can at least decide on bringing their own instant coffee packets. This fact alone prevents me from ever booking that hotel again

title: Excellent hotel in Manhattan
text: My girlfriends and I stayed here for 4 nights.  I was a little concerned about the negative reviews but all of us were extremely pleased with the location, price and condition of the hotel.  We had great service with the staff and would definitely stay here again.

title: The Empire Hotel, NYC, rocks!
text:
From check in with the delightful D’Angeli, to checkout 4 days later, our experience staying at The Empire Hotel NYC was perfect! From the room with a view of Lincoln Center and 2 lovely windows to look out at the city below, the comfy bed and just right pillows, and the friendly housekeeping services, all hotel services were excellent. 

All personnel at this hotel provided friendly and considerate service from greetings upon entrance and exits , to advise on nearby places to grab breakfast, we always felt welcome. 

The lobby with its beautiful Art Deco black and white furnishings is a lovely place to wait for friends, as well. 

One tiny thing that would be nice is either daily coffee service in the lobby for those of us that skip breakfast but need that extra boost while getting ready for the day, or perhaps an individual coffee station in the room?  

Otherwise I highly recommend this comfortable and nicely located hotel.

title: A+ Staff!
text: I worked directly with the hotel on a large event and when I say the hotel management and front desk staff went above and beyond to make sure our guests were taken of--I truly mean it. Carl, Erica, Adam, and Chris--incredible hotel management and sales team. And the front desk staff was superb--Daniel and Ariel have so much patience and grace when dealing with obstacles. All my thanks to the hotel team!

title: A+ Service D- Rooms
text:
The public areas, like the lobby and rooftop lounge, have very chic decor and seem to be maintained nicely. The rooms however are dingy. There were shoddy repairs and beat up furnishings in the room. The shower head was held together with duct tape, the paint is chipped and walls were stained. If I were to rate the room alone it would get 2 stars. 

My experience with the hotel staff was wonderful though. The front desk agents, the bellman and the rooftop bar staff were all very kind and helpful. We had multiple situations where they went out of their way to offer us help. Each went above and beyond and made our trip extra special.

title: Thank you Samantha!
text: It was a rocky start until I spoke with Samantha at guest services who quickly and graciously assisted with my request. Thank you so much! I'm relieved there is a superb level of customer service once you find the right person to help!

title: A Night at the Opera
text:
My room was comfortable but small. Great view of Lincoln Center and further north. I was there for the Met Opera and location could not have been better. There was a bit of pandemonium in the hotel because of the NY Marathon. On balance, a good thing, the runners and their families were a plus. And the desk staff were friendly and helpful, Hello Ariel! 

Some negatives. Nearby restaurants are crowded and expensive. No room service. No breakfast. The next door restaurant is crazy noisy dark at dinner time.

title: Moved my son into college
text: Empire Hotel staff was amazing.  I was so stressed moving my son into college but the staff just made all the difference. I was going to stay at another nearby hotel and I am so happy I didn’t.  I can’t say enough about how well we were treated.

title: Room and check in staff below average the rest was good
text:
The room I booked was not as it appeared online. The staff at the front desk were not polite and when I explained that none of the blinds would go up to let daylight in and see outside they told me I could go somewhere else. The room was very small and dungeon like with no light from the outside.

The front door staff Dennis was amazing and very helpful also Nela from the rooftop bar was amazing and went out of her way to ensure we had a great table every night. 

The maid service was really good as well

title: Warm Welcome
text: What a wonderful welcome! D’Angeli was such a delight! She helped get us checked in and made it such a smooth a stress free process. Our room was nice and had a lovely view. Thank you so much to her for creating such a great beginning to our stay here!

title: Great Manager and Service
text:
The hotel looks stunning in the lobby. Server is very friendly and kindly gave me 2 bottle of drinks when I came in. Besides, the manager Adam gave me an free upgrade from the queen to two double beds to make sure the customers are happy with their stay! Distance to the Lincoln center is unbeatable!
I do hope the interior of the room can be renovated. The wallpapers are falling off. The sink needs to be caulted around.

title: Great hotel in marvelous location!  Would stay again!!
text: We stayed at the Empire Hotel this past weekend, 10/13-16/23.  Our experience was wonderful.  The staff was phenomenal and the deco vibe of the hotel amazing!  Uber clean rooms and convenient to all.

title: Brutal service recovery for minor issue that caused significant damage.
text: Brutal service to the fullest. I work in hospitality as a manager and I was appalled by the service proved by the front desk team and front desk manager. We arrived to the hotel ready to shower and change for dinner. We had 0 towels upon our arrival. This included 0 hand towels. The saddest part was after 3 visits to the front desk, they finally sent someone up with their towels after seeing me at the front desk. The front desk manager then tried to claim the towels have been up there. They hadn’t and we’re just delivered after we missed our paid reservations. Staff was rude and didn’t have any sympathy towards the mistake they they had. Just terrible service to rectify a minor issue. Caused a minor issue to become major and addressed it with attitude. Honestly, just embarrassing for the hospitality world. Not surprised after reading other reviews.

title: Shabby hotel but great staff
text: This was my second stay here and the only good thing about the hotel is the staff.  I asked to have my first room changed because the air conditioner had no controls due to a very old unit.  In the second room, the toilet was broken.  Maintenance came up after dinner and had to replace three parts.  When going to bed, I realized the sheet was stained-one was red like an old blood stain.  There were several holes in the pillow cases.  The wallpaper is peeling in every room.  The carpet is ripped, paint is peeling off the ceiling.  The next morning, in the shower, I discovered the part of the trim that controls the temp was completely broken off.  All the furniture is shabby and under the bed, there were nuts and a thick layer of accumulated dust.  It was gross.  When I complained about the shower, I was immediately switched to the next room over which was a suite, so that was very nice of them.  However, that second room should never have been given to a guest - it was a disaster.  The mattresses are hard being on platforms - really uncomfortable.  But yes, the staff is great - the head of housekeeping helped me change rooms and tried to make the situation right.  But the rooms themselves are very neglected.

title: Great location; great rooms; responsive management
text: Though it started on a downer-note, our stay last week improved significantly when I pointed out to the manager – politely, but emphatically – that the square-footage of the room assigned when we arrived on our first night fell quite a bit short of its description on the hotel's website ... and we were promptly, and without fuss, reassigned to a significantly better room that made the remaining four nights of our stay a real pleasure. In NYC we of course had plenty of things to do outside our room, and we found the Empire's location a superb base from which to visit all parts of Manhattan.

title: Just don’t
text: Cockroaches; shades and windows that don’t open; no thermostat controls; no bathroom vents; peeling paint and wall paper; humidity trapped in the room all day making it miserable; rooms so small that a tent would have been more comfortable; awful.

title: Love Hotel Empire!!!!
text: This is the fourth time I've stayed at the Hotel Empire this year.  It is wonderful.    The rooftop bar/restaurant is always fun.  Location is ideal.  Walking distance to Central Park and Columbus Circle and steps away from the Lincoln Center.  I was in room 1116 this time and I will always request that room from now on.  Look at my views!  On this visit, Robert and Fatima were particularly helpful!!  Can't wait to book my next trip!

title: Disappointing
text: It is a busy week in NY, but for $500 a night, I was expecting less peeling paint, better fitting windows, a TV you could not hear through the wall and a coffee machine (or even a sachet). A very disappointing stay

title: Another review of a  terrible experience
text: I moved out after one night.  While the location is very convenient the place is a wreck. Looks like no upkeep for about five years. When I said my shades don't work they said "oh yeah, all of our rooms have broken shades,we are working on that"  My room also had a hole in the carpet, peeling paint in multiple places, terrible lighting. The staff was mixed- some were professional and the other half couldn't be bothered with please or thank you or even looking at me in the eye. I couldn't get out of there soon enough.

title: Nice Retro Hotel
text: After looking at other reviews I was a bit worried. But the reviews were definitely deceiving. Even though the lobby area was a little more updated the room was nice, clean and very retro in a nice way. It served its purpose. Samantha from the front desk was awesome. I talked to her during check in and went looking for her at check out.

title: The biggest disappointment
text: The biggest disappointment. I’d like to register my complaint with this hotel, unfortunately. We look for the basics: good shower, good bed, air conditioning and location. So we chose The Empire Hotel, with a reasonable distance from Times Square so that there wouldn't be so much noise, as we were only going to spend two nights in NY and we would like to rest very well at night, because we would be walking a lot to see much of the city and living our dream. We arrived at the hotel and realized that the air conditioning was off, we spoke to reception, they turned on the air, we left the hotel for a walk and when we came back the air was off again, we talked to reception again and they turned it on and then we slept, after 1 hour we woke up and the room was extremely hot, we were sweating, and the air wouldn't turn on at all, the reception sent a technician and he said “I'll turn the air on again, but if it turns off soon, ask to change the room”, so he turned the air on again and within 30 minutes stopped working again, we had a horrible night, we didn't sleep at all, the room was too hot, and our flight was in the early hours of the morning so we hadn't slept well the night before because of the airport/plane, anyway, super stressful. The other night, when we returned from the city, we asked to change rooms and the manager replied that there was no more room, that he had nothing to do, at most, refund 100 dollars (from a reservation of more than 400 dollars), and gave us a small fan. Anyway, very bad service, we were supposed to live two days of a dream in NY and we lived a nightmare, because in addition to the air conditioning not working, we were next to a service room/hotel storage room where they were supposed to store things and they did noise the whole two nights, so if we managed to sleep a little in the heat, we woke up to the noise. Bad experience, I don't recommend it. The least that should have been done is a 100% refund of what we paid to find another hotel and to alleviate the physical and mental damage. A detail is that when we arrived at the hotel to check in, the girl at reception said that we had been upgraded, but she was confused, it must have been a downgrade. Worst experience of my life, I wouldn't recommend this hotel even to an enemy.

title: Clean and Perfectly Located
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a “long weekend” getaway and it was perfect. The room was clean and well appointed. The rooms are on the smaller side, which is very normal in New York, but we didn’t plan to spend lots of time in the room.  The staff were all extremely polite and kind. The house keeping staff always had a smile and would greet us kindly, asking about our day and what exciting things we’d done. 

The concierge desk was not as helpful or knowledgeable as I’d have liked. But that’s just me being a little picky. When we were asking for desert and rooftop bars, their suggestions were not in keeping with what we had explained we wanted.

title: Very disappointing!! I want my money back!!
text: This hotel used to be so beautiful and quaint! My wife and I decided to stay the night here after going to New York for the day. When we checked in, we went to our ‘Deluxe King Room’ which was just a small room that was dirty, outdated and had peeling wallpaper. I called down to the front desk to be moved to another room, which is something I’ve never had to do in a hotel before! The next room was just as bad. This hotel was dirty, rundown and had no amenities. There was no room service and no coffee maker in the room. I’ve never heard of such a thing in a hotel room. This is supposed to be an upscale property. The last time I stayed at this hotel in 2012, it was gorgeous, but it’s very disappointing and rundown. I would like to get a refund on my credit card for my stay.

title: EXPERIENCE TRAUMATISANTE
text: Nous avions initialement réservé cet hôtel pour y passer la moitié de notre séjour. En visite à NYC pour la première fois, et ce pour 15 jours, nous voulions vivre une expérience en plein coeur de Manhattan et avions fais cette réservation depuis Paris. Ce qui au départ devait être un séjour inoubliable a très vite tourner au cauchemar. Propos raciste, par l’une des réceptionnistes à l’accueil. Le personnel nous a fait passer par l’ascenseur de service pour accéder à notre chambre. Tous les ascenseurs étaient fonctionnels. C’était simplement pour ne pas que les autres clients de l’hôtel ne s’offusque de clients comme nous visiblement. La chambre était d’une vétusté sans comparaison. Le chauffage ne fonctionnait pas correctement en plein mois de Décembre avec des températures affichant -10. Nous avons voulu annuler notre réservation pour toutes ces raisons, ils nous ont menacé de prélever l’entière réservation. Nous avons dû signaler leur comportement auprès de notre opérateur de réservation et avons tout de même dû régler une nuitée pour une expérience désastreuse. La seule bonne nouvelle c’est que nous avons changé d’hôtel pour un hôtel à Times Square et le reste du séjour à été incroyable. Je maudit cet hôtel qui tombe en ruine qui plus es. A FUIR ! Nous avons été la cible de discriminations raciales et c’est inadmissible.

title: Une grande arnaque à éviter
text:
Hôtel très sale avec soit disant une piscine sur le toi qui minuscule qui ne représente absolument les photos de l’hôtel 
Chambres très sales avec de belles trace des anciens clients 
Toutes les remarques ne sont pas écoutées de la réception 
A éviter

title: Si salva solo la posizione il resto è inquadrabile.
text:
Devo dire che la posizione è ottima, vicino a Central park e a pochi minuti dai principali posti come time Square e 5th Avenue.
Però per il resto non si salva nulla, le foto sul sito non rispecchiano il vero stato, camere vecchie, con moquette per terra e tutto decisamente sporco nonostante le donne delle pulizie devo dire che facciamo il loro massimo. 
Piscina minuscola e per accedervi si passa dalle scale del palazzo veramente brutte e rovinate.
Le foto della piscina sono dei render, non è affatto così nella realtà.
Secondo me visto che costa, dovrebbero almeno mettere foto realistiche.

title: Molti disservizi, rumoroso, stanze piccole, un 4 stelle che sembra un ostello.
text:
Evitate questo hotel! 10 giorni ad agosto 2023, camera 1029 arriviamo e l'aria condizionata non funziona, ci lamentiamo e solo dopo 5 giorni ci viene assegnata la camera 539, qua manca il frigorifero ma rassegnati da tutto ci teniamo la camera, le camere sono davvero piccole, rumorose, l'aria condizionata quando funziona fa moltissimo rumore, senza tappi non dormirete, ci vengono addebitate spese sconosciute, ho appena chiesto informazioni....le tasse per servizi extra che ogni hotel decide se addebitare o meno ci sono state addebitate ma come sopra siamo stati senza aria condizionata 5 giorni e gli altri 5 in una camera di ripiego senza nemmeno il frigo.

L'hotel viene dichiarato come 4 stelle ma sembra un 2 stelle italiano, ho letto che negli stati uniti basta avete la piscina per aver 4 stellle.

L'unica nota positiva è la posizione, vicina alla metro, celtral park e relativamente vicina a times square, stop per il resto vi consiglio di cercare altro.

title: Location location location!
text:
I'd definitely stay here again! We have just returned from a week here. 

Firstly, the reviews are pretty accurate so I was glad for the heads up. However, for the price on the Upper West Side the pros certainly outweigh the cons.

Pros
-Location location location! It's such a lovely neighbourhood right opposite the Lincoln Centre. Great places to eat and drink around and the subway and bus stops are right outdoor. 
- the cleaners did such a fantastic job every day. Fresh towels, toiletries and an extremely clean room.
-the bed was super comfortable!
-WiFi worked great and excellent TV choice of channels
- friendly staff. We had an issue with our air con and it was sorted straight away 
-the air con worked so so well which was really appreciated in the heat
-the bar upstairs is lovely but yes it's run by another company. However we never needed to book.
-free bottled water every day but you need to ask for it at reception!

Cons
-yes the decor needs updating as it is looking quite tired.The stairways in particular was a mess but we just took the lift instead! 
-she asked for my card at check in as a safety deposit (standard). But they didn't mention this involved taking £114 out. Had to go down and check what the money taken out was before and I'm just waiting for this to be refunded now. They just need to make this clearer. 
-the air con is noisy. I'm a very light sleeper and had to turn it off but then there was also a noise. However, it was so powerful it was worth it! 
-the pool was tiny and looked very sad. It was also closed which seemed odd as it was sunny and even if there was rain forecast it had a cover on. 

Overall, I'd recommend the Empire to friends. Yes there are nicer hotels but not at the price the Empire offers.

Thanks for a fab stay!

title: Do NOT book here unless you want to lose your money and reservation.
text: We got scammed out of 700 dollars and our better reservation because they refused to answer calls from my number. I had to use my partner’s phone to get them to pick up. They were not accommodating whatsoever and used excuses as to why they never answered for an ENTIRE day. When I first called they answered immediately and then I was immediately put on a 30 minute hold for them to never answer again. When I used my partners phone they answered immediately and gave us our answers. Our initial reservation was cancelled by the system, and then our card was charged due to our room being non refundable. We had to reserve a smaller room when we were already there and it had cost 50 dollars more than the room that was twice it’s size. It had also required a 150 dollar safety deposit. The queen room had water damage and mold spots on the walls of the bathroom. The air conditioning made loud bangs and sounds all throughout the night. We also kept receiving spam calls late at night from the phone next to our bed. The elevators were very sketchy as well. All of the appeal was in the lobby and rooftop.

title: Pessimo
text:
