Peggior albergo in tutte le mie volte a ny!
Vecchio e sporco..
Ho preso una junior suite … moquette sporca pareti e carta da parete scrostata
bagno piccolo e con vasca e tendina( nel momento in cui ho chiesto doccia mi è stato risposto che per il mio maggior comfort c’era la vasca) 
Due asciugamani per tre persone 
Aria condizionata rumorosissima 
Direi da non ripetere …

title: Disappointed stay!! Book elsewhere!!
text: I had read the poor reviews of the hotel before booking, and although I had reservations I still booked as I thought my children would enjoy the pool and viewed it as just somewhere ‘to sleep’. I was wrong!!! The air conditioning unit was so noisy it made it hard to get any rest which really impacted our holiday. We did unplug it but the units outside were just as noisy. To add insult to injury the Venetian blinds did not open so we were in darkness for a week!!! No natural light - I find this unacceptable- trying to get 2 children ready for the day via lamps is frustrating!! The least I expect from a room is daylight. This is not a one off incident a lot of rooms are like this and therefore they should be advertised as internal rooms and priced accordingly. Or just get the mechanism fixed so the blinds work, i don’t think this is asking too much. We were unable to be moved as the hotel was full. On arrival the check in girl made a comment about me to the guest in front which is unprofessional and not needed after a long flight. I found the only friendly staff to be the cleaners and bellman. As per other reviews and therefore expected the rooms are dated, and need upgrading- warped doors, mould in the bathroom. It was too dark to see the condition of the actual room. My children did enjoy the pool, as per other reviews it is small and crowded but served a purpose. The hotel is in a good location and has potential but for the high price we payed versus what we got I can’t help but feel I’ve just been robbed!!!      With so many great and cheaper hotels in the city I would choose to stay elsewhere in future.

title: Au top
text:
Un séjour très agréable dans cet hôtel. 
Un rafraîchissement des chambres serait souhaitable ( salle de bain).
l’hôtel est idéalement placé, à 2 pas de central parc, Times Square et à proximité des stations de métro Lincoln et Columbus Circule.
Une équipe très accueillante et serviable, notamment Zee un membre du personnel à la perfection qui nous a guidé tout au long de notre séjour sur New York, merci à lui.
Je recommande entièrement ! Vive Zee 😀
Le petit plus: les bouteilles d’eau à volonté pour toute la family

title: Dilapidated- only good thing is the location (and not a one off like the management will say)
text: : We stay here regularly but it just keeps getting older without any work being done. The bathroom doors are warping and moldy and need replacing, the lamps are cheap and old, the blinds don’t even open, and the wallpaper is getting old and too dark. The place needs an overhaul. We do love the location though.

title: Terrible!
text: Terrible. Room and bathroom tiny (booked a suite), was not cleaned upon arrival. Curtains don’t stay open, front desk gave me binder clips to keep open! Pool is a joke - more than one person is crowded. Only given two stars instead of one because Niya at front desk was great. Save yourself the disappointment and stay somewhere else!

title: Family vacation/ Conference visit at Fordham.
text: We had a great stay for 4 nights.  The location is fabulous for access to Lincoln Center, Central Park, Theater District, Upper West Side and more.  It was walkable to so much.  I felt safe being out at night and safe leaving my teenagers to explore the area alone.  The rooftop area is a great perk.  It is a bit pricey but worth it for the benefits.

title: Don’t be fooled by photos!
text:
I booked to stay for 4 nights before heading back home. I booked the hotel purely based on the fact they have a rooftop pool to enjoy the sun before I headed home and the website made the hotel look stunning and modern. On one of the days I lay at the pool with the roof covered over, for over 2 hours. I asked 3 times when it would be opened, the woman on the third time said she would ask maintenance to come and open it. Over 45 minutes waiting and still they didn’t opened it. I then went to the reception to enquire to be told the rain is due to be ‘on and off’ today. It hadn’t rained once, it was due to be a cloudy day but surely the pool roof can be open. Everybody who came up to access the pool had commented on how small and different it is compared to the photos on the website. There is about 10 sun beds which is not enough to cater for the guests. 

Additionally, the hotel website portrays a luxurious modern hotel, when in fact it is outdated, the corridors and bedroom have very poor lightening and need to be renovated as parts of the wall and bathroom doors were falling apart. Furthermore, to access the rooftop we had to climb stairs that were covered in debris of clearly unfinished building works. When then sitting at the rooftop bar we were asked to move as people came in, every other table had a reserved sign on it apart from ours yet non hotel guests seemed to get priority over us. 

I am extremely disappointed with this as I could have easily booked a cheaper hotel and enjoyed sun in Central Park. 

The photos on the website do not give a true representation of the hotel and it is over priced for what it is. Other than a good location, I would not recommend this hotel. All hotel guests felt the same. I emailed a complaint on my second day staying and I am yet to hear back from them.

title: Buena ubicación
text:
Al hotel le falta un poco de renovaciones.
El personal es muy atento.
La calefacción es ruidosa.
Una noche nos asustamos porque había gritos y golpes en la habitación y corridas por los pasillos!
Está en una buena ubicación cerca de la ópera y el Central Park.

title: Excellent location
text: Excellent location , this hotel is located close to subways , shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is dated and could do with a revamp but the staff , namely Ms Karma, Ms Tyra and Samantha were amazingly helpful friendly and professional.

title: Classic Art Deco beauty in Best location for Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park and more.
text: No better location for Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park, Upper West Side, even Riverside Park and West Side Riverwalk are just blocks away. In the middle of it all. Great restaurants and activities all around. This is a classic Art Deco styled hotel. Lobby is large and comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. Doormen especially helpful. And the Rooftop Bar/Lounge is outstanding (make a reservation for good outdoor seats!). Wonderful views up and down Broadway and a unique vantage of the enormous Empire Hotel rooftop signage. The guest rooms are small, but that’s expected. Ours was a little worn, could use a bit of a touch up, but NYC is about leaving your room! I would definitely return.

title: My first nights in new york
text: We arrived on Sunday morning, the whole desk staff but specifically adam , mya and tyra gave us a warm welcome with a big smile on their faces. Everytime we walk nearby the desk, they give us some advice and recommendation about New York City. The hotel also had some nice place like the gym and the pool.

title: Staying for 3 days
text:
We were 4 friends and stayed in a two bed room,
The room was extremely clean when we came.

Very good spot in manhatan, and an amazing staff.
They took care of us very well and offered unlimited water when we came which was nice.

I very recommend this place!

title: A nightmare staying at Empire Hotel
text:
The staff service is terrible. First of all, when I arrived at the hotel, I noticed that room had mold in the walls. After different approaches explaining the situation, they finally changed the room. When I thought everything was resolved, the day after, I noticed that air conditioning of the other room didn’t work. I called the front desk requesting help and after several calls beginning at 11pm, the person in charge finally came in after 12:20am. He didn’t apologize for the delay. Unfortunately I confronted the same issue the next day at the same time, 11pm, and nobody came to fix the problem until 4am. I spent the entire night without air conditioning. 

In addition to the terrible staff services, the furniture is old and damaged. Please see the picture below to see the doors condition. They didn’t work appropriately. You have to push them very hard in order to close them. 

I do not recommend this hotel.  If you really want to enjoy your stay in the beautiful NYC, please book another hotel. There are so many great hotels out there.

title: Book anywhere else but not this hotel!
text: Pictures can be deceiving and this is the perfect example. The lobby is beautiful but the moment you step into the elevator you get a different picture. Old, dirty, dark to hide the dirt. Bathrooms with no ventilation, rotting doors due to humidity, curtains that don’t work, AC old and loud and I can go on. I’m giving this review 2 stars only because Adam, one of the managers got us a suite.

title: I expected more
text:
We were not impressed with the overall upkeep of the hotel. We were given a room with a very dated television and air conditioner, a broken curtain (we couldn't get natural light!), and things generally felt old and very well used. It is just not what we expected from a hotel.  

When we told the front-desk about the broken curtain, we were given the excuse that most rooms have broken curtains because most of their visitors found the outdoor light too bright. We didn't buy this at all and were very disappointed as we felt like we were given a lame excuse because they didn't want to switch us to another room, even though all we were asking is for someone to come and fix the curtain. They ended up moving us to a different room which, to no surprise, had a working curtain that allowed us to get daylight, and a much better TV. The advertised pool is actually very small and I wouldn't consider it a feature; pictures can be deceiving.

On the positive side, the hotel is located in a quieter area of Manhattan very close to Central Park, with some nice restaurants and breakfast places around. We found this to be a really good thing as the Times Square area can be overcrowded and overwhelming.

title: Came through with flying colors
text: This is going to be an unusual review.  First, I want to say this hotel has never disappointed.  But what happened on Friday night was above and beyond.  My daughter apparently had missed the last bus out of NYC to NJ.  She was alone at Port Authority and frightened and didn't know what to do. No police anywhere and it was midnight.  She called me for help and all I could think was get her to the Empire Hotel.  I called the hotel and spoke to manager at front desk. Big shout out to Danny!! He got me a room, told me he would take care of her when she got there and not to worry.  She made it to the hotel, called me I spoke to Danny again and he did just what he said he'd do!! My daughter was safe and staying at this wonderful hotel.  I was never told I can't help you.  Thank you, Danny, and everyone associated with the Empire. Always my go to when I'm in NYC!!

title: Do you like FILTHY rooms & cheap decor? Love being ripped off? This is the place for you
text: This hotel is a joke. They exist purely to fleece tourists, don't be one of them. They botched our booking and gave us a room with 2 beds in it even though we'd specifically requested the exact opposite. Then they charged us extra for it even though they admitted they messed up the booking. They did move our room the following day and it was just as horrid as the first so I can't imagine the quality is much better regardless of rooms. Chatted to some other guests in the lift who were as equally horrified by their room as we were. My colleagues who stayed there were also repulsed by the place so I'm definitely not alone or being a princess about it.  Gross rooms, totally FILTHY. It is one of the ugliest hotels I've ever stayed at in NYC.

title: Dirty and rooms need renovations
text: Didn’t have room at check in them all of a sudden..had a room available. Was suspicious and for a good reason—Room is very outdated and not clean. Electric outlets look like a fire hazard. Holes in bathroom wall, hair on floor. Lobby is nice and updated but that’s about it.

title: Personnel= TOP; Building= to renew
text:
The entrance looks great, same as the furniture of the rooms, but the basics (as a terribly old AC system, the noise of the street entering from old windows @ floor 5),  a very small bathroom, a swimming pool as small and as deep as a tub) are even below what expected for the convenient price. 
Luckily all the staff is marvellous: from Pasquale by the reception desk to Dennis by the entrance-taxi arrangement-luggage storage, were simply great and made us forget the other inconveniences.

title: Noisy!  But good location
text: Good location, near the park.  Nice rooftop bar/restaurant and pool. My room was small and dark.  It llooked out onto the central “courtyard” with the aircon units and the like.  The machinery was incredibly noisy and made it uncomfortable  to be in the room and particularly a challenge when trying to sleep.

title: It’s a dump
text:
It’s a total dump. 

TripAdvisor is saying I need more characters but that’s really all you need to know. A dump. 

Their website/photos are a good work of fiction lol. Wish I would have read the reviews!

title: VERY DISSATISFIED AND FALSE ADVERTISING
text: Very dissatisfied with my stay at this hotel. They advertise rooftop bar and lounge, so after a day of touring the city my sister and I wanted to go back and experience the rooftop bar and the views they say are so spectacular o ly to find out there is a private party and couldn't go up there. I complained to mgmt. And they said they are "Partnered" with other group of. Rooftop bar and they don't know their schedule. I believe they should know and be able to notify their custo.wra who are staying at that hotel for the rooftop bar/lounge. FALSE ADVERTISING  if you ask me. They advertise twice about rooftop bar/lounge, they also need update the decor and rooms, windows very dirty and curtains. The bar/lounge in the hotel was even closed. They also advertise in site secured parking....FALSE,  we had to park over two blocks away and DID NOT look secure AT ALL. VERY upsetting and dissatisfied.  Didnt help complaining to them, they got their money they could careless how your stay was. Don't suggest this hotel to anyone. The gentleman helping with our luggage very friendly and helpful though.

title: It's not that great! Unfortunately
text:
This hotel appears great in the pictures, and whilst the lobby looks grand when you enter it, it basically stops there. This review is positive, but the hotel could be so much better for the money you spend on it and the location.
Staff are friendly and helpful. However, we had a key issue when we arrived. It appears the staff know keys stuggle as they tell you not to put it anywhere near anything electronic. Upon arrival we were given the wrong room number, so late at night we were trying to access a room that wasn't ours. The staff member laughed and gave us the correct room number only for the key not to work (we were just holding it) we went up and down the lifts twice! With no apology 
Note: When you check in, staff offer you bottled water (free), take it as there is nothing else in the hotel (other than pre booked roof top bar) 
Rooms are basic, spacious, and clean but tired. The aircon unit is cold but so loud that you can barely hear yourself think, let alone talk. In the room, there is a fridge in the wardrobe, a small table iron board, iron, and an umbrella. 
Note: There is no safe in the room. This worried us as we had to keep hold of our passports all the time. 
The bathroom is clean and has a hair dryer in the cupboard under the sink. The hotel provides toiletries which are nice. The shower has fast raining hot water, and there are plenty of sized towels.
Note: There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room.
There is no bar in the hotel, no restaurant, or anywhere to get food or drink. 
The rooftop bar is lovely but not owed by the hotel and is very expensive. However, of the 3 days we were here, it was closed to private functions.. Not great! The hotel doesn't have any issues with you bringing food and drink back to your room. Starbucks is next door for a nice morning coffee.
The pool is hilarious. The hotel website makes it look so beautiful. It's not! It's very tiny both in length and width, and there are maybe 5 sunbeds. The pool is open from 11 am, and weather permitted. Disabled people could not access this area unless you had access to the service lift. 
Overall, we enjoyed our time here but wouldn't return. The location is right next to Central Park and not too far from Times Square.

title: Disappointed
text: The AC issues were extremely frustrating, as they seemed to temporarily fix it but failed to maintain it for more than a night. Additionally, the overall condition of the hotel was disappointing, with everything appearing worn down and malfunctioning. The pool was a huge letdown, not at all resembling the enticing picture on booking.com.

title: Awful
text: Where to start...ewww. Believe the terrible reviews, this place is dirty. Our sheets had stains all over, looked like small blood sports (google bed bug stains). Asked for new bedding and they sent up a bunch of ripped sheets. A/c stopped working (thankfully just before our checkout) during nyc heatwave. Odd smells, bathroom is downright scary. Would absolutely never stay here agin even if they offered it for free.

title: Best staff, accommodations, and location
text: The accommodations, front desk staff, and especially the manager, Adam, was exceptional. When my flight was cancelled (twice) and needed to extend my stay, Adam quickly helped me sort out the best room rate, so I didn't need to change hotels, or rooms. Having a manager quickly accessible, understanding, and professional was amazing  - especially since my travel plans kept changing. The staff, the room, the lobby, the rooftop, and the location are all top-notch! I will defintely return with friends.

title: Do not stay!!
text: Worst hotel ever!!! Our ac was broken for two nights and they still refused to move us rooms. Even the engineer of the hotel said it has been broken but nobody did anything. Manager was very dismissive. Do not stay in this hotel! Save your money, stay away from this hotel! worst ever!!!

title: Excellent Hotel, great staff, central location!
text: A wonderful hotel to stay in - the staff was extremely helpful. We were given a corner room which was very spacious and comfortable. The location is perfect - across from Lincoln Center, a variety of restaurants, near Central Park and Columbus Circle. The rooftop bar was fun, the valet parking was easy and the front desk was very accommodating. Highly recommend!

title: Hôtel correct et satisfaisant
text:
+ L’hôtel était très bien situé, à côté du métro, il y a tout ce qu’il faut.
+ Le personnel hyper sympa
+ Chambre très correct
+ Le bar/roof-top offrant une jolie vue 

- Pas de petit-dej au moment où je suis venue 
- Pas beaucoup de services proposés par l’hôtel

title: Magnetic Fourth Stay
text:
This is my fourth stay at Empire Hotel. I extended for two more days for a variety of reasons discussed previously in a review of mine during my stay for a my birthday celebration. I’d like to add that my late March stay was the winning element in my life to return for the my holiday work week off during Fourth of July Week. The front of house manager, Tommy Tinoco, security and doorman, housekeeping and engineers, restaurant staff at the Empire Rooftop have hospitality in a regal ranking. So during my birthday, Tommy complimentary upgraded my two full bed room to a junior king suite. Huge room, especially when in Manhattan. I wouldn’t return if it wasn’t for upper management that follows Tommy’s example —- guests aren’t a number, a room filler. Guests even become friends with another; I should know, I have a few as Instagram friends now. New York and its visitors is addicting. Empire Hotel helps me to know I will make my holiday and birthday plans an annual thing like I have for the last two years. 

Ok, so for my Independence Day (week) stay, I work as a music journalist so being next to Lincoln Center’s Summer In The City was brilliant for my hobbies and networking. Rooftop views at the pool for guests from below catching Lincoln Center is worth all the magic one will tell friends and gloat on social media. Let’s be real. PJ Clarkes is also next door and hopping. The atmosphere in Empire’s lobby is full of ambience. I am a late owl because of my career, so it helps few guests, and security and the front desk is always there to chat a conversation with even the news on. New York doesn’t sleep but because of this Upper West Side location, it’s very neighborly and quiet when one does want to turn in. Plus, ✨best✨ sleep of my mom’s life. Mine too when I wasn’t just a social butterfly visiting local bars in the LGBTQIA community nearby. That was fun just coming off of Pride celebrations. 

We checked in early, it was no problem. Room was exceptionally clean and ready for my mother and I for our week together before I hop music tours and festivals again across the country. I lived in a hotel before (when I was 18 and have family as executive management with top amenities but also  stayed in several across all regions of U.S.  because of my career) Empire is cannon and incomparable for the experience and smiles from staff. The building is historical, take NYC history with you. We use Empire for quality time because you want to be around a staff that also is a family.

Visits also include Fourth of July fireworks obviously with help from doormen on which train to go — so easy because stations are everywhere in the vicinity, 👑Taylor Swift Galleries 👑 for all the swifties!, celebrating New York Asian Film festival at Lincoln Film Center, Silent Disco Night or Jazz Night at Lincoln Center, Central Park, Columbus Shops Center, Bloomingdale’s Outlet, AMC Movie Theater, visits to ABC News studios for Kelly and Mark, local bookstores and ice cream shops— my choice Van Leeuwen and Westsider Books, Whole Foods or the Walgreens next door for my grocery needs when not dining at The Empire Rooftop or grabbing a bagel across the street or Starbucks and just an overall appreciation of the buildings architecture. I love New York because of Empire introducing me to new things each visit.

title: Do not stay here
text: This hotel is filthy. Paint peeling from ceilings. Air conditioning ancient and filled with dirt. Super loud because air conditioning is kaput (they don’t send anyone to fix it) and bedroom windows so poorly fitted they don’t stop street noise.  Bathroom toilet has cigarette burns and permanent stains inside the toilet.  Blinds don’t lift and management say that’s acceptable to sit in dark. Windows filthy anyway and management say they will be cleaned in a few weeks. Wallpaper peeling. Wires on the floor. Furniture scuffed. Doors and handles dirty   Bathroom door warped and cracking. It’s awful. No food and no breakfast offered so have to leave hotel. Not even a kettle to make a cup of tea so have to leave hotel for anything. Wanted to leave the moment we saw inside our bedrooms but won’t refund. Btw we have two bedrooms and both are as filthy tired and stained as the other.

title: falta de atención al cliente
text: la Habitacion estaba limpia, pero no había aire acondicionado y estaba muy caliente. tube que llamar varias veces para que arreglaran el problema y nunca lo resolvieron. quedaron de traer un abanico y tube que llamar hasta tres veces para que al final ya casi amaneciendo lo trajeran. creia que descansaríamos y no mas bien salí mas cansada. no tienen buen costumer services.

title: Old, Filthy & Terrible customer servive
text: If I could 0, I would've! This hotel is so old! See pictures. The service is -10, the hotel staff is so unfriendly and not helpful at all. We were at the hotel at 4am due to an early flight, so asked for possible early check in as check in is only at 3pm. We were told we couldn't, so asked to be on the waiting list. Nobody called us until we went back at 2pm after seeing other people check in. I then asked for a big room as there's 3 of us with 8 suitcases, I was put in an old room with cracked furniture and peeling walls, with a tiny space for a closet. Filthy windows and dirty shower with stains. This the worst hotel I've been in in New York and I've been to a few. Worst part is that it's overpriced with terrible customer service. Do yourself a favour, DO NOT COME HERE! Go to The Manhattan rather

title: Great Location.
text:
Very pleasant check in experience with Adam at front desk. He patiently answered all of my questions and offered a few suggestions.
The hotel decor and room finishes are a bit tired. But you do not go to New York to sit in your hotel room. The room was clean and well serviced. 
However, I cannot emphasize enough that the location is great. Close to Central Park, the blue subway line, Broadway, restaurants, Lincoln Center, and a Whole Foods for hotel rooms snacks or a quick meal. 
Had some positive interactions with room cleaning staff. 
The bottom line is the I will probably go back to the Empire for my next trip to New York.

title: Proprio no
text: Ammaliata dalle serie tv viste negli anni, ho deciso di soggiornare in questo hotel per 3 giorni. Posizione ottima per spostarsi, vicinissima a central park e alla metro. Camera piccolissima e non pulita.

title: Wonderful Experience at Empire Hotel NYC
text: Everytime I stay at The Empire Hotel in  NYC on W. 63rd Street the service, hospitality and everything is outstanding. Ami, Adam, and Erica are an incredible management team. They go above and beyond to make sure their guests are comfortable, relaxed and enjoy their stay. The entire staff is excellent. I will continue to be a frequent guest at The Empire Hotel.

title: Empire Hotel is in great location central to everything.
text: The hotel is in a great location. There are a few places to eat by the hotel. Our room was lovely. Hotel very very nice. Ami and Daniel were very pleasant and very helpful.  Cathy and Mo from Ireland

title: Location location location
text: Fabulous location, right next to the Lincoln Plaza. Very friendly helpful staff, especially Ami at reception who was amazingly kind and very astute with great advice and helpful tips. Lovely rooftop pool and bar and a reasonable gym

title: Our stay at the Empire Hotel
text: We were assisted by Karma and Sarah during our stay. They where both very friendly and well predisponed, they were also really professional and understanding. We were very happy to recieve their help, they made our experience better. Moreover the hotels facilities were great and the location was tourist friendly.

title: Nice with one odd occurrence
text: Very lovely pool, fab to have in NYC, and the staff are really nice, the room was clean and pleasant if a bit small (NYC…), the free Wi-Fi everywhere is a nice bonus! Knocking one star off because when I plugged in a hairdryer it SMOKED and was clearly about to go on fire before I yanked it from the wall, and the guy who came to take it away was like, oh you shouldn’t put it on high? Specially with the skies going wild (not the hotel’s fault ;)) that was a little alarming, but honestly everything else was great.

title: adequate
text: the hotel’s location is fantastic.  the room was adequate - dated decor, undersized bathroom, but everything mostly worked.  the good news: clean sheets and towels, lots of very hot water for the shower, air conditioning was good.  not so good: sitting on toilet, my feet weren’t quite inside the bathroom, the shower bracket was broken, and there was no coffee maker.

title: Wonderful Hotel, from curb to room and back again
text:
I was back east for my 50th High School reunion. A decent number of us stayed at the Empire Hotel, about 12 of us in all.

From the moment I stepped out of the cab from the airport, it was just magical.  I've stayed other hotels in NYC, but this was by far the best.

The cab was greeted by a doorman.  He took my luggage into a separate room for a moment while I composed myself outside.  (It was a hellacious experience getting there due to booking the room through Booking.com.  Word to the wise. Never, EVER use Booking.com, but that's a story for another time.)

I returned to the hotel after walking things off, was greeted by another doorman, who retrieved my luggage.  Escorted me to check in (another few moments of what the hell, as Booking.com had my name entered incorrectly!)  that got straightened out relatively quickly, and graciously, by the woman at the counter (I wish I could remember her name, She was AWESOME!)

The doorman escorted me to my room, brought my stuff inside and exited professionally, and politely.

The bed was calling me to just chill.  Go to turn on the TV, and LO!  It wasn't working right.  I called the desk, and someone was in my room in less than a minute!  I was astounded at the customer care!  He had to reset the SmartTV, which he did quickly and efficiently.

I headed out to explore the area a bit and figure out where to eat.  The rest of the alums had not checked in yet.  Again, a doorman held the door for me.

I was feeling better, and headed back to my room. Again, a doorman.

I keep mentioning the doormen because other places I've stayed that had them did their thing when I arrived, but little else.  There was a lot of coming and going. There was ALWAYS a doorman.  I'm telling you, the doormen made the whole experience richer.

 

I found some mediocre food at a place next door.  I didn't finish it.  I returned to the hotel, and decided to check out the rooftop bar and restaurant.  Lots of choices of small plates, and top shelf liquor, and really decent choices of beer.  The hostess was delightful and inviting.  The food was terrific!  I had some hamburger sliders, and chicken wings.  

Headed out again as I had managed to forget some things, despite my list.

I'm telling you! The door people were incredible!!

The room itself was a decent size also.  I booked a superior queen sized room. The mattress and pillows were wonderful.  The carpeted floor was clean.  The bathroom was small, but functional.  There was sufficient storage for what I brought.  The shower!  Again! Holy whoa.  It was a rainfall shower thingy, with excellent water pressure. I've been in rooms where the water was barely a trickle.  Not at this place.

Then I checked out the view!! HOLY MOLY!  Looking out at Lincoln Center and the little park across the street.  (Dante Park)

Other alums had started arriving, and we met at the Rooftop.  I developed a mobility issue a few weeks back, and there was a lovely sitting area I simply could not get to as it appeared to be only accessible by two flights of stairs.  Well!  A friend mentioned this to one of the servers, and et voile!  The server told her there was a service elevator to get me up there.  Someone was called to operate it, who showed up a few minutes later, and there I sat. The top of the world.  Considering that about 24 hours earlier, the sky was filled with smoke from the Canada fires, the sky had completely cleared.  More small plates.  Chicken wings again, excellent fried calamari, excellently prepared fish tacos, great fries. And great mixed drinks.

When we'd had enough partying up top, the server was asked to get the person who had the service elevator thing.  That person showed up at exactly the right time.

I can not sing the praises of this place enough.  The alums staying there had the same things to say.

Thank you, Empire Hotel.  You made the weekend perfect!

title: Great service, cleanliness and location make for a winner
text: We picked this hotel because of its location and reasonable price.  We were very happy with the excellent service from everyone we encountered - front desk, doormen, housekeeping. Our immaculately clean room was very small but this is typical in NYC.  We enjoyed the  rooftop bar - both the view and the quality of it offerings.  Many options for food and beverage nearby.

title: You can't get closer to the Met
text: We had such a fabulous stay at this hotel when we visited New York for the Met.  Three of us fitted comfortably in the delux double room. The staff at check in were friendly and gave us a warm welcome.  The lobby is gorgeous and is lovely to sit in as it is air conditioned. We loved the funky decor of the corridors and room.  We had asked for a view of the opera house when booking and were delighted when we saw the view from our 2nd floor window.  The room has a spacious closet with fridge and the bathroom had a great shower with lots of soft fluffy towels and nice toiletries. There is air conditioning but this took some time to cool the room.... But it had cooled it in time for a comfortable nights sleep.  I was doubtful when looking at the size of the beds on arrival but they were very comfortable and the linens were soft. There is a lovely rooftop area with pool but we visited during the Canadian wildfires which made the air quality in New York not great for sitting out in.... Such a pity as its very lovely up there.  We did have pre opera food and drinks in the rooftop bar... Be sure to book as it was a lovely experience and books out. Checkout was very fast and again very warm and friendly.  They stored our bags for us so we could see the city and it was quick to retrieve them on our return, a cab was called for us.  I would recommend this hotel as we had such a good experience.

title: Cute rooftop and delicious food. Great for Gossip Girl fans!
text:
As a huge Gossip Girl fan I was super excited to go here and it didn’t disappoint! So cool to sit looking out on the city and the “Empire” sign, they even had a Gossip Girl cocktail!

We had our toddler with us and while as a European I normally find the US very kid unfriendly for eating out, I did actually feel very comfortable with my son here. 

The food and drinks were really tasty and for NYC good value!

title: Do not stay here, it’s unclean, dirty and overpriced
text:
Awful hotel, the lobby looks great and then you get to the rooms and they are disgustingly dirty. 
They’re charging $300 + for a room for the night you expect a certain level. We checked out the next day and moved to another hotel. The only good thing about this place is the location. 
We were so disappointed with the rooms, it made me actually want to cry.

title: Location Amazing
text:
Friendly, helpful staff..
Water given after a long flight.
Hotel room amazing,  everything you need in it. Small fridge, iron & board.  Good size shower with good power. Rooftop bar/food a great asset, also has pool deck. The best feature of this hotel was Location,  Location,  Location! Would highly recommend this hotel and we'll definitely be back to visit again.😊

title: Dc Ireland
text: We there for a week staff where very pleasant especially Adam could not do enough for us room was very good needs a little refurbishment but nothing major to be expected for such a busy hotel as a we’ll traveled person will be back soon don’t let all negative reviews put u off  some people no pleasing  back again in January

title: A Cave
text: The hotel is in an excellent location.  It's too bad that it doesn't age nicely. The corridors and rooms are as dark as a cave, with decrepit, mark-ridden furniture and fixtures. The air conditioner is loud and difficult to adjust, with unsatisfactory results. The front desk staff is fine but appears bored with their work. There is no breakfast available on the premises, however, there are lots of options nearby. The doormen are fantastic.

title: Rude staff
text: The front desk staff was the rudest I’ve ever experienced. The room keys didn’t work and they somehow  tried to blame us. They gave us the wrong room and didn’t apologize. The staff refused to answer very basic questions and had shockingly bad attitudes for the hospitality business. And it’s a dark, dingy place all around. There are much better options at similar price points and I would not recommend the Empire.

title: Great location and excellent service
text: The location is fantastic, great neighborhood with lots of restaurants in walking distance, easy access to the subway. Pasquale at the front desk was so helpful at check-in, he was so friendly and helped us get a better room.

title: Horror Novelist Special
text: The hotel when you first walk in looks great.  It is surrounded by places to eat & across Lincoln Center- but that’s the only advantage.  I actually got upgraded. If my  room was an upgrade, I wonder what the original room was like?!?! The room was dusty, the carpeting smelled yuck.  The bathroom was incredibly small.  The door had to be kept open when you sat on the toilet.  The ceiling and the doors had paint chipping.   The hallways and decor was a remnant of StephenKing novel The Shining. The hotel does not have room service.  The corridors are dark, really dark.

title: Unless you need to be near Lincoln Center, don’t waste your money
text: It’s been a while since I wrote a review, but I was compelled to due to our bad experience relative to cost. The room was dark and smelled musty. The front desk man was brusque and unhelpful. We requested a wake up call that didn’t happen. There are no amenities — no coffee maker, no fridge. It took literal minutes for the shower to warm up, and the water never got hot, just warm.  It is clear that they can rely on their location for a steady business, even with their high rates, and so don’t have to live up to the photos or descriptions on their website.  Yes, the lobby looks cool. Too bad the rest of the experience is so disappointing.

title: Hotel room left MUCH to be desired
text:
The Empire hotel left much to be desired.  Firstly, I happened to be traveling on days when the hotel had inflated prices. I paid so much money for a hotel that simply isn't worth it on a regular day.  I will start with the pros. There are two.

Pros:
1)Staff was helpful and attentive
2)Right in the middle of Lincoln Center and I was there for the ballet, so great location

Cons:
1)The room was small
2)The room is DATED. Don't let the website pictures fool you.  While the lobby is nice, the actual hotel room itself needs a renovation.  The room is not only old and worn (dirty furniture, peeling paint, chipped furniture and paint) but not functional.  For example, the phone panel that indicates what numbers to call for help was completely peeled up (see pics) so the phone was inaccessible.  The sink sprays water out at you.  The refrigerator has no interior shelves.  There is a large bench in front of the full length mirror that you can't move, so you lose access to the bottom half of the mirror and the bench was also dirty and peeling. The bar in the closet is so high up that you have to stand on the fridge to hang your clothes.

I don't recommend this hotel.  It wasn't the worst of the worst but nowhere near what I thought it would be based off of the website's pictures.

title: Another great stay at the Empire
text: We always have a good stay at the Empire. Close to Lincoln Center, Central Park and good restaurnts. Very efficient and attentive staff at the desk and in answering our calls.   Chheorten was very helpful at checkint desk.

title: Not worth the money
text: We booked this hotel due to its proximity to the Lincoln center, where we had theater tickets. The area is lovely, lots of restaurants (loved PJ Clark’s), but the hotel was very disappointing! $475 a night. AC did not work, took multiple calls to front desk before maintenance arrived (midnight) . Took 2 visits from maintenance (now it’s 1 am) before they finally admitted they had another room. At midnight they had denied that. So we moved rooms and the second room was shabby and had no linens for one of the beds. Certainly not the experience I expect for that kind of money

title: Good hotel, nothing special but good.
text:
Good location as it’s just out of the craziness of the midtown area. Easy to take trains from here. However, other than the lobby they hotel is quite tired. The rooftop is also open to public so it’s difficult to get space up there. Staff were amazing especially the very friendly cleaning staff! 
It’s a very expensive hotel but on the cheaper side for hotels in and around midtown.
The hotel is close to very nice restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen and along Amsterdam.

title: I give the Empire my highest ratings.
text: I visit the Empire frequently and my stay this past weekend exceeded the service I so appreciate about the hotel and staff.  Pasquale at the front desk was his usual efficient and gracious self.   Chaarthon accommodated a late room cleaning request.  A late night request to fix the room AC was handled promptly.  All in all, the service and responsiveness of all Empire hotel personnel I have encountered has been and continues to be superlative.  I give this hotel my NYC business because of their excellent customer service.

title: Perfect
text:
We arrived on Thursday evening to a friendly welcome at the front door and again at the reception.  We were told about the roof top bar and offered bottled water.  Staff were polite and friendly so not sure why so many reviews are complaining.
I was embarrassed by one English guest who was complaining that the outside noise was too noisy and she wanted an upgrade! 
Our room 1116 (king deluxe) on the top floor was pleasantly comfortable and spacious. We had a nice view, it was clean and fresh and the bed was large and comfy.  So what if the paint is peeling on the bathroom door, I don’t understand some people who complain over such petty things. The lobby and mezzanine are really lovely.  Staff always greeted us and held the door as we left each day.
Location is perfect.
Housekeeping cleaned our room each time we went for breakfast , we’d always return to it smelling fresh  of disinfectant and the bed made and fresh towels. 
Honestly couldn’t fault the hotel and hope to come back next year.
We were celebrating my 50th birthday and has the best time. Thank you

title: Avoid this place
text:
Front desk staff very unwelcoming and inpolite. Lobby looks pretty but that's where it ends. 

Corridors are dark and like the rooms they smell badly. Paint peeling off doors and walls, Shower curtain attached with safety pin. Shower tiles cracked, patched and mouldy. AC does not work, curtains and carpet dirty. Furniture chipped and scratched, TV is at least 15 years old. Paint blistering on ceiling. Bathroom light contained smeared debris of dead insect.

The fact that there is not a single sign or electricity outlet that's been attached straight tells you all you need to know about attention to detail.

The rooms and corridors are carpeted with near identical partern as the Overlook hotel in the Shining. That's a sign.

title: Deserves to be closed—horrible
text: This hotel deserves zero stars. Their front desk lacks hospitality, their rooms are old, dated, stale, and the upkeep—-well just say as a well traveled individual who only came because of group travel, our entire group had a horrible experience. Overpriced and understated—the engineer was busy ensuring rooms had heat and air. The noise is another factor, we heard dragging and furniture moving throughout the stay. Oh and they are so bad they have shower curtains that look like they are not cleaned, the velvet sofas are stained and there is zero room service. If you value your money, you would fare better staying elsewhere. And the front desk, who couldn’t even apologize for the lavkluster stay, was Chourdin. Bottom hotel for sure.

title: Hidden Gem Boutique Hotel with Pool & Near Central Park
text:
This is a lovely upscale boutique hotel in the Upper West Side of Manhattan. I would not normally choose this neighborhood for my NYC touring but my daughter asked for a hotel with a pool, and in Manhattan, that's not easy to come by.

They have a small rooftop pool with a swanky patio bar/resto which was nice, although got quite crowded later in the day.  Due to it being on the roof the pool area was not as warm as it could be, and I feel the temp of the water should be raised accordingly.  Also, there were times the whole patio would shut down if there were threats of thunder & lightning.  One day, there were storms in the forecast but they never materialized but the hotel closed the pool anyway. This was devastating for my little one.

Upon mentioning it at check-out though the staff member was very sympathetic and comped some of my resort fees accordingly, so no complaints. 

Overall it was a nice stay and would recommend this location.

title: A Good Stay for a Good Price
text: A good stay for a good price.  Located across from Lincoln Center and walking distance to hundreds of restaurants.  The staff was helpful and gracious.  My room was fairly standard for a mid-range hotel.  There was wear and tear, which is normal for the price range.

title: Believe the negative reviews,..
text: Believe the negative reviews,.. but hotel is convenient to Lincoln Center and the staff does their best but the place is astonishingly inadequate and overpriced,.. they claimed to be at full capacity so who knows where the revenue is going?

title: Best Location for Lincoln Center and a very Comfy Bed!
text: I needed a comfortable bed, a nice greeting, and to be close to Lincoln Center. It doesn't get better than literally across the street from the world famous fountain.  I had a wonderful stay for 3 nights at the Empire Hotel, and I will definitely stay again. Location is also perfect because it is right next door to PJ Clark's, a delicious restaurant with exemplary service.  Highly recommend. I liked everything about my most recent stay in NYC. Thank you, Empire Hotel!

title: A rafraîchir tres sérieusement
text:
Déception. Chambre vétuste (papier peint arraché, moisisure à la fenetre...).
Piscine très petite. 
Personnel sympathique, sauf quand il s'agit d'accéder au rooftop le soir... Les jeunes gens branchés sont privilégiés. 
Idéalement placé.

title: Great customer service
text: We unfortunately had some concerns with our room, but Ami was absolutely lovely. She came in and listened to our concerns, coordinating a room change that was suitable. Although the overall experience was more so average, we would give Ami 5 stars. She was so sweet and caring, truly amazing hospitality that would make us happy to revisit The Empire Hotel.

title: NYC Empire Hotel
text:
Why we stayed at the Empire hotel: 
We were staying at a hotel around Time Square which was very disappointing in terms of infrastructure because 1 of the 2 elevators was not working at a 27 stories building hotel!!!!!! (it took us 15 minutes to go up or down)... so we came to visit The Empire Hotel based on a friend's recommendation. We walked in the lobby and Karma helped us at the front desk with a great smile (which we were missing at the other hotel) and even offered for us to see the room before making a reservation. We discussed room rates and right there we decided that we were going to stay there. 
The following day we checked in. 
The hotel is beautiful and still keeps a great style of the old NYC with great taste.
The lobby area is very nice and even has a second floor for more relaxing time and/or eating, drinking...etc. 
Rooms are very nice and confortable, bathroom had everything you would need, very clean. Bed had great linens and was extremely confortable. 
We stayed at a 9th floor so we had a little bit of a view from the side. 
Location is incredible been situated in Columbus Circle with great walking around the hotel (Central park, Metro station) and just walking around the block is very nice.

title: We'll be back! Excellent location and great value!
text:
Awesome! We were so happy -- our room was ready for us when we arrived! I was chilly bc my teen likes cold air, and housekeeping brought me another comforter within 5 minutes! The shower pressure (rain head) was amazing. The room was clean which is what I really care about. Basic decor, but we were there to experience NY, not look at curtains!

All of the staff were polite and helpful. They gave us a great restaurant recommendation and offered a late check-out hassle-free. Can't beat the location -- steps from Lincoln Center and just a few blocks from Central Park and Columbus Circle. 

We drove down from Boston and parked in a garage around the corner on 62nd street -- so much less expensive than valet (our total bill was $106 and they had the car waiting for us exactly when we said we needed it. 

There was a Mexican food truck that serves delicious healthy Mexican 2 blocks away on Broadway, and there's a Target right there (61st &Bway) in case you forget anything or need some snacks!

The Mezzanine was nice for hanging out. We did not get to go to the rooftop bar bc my son was underage. And the pool was not yet open. But all in all, a FANTASTIC place. We will be back!

title: Girls trip for a couple seniors. Such a great location.
text:
I booked a three day stay with a college friend from April 17-20. I was concerned with the mixed reviews - but only found a wonderful and amazing hotel just steps from Lincoln Center.
Pasquale and the front desk staff are a treasure. The lobby and mezzanine are funky, retro and spotless. Security is great - which I wanted as we are in our 60s and women traveling alone. Everyone is friendly. Housekeeping is outstanding (don’t forget to tip them!)
Things to know : this is NYC and rooms are small. There was a refrigerator hiding in a closet and a safe, but there isn’t anywhere to stash a coffee maker. Starbucks is steps from the front door, great dining at PJ Clark or the Smith very close by. It was in the 50s so we passed on the rooftop pool and Bar.
It’s an older building. The paint in our bathroom was a bit “bubbly” from stream, and there was no bathroom fan - but there was also no mold or dirt. Bigger than a cruise ship bathroom, but tiny because, well, NYC. Great water pressure and plenty of hot water.
It is a little noisy, but Mount Sinai ambulances have sirens, and again, NYC. Our room, 322, faced the street. No noise from surrounding neighbors. Also - some reviews mentioned a pot smell …not at all my experience. All was fresh and lovely.
This hotel gives excellent pricing if you call them direct - price out with the services, but call them and compare. I saved money and could cancel up to 24 hours before.
Walkable location to Times Square and Broadway Theatres, Lincoln Center across the street (Camelot!!! See it!!!), upper west side, Central Park (strawberry fields).
Quick ride from LGA via cab or Uber.
I will be back!

title: Would not stay again: musty, small, very worn.
text:
It was not the worst it could have been, but I definitely wouldn't stay here again. We were originally put into a very small & musty room where the AC unit was left open with the cover leaning against the wall, revealing sticky bug traps on the floor and one dead bug on the trap.  I immediately asked for a room change, and they obliged, but yuck. They ended up sending us to a room that was slightly larger and nicer, but regardless of that, the carpets look, feel and smell, old and dirty.  I didn't want to walk barefoot in the room. The bathroom doors are rusty, with peeling paint and a sketchy looking bathroom door, the bathroom sink is so small it's like using an airplane bathroom, and there is just no space anywhere. There were a few weird stains on the wallpaper, the mattress bottom sheet wasn't fitted so it came right off the mattress, and the whole room smelled musty and old. The TV did not have any of the streaming services that many other NYC hotels have at this point - while isn't a requirement, it was another thing to make me consider only other hotels for the future. 
 Housekeeping also started knocking in the morning starting at 7:55AM, when check out was not until Noon.  That just seemed bizarrely early.  The bed was comfortable, but that's about the only thing going for it.

title: Can't beat the price or location!
text: Excellent hotel for the price and location - literally across the street from Lincoln Center. Friendly, efficient staff who were very responsive to my reporting of a noisy radiator; fixed immediately.  Good restaurants within easy walking distance and a Starbucks at the corner.  Rooms large by NYC standards and very clean.

title: Excellent Location for Lincoln Center Performances
text: We chose the Empire because of its proximity to Lincoln Center since my wife has some mobility issues. Our deluxe king room had a desk and upholstered easy chair. The bed was comfortable, and our view of Lincoln Center excellent. The bath was small with no counter space. There was no coffee maker, but Starbucks is in the building and Rosetta a block away. It is just a block and a half away from the southern part of Central Park. The Hotel Rooftop Lounge has great views and good margaritas. Our housekeeper was very helpful. The clientel were just fine with many families and some older folks. I  would stay there again.

title: Great place to stay if you're seeing a show at Lincoln Center
text: It's a decent NYC hotel.  The biggest reason to stay here is if you're out of town coming to seeing a show at the Lincoln Center. You can check-in at this hotel in the afternoon, eat dinner at any nearby restaurant, and then walk across the street to Lincoln Center.  And when your show is done walk back to the hotel and sleep.

title: Wonderful Experience!!
text: This hotel was above our expectations. We are from NY, but had never stayed here before.  Pasquale, the gentleman who checked us in was wonderful. We got there early, 12:45, and he was able to check us in immediately. When he found out it was my 60th bday he gave us a free room upgrade. The room was amazing and Pasquale was beyond exceptional!!

title: Aging Building + Uneven Service + High Prices = Poor Value in Great Location
text:
Stay here for the location adjacent to Lincoln Center and a short stroll to Central Park. Don’t stay here for good value— other options abound in other neighborhoods.

In one week I stayed here in a “Superior Two Double” room, and elsewhere midtown at a major chain brand that cost about 20% less. The chain outperformed in every facet, setting aside specific location. (Both were 2-3 blocks from a Metro station)

The Empire Hotel may be historic, but based on my stay the rooms are falling apart. In one room, here’s a list of the flaws:

Filthy window with difficult drapes, a rod moving in the ceiling, split wood frame and peeling wallpaper
Headboard semi-detached from wall.
Thin walls so you can hear conversations in adjacent rooms.
Outdated TV with no onscreen guide- look on the nightstand to select a channel. 
Noisy AC with front panel that falls off
Extra-firm bed (some may like this)
Rotted wood, peeling paint, rusted metal, sloppy caulking/painting all in the bathroom
Faulty toilet that I learned to use by opening the lid and jiggling the flush valve
Small sink, no counter
Towel rack that’s bent with drywall anchors coming out of the wall.
No vent in or out of bathroom so basically it’s a closet. 
Bathroom reeked of pot when we arrived
Loud AC unit that couldn’t lower the room temp on our warm 70 degree day— I wonder what happens when it’s 90?

Check-in was stressful with frazzled staff dealing with complaints from people checking into t die assigned rooms. Our desk host rushed through and handed us one key with a “one key’s okay right?”. Uh, no sir there are two of us; we want tow keys. I asked about late checkout and was provided a chart that shows $50 per hour. Yikes. 

I have to admit that the lobby is nice and pleasant, though oddly the bar at one side seems to be permanently closed. The hotel has no food service or lobby cafe or store. The rooftop dining option seems to be an entirely separate business.

Well, the location is rather convenient , but really I’d rather stay midtown and rely on the subway or Uber to get uptown. 

You’ve been warned.

title: Avoid "Express Rooms"
text:
Yesterday, my wife and I attended an evening performance at the Metropolitan Opera. Since we live in Connecticut, and hate having to go home via a late night train, we decided to book a room at The Empire Hotel. 
We've never stayed here before, and chose the place based on its extremely convenient location: it's basically just across the road from the Lincoln Center, and a very short walk from a few of our favourite restaurants. It has a bar on the roof, with bar food, but we didn't partake.
It's a nice old place - the entrance doors and lobby are inviting, and have an air of faded gentility (it's not often that I get a chance to use that phrase). 
Check in was smooth enough, I suppose: we mentioned that our Met Opera Guild membership entitled us to late checkout, and were met with a blank stare. We overheard the lady standing next to us, showing her Met Opera Guild card, and asking for a discount. Looks like blank stares were in fashion.
Once we left the foyer, we found that some madman had redecorated the public areas, with wallpaper which resembled lots of blank picture frames: basically the perfect shape and colour to confuse a guest trying to find directions to his room.
Our room? Tiny, stuffy and lacking in basic amenities. It didn't even have a chair. I'll post a picture. It had been renovated, very badly: the sink was shallow, so that when you turned on the tap, it sprayed water all over your lap, the curtains didn't actually keep out the light. the light switches were crooked, the toilet tissue was mounted on the wall behind the toilet door (nice trick - it took us a while to find that one).  There was only one bedside light. Bottom line - awful room.
Since we were staying only one night, I didn't rush off to the front desk to complain.
When we checked out, the guy on the desk winced, and said that we had booked an "Express Room". Apparently, these are crappy rooms, tucked into odd corners, to satisfy the needs of people who just need somewhere to spend the night, at short notice. He suggested that next time we visit, we ask for one of their other rooms.

So, bear that in mind if you want to stay here.

title: Friendly,Great location
text: Customer service could no have been better Everyone from The GM through all who helped ensure we had a great stay at the Empire Hotel  we’re super.The location was perfect for our stay, we had a great corner room (515)  with a pullout sofa  and plenty of room.The rooftop bar was comfortable and had a great view. I highly recommend the Empire Hotel and cannot wait for our next stay

title: Empire is our NY home
text:
Good location with respect to the subway.  Columbus Circle has several options and an entrance only 2 blocks from the hotel.  Lincoln Center very close.  Room was clean, service was friendly and easy to obtain.  Bed was comfortable, as were the pillows. 
Relatively quiet at night, given the proximity of Broadway, Lincoln Center, and Columbus Circle.  Reasonably priced.  We’ll go back.

title: A Perfect Weekend at the Empire Hotel
text: The attention at the front desk was exceptional.  We enjoyed our stay even though we booked a room with "no view."  It was literally no view but we didn't expect to spend much time in the room anyway while in the New Your City. The room was impeccably clean, our bed was comfortable, and the shower was great!  We had a little issue with the water drain till we called the front desk and the issue was resolved almost immediately. The amenities, the reception, the free WiFi - all was working superbly well!  We love Hotel Empire and will continue coming using this hotel ourselves and recommend it to our friends and family!  Perfect location - just across from the Lincoln Center, close to all our favorite museums and surrounded by great places to relax, enjoy a good meal and get ready for the next New York Adventure be it opera, theater, musical, a good movie or just a promenade in the Central Park.  Thank you Hotel Empire.  We are coming back!

title: Helpful Staff at the Empire Hotel
text: Adam (and Herman, Chhorteh, and Sarah) were all so very welcoming and helpful when I came to stay at the Empire Hotel. I had to book my reservation last minute and was stressed, but they were such patient and compassionate people! Definitely coming again :)

title: Fantastic
text: I frequent this hotel when I am in the city for work and it’s always a lovely stay. Tommy the manager is amazing. So kind and patient and a great guest service representative for Empire. Tonight especially he helped me out with my super late check in and giving me an awesome room. It’s in the middle of everything, I highly recommend Empire Hotel when you stay in the city- for business or on holiday. Ask for Tommy!

title: A hidden Gem
text: This Hotel located across from Lincoln Center is a hidden Gem.  It is clean, quiet and has a great Vibe to it.  We stay there every time we  are in NYC.  The entire staff is very helpful and they are very helpful.  The Reception staff is wonderful.

title: Excelente Workers
text:
They are the best and give us all the attention.
We recommend a lot this hotel because of the people that work there.
The beds are good and the hotel it self.
For sure we are coming back
Thanks to ADAM, HERMAN, FATIMA AND AMI.

You guys are the best.

title: I love NY
text:
My visit was amazing. The staff was very kind. Adam and Sarah particularly.
The room is very comfortable and cleaning services are very well.
The position was strategic, it’s very close to the Central park and city centre. It’s close to the subway, too.
The roofbar Is one of the best place in NY.
I’ll come back there soon.

title: Just What We Needed!
text: My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights at the Empire, following her knee surgery. We were in the room 24/7, except for me leaving to get get food and supplies. I was concerned at first, reading some of the other reviews, but our stay could not have been better. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. I had to trade out ice packs frequently throughout the day and night with the staff at the desk. All were gracious and helpful.  I’d like to give a special shout out to Ami, who called me twice to make sure everything was to my liking. Other notable staff who assisted during a difficult time were:  Adam,Herman, Fatima, and Chortten.  The housekeeping staff was respectful of our privacy and cleared away trash, and brought fresh towels and toiletries, even though we couldn’t have the room cleaned while my daughter was in bed. We truly had all that we needed.  The supply of water bottles was much needed, too, and a nice touch.  Thank you to everyone! I’ll be back to visit my daughter under better circumstances, as she is a resident nearby.  I would definitely choose the Empire for my next stay!

title: Awesome experience!
text: Only had my first night here and couldn’t have asked for anything else! The staff is very charismatic here, while Adam was awesome enough to upgrade me for my birthday weekend! Adam did great handling and getting me ready for my room too. Great service from all the staff and beautiful rooms! Can’t beat the iconic location.

title: Feeling at home in NYC
text: We have now stayed at the Empire about 8 times over the last six years.  We simply love it there.  The location is unbeatable.  Everything is within reach, at the same time, it is not a terribly loud spot despite being bordered by Lincoln Center and Broadway.  It is rather calm, in fact.  The subway entrance is right across the street, 'minimal exposure if you need to get in there in bad weather.  The building is older, which means it was not built with the intention of squeezing you on square footage.  They are comfortable in that way, but not huge, which makes it affordable.   The rooms also begin on the fourth floor, so you get some reprieve from whatever the noise level may be outside.  And of course, half the rooms have an incredible view of Lincoln Center.  The lobby is beautiful and offers space to lounge around, as does a wrap-around balcony overlooking said lobby.  Our kiddo was little when we first stayed.  Through the years, he has always loved the hotel.  I cannot recall outside noise that ever kept him from sleeping, or any personalities in the lobby or elevators that were intimidating to a child.  It's a mellow place, is what I'm saying.  The staff has always treated us with terrific service.  Storing luggage with the bell hops is easy, as is valet parking.  The rooftop bar is a terrific setting, great for having a drink or just quickly stepping out to take a photo/selfie with that stunning view.  Maybe best of all... I don't know of another hotel so close to Central Park, that is actually affordable to stay with.  Even if our itinerary doesn't include the park at first, we can always find time to wander in because the Empire is right there!

title: Very attentive staff
text: The rooms were clean and comfortable and the location cannot be beat. You couldn’t hear a sound between the rooms. Adam at the front desk and all the downstairs staff were so friendly and helpful. Great place to stay near Lincoln Center.

title: Incredible Stay!
text:
Thank you Adam!
Adam is 10 stars an absolute pleasure to get checked in at the front desk with. His charisma made our stay just that much more fun especially when your traveling is it can be kinda a drag. We had a beautiful room. The view was truly spectacular. This hotel is a perfect location & clean large rooms and many restaurants close by. The service is impeccable. We have continued to come back to the Empire ever since! Thank you so much for making our stay memorable. Much appreciated sending so much love!

title: Highly recommended
text:
Famita, Thank you so much for your kind and courteousness checking us in and changing our room. We had a much better stay than initially would have been. The two beds were perfect! 
We have stayed here at the empire before and really love it.

title: Fabulous rooftop view + TKTS discounted Broadway ticket on the same block
text: The rooftop views warmed our hearts even on a cold New York City winter day. We were in town to see theater so it was a real treat to have the TKTS office on the same block as the hotel. Mr. Pasquale at the front desk was especially friendly and attentive at check-in time.

title: Faulty Towers at its best!!
text:
On first glance, from the outside going into the lobby, The Empire Hotel gives the appearance of a modern day hotel, which cannot be anything further from the truth. Our stay began with one catalogue of errors after another, Fawlty Towers springs to mind. 

On arrival we were met with the the most miserable, unhelpful, rude young lady.  It was clear from her tone that she was not happy to answer any questions, so once I asked one question, that was me done!

The elevator from the lobby had a very odd smell, once we reached our floor, I felt as though I was in the movie’ The Shining’! I had been transported back to the seventies, the corridor boasted the most out dated wallpaper I’ve ever seen in a hotel. When we got to the room we were exhausted and it was late, so you can imagine my disappointment when the room key didn’t work. Thank goodness the potter had a master key and let us into the room. Originally, we were given a room on the 8th floor which was changed the next day. We had a Superior room, however, there really wasn’t anything superior about it! The room clearly hadn’t been cleaned, the shower was dirty as well as having dried soap suds on the tiles, some dirty grey water came up through the plug whole. The toilet came making some strange sounds and there was a rusted shaving mirror hanging from the wall. 

As previously stated, the next day we were moved to the 11th floor and here’s why! After a day of sightseeing we just wanted to relax, whilst watching the tv we started hearing strange noises from the bathroom on investigation the toilet seemed to be filling up with water and then the water would just disappear, we put it down to the system in America (plus we didn’t want to make a fuss). The next thing we knew the water was overflowing in the bathroom. I called the reception , however after waiting nearly 15 minutes for anyone to arrive, we had to try and stop the water ourselves from leaving the bathroom, so we put down towels, to no avail! I had to leave my children to go to reception, the male receptionist acted blasé about the situation. I literally definitely waited for someone to come with me back to the room. You can imagine his surprise when we got upstairs, to find the water was now in the corridor and had cover most of the bedroom floor. We were told to gather our belongings and that a porter would come and take them to another room. Needless to say no porter arrived so we took ourselves to reception with all our baggage. At the reception I was told “You need to go to the the 11th floor the porter has your key.” By this point I was so annoyed I just didn’t have the energy to chase after a porter, who we’d just passed us going into the elevator with another couple’s bags and had said nothing about having our key! 

On another occasion, the elevators (including the service ones) stopped working. We had not been notified by the hotel and if wasn’t for the cleaner we wouldn’t have known. She tried to send us down the service elevator but realised none of them were working, so she sent us down some service stairs instead. We got completely lost but when we encountered the security staff and maintenance, none were helpful. We could have been up to no good and they just couldn’t care less, they continued with their conversations. I had to approach them and ask for the way out. 

I’ve never been to any hotel that doesn’t offer complimentary tea/coffee with a kettle in the room, so this was a first. I usually carry my fire stick to watch tv in the evenings, however, the hotel’s tv are so old that there were no HDMI outlets usb ports, thankfully I’d brought my laptop with me. 

Although the superior room was small, the beds were comfortable and the bedding was reasonably clean. The hotel is situated in good location with many restaurants and nearby tourist attractions. Central Park is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, Fifth Avenue and the Rockefeller Center are a 20 minute walk, the Lincoln Center is round the corner and there is a nearby shopping mall not too far away. 

I paid $2,187.60 to stay here for 8 days and it certainly wasn’t worth the money.

title: Buena ubicación, pésima iluminación!
text:
La ubicación del hotel es excelente: al lado del Lincoln Center, muy cerca de Central Park, el subway y al lado de un Starbucks. 
El personal del front desk era poco amable e incluso desagradable a veces. 
Las habitaciones eran extremadamente oscuras; tenía que alumbrar con mi celular para encontrar mis cosas. El aire acondicionado viejo y ruidoso, por lo que la pieza nunca estaba a una temperatura agradable cuando llegábamos. 
El personal de aseo -las mucamas- eran atentas y hacían un muy buen trabajo. 

El hotel nos hizo cobros en la tarjeta de crédito que no pudieron explicar a qué correspondían y después nos costó que los devolvieran. 

Al final lo único rescatable del hotel es la ubicación.

title: Great stay. Excellent service.
text: I had a fantastic stay. I will stay here every time I come to NY. Not only was the location amazing and the service outstanding but the incredible general manager Robert Holmes was so helpful and went above an beyond when I needed help with my stay / booking. Thank you and see you again soon!

title: Great experience
text: Excellent experience especially at check in with Sarah, Herman and Adam. Apparently they're all personal friendly gave me excellent suggestions offered to carry me around if I had trouble with my legs. Just kidding on that last.

title: Amazing stay
text: Excellent stay, the most comfortable beds and linens. Great view overlooking Lincoln Center. Room was clean. Staff was courteous and extremely helpful. Pasquale from the front desk went out of his way to help us. Will definitely be coming back soon! Oh and awesome rooftop!

title: Will stay here again!
text: My husband and I spent the weekend in NYC. The Empire Hotel is located in close proximity to the places we wanted to visit. The hotel is quite lovely and very comfortable. The staff were terrific -- friendly, professional and helpful -- the folks who checked us in and out, the folks at the outside doors who greeted us as we came in and went out. We had trouble accessing the digital service  on our TV -- the front desk sent an engineer who quickly diagnosed that the TV needed to be replaced. When we came back from dinner, it was done. We will stay at the Empire Hotel again. We highly recommend it.

title: Quindici giorni tra Natale '22 e Capodanno '23 a New York all'Empire Hotel
text:
Il rapporto qualità prezzo è ottimo. Le camere sono piccole, molto pulite. Alla  concierge sono stati gentilissimi e professionali. L'atrio è comodo e lo abbiamo usato anche per qualche cena volante. Peccato che abbiano chiuso il bar. 
Ma quello che è eccezionale è la posizione. Si trova proprio dove la Broadway incrocia la 9a Avenue, vicino a tutto: Central Park, Columbus Center, due grandi stazioni della metro, la quinta...
Dall'undicesimo piano la vista era magnifica. 
Ci siamo già stati due volte e ci torneremo.

title: Excellent UWS Stay
text: I live on the UWS and needed a place to stay while family was visiting and occupying my apartment. My stay was 6 nights and came out to a very reasonable rate for the location. The hotel is very quiet and pleasant. Staff is super friendly, and happy to help. I have a service dog, and she was welcomed warmly when we checked in. This is always a big plus for me when I stay in a hotel. Water bottles available at the front desk, and an electric kettle was brought up to my room by housekeeping when I requested it. Clean and functional room with a great shower. Highly recommend The Empire Hotel for a nice stay in the heart of Lincoln Square!

title: Great location, great staff
text: My teen and I stayed here Jan 2023. Empire's greatest asset is the location. It was about a block to Central Park and you're right across the street from Lincoln Square. Easy 25 minute walk to Times Square, 5mins to Columbus Circle shopping. Many great restaurants in walking distance. The rooms are small, as expected with NYC, but perfectly nice. Bathrooms have all the amenities you could need but lacking counter space. Closet is tiny! For two of us it was fine but could get uncomfortable with any more than that. Much thanks to the doormen for help with directions and restaurant recommendations!

title: Great Family Experience
text: We stayed at the Empire Hotel for our daughter's first trip to NYC.  The location was perfect . It's a very close walk to Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, Lincoln Center, lots of great restaurants and shopping.  We also enjoyed being very close to two subway stations which allowed us to easily explore the rest of Manhattan.  The staff was very polite and accommodating.  Will definitely be back!

title: Fantastico soggiorno a Manhattan
text: Ciao Pasquale! Grazie ancora per il tuo aiuto e la tua gentilezza, ci siamo trovati proprio bene. Gentilissime le cameriere, spazi comuni accoglienti e comodi, personale sempre disponibile. Bellissimo tutto, torneremo sicuramente!

title: due settimane all'EMPIRE inteso come hotel: di NY naturalmente
text:
Io New York la conosco, la amo, ho scritto molte volte di questa città: su libri, su riviste... Questa volta non è stata per lavoro, è stata una vera vacanza.
Andavo a colpo sicuro scegliendo l'Hotel Empire: nel cuore di Manhattan, a due passi dal Metropolitan, da Columbus Circle, da Central Park e da due linee di subway che ti portano ovunque.
Grazie a Pasquale e al suo team per la camera bella e comoda, per la pulizia, la cortesia, il saper scherzare con stile e  l'averci fatto sentire a casa.
LAURA MAGNI, Milano

title: Another great stay!
text:
Just back from another stay at the Empire. This time, we had a Junior Suite. It was very spacious with nice views. We've been staying at the Empire for several years now and highly recommend it.
The location is perfect — across from Lincoln Center. There is also a TKTS booth just steps away to get theater tickets. Also, a goof selection of restaurants and Central Park is just a block away.

title: Showtime
text: Really a fantastic boutique hotel perfectly located across from Lincoln Center and half way between Midtown and Upper West Side. Everything is within walking distance  or short bus ride on Broadway, Columbus or Central Park South. Next to Central Park as well. Staff was competent, responsive and friendly. Rooms are a little small but that is true of most Boutique hotels. Paying a little extra for the view is worth it as it opens up the feel of the room. It has a magnificent roof top restaurant bar with spectacular views and a pool. No complaints. I have been staying there for years and it has never let me down.

title: Please don’t renovate, keep it affordable
text:
The price is right, location is perfect. We read the less favorable reviews and we had a great time. Clean room, hot shower, comfy beds, and quiet. 

It’s a basic hotel in a very expensive city. If it had all the bells and whistles, it would cost more for the consumer - and right now it’s affordable. So: please don’t renovate, just keep it clean.

Our room could have used more lighting but beyond that…you aren’t in NYC to be at your hotel. The whole point is to be elsewhere…

Nice staff, and easy check-in/check-out.

title: Terrific location, dated/dingy rooms
text:
The location is terrific, but I don’t think I’d ever stay here again. The public spaces in the lobby were nicely done, but as as you stepped into the elevator, you could begin to see the wear. The carpets in the elevators and hallways were often dirty and tired looking.

As soon as we left the elevator, the smell of marijuana was beyond strong. This was the case every time we came and went for 5 days. Ridiculous and made the hotel seem super trashy and low budget.

The room was very small and showing its age. In NYC sometimes hotel rooms are small, but with thoughtful touches for storage/maximizing space. Not here. There weren’t any places to really hang clothes because the fridge was in the closet. A tired looking chair was randomly placed. The 2 drawers on the bedside table wouldn’t close and we kept bumping into them. Most of the furniture was scratched and shabby. The whole ambiance was tired and worn looking. While it might have been clean, I really didn’t want to walk in the room without slippers or socks. 

The bathroom was terrible. Paint was peeling and you could see dirt in the corners when the door was closed. It made us want to keep the door open since it was so yucky to see the back of the door. Towels would be taken and not replaced consistently. The shelf in the bathroom was worn and nicked, which made me worried it wasn’t clean.
