Front desk personnel were pleasant and promptly sent up ice when we requested it.

At the end of the day, it was a place to sleep. In a city with LOTS of hotel options, I’ll look elsewhere in the future.

title: Location Location Location
text:
This was my second stay at the Empire Hotel. The Empire is an older hotel but is very well maintained. Lincoln Center across the street, subway a few steps away, Starbucks and PJ Clarks next door! There is a great rooftop bar, also!
 Very friendly and helpful staff and top-notch housekeeping. 
 Will definitely be back for my next visit to NYC.

title: Couldn’t stay one night
text:
Absolutely awful experience. Reception staff rude and unwelcoming from the moment we entered. We had sent an email previous to our stay with some requests which had been ignored completely and the lady at reception smiled when I asked if it was received. 

We were so excited for our stay here but the coldness from the moment we entered ruined it.

Room we were given had no light fixture at all and was on complete darkness. Only a standing lamp present for some light. Staff offered an additional lamp but simply not good enough!

Room damp smelling and old. Random fridge in the middle of the room and no space for suitcase. Asked if we could switch rooms but apparently hotel was completely full.

Ended up having to get a full refund and finding another hotel on NYC last minute. Shocking customer service.

title: A great stay over the holidays!
text: A 5-night stay over the Christmas holidays was made easy and effortlessly by the staff at The Empire!  Clean, courteous and quiet…just the place I needed to unwind from the busy city surrounding this lovely and quaint hotel.  My room was clean and fresh.  I don’t require housekeeping daily so my do not disturb sign was respected and I did not have any interruptions when in my room (or when I was out).  The staff was helpful, especially when I left my key in my room!  Helping me navigate the subway as well as general hospitality, the entire staff made my stay very enjoyable!

title: Empire Hotel
text: We just stayed in this hotel and it was fantastic.  The staff were so nice and helpful.  The location and quality of the room were first rate.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.  We visit NYC on a regular basis and we'll be sure to stay again

title: Great location
text: Great location, fantastic bar but rock hard beds and crappy air conditioning.  Hard to sleep when room temp is 76.  Nice seating area in the room but apparently not all rooms have that.  Housekeeping was good and unlimited free bottled water was a nice touch.

title: Needs updating
text: The hotel is in a great location and you can tell it was once very nice. It's in desperate need of an update. Rooms were hot and it was only 25 degrees outside, we had to turn on the A/C. Wallpaper peeling off, window treatments didn't close properly, downstairs bar closed, furniture worn and tired. However, the staff is all wonderful and very friendly.

title: Dirty and run down. Amazing location.
text:
The location of this hotel is amazing - right in front of Lincoln Center and walking distance form mid-town. However, this is pretty much where the good ends.

The hotel grounds in general, and the rooms in particular are old, run down, and in some cases just filthy. Much of the furniture in the rooms is worn out (see photos) or broken. Some of the towels I had in the room had holes; others had mold (see photos). The A/C and heating system is very noisy.

The gym equipment is old and has signs of rust.

This was the first and last time I will step foot in this hotel. If you need to stay in New York, look for another place.

title: Very expensive for what it is!
text: An old hotel very close to Central Park.The rooms are too small ,with exremely small bathroom and with any space to put your clothes, they need renovation.The service is bad in the reception and in the concergie.Housekeeing acceptable.If you can find another alternative do not choose that hotel.

title: Estadia muito boa e recomendácel
text: Serviço, de uma maneira geral, de muito bom nível. Cortesia e cordialidade.  Tanto o check-in quanto o check-out, bem como a limpeza e a cordialidade do serviço de housekeeping foram muito bons. A limpeza das instalações do hotel também foi ponto muito positivo, além do ponto do hotel em NYC ser escepcional!

title: Three Beds in a Room
text: I will start by saying there were three beds in our room…two doubles and a very comfortable fold out sofa. This is a rare thing in NYC no matter your price point. Our room was very big with a great view of Lincoln Center…we even heard a choral group outside the center one night which was nice. The hotel is old and they have done a lot to modernize it. We would have liked more convenient electrical outlets and a coffee maker in the room…I suspect they don’t offer this because there is a Starbucks just outside the hotel but I was missing my hot cup of tea at night. I found all the staff to be very nice. The housekeeping staff were always very friendly and provided us with all the extra amenities we needed with having three people in one room. A couple of tips…you can pick up bottled water every day at the front desk which was very nice. And the rooftop bar is separate from the hotel…you have to make a reservation and enter via a separate elevator with a door person managing it. It was too much trouble to go as we just wanted a pre-dinner cocktail one night on the fly so I can’t say anything about it since they wouldn’t let us up. I’ve stayed at more hotels in New York than I can remember and this would be in my top ten. This was a great location for exploring the upper west side as well as the museums on the other side of the park…an easy walk through the park. There are also so many good restaurants within a couple of blocks…see my reviews for the best ones in my opinion.

title: Book anywhere else in the city
text: Save your money. This hotel offers literally nothing except location. Zero amenities, rude staff, small and dirty rooms, no controlled heat or air… worst hotel I have stayed at and it is NOT cheap. 2-3 stars on its BEST day!  Parts of the room were broken , non working or non existent. To top it off they charge you a $150 fee up front for incidentals but when asked- it is in case you damage the room! The room was damaged upon arrival! They say they release the funds later but still- there is no mini bar, coffee, room service- nothing!  Awful hotel

title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!
text:
This was the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in for the price we paid for two nights.
First the good—the staff at the front desk were very friendly. Greeted us with a smile. The bell hops were pleasant as well. That is the only thing good I can say. 
The hallways—dark and smelled somewhat like mildew. 
Our room—there were 4 of us in a room that was very small including the bathroom. We had 2 towels folded in the shower. No wash cloths and toiletries enough for one person. We called for more basic supplies and they were delivered. (Shouldn’t have to call).
The space to place suitcases, hang clothes, is beyond minimal, as there is barely any. I realize this is an older hotel but updating furniture, etc is a doable investment.
The air conditioning and heating unit is probably the original or at least it looked like it. The controls were deep into the unit and lopsided as if it was hanging on by a thread. We all tried pushing every button and turning every dial to gain some comfort. We never found an ideal level.
The rooms have no coffee makers, no ice buckets (not even sure there is an ice machine—we never found one) but there is a small college sized fridge…go figure. Oh that’s for the 4 warm water bottles we received upon check-in. The hotel has no restaurant, no vending machines, no room service…no nothing! We were disappointed.
The tv finally worked after figuring out the channel buttons in the remote have to be pressed up (no instructions for that). When the tv turns on, the message you’ll get is “no signal”. Logically, most would think you’d need to press the source button but there wasn’t one. 
The bathroom door is warped from steam. Paint chipping is evident.
The rooftop bar was the best part of the hotel.

title: Great hotel and staff!!!
text: We visited New York for a long weekend and the Empire Hotel was amazing! The lobby was spacious and had a lot of room to hang out, the rooms were clean and spacious, and the staff at the hotel was awesome and accommodating! The manager Tommy went above and beyond for us and was super friendly. The hotel did a great job and I’d stay here again!

title: Expensive but good location
text: Location is the best to Central Park & Lincoln Center.  About a20 min walk to Rock. Center.  Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby.  Price was exorbitant---$1400 for 2 nights in December!! No amenities in room (no coffee, no room service) Rooftop bar is nice but costly.  Daughter in Fordham so great location---will not stay here once she graduates...

title: Great location
text:
Great location. Close to everything, hotel is dated but very clean. 
Easy checkup and check out. 
Staff was very attentive and very professional. Rooftop restaurant and lounge is a must ! Great food. 
Bonus is windows actually open ! Unlike a lot of hotels.

title: Good location but not worth the money. Will stay at somewhere else next time
text: Really not sure the hotel is worth the money. The final bill was close to $350 per night for a super tiny queen size bedroom overlooking an alley way with almost no natural light coming in at all time. My daughter said the bathroom was like the one on the airplane. Super tiny and tight. The bathroom really needed some TLC, it was a bit rundown. The bed was comfortable and the sheet was good. The reception area was nice and the doorman was polite. The reception lady was non-chalant and uninterested. She did give us 2 bottles of water...Will definitely stay at other hotels in the area when we come back in February. BTW, Management, please fix the lights on the Giant Sign above the building. Its embarrassing to see the letter O and E are broken. Great location.

title: Dated, dingy hotel.
text: Old, tired, dingy, dark badly lit hallways and rooms once you are off the ground floor. No ability to control air or heat in room, no drawers except for small 2 inch deep drawer in end tables, not even a coffee machine since there is no room service or restaurant. Paint is cracked and peeling in the bathrooms.  The roof top restaurant is not part of the hotel.  Great location but for the money...absolutely awful.  One caveat is the employees, both front desk and service personnel.  They were great, always smiling and happy to help if they could. Too bad they have so little to work with.  Next time I would give up the location for a decent room and a cup of coffee in the morning.

title: A great hotel
text: The Empire is a lovely, old-fashioned hotel in a perfect location at Lincoln Center and surrounded by every kind of amenity. I stay here when my work takes me to New York, and I always feel welcome. In particular, Pasquale at the front desk is like a maitre d' at a fine hotel who makes one feel like a real guest and not just a client. And on my last trip I had an example of simply remarkable service. The "Roman" blind in my room could not be lowered all the way as the string had been tied to prevent it. I called the front desk to ask for a pair of scissors so I could lower the blind (I know, a little crazy). What was sent instead was a true artisan who restrung the entire blind on both sides. Just amazing to watch. You won't get glitzy glass and steel at the Empire, but you will get a warm welcome, a clean and comfortable room, and the best food, music, and shops steps from the front door. A great hotel!

title: Convenient, clean and Great Staff
text: We just completed a four night stay for Thanksgiving.  Hotel staff, from bellman to all inside staff we’re extremely helpful and friendly.  I need to highlight Sherpa for some special help he provided me in getting some ice.  He is a wonderful person and impressed me in his willingness to go out of his way to help me.  Our room was smaller than expected (741) and somehow we ended up with a smaller bed than what I thought I’d reserved.  All worked out fine.  Our son and daughter in law’s room was larger with the king bed.  Both rooms have the same design flaw.  When closed there is very little air circulation possible from the HVAC unit.  With the thermostat on the wall and very little heat or AC impact with curtains closed, the HVAC unit runs non- stop, no doubt driving up energy costs for the hotel.  An easy fix would be to install a blackout that can be pulled down at the window.   Clearly the designers had more influence on these decisions than the engineering staff.  I would still recommend the Empire Hotel due to its convenience to where we go and the great staff.

title: Very nice stay!
text: We met in NYC from MN for a concert at the Lincoln Center and we couldn't have been happier with the Empire. It was perfectly located by our venue, the staff was fantastic and it was affordable. If I had to be picky and complain about something small it would be that the corners and crevices could have used a better cleaning job. Also, the doors slammed, which was a little annoying, but only during the day. We would definitely stay at the Empire again.

title: Great service!
text: Didn’t stay here, but we wish we did! Had some problems after we cancelled our stay on booking.com, went to the hotel personally and had great help from Adam. He was very understanding and helped us out immediately. A big thank you, Adam!

title: Another Great Stay
text: Always a pleasure to stay at the Empire.  Friendly staff, reasonable rates, rooms have plenty of space, are clean and well-maintained.  Starbucks in bldg and some great restaurants across the street.  Upper west side location is perfect for us (steps to #1 train and Lincoln Center, 5 min walk to Columbus Circle with shops., restaurants and more subway connections).  We often drive to NY and the hotel is very easy to get to with lots of parking choices nearby.

title: Great experience for a team of seven!
text: I run an international design and education non-profit and we were working on a review of user experience at Geffen Hall last week.  We were a total of 7 people in 7 rooms at the Empire Hotel which is just across the street from Lincoln Center.  Front desk staff (Pasquale deserves special note) were all incredibly helpful and welcoming.  We were given rooms ready for occupancy when we registered.  A problem with one reservation was figured out and resolved patiently and quickly.  I needed a small number of copies both days and it proved no problem at all.  Such a seamless and welcoming experience is rare anywhere and we were very grateful to the Empire Hotel!

title: Excellent hotel for business trip
text: Location location location! The famous site of gossip girl filming, this hotel has some really neat history and a great vibe! Adam & Chorten were fabulous at check in! Room is nice and clean and has a great view. Rooms are also fairly big for nyc which is a nice plus. The famous rooftop bar has delicious drinks, food and an amazing view of the city too!

title: Perfect weekend getaway!
text: The Empire Hotel did not disappoint! It's just across from Central Park, close to great restaurants, coffee and pastry shops and within walking distance from many of the iconic New York City sites.  We had no issues checking in, even though it was extremely busy on marathon weekend. We enjoyed drinks in the rooftop bar: what a view! The service was great. All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The decor was colorful and glitzy, just like you would expect. The room was comfortable, with soft robes and slippers waiting for us after a long day of travel.  Though the city outside was a bit noisy, we did not notice it inside, in fact, we had no disruptions the entire night. I enjoyed a coffee and pastry in a quaint little park while just across the street, sitting at one of the bistro tables.  Though our stay seemed much too short, we will certainly return again!  Thank you Empire Hotel for making a quick girls getaway very memorable.

title: Great location at Lincoln Center
text: We always stay here when going to Lincoln Center or Columbus Circle area.  It's a decent place with good service.  No restaurant or food service and that's inconvenient, but plenty of quick coffee or good dining just steps from the front door.  Updated but small rooms.  We like it enough to return year after year.

title: Amazing location and famous person sighting!
text: I've stayed in The Empire a few times since moving away from the neighborhood 20 years ago. It's the best location ever - on the UWS, directly across from Lincoln Center, 2 blocks from Central Park, 3 blocks north of the new luxury mall at Columbus Circle, and an easy walk to Broadway theaters. While I agree with some reviewers that the rooms could use an upgrade (our bathroom was tiny, and the door got stuck multiple times - my husband had to rescue me out of the bathroom!), the hotel public spaces are great - and the service is overall wonderful as well. One positive (or negative, depending on who you are!): Ted Cruz was staying there at the exact same time. I almost ran him down with my morning Starbucks takeout (which is conveniently located next door to the lobby). He shouted "good morning!" to me in an annoying politician voice. So - if it's good enough for Ted Cruz...

title: Beware: extra charges
text: We have booked 100+ hotels online and this was the first time that we were charged a “residence fee” after we had paid the “full price” online. When we asked the front desk staff about it, she said “it was clearly stated in the confirmation email.” I asked “But the confirmation email comes after the booking. So you only told me about it after I had booked, and you changed the price subsequently?” “Yes.” “So maybe on my next visit you can charge me a thousand dollars extra?” “It depends.” Beare before booking this hotel online.

title: Great Location
text:
The Empire Hotel is a hop, skip and jump from Lincoln Center, great restaurants, central park etc. It is a great location. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The staff is very friendly. The room was small but we expected that. The patron can not change the air/heat and it ran all night -  I did have a hard time sleeping. 
We had a great time and would recommend this hotel anytime.

title: Definitely not 4 star
text:
I get that many hotels were terribly affected by the pandemic, but I really feel this hotel cannot call itself a decent 4 star. Here's why:
The good:
-Excellent location, close to Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, Lincoln Square the Upper West Side. 
-Nice roof top bar and instagrammable Gossip Girl-filmed spaces
- Rooftop pool looks like it could be nice in the summer when it's open
- Good, strong showers
The bad:
- No food or drink available in the hotel itself. No room service. No bar or restaurant. Rooftop bar separate to hotel and only open certain times from the afternoon. So nowhere to just chill out and have a drink or get any food within the hotel itself.
- The rooms were small and extremely dark and dingy (even after we insisted on moving to a brighter room). Seriously in need of a makeover, with dirty brown carpets, barely any lighting, little storage and drab decor and furniture. Maybe it was cool in the 70s. 
- Beyond tiny bathrooms with the paint peeling off
- Staff not particularly helpful or friendly and no concierge which, considering so much has closed down in NYC, would have been helpful
Don't expect luxury, charm or any small personal touches. Such a shame as with this location and cost per room, the hotel could be so much more. But as a very basic base for exploring NYC it does the job.

title: Horrible
text:
On vous vend du rêve fuyez, très bruyant ( pas de double vitrage) Clim
Hors d’âge qui rajoute encore du bruit, salle de bain vétuste ( aucun confort ) pas d’adaptateurs pas de chevets ni prises d’un côté du lit 
Pas de rideaux occultants… TV posée latéralement du lit 
On vous monte une bouilloire (car non présente dans la chambre) sans tasse ni tisane ou thé ( c’est un 4 étoiles prix du séjour 1660€ les 5 nuits pas de frigo, 
Ménage fait à peu près, 1 mini gel douche pour 2 etc,etc…. 

Bref un cauchemar 
L’hôtel est vieux et mérite d’être entièrement rénové

title: Great Location
text:
Overall a great hotel, located just a 5 min walk from Central Park and 15 /20 mins walk from Times Square. 

The hotel staff are extremely friendly and are always available if you have questions 

The hotel itself is a good standard. Rooms aren’t huge but are more than adequate for the amount of time spent there given the nature of the break. Beds are very comfortable and air conditioning works well if needed. Would have liked coffee / tea making facilities in the room but there is a Starbucks on the corner outside the hotel which comes in handy. 

Sadly due to the weather  the outdoor rooftop bar was shut but this is understandable for safety and the bar inside is well worth a visit. 

I would stay here again and would highly recommend

title: Not the greatest experience….  If we’re you look for a different place
text:
I had to travel on a budget, and I did not want to stay in time square,  so I found the empire hotel.   As a fun of the tv show gossip girl,  I decided to give it a try because the location is great.    But it is pretty much it….  Nothing else good I have to say. 

The room was so small and old.   Not very clean and most of thing in the room were run down… I am afraid to touch and break

The worse part was the bathroom.
The shower was clogged,  and after two shower, the water was about to overflow… which is disgusting.

I was going to give two start but after heading down to the reception and ask nicely to change the room,  I was told no, and they would bring a technician to work in the room.  After I complaint again, saying I did not want to have someone working in my room.   
They finally changed me. But gave me a slightly attitude that they were doing me a big favor and said if I did not have my things ready by a certain time.   My reservation would be canceled 

As I got down to get the keys for the new room, another customer was very upset and yelling  at the front desk during her check out because her experience.    (Which I assumed Not great if it got to that point).  

Best part, as she left, one of the front staff was sarcastic and inappropriate to his colleague who was getting my keys,  right in front of me.  

I got to my room, Pretty much same.

Old and rundown.  

Such terrible experience, poor customer service from the management.  

Like me and the other lady, 
If I were you I would not stay away from here,

title: For Lincoln center it can’t be best
text: I read several challenging reviews so I checked in with a trepidation , but the fact is the hotel is nice , it isn’t 5 star but it doesn’t claim to be , if your going to the  ballet, opera , or philharmonic . It can’t be beat. I did not find the decor dated , the staff was pleasant and the room was clean. For a Lincoln center experience the post walk half a block at 11 pm is awesome.

title: Always consistent with service and stay.  We enjoy this hotel.  4th stay here.
text:
Hadii (not sure if that is the spelling) as soon as he saw me with my big suitcase, he was so helpful to taking it up to my room.  Always service with a smile.  

Everyone here is so nice.  Great room and awesome location to Restaurants. 
Starbucks on the corner and Smith's restaurant across the street. 

Hotel reminds me of the old Hollywood Glam.

title: terrible experience
text: the hotel is very old fashion and needs a complete update. The room on the second floor was very dark and noisy as it backed on the hotels air con systems, so noisy that it was almost impossible to sleep. The advertise a roof terrace but it was closed all the time we were there. The TV remote control didn't work and the shower dial didn't either. We wouldn't recommend it.  Way too expensive for the room we got.

title: Great experience
text: The hotel may be a little tired, could do with a bit of updating, but was extremely clean & comfortable. Staff were very helpful & pleasant. It’s situated in a lovely area, just a block from Central Park. Metro station is just across the road, very handy for visiting all New York attractions. We had a double aspect view from our spacious room. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel & would definitely stay again should I return to New York

title: Great location and hotel!!
text: Excellent location and the staff from beginning to end incredibly friendly, helpful and professional. Appreciate everything and thank you for a beautiful experience!! The rooftop bar was a phenomenal experience as well and special thanks to Giselle and Raul and caring for our visit there 3 nights!!

title: Great stay, Staff is exceptional
text: We have now stayed at the Empire twice. Both times  the service has been exceptional. Rooms were spacious, clean, with beautiful views. Conveniently located near Central Park. We met a kind gentleman named Tommy who was so friendly and went out of his way to make our stay comfortable. Tommy was available to help us with our needs and we now consider him a family friend. Our daughter moved to NY and we now consider the Empire our second home.

title: Tommy Tonoco is the best hotel manager I’ve ever seen.
text: I love the Empire Hotel. Tommy has resolved my issue with double charge with such a decency and courage and ability to hear the client- that makes Tony the very best! Generally I have not seen a better manager!

title: Can not recommend this hotel
text: Rude staff. Cheap furniture and air conditioning functions very poorly. Carpet in hallways is ripped and shabby. Would not recommend unless all you care about is location. No hand towels. Limited electric outlets in rooms. Terrible value for the room rate.

title: Location great
text:
We reserved rooms for a wedding. They send emails with confirmed bookings but some of our family had problems such no bookings in their system etc.
Some rooms have defective aircon, keys dont work(have to go up and down to have them fix).
Location is very convenient. Restaurants, public transportation, central park.

title: Needs a lift
text: Old but semi-clean. Very small. No wash cloths or hand towels in our room.  No counter space or places to put toiletries.  No full size closet so if you need to hang dresses there’s no where to hang them. 1/2 size ironing board but no where to place it to iron. Okay to hang Skirts and shirts.  Fridge in room was not cold.  There was a charging station in one room but not another room.  Very dark in hallways and rooms.  Great street view from room but only on street side. Ally side you can see into other rooms and brick wall with garbage.  No restaurant inside hotel, just next door. Many places to walk to. Central Park only a couple blocks away. I would not recommend children as it is very tight quarters.  Staff is friendly enough but doormen are awesome and helpful.

title: Recent experience
text: I posted a review about my poor experience. The manager responded and indicated that I was offered a new room. Completely untrue. Notes were made on the file apparently, but no offer was communicated.  A new room wasn’t mentioned until I checked out. Terrible experience all around.

title: Lipstick on a Pig
text:
This hotel is old and the renovations are cheap and badly done. Cracks and scrapes everywhere. Resort fee of $19 was "for internet" which I did not use. Dark, scary hallways. Room is very small and dowdy. Really loud noises in the wall for a 1/2 hour. My impression was that it was from someone taking a shower.
Good news:
Bed was good. Doormen and bellman and security were very, very nice. Everyone else was unbelievably unpleasant.  Depressing place that cost close to $400 - crazy!

title: Glossy website.  Reality is very average.
text: Hotel has good location for Lincoln centre  but needs a lot of investment- rooms old and aspects that have been ‘upgraded’ feel like it has been done superficially/cheaply. Premium Internet is actually pretty rubbish- in my room it struggled to stream a movie (was better one night than another).  They don’t even put the two ‘free’  water bottles in your room each day - have to collect from reception - presumably to keep the number they actually give out down.  Overall pretty disappointing - can live with on a business trip if have no choice but definitely nothing special.

title: 2 Week Stay - Great Home Away From Home
text: I stayed at the Empire for 2 weeks while my daughter was in the City for a summer program. I had a Jr. King Suite and the size was perfect for the length of my stay. The staff was attentive and made me feel comfortable. The hotel is located in a great area and is an easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and 5th Avenue, The hotel is an easy walk to the Broadway theatres and the Lincoln Square area gives a nice neighborhood vibe, with plenty of great restaurants in walking distance. I think I've found my NYC hotel of choice whenever I visit. In fact, I'm headed back for a few more much shorter trips and have already booked my stay(s). What a fortunate find.....

title: Visiting the trio for business.
text:
I think if they don’t fix up some things it may have been my last stay at this location. The location is perfect and most of the staff was great. I don’t remember the female agent that checked me in but I do remember he beautiful blazer in white. She was great. 
The stay was ugh.. the rooms are old and the AC has major problems as they moved me twice until I finally got a working room. I tried to explain my stay to the agents at the desk and no one cared to help me besides that young lady that checked me in. She listened and pointed to he manager to assist me. BTW the manager with red hair as she didn’t give me a name and didn’t want to give me her name; was very rude and didn’t seem to care to help me and only rolled her eyes and said I’ll send someone up to check on my room. That’s is all. At that moment I decided I wanted to leave and check out early. The next day comes and I come down to speak to the other young lady to let her know about my experience and why I wanted to leave. She than appointed to a male manager by the name of Tom. He gladly assisted me and my concerns. To even just giving us a call to check if we are okay with our new room. Those are the little things a guest like to experience. A place that care and makes you feel at home. Now Tom went out his way to get us something amazing. It indeed helped with our stay as we stood an additional 3 night and enjoyed our time. The bell me harrow is also great. The afternoon team is by far the best team and only wish they were here at all times to help. Now if anyone does stay here just know this place location is beautiful, most of the staff is amazing people as well. The pool sadly closes early but that’s okay because you can get ready to enjoy a drink on the roof. The team also has great location to eat since they don’t have a restaurant. The list they have is amazing everything close by. As it definitely help so you don’t have to search on your own. 

My only advice is to make Tom and that female agent work all hours haha if not hire a good people like them. You can tell they try hard to help us. We don’t ask for much but to just experience a great location, peace, and justa place you feel safe. Hope this helps people decide as this place is still a good place to stay at.

title: Good experience, well located, some great views
text:
We booked two Junior Suites (King), and the space in each one proved to be exactly what we had hoped for: not palatial but able to easily accommodate visitors around a coffee table away from the bed itself.  On arrival, we were shown to suites at different ends of the hall, one of which had dim lighting in the bathroom (which happened to be an issue for us because we were in town for a dressy event). Adam at the front desk was extremely responsive and kindly switched that second room to another one.  Our views from the front of the hotel, which overlooks the broad, angled intersection of Broadway and Columbus, were really spectacular, including a tree-filled park directly ahead and the plaza of Lincoln Center to the left.  

We went up to the rooftop bar one evening and found it attractively lit and spacious, with friendly service by the host staff and our server.  (We were sorry to learn that some fellow guests were refused access to the rooftop elevator half an hour before the bar's closing time on Friday night––a tad unexpected in "the city that never sleeps"!)  

We also had fun taking a toddler to the pool one afternoon, but please be aware that the pool deck is reached via at least two flights of iron stairs, and the pool itself is really just a glorified space to dunk oneself (I'm guessing it's about 6-7 feet wide and 20-25 feet long––my very rough estimate, but certainly it's nowhere near the size of a standard motel or apartment-house pool).  The pool deck, however, is spacious, with great views and lots of seating, including some little cabana-like areas. 

We discovered the 2nd-floor Mezzanine shortly before our departure, and it offers very nice, separate seating groups and would be a good spot for guests who need a place to "park" themselves outside their rooms.  

Overall, the decor is aiming for a contemporary feel, and although the wallpaper does admittedly strike some as too bold and dark (and even "dingy," according to some reviewers we read beforehand), we were impressed that all the spaces were good, the hotel clean, the service excellent and unobtrusive, beds comfortable, towels thick and abundant, and outdoor noise nonexistent thanks to excellent windows and steady, effective air-conditioning. For those whose chief booking concern is fire safety, it might be wise to request a room fairly close to the elevators, since the fire stairs are located near the elevators as well, but I will mention that the elevators have a fairly loud ding. (This was not an issue for us––our rooms were not immediately across from the elevator bank––and for all I know it's not a problem even in the closer rooms.)  

For an improved experience, my wish list would be: cleaner windows (my photos were strategically taken through the clearest part, but the experience of looking out is blearier), a better-positioned shaving/makeup mirror (it's mounted so that anyone under 5'10" can't use it––and, while we're making wishes, a lighted version of the mirror), a better-positioned safe (we had to get down on our knees and hunch over to find the right buttons), and a shower cap (a small amenity that makes a difference to some of us).  None of these things are deal-breakers, of course, and we look forward to booking at the Empire again.

title: Perfect location but absolutely nothing else
text: The Hotel is completely run down.  My room smelks like sewage and it has signs that it has been flooded maybe as all the furniture and doors show water damage at the bottom.   The AC is super loud and I cannot control it (No AC control).  WIFI is non existent.. It connects but it goes 1990’s slow.  I paid for 3 nights, this is my first and I will be moving out after today (first night) to a different hotel.  The floor corridors are super dark! I mean haunted house dark, and I suspect it is like this so people cannot realize how badly everything looks. The ONLY, ONLY thing great about this hotel is LOCATION.  That is it.  Forget about gossip girl and all that.  Sorry Empire but.. wow… BAD. Disclaimer:  This is not an angry review, I did not have an issue with hotel management or anybody.  This is truly my honest appreciation about it.  Very dissapointed.

title: Great location!
text: I found this hotel accidentally when looking for a place to stay for a work trip. The hotel is in a great location just blocks from Central Park, Columbus Circle and the Hudson River. The property is nice, not amazing, but nice enough and the people are great. Pasquale was very helpful during our stay. They even have a rooftop bar and pool.  The rooms are older and probably need to be updated, but for the price, in this part of town we were happy.

title: The hotel is DANGEROUS, the staff is RUDE and the rooms are DINGY
text:
The hotel is DANGEROUS, the staff is RUDE and the rooms are DINGY

I had booked two rooms for three weeks in July. Unfortunately we had the worst stay of our lives because someone broke-into our room.

1. On day one, although we had requested adjacent rooms months and then one week prior to our check-in date, they wouldn't give us rooms even on the same floor. We had to literally beg for rooms on the same floor which we eventually were able to have.
2. The hotel staff was completely ill-mannered toward us from the day we checked in.
3. The key to my room got demagnetized five times a day and they (very rudely) asked me to get in long lines at reception just so I could fix the key and enter my room. every. time.
4. There was no in-room safe although it's claimed all rooms have one. They installed it only after we checked into our room.
5. The rooms, the bathrooms and the pool were old and rundown.
6. Everything got even WORSE at the end of the first week of our stay when we returned to our rooms in the evening and found out that two of my purses had been STOLEN from my room. Realizing someone had broken into our room, I was very worried and I asked for help from the reception staff but I was told to wait until 8 in the morning (for 12 hours). They didn't even offer us a different room or tried to call the police, they just ordered us to wait in our rooms like there wasn't a burglar in our room just hours ago. Of course, I couldn't sleep a wink and waited for the security to arrive in the morning, meaning, there is no legitimate security present in the evening and at night in this hotel. The security came in the morning and checked the security cameras and CONFIRMED that a man had STOLEN two of my purses and left the hotel. They insisted that I had left my door open and that's how the burglar must have gotten in. That's ridiculous because my husband and I both confirmed that the door was locked before we left and also the hotel didn't have a camera which was pointed to our hotel room door which could record their unfounded claim that the door was left open. It was a mean manipulation strategy to get out of liability. We immediately changed to a different hotel to be safe. Tired of the Empire Hotel's irresponsibility, I went to the police and spent the next three days trying to find ways to make up for my loss. The hotel manager stalled me for weeks as if he would compensate for the bags but in the end I had to pay for the incompetence of Empire Hotel.

Overall, it was a very unnerving experience to stay at this hotel and I think you should avoid it at all costs.

title: Not as expected
text: Just checked in at the Empire Hotel. Staff at front desk not very friendly. Got our room and was very disappointed. It’s a room that needs love and attention. Went down to reception and informed them, but left with an impression that I just waisted their time. We are here for three days and hopefully things can only get better. By the way doorman very friendly.

title: Faded grandeur
text:
Great location, and a beautiful, 20s brick building. The lobby is a marble masterpiece. Unfortunately the hotel is terribly, tragically dilapidated throughout. Looks like it hasn’t had a refit in 50 years. Dark and gloomy throughout. 

Rooms facing into a central courtyard (filthy, incidentally) are marred by deafeningly noisy air-conditioning inverter which run 24/7. Water pressure negligible, showers an exercise in frustration 

Roof pool was a disappointment, a sliding plastic roof arrangement means it gets very little sun. Not open until 11 in the morning which was annoying, and the space by the pool is crowded with far too many sun lounges. Roof bar is fine albeit service sporadic and inattentive. 

Service throughout ranges from good, to normal-for-New-York to some of the female front desk staff verging into outright belligerence. The ladies who checked us in at 1 in the morning when we first arrived however could not have been nicer, but staff during the day fighty and unhelpful.

title: Good location, very noisy though!
text: The location is great if you’re wanting to be near the park, which we did- one of the best things we did in NYC was go for an early morning run in Central Park.   The main problem was the noise !  The window of the room looked into the central “courtyard” with the fans and the noise was deafening. Really loud!  Granted it was hot outside, but the noise was very very loud.   The room was small and not fancy.

title: Not recommend this hotel
text:
This hotel is greatly located but thats all it has going for it.
The rooms are small and dated, my first room lights did not work and was like a freezer with no controls working for the air con unit, and the unit was so loud you couldnt hear yourself think! i then moved rooms to which my next room had a sewage smell but by this point i was so tired and was told there were no more rooms to change too.
they also kept £18.88 out of the holding fee as a charge for the pool & roof top(which we didnt use)and the wifi - all of which was not explained to us at check in
we also booked bed and breakfast to be told the kitchen was closed!
all in all i would never stay in this hotel again

title: Family Vacation!
text: This hotel was in the perfect location for us. We were able to get to Times Square, Central Park and Pier 83 easily and cheaply. When traveling with two kids this is a must. As soon as we pulled up there was a bellman ready to get our bags from the car and give us directions to the closest parking garage. This hotel is traditional and full service. You don't have to lift a finger. There is a very small pool on the roof which came in handy because we were in New York during a heat wave. The roof top bar was nice with good views. Just wish we could have sat outside but there was a storm the day we had time to go so it was off limits for safety. We would stay here again anytime. We liked this hotel for it's character and staff. The traditional feel was great which can be lost when staying in a chain hotel.

title: Lovely well situated Hotel
text: Room was a little dated but it was spotlessly clean , the bed was very comfortable and the air con was amazing , we visited in a heat wave so air con was very much appreciated. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel’s a 5 minute stroll to Central Park . We would definitely recommend and stay there again

title: Outstanding & Awesome Location
text:
We checked in on 100 degree day in NYC, burdened down by our luggage and literally dripping in sweat. They checked us in early, handed us bottled water, confirmed our details, and sent us to the pool. The rooftop pool is small, but I’m not sure what people expect 12 floors up. It’s PERFECT for a dip, and the service at the roof top restaurant was great!

The hotel is easy access to the 1, A, B, C, D metro lines, all via Columbus Circle metro, abuts Central Park, and is adjacent to Lincoln Center. 

Our room was even a touch bigger than a traditional NYC hotel room. 

Really outstanding, we will be back! 

Shout out to Luis at the front desk.

title: Too noisy AC keep you awake
text:
The location is great close to Lincoln center. 
Front desk man luggage person and doorman were friendly.     

However the AC is too noisy feels like inside subway stations.
Claimed to change the room and the front desk said they will prepare a new room till I’m back. I got back but found NO new room was prepared. 
Seems like the relocation request has not been relayed.  The ladies in the front said they will manage for relocation in the next day because “it’s too late for the day to get another room.” 

I’m wearing ear plugs but their not working for this level of sound. I’m really tired after long flight but the AC keep me awake. I feel like getting a headache.

I saw similar comments in some booking sites about the noise and other comments.

Seriously, if you don’t like noisy AC, recommend you think carefully. 

Will see how it goes in few hours.

title: Avoid!
text: I booked at this hotel because somewhere I saw it had 4 stars.  I can't emphasize enough how terrible my stay was.  For 6 days my air conditioner only worked intermittently.  I called and stopped by the main desk to complain.  One day prior to my departure, they finally replaced the unit.  The refrigerator barely worked, I asked for a replacement, that never happened.  It was very hot outside the days I stayed and each guest was given 2 bottles of warm water which you had to ask for.  There was no coffee available in the lobby and no newspapers.  The room itself was nice but very small (I had a queen bed) and they did an excellent job cleaning daily.  The front staff were not helpful and often had to be told multiple times about problems.  TERRIBLE  customer service and the staff were not friendly.  I will be visiting NYC multiple times in the future but will not be staying at this hotel.  They didn't even offer to lower my bill due to inconvenience.

title: Terrible customer service
text: My best childhood girlfriends and I planned a get together for one night in NYC-we booked two connecting rooms, or so we were told by the person at the hotel who made the reservation for us.  This was confirmed by a phone call later before our trip.    When we checked in, we were told that the rooms were not connecting.  We were very upset about this and they obviously did not care at all that we had been misled when making the reservation.  We were then told that we would get rooms across the hall from each other.  That also turned out to be not true. The rooms were not close at all.   One room was ready at 3:00 but the other room was not.  We were told it would be 5-10 minutes until it was ready, but that was not true either .  We were told we could have a late check out for that room.   The next day when we went back to the room after the regular 12pm checkout our key no longer worked.  We went to the desk to ask and they very nonchalantly said that the keys deactivate at noon.  They did not care less that they had neglected to tell us that.   I would never stay here again or recommend this hotel.  The customer service was the worst I've seen.  Never getting my money again.

title: Deserves revitalization
text:
Got wrong room at first, way below adequate for pre paid rate, not clean, about 120 sft smaller than suggested in booking process. Upon complaint we were relocated to the correct room - great size, great view. Unfortunately hairdryer and small things missing, and only provided after walking down to reception (after calling twice in vain).

Wifi low and unstable in our room on 10 th floor/corner - useless unless in the lobby.

Overall, still a lovable place - but you just notice it’s been great in the 2000s and that’s been a while. Pool area closed (again) for one of our few days there. Lobby bar closed. Restaurants closed.

title: Délabrement
text:
Les photos ne sont pas du tout représentatives de l’état de l’hôtel. Très bruyant (rue Columbus) ont dirait que la fenêtre était grande ouverte. Clim infernale.  Pas de restaurant déjeuner. Resto autours très moyen sauf Smith.  Rooftop inaccessible (reservation, toujours complet). Piscine minuscule ( 1.5 m de large) et toujours fermée ( avons pris cet hôtel pour la piscine) très décevant avec enfant et la canicule. Personnel excédé. Wifi pas fameux sauf au lobby. Frigo reste chaud et l’hôtel n’avait plus de bouteille d’eau. 
Hôtel sombre, lourd, vieillissant et sale. Si vous ne prenez pas le métro, vous êtes loin de tout. 
Je ne recommande pas du tout.

title: Cher pour l'état de la chambre
text: Hôtel extrêmement bien situé à deux pas du métro et de central park. Mais je suis déçue de notre chambre au prix de la semaine je trouve ça limite d'avoir eu une chambre en si mauvaise état. Clim qui coule et extrêmement bruyante. Meubles abîmés, moquette sale, système de douche qui ne fonctionne pas  totalement. Frigo d'un âge très avancé et qui refroidi à peine les bouteilles d'eau, stores déchirés et cassés, lampes très bancales Même l'enseigne lumineuse de l'hôtel était en piteuse état . Par contre le personnel lui était parfait.

title: Gossip Girls Trip
text: I took my daughter to NYC to visit locations from Gossip Girl in March.  We stayed one night and were very pleased.  The lobby was gorgeous and we took a ton of photos.  We had an "express" room booked, but we were allowed to upgrade to two beds at no charge. The rooftop restaurant was good and the location was convenient to the subway and within walking distance to Rockefeller.

title: Desperately Seeking Renovation
text: The location is great, the bedding was fine, the towels and linens were clean and the wifi is easy to access and fast.  But clearly nothing has been renovated in quite some time (my daughter-in-law remembers the interiors from Gossip Girl which was ages ago).  Furniture is scuffed and scratched, wall-to-wall carpet is not particularly clean.  Even the buttons in the elevators look like they are worn down to nubs.  No coffee, tea or mini-bar in the room either.

title:
Excelente custo benefício. Perto de tudo, longe da
Agitacão
text:
Excelente custo benefício. Hotel com tudo próximo. Farmácia, várias opções para o café da manhã e restaurantes. Próximo da Times Square mas longe de
Seu agito. Próximo de
Várias linhas de
Metro.  Pessoal muito atencioso. Minibar (vazio) no quarto. Garrafas de água disponíveis gratuitamente na recepção. Quarto e banheiro limpos e confortáveis. Rooftop fantastico. Ponto negativo para o ar-condicionado. Só funcionava quando queria, ligava e desligava aleatoriamente e não obedecia aos comandos; só haviam duas opções: desligado (aí eram forno, pois fomos no verão) ou frio siberiano. Apesar disso recomendo e voltarei.

title: Great bar on the rooftop
text: Perfect place with a great rooftop terrace. Stuff is very friendly and always tries to help you. They do anything to make you enjoy your stay. Pool on top is small but very refreshing on a hot day like we had them.

title: Hôtel très moyen
text:
Hôtel médiocre / pas digne des commentaires lus sur internet 
Notre chambre donnait sur un mur avec le bruit de la climatisation jour et nuit. 
Chambre très petite 
Personnel pas forcément accueillant 
Salle de bain minuscule 
Pas de bar ni de service petit dej …
Prestations à revoir

title: Stay Away!!
text: I stayed for a weekend. The room was old and in a VERY bad shape. I understand why the check in was so quick. Who would want that terrible room? The hotel needs serious maintenance. It was also extremely noisy and it was impossible to sleep. I called the front desk and the guy hung up the phone. I had to call again and he said there were no more rooms available. The following day I went to talk to the front desk again and I had to speak with multiple very unfriendly people before I got to the manager who finally changed my room. Terrible experience. The new room was supposed to be an “upgrade” but the it was also in terrible conditions (lots of mold) and still noisy. Mold everywhere. I am never coming back.

title: Blair Waldorf Wannabe dream come true
text: I walked past this hotel a million times when I lived in the city. I never realized how amazing the location is. You’re a few blocks from Columbus Circle and our room over looked Lincoln Center! You could see the Chagall paintings at night in the opera house. There’s a Starbucks about 50 feet from the entrance. The room was really clean and well set up. Only gripe is the lighting in the bathroom was a bit dim but…Louis at the front desk really went above and beyond for us.

title: Pool closed for both days of my stay
text: Would have given the place rave reviews, but on a gorgeous 85 degree day, the pool was closed.  It was closed yesterday for rain. Sign went up this morning saying the pool would be open at 11 due to mechanical issues.  Later the sign said 1:30. Sat out waiting for the pool until 2:15 when they announced the pool would not be opening at all.  Picked the hotel BECAUSE of the pool…paid more for it than we would have for a hotel without a pool…and no access to the pool at all.  Room was comfortable.

title: Great location; great service by Zahir
text:
Enjoyed our 4 night stay here. Can't beat the location. 
Zahir was extremely helpful and courteous. Will come back to this hotel as a result. 
Rooftop bar here is also very cool and the views are hard to beat.

title: Billederne snyder. Mangler rengøring og aircondition larmer selvom den er slukket
text: Mangler rengøring og aircondition larmer helt utroligt meget selvom den er slukket ! Det første værelse vi fik, var der efterladenskaber i toilettet. Vi har nu fået et anden værelse. Men her er heller ikke super rent. Uheldig start på bryllupsrejsen.

title: Decepção
text: Passamos o dia fora e não arrumaram o quarto a desculpa foi a falta de funcionários . Tive que ligar para trazerem toalhas mas não limparam o quarto o corredor cheira a urina e falaMos desde o primeiro dia . Tinha tudo para ser um hotel bacana mas falta atenção as hóspedes é enorme

title: Humiliated In my Bedroom by Staff
text:
My fiancé and I were staying at the Empire Hotel for an exciting first trip together in Nee York City. We were making love in the afternoon and even though we had a sign on the door for privacy, a male worker walked in. I was completely exposed and naked in the middle of our very intimate moment. I looked up, had eye contact and screamed at the man to get out. My fiancé said the same. The worker closed the door and then my fiancé got dressed and went downstairs to the front desk. I felt embarrassed, violated to be seen in such a naked and intimate, private moment. The hotel manager apologized to him, gave him a bottle of wine & 2 free drinks later at the bar. This did not make up for my emotional trauma. I would assume a hotel like this would at least offer a comp of a night or the 2 night stay and a written apology. They treated my fiancé rudely when we checked out. I was embarrassed the entire time there wondering with if I would see the man who walked in on us. 
I worked in the hotel and restaurant  industry when younger and was appalled at how they handled this very delicate situation. The demeanor of the management and most all of the employees(the Bellman were helpful & friendly) need to be trained in customer service. It was a horrific experience for me at this hotel.

title: Nice lobby, no a/c in room
text: Nice lobby. Cute hotel rooms. A/c in room failed to work all 4 nights. Multiple service calls and never fixed. At least we could open 1 window and only a few flies slept with us. Central to a lot of things in town.  Loved being close to Central Park

title: Look for a other option
text:
since we arrived everything has been wrong. first they gave us a room with everything dirty, the bathroom door super old and damaged and the most serious thing, an air conditioner with a noise that did not let us sleep.
Terrible service, they have no solutions, they are rude and everything is always your fault. The second night we called to complain about the noise, they hung up the phone because there was nothing to do and it was my fault for not calling beforehand. That morning when we changed rooms we left our bags in the lobby and we had a gift (food) left in the fridge and last night they told us that they had no solution for the time and that it was our fault for not calling before and that it was thrown away, that we find out in the morning, I went down to find out in the morning and they only told me that they throw it way.  I do not recommend the hotel, the only nice thing is the lobby, not even the name.

title: 비싸고 좁음
text: 방이 매우 좁고 소음이 큽니다. 어둡고 답답한 방입니다. 슬리퍼와 가운도 없어요. 직원들도 친절하지 않아요. 위치는 링컨센터에서 가깝습니다.

title: Awful
text: This was once an ok hotel.  The location can not be beat...but the rooms are woefully outdated..peeling paint, smelly cigarette stinking carpets...outdated bathrooms, terrible a/c...and nasty staff.  No one answered the phone at the front desk or concierge...they charge an added a mandatory  $23 to cover two mini warm water bottles...no ice...no restaurant or room service...really terrible.  The worst thing that happened is that they gave a key to an incoming guest...who barged into our room while we were still there...I was about to head out to a meeting leaving my 12 year old daughter in the room when this big guy burst in unannounced saying the front desk had given him the key!  Needless to say I did not leave my daughter there...she came to the b'fast meeting.  I would never stay here again.

title: Horrible...give it a miss if you can!
text: I have stayed here previously and it was pretty good...but this time it was horrible.  I heard they shut down over the pandemic and then couldn't hire their regular staff back...so the service was dreadful.  We booked a jr. suite..expecting an adjoining room with a fold out couch...and it was just a regular room with a couch uncomfortably plopped in ... not acceptable at all.  We had to take an additonal room...the room we had smelled of cigarette smoke...despite the hotel claiming to be smoke free...we complained and they offered to come up and spray...so I'm guessing we are not the first.  We declined as that seemed like it would make it worse...the room was really unpleasant..the decor shabby...and the people working the front desk were not helpful at all.  We asked for a second room...the offered it for a discount and then charged the full amount.  They also added $23 for wifi and water bottles...just ugh.

title: Great location/Clean and comfy
text: Stayed there with a group for a wedding. A very nice boutique hotel experience. Double room was very small but very clean and the beds were some of the more comfortable I’ve slept in during hotel stays. The location was a five star for sure! Very nice, clean area that felt very safe. Walking distance to amazing restaurants, Central Park, right across from Lincoln Center, a little more than a mile away from Times Square, two blocks from Columbus Circle and subway, etc. So close to so many amazing things to do but the area around the hotel was never super crowded. Loved that! Housekeeping was wonderful and cleaned the room every day. Front desk very friendly. AC in the room ran the entire time to keep it cool and was obviously an older unit but the room stayed comfortable. Hallways were dark but I think that was park of the art deco look they were going for in the overall look. Not necessarily a family vibe…felt more like a place for adults, friends, couples, to have the chill NYC experience.  Would come back with my husband in a heartbeat.

title: Stay Here - Convenience!
text:
What a pleasant surprise when pulling up to the hotel - location, location, location! Right across the street from Lincoln Center, a small park, with plenty of stores within walking distance. 

Taxis traversing the streets on both sides, so easy to hail them to get to wherever you're going. 

Denis the bellman kindly brought my bags into the keenly designed, comfortable black, white and gold lobby. 

Our room overlooked Lincoln Center - enjoyed the music on the plaza during the day. Inviting king bed, good air conditioning, plenty of room to work .

Rooftop pool and bar is great! Be sure to reserve bar right away for outdoor seating.

title: Hotel nella parte giusta di New York
text: L'hotel è molto comodo perché si trova vicinissimo a Central Park e alla metro dove puoi raggiungere qualunque posto in comodità. Un ringraziamento speciale lo dobbiamo a Pasquale che si è occupato di noi ed è stato sempre disponibile e gentile. Lo consigliamo vivamente soprattutto per chi vuole alloggiare nella New York giusta.

title: Top notch staff
text: Adam changed my experience here from good to exceptional. Adam went out of his way to not only switch my room, but then personally checked in with me later and the next day. He was kind and genuine... it was the best customer service I have experienced at any hotel. He is a million dollar asset to the Empire, a diamond in the customer service world, and I am truly grateful.

title: DID NOT HAVE A GOOD STAY
text: Stayed 5/26-5/28 - Upon check in found the front desk staff rude. not hospitable at all (the young lady at the front desk projected distain for guests).  We had called a few weeks earlier to ask about early check-in policy (we took a red-eye to NYC) are elderly and needed to rest, we were informed Empire could accommodate us.  When low-and-behold upon arrival our friendly desk clerk said  our room would NOT be available until sometime between 1-2, we would receive a text to let us know (never received a text).  Room 438 smelled like mildew, tiny bathroom smelled unclean and also of mildew, no bathroom counter space, carpet in room was unclean, furniture is chipped, old, ceiling stains and cracks and the floor is uneven...causing multiple tripping.  This boutique hotel needs to provide ALOT more for the money they charge, despite the easy location.  I will NOT be staying here again.  Hospitality is ALL in the details in which this hotel sorely lacks.

title: Amazinggggg!!!!
text: This place was far beyond what I expected. The lobby Andy rooftop are so cool, the pool was amazing. I had difficulty with my television and I told Adam and Herman my issues and how it was my anniversary and asking if it could be fixed. They went above and beyond for me and resolved my issues. They were truly amazing staff and great location I would recommend to anyone

title: Decepcionante
text: El hotel pésimo nada qué ver con lo qué ofrecen por la web las habitaciones súper pequeñas y no obstante con un ruido espantoso las 24 horas dado que dan a un patio interior y suena todo el rato la máquina qué tienen del aire acondicionado no hay quién descanse el servicio pésimo el gym cerrado lo único bueno que tiene este hotel es la ubicación muy DECEPCIONADOS después de ir a quejarnos a recepción la única solución que nos dieron fué cambiarnos a un piso más arriba cuál ruido era peor en definitiva un auténtico desastre habiendo pagado 1600 eur 6 días no lo recomiendo por nada

title: Great location
text: My husband and I went to NYC for a vacation, and had booked a room at the Empire for three nights. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. First the drawbacks: the air conditioners were noisy, and we had an inner room where you could hear the building’s climate control system or whatever it was. I bought earplugs and used them one night but really, it was more “white noise” and did not disturb my sleep much. The other thing we found annoying was we wanted to go to the rooftop bar for a drink a couple of times but were told there was no room. We could not even go up and check for ourselves, there is a bellman at the elevator who decides who can go up and who can’t. I got the feeling that we were not the “beautiful people”. But I am probably just imagining that…at least, I hope so. The pool was not open because it wasn’t summer yet…fair enough…and the gym was closed for renovations. Anyway, for the pluses…the room was fairly spacious for a NYC hotel, and I was impressed with the very comfortable bed. The housekeeper did a fantastic job of cleaning the room. The location was superb…right near Columbus Circle and a short walk to Central Park, Hell’s Kitchen, lots of restaurants and the subway. Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The price was reasonable considering the location. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good stay, good location
text: Area named hells kitchen almost put us off this great place to stay in NYC. Once there, we found our fears unfounded. This hotel was a true find. Hotel made up room each day. Door staff were really helpful. Location was great for getting to all the sites. Would stay again.

title: Not good value at all.
text:
It’s generally ok as a hotel. The staff are friendly, quite efficient and the location is great. 

Rooms are quite small, and there is no hanging space. I had to swop rooms as the first room they offered the window didn’t open and there was a fridge in the middle of the doorway. Very odd. 

The biggest issue at this place is noise. Not from the street, from the 500 air con units that blast all day and all night. You have two options; sleep with your window open and hear the noise, or boil as the hotel air con doesn’t work all that well. 

Showers are ok, housekeeping is fine and the place is clean enough. I guess my issue is that this cost £300 a night and just wasn’t good value at all.

title: Anniversary Trip
text: We stayed 4 nights and really liked it.  The location is perfect!  Our room was nice and large for NYC.   We loved the roof top bar and went their twice. You do have to make reservations which was no problem. The pool was not opened which was no big deal.  The hotel itself is really cool and has a vintage look to it. Some areas are dark so the lighting could be a little better but honestly no complaints. Would stay there again for sure.

title: Always ups and downs
text:
Just back from our 5 night stay in NYC. My first time in NY and my partners second time in this hotel. Really liked the area, its chilled and the subway is right beside hotel so can be at times sq in like 10 mins. Our bed was comfortable and room OK size for 2 people on a city trip. Cleaned everyday. Bit noisy but it's nyc... Just no day time naps! Staff were nice, enjoyed chatting to Jose briefly made me feel very welcome. The rooms do need updating and bit uncared for. Did not like the rooftop bar, more of a venue than a hotel guest spot. Overall price was fair for NYC, just some investment in the appearance and amenities be great. No issue with the WiFi at all. Just have to sign in when u leave and come back.
Would stay again if got a deal.

title: The Empire Hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Empire Hotel.   Adbelah at the front desk went above and beyond to ensure that we had all the amenities and services that we asked for.  Really appreciated Abdelah’s customer service

title: Rooms on the back are under brutal ventilation noises from the building nearby
text:
Location excellent, arrived at midnight and I was quickly checked in. I arrived to my room , which was correct. Unfortunately a brutal aspiration noise from the climate system of the building on the side makes it truly difficult to sleep.

The blowing noise is so brutal that tomorrow I will leave the hotel and will look for a proper place to sleep.

If you chose this hotel make sure your room is not on the back of the building unless you plan to go out at night hard and sleeping is not relevant

title: Exceptional service!
text: Very efficient, polite, and professional front desk! Able to check in early with requested accommodations. Nice room, great beds, perfect location for theater, Lincoln Center, food, subways. Excellent stay! I would recommend as safe, pleasant hotel!

title: First time, disappointed
text:
I don’t know WHO waited on some of you people that RAVED about the staff, but I did NOT have a positive experience with one member of the staff.  First and fore most for those of you reading this review:  this property, even with its good location, is OVERPRICED.  By the time all the taxes, fees, and nonsense were added, my rate was over $55 per night higher than anticipated, and for the quality, and condition of the rooms, and halls, and lack of things, it’s not worth the price. 
I booked through a travel site, MONTHS in advance, and am fairly certain I requested a room with a bath TUB, not just a shower. I walk a lot, have back and hip issues, and like to soak at the end of the day. In any event, even if I forgot that request on the initial booking, I was sent a note from the property, where I requested it, still weeks in advance.  I did arrive at the property early, 10:30 am (ish), and let me state that the first thing I told the female staff member at the desk, was that this was my first time at this hotel.  I knew I would not be able to check in, but I let them know I was there and that I was not happy with the total rate for the 3 nights, as it was much higher than I was quoted, but what could you do?  She would not waive any of the extra charges, including one that provided me with water and wi-fi!!!  When I asked if she saw the note about the tub, she confirmed that she did AND indicated that she had a room to offer me that would meet my requirements, but of course, it was not ready yet.  No problem, I told her, I would be back.  I heard the other staff member checking in another guest at the desk, telling him that now that they knew he was there, he would put a rush on the room cleaning.   I was not offered that courtesy.  She did say she would text me when my room was ready.  I received no such message.  Check in was 3 pm. When I arrived back at the hotel at approximately 2:40, asking please, was my room available, a gentleman checked me in and I went on up with the bellman and my luggage and shopping.  Upon entrance, I immediately saw that my room had NO tub, just a not so nice shower – big, but beat up and in need of updating.  I went downstairs and the poor nice young man said he did not have a room to meet my request. I offered to take a different type of room if that would help and NO.  She was standing at the desk, and I told him that when I was there over 4 hours ago, she indicated that she could meet my request.  She said nothing, he avoided eye contact, and I said I was not happy to which he replied “I’m sorry, but it was only a request”.  No offer to do anything!!!  No bottle of wine sent to my room, no slight reduction in my rate, nothing more than a verbal apology.
Here's the rest: 
The halls are EXTREMELY dark, can barely get your key card in the slot. The place was NOT clean, and the bathroom was run down.  I did have good maid service, for which I gladly tipped.  The only redeeming feature, was the roof top bar/restaurant.  The hotel bar, which looked cool, was closed despite stating this on their web site:
Join us for appetizers and cocktails at our iconic Lobby Bar 
along with pictures of the lobby bar! 
There are NO ice machines on the floors.  I was told they were too loud and the walls are thin, for which I can attest to, as I could hear people in the next room as clearly as if they were in mine.  You had to bring your ice bucket downstairs, where other staff members (not that female at the desk) gladly filled it.
When I tried to catch a little TV, it stated, no signal, or not available, or something, but I couldn’t get it to work.
A friend told me once that when you travel, your accommodations should be at LEAST at the level of what you have at home, if no better.  My home is bright, and clean, and not run down.  This hotel was not better than my home.   :  ( 
I usually stay somewhere in midtown, but wanted to be close to the park for morning walks.  I would not stay here again.

title: Parfais
text: Franchement je vous recommande cette hôtel à New York super bien placer et super safe ! Proche du métro de Time square de tout franchement endroit idéal pour visiter New York tout et à côté je vous le recommande , l’hôtel dispose d’un roof top super magnifique

title: Good Hotel in New York
text:
Nice hotel. Good size on the room. Not easy to find in New York. Helpful staff. Location couldn't be any better. Close to Central Park and subway.
The service fee should had been for wifi we were told. But didn't work in our room. Very annoying when you book hotel and it says you have. Did ask them about it. "Working on it"...
And a great hotel like this should have had glass, not plastic glass.
We stayed here for 3 nights.

title: Cancellation many days in advance is 100% fee.
text: Look elsewhere since this location seems to try to trap you into staying.  Looked to cancel multiple days prior and was told that cancelling would be a full charge.  Called to work out cancellation and was unable to get beyond the cancellation would be the full charge for the room.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week while on holidays in New york. The hotel is located right across the road from Central Park and in between 2 subway stations about 3-4 minutes walk from each. It takes about 5-15 minutes to midtown on the subway depending on where you want to go and then a half hour right down to areas such as brooklyn bridge and battery park. 
The hotel itself is perfect, it's clean and the lobby is beautifully decorated. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We had an issue one of the days where the TV in our room was damaged while we were out, possibly while the room was being cleaned, we reported it that night when we got back and when we arrived back from sight seeing the following day the TV was replaced with a new and better one. I was very impressed at how quick and efficient the staff were and how helpful they were throughout our stay. The only issue I had was that the gym was closed for renovations and the pool was closed as it wasn't in season when we visited. I would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.

title: Excellent hotel, even better service.
text: My girlfriend and I stayed in the empire hotel for 3 nights, and we had an amazing time. The hotel is situated in a very nice area of New York, right in the middle of everything. The hotel was great, but what especially separates it from any other New York hotel was the staff, specifically Adam, Sarah, and Karma. I had a problem with my room, and alerted the staff about it, Adam did not hesitate to accommodate my girlfriend and I. We were given a new, upgraded room. We were also always greeted and given water whenever we asked, along with whatever else was needed. This was greatly appreciated and I would not hesitate to book with the Empire Hotel for this reason. Once again thank you Adam, Sarah, and Karma!

title: Hôtel vétuste et chambres pas insonorisés mais bien situé.
text: Hôtel vétuste qui a besoin d’un coup de rajeunissement. Eau chaude manque à certains jours et moments. Fenêtre pas insonorisé. On dormait au 7 eme étage côté Columbus avenue. C’est comme ci on dormait dans la rue. Pas de bar et de restaurant. Pas digne d’un 4 étoiles.

title: Excellent location and stay
text: I absolutely loved my stay at the Empire hotel. The location was perfect, as it was across the street from the Lincoln center and two blocks from Columbus circle. The room was comfortable for one person (would have been for two as well), the decor was modern and aesthetically pleasing, and the bed super comfortable. The shower didn’t have good water pressure and the bathroom was fairly small (but to be expected for a NYC hotel). The one reason I didn’t give five stars was because the rooftop bar was closed for a private event. This was one of the reasons I chose this hotel and was super disappointed when I was told I could not go up. I didn’t use the wifi nor the rooftop, so I’m not quite sure why I was charged the resort fee!

title: Can't beat the location & staff
text:
I wasn't expecting much after reading the mixed reviews but the pros definitely outweighed the cons.
Yes the rooms are small & in need of an upgrade but the shower is excellent, bed is comfortable. They have daily maid service & all of the staff is outstanding.
Location can't be beat!!

title: Cool hotel in Lincoln Center next to great restaurant PJ Clarke . Good rooms great roof top . Too bad pool amd gym N/A
text: Great service . The difference was at the reception with Pasquale , he was super kind and treated us with a lot of respect and gave us a very nice room . Hotel is located in a great area in Lincoln Center. The only issue was that the hotel listed a gym and it was closed . We travel and the gym is key Forbis to keep our trailing . The roof top is great . But again Pasquale greeted us and made us feel at home !!!

title: Very nice
text: Yes, it's a bit dated. But it's still very nice. The rain shower is wonderful. They upgraded us, which was greatly appreciated. Everyone is super nice and helpful. Very convenient to subway and Columbus Circle.

title: Location Rules!
text:
Location rules is a lesson we have learned through our travels! And the Empire Hotel’s location can not be beaten in NYC. But for the great location you have to sacrifice and here you will sacrifice amenities.
The Empire is virtually a few steps away from the Lincoln Center, a few more from Grand Central Park and Julliard, and a chipping wedge from Columbus Circle. Taxis and Ubers are constantly in front of the hotel entrance. All the subway lines pass through Columbus Circle and the bus stops are right there.
When hungry there is PJClarke’s, Rosa’s, and The Smiths within a few minutes or less walk. 
The hotel is extremely clean and the cleaning staff receives kudos.
The front desk is very helpful but the door guys will go the extra mile for you.
Now the amenities, like wi-fi, glass drinking glasses, mini bar, etc. are missing or very bad. The wi-fi really sucks and really doesn’t qualify as wi-fi. Without piggy backing off our telephone we would have been without it.
But the hotel saves it’s ranking by having a roof top bar! And that bar has views, service, comfort, and drinks that make you forget the lack of wi-fi and amenities.
Overall, we’d definitely stay there again because of the location and the roof top bar!

title: Excellent accueil à l’Empire hôtel de New-York
text:
Parfaitement accueillis à notre arrivée , en particulier par Pasquale, charmant et polyglotte de surcroît qui a su nous trouver une chambre calme avec une large vue sur le quartier… merci à lui !
L’hôtel est très bien situé dans Manhattan avec des stations de métro proches.

title: Ok
text: Reception and staff are fabulous. Rooms are outdated. Noisy. Small. In desperate need of a decent renovation. Rooms are very hot (March) , taking a shower is a challenge. The room is so moist and hot after that you feel disgusted. Hallways are dark and make you feel like your in a horror movie. Pro: location, staff, free water.

title: GREAT HOTEL IN NYC!
text: Had an excellent one night stay at the Empire Hotel.  The location was fabulous...so close to Fordham Univ-Lincoln Center Campus where we were seeing a play that our daughter was in.  Lots of restaurants nearby and walking distance to so many NYC attractions...Lincoln Center, Central Park to name a few.  Check in and Check out was swift and efficient.  The room was clean and looked out over the city.  There were a few minor things that were "run down" in the room, but nothing to make our stay bad.  The rooftop bar is nice but EXPENSIVE!  2 drinks cost $35!  There were parking facilities less a than block away that cost $45 for the night --got ticket validated at check-in for this reduced rate.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Needs to up its game to return to its former glory
text:
Positives

Superb front desk staff
Impressive, modern & clean lobby / mez area 
Roof bar food was excellent 
Good size room for Manhattan
