Comfortable beds & good quality bedding
Great quality soaps, shampoos etc
Quality housekeeping staff who were very polite & helpful
Great views from roof bar
Fantastic location

Negatives

Dreadful to non existent Wi-Fi (7 days)
Pool & gym facilities still closed due to “covid” but full rate still charged & open in competitors hotels
Room rundown, smelt of damp, mildew on inner side of curtains 
Dated TV that didn’t point toward bed or seat
Lack of basic room amenities expected of a 4* hotel
Legendary lobby bar permanently closed 
Room service not currently operational 
Lack of response when dialling from in room telephone
Roof top bar staff quite rude (on three separate occasions and spoke to people in the lift down who complained of the same also)

After two previous fantastic stays at the Empire, this left us quite disappointed all in all. Will likely stay else where on my next visit.

title: Great location, super staff, lovely stay.
text:
Stayed three nights with my daughter, and everything from check-in to check-out was excellent. Sarah and Adam at the front desk were especially helpful.

Hard to beat the location, and it's a rare hotel room where I didn't once hear my neighbors. Really nice rooftop terrace for drinks, too.

title: Beautiful welcoming stay in NYC
text:
After booking a NYC trip via a travel consultant we needed up in an absolute hovel of a hotel .. we immediately checked out and found the Empire .. 

The place is really clean and the entrance and lobby are beautiful.

It was my birthday and Pasquale on reception welcomed us immediately, I told him of the horrible experience we were having and he was able to help us.

He made sure our room was upgraded it was beautiful with 3 large windows and views across the Lincoln centre which is beautiful when lit up at night.

He also messaged me as soon as the room was ready before actual check in time as an emergency ( he could probably tell o hadn’t slept and was having the worst birthday ever )

The staff and really helpful and friendly especially Pasquale.

The roof top bar in the sun is something else I loved it , great food and delicious cocktails.

The pool opens in spring would love to come back and see it again !

Thank you again for making my trip to NYC and making sure I had an absolute perfect birthday.

title: Stellar front desk staff
text: We enjoyed our stay at The Empire Hotel.  I would suggest better lighting and the ability to adjust the room temperature. Overall, I was impressed with the front desk staff.  Pasquale was especially helpful and personable.

title: Wonderful and Perfect!
text:
I highly recommend this wonderful hotel. The location is perfect - seconds from transportation shopping and dining and entertainment. The hotel is boutique like and charming with a fabulous and warm decor. The rooms are spacious clean and well appointed. It also has a chic rooftop lounge and an array of amenities including an outdoor pool. This hotel offers everything for a pleasurable stay, however  the staff will make all the difference in your expirience- they are exceptionally hospitable.  Especially the front desk staff members: Luis  was incredibly jovial  kind and understanding. Adam was professional , helpful and warm ;as well as Karma who was friendly and welcoming and Pasquale who was compassionate and caring. 
 Thanks to thier exceptional service we cannot wait to return!

title: Compliment
text: Incredibly kind and friendly staff. Rooftop bar was wonderful.  The staff and management were incredibly gracious to us as healthcare workers as we had to cancel our reservation twice. They were under no obligation but do so anyway. Would highly recommend this hotel

title: Always happy to stay at the Empire!
text: I came into the city to babysit my grandchildren.  It was a late night and I didn't check in until 1am.  Abdellah checked me in and he was so kind.  I felt right at home.  The roof top is open again and I think I will come back for myself next time and enjoy that and the lobby when my babysitting services are not needed.

title: A great discovery
text: A group of us stayed at the The Empire Hotel for a film festival, and it worked out to be a perfect choice.  The staff could not have been nicer, the rooms were clean, quiet and nicely set up.  Plenty of hot water in the spacious shower, plus extra towels and nice toiletries were an unexpected treat.  And the location near Lincoln Center is great, easy to walk to so many places.  We look forward to coming back.

title: I love the Empire
text: I love the Empire Hotel, I stay here every time I come to NYC. It’s well located, and the lobby and rooftop bar are great. It definitely does need a room refurb, the paint is peeling and the tiles are coming off the walls. When I went in February the bar in the lobby and the restaurant Ed’s Chowder House were not open which was a shame, but hopefully they will be again soon.

title: Accidentally in Manhattan
text: Even though it was unplanned, I was blessed enough to stay at the Empire Hotel. It was an incredible experience with the most fun loving staff I have ever seen. The staff at the reception especially, I never felt more comfortable in a different country. Thanks to Sarah and her positive energy and the amount of time she put aside to help me during my stay is something that makes me want to not leave. Definitely coming back as soon as possible.

title: A la Chuck
text:
On se l’ai joué à la Gossip Girl ! Super hôtel : les chambres sont petites mais fonctionnelles ! Après nous n’avons pas tester les services de hôtel. 
Il est idéalement situé pas très loin d’une station de métro. On y a passé un super moment ! C’est validé

title: Great location & extremely helpful concierge
text: We stayed at The Empire Hotel over New Year to celebrate the end of 2021 with my girlfriend. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to the Lincoln center. The only setback is the unreliable wifi making it difficult to navigate all the forms required to travel internationally. However, Abdellah at the concierge desk was extremely helpful and helped us sort through the paperwork issues. Thank you very much to Abdellah for ensuring we could get all the forms done in time to catch our flight!

title: This is bloody terrible
text: When you first enter in the lobby it’s lovely and the staff are very friendly but as soon as you go to your room there’s where its bad the paint on the wall is peeling and its really dark the air conditioning has a knob what you turn its not modern at all and the bathroom’s door paint is peeling up I will never stay in this hotel anymore.

title: Best stay ever
text:
From check in to check out we had the best stay ever and if we should ever be fortunate enough to return to New York again, we’ll be returning to this hotel.
I’m not sure why anyone could have anything negative to say. 
On check in, luis was the friendliest most welcoming guy.
Housekeeping were the best with clean towels and a tidy every day. 
The young man on the door was so friendly and helped us with directions.
The hotel itself is spotless and my husband my little girl and myself all slept so well in the comfortable beds. 
The location of the hotel is amazing, so near to so many attractions and the subway only a short walk to use to see things further away.
Thankyou to all of the staff for taking such good care of us.

title: Courteous staff, great location, comfortable rooms
text: The Empire will treat you well.  Luis took care of us when we arrived.  The rooms are modernized and comfortable.  The pool deck looks great for the warmer months.  It's well located next to the Opera House near Central Park and Times Square.

title: Froid et cher
text: Hôtel agréable et bien placé mais cher pour le service: chambre mal isolée donc froide en hiver, pas de petit déjeuner sur place, pas de bouilloire en chambre, salle de bain plutôt petite et ancienne. Nous avions réservé juste avant le covid et la direction de l’hôtel ne nous a pas laissé le choix du remboursement du coup nous avons du revenir dès la réouverture des frontières c’est à dire en décembre et l’hôtel nous a énormément sur facturé car haute saison bref pas très commercial tout ça.

title: Empire hotel is not worth $100 much less $350 a night
text: I went to the NYC with my mom and sister and stayed at the Empire hotel. This was deemed a 4 star hotel..it deserves 1! The lobby and front desk staff were lovely and the location is great but that’s where the compliments end. The rooms are super small and dark. The lighting was terrible. Our showers were luke warm at best the entire 3 days. The bathroom was only big enough for 1 person to enter at a time. The beds were double not queen. The air conditioner/ heater was an old unit with a dial and though we had the temperature at the lowest setting it was still really hot in the room. The blind in the room on the one window randomly fell so it was all the way down and it was so old it didn’t go back up. The furniture is all really old. One of our lamps looked like it would fall over at any minute. There is no closet space whatsoever and no drawers . The closet contained a mini fridge with a safe on top of it. We had a hairdryer that did not work. There is no coffee in the hotel at all. The gym was closed due to Covid . There was a bar and restaurant on the lobby floor that was closed. The only food available was at the rooftop bar. On our one excursion to the roof top bar one of the elevators was stopped because people were stuck in it and it took a long time for them to find someone with a key to get them out. I would obviously never stay here again and tell anyone thinking of staying to look anywhere else.

title: Amazing hospitality and welcoming front desk!
text: Not only is the Empire a beautiful hotel in an amazing location, the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Luis and Pasquale, along with William, kept smiles on their faces in the middle of a hectic holiday weekend and made us feel truly welcome. They were the best start to a magical NYC Christmas weekend!

title: Best Stay In NY
text: location Location we have all heard it but its not only the location, the staff is helpful and very accommodating. My most resented stay was just after  the Empire Hotel reopened after the COVID shutdown. Limits staff, I was still take care of like I was the only person stay at the hotel. December is a very busy time received best advice and accommodations for visiting 30rock and 5th Avenue holiday lights/displays, Great recordation's for place to eat .

title: Disgusting room, garbage on the floor
text: Disgusting. Just purely unbearable. Unbelievably dirty. Can’t believe this city keeping these places remain open and calling them hotels. Can’t believe this. Extremely dirty. Garbage on the floor. I can’t believe this. The garbage from the previous guest was witnessed at the same hotel series in Lenox. I feel like I was pushed into the very worst thing to face about the United States. Oh my God, dirty. This is just disgusting. No way.

title: Horrible Experience on Many Fronts
text: I normally don't write reviews but was so disappointed with my stay on so many different fronts that I wanted to share my experience.  My wife and I and two small kids were promised adjoining rooms.  On check-in, one was ready and the other was not.  When we came back that night, we were given a key to the second room and when we walked it -- there were animals in it (a dog and a cat) and it was disgusting.  The prior guests had not moved out and we were not notified of this in advance so we could make other arrangements.  When we told the front desk, they were not particularly helpful and it took numerous follow-up attempts before they rebooked us.  The bellman never showed up as promised to help us move our luggage so we moved it ourselves.  And calls to the front desk were repeatedly unanswered -- but would just ring in perpetuity.  For those traveling for work, the WiFi cut out repeatedly.  There are many other properties in NYC to stay at. I would advise that anyone considering this property do that.

title: Great visit
text: Fantastic location across from Lincoln Center, near Columbus Circle and Central Park. Lovely ambiance, the hotel recently reopened, and the lobby is elegant and comfy. Pasquale and the entire staff were very helpful and accommodating. We will be back

title: Disappointing stay at what could be a great hotel
text: An Instagram v reality hotel - looks great on the outside & in the lobby, but beyond that it is in need of some serious TLC. The rooms are dated & we had to call reception at 2am for assistance to get some air into the room as it was too hot & the rickety unit was shut off. The view from the room window would have been great if it was clean and the wifi was the worst I’ve used on my travels for years, making the “resort fee” all the more laughable. Furthermore, unlike any other hotel I’ve travelled to across the world, the reception at check out didn’t remind/inform me that I had to pay that “resort fee”, so I’ve just seen it pop up on my credit card bill (that card was holding card for incidentals rather than the one I would pay with given I also incurred a nice non-Sterling charge so thanks for that as well). All in all, this was not the treat I had hoped it would be for my partner. This is hotel is in a superb location and has the possibility to be great, but the fact a number of the lights are out in the Empire Hotel sign sums up how frayed it has become at the edges. A real shame.

title: Good location. Friendly staff
text:
I stayed here last weekend for a long weekend away for theater and museum visits. 

The location is great just across from Lincoln Center—just a block west from Central Park, a few blocks north of Columbus circle and at the beginning of the Upper west Side. 

I emailed ahead and they were able to accommodate an early check in when arrived early afternoon. They were training a new front desk clerk and everyone was pleasant.  Room was small but as I expected for an older NYC hotel. There was a large king bed and a view overlooking the square just north of the hotel.  As noted in other reviews the bathrooms are tiny as you’d expect in a hotel from that era—it was updated with a rain shower and shower wand attachment.  Excellent Bigelow shower products.   The room was clean—a few scuffed corners in some of the leather furniture but the furnishings and carpet were not otherwise worn. 

I stayed two nights—currently they did not have daily housekeeping but that may be covid related. There were plenty of towels in the room. One thing that would have been nice would be coffee service in the lobby.  I came down one morning to get a cup of coffee but it wasn’t a service offered. There is a Starbucks and other coffee shops near by but I was just looking for a quick cup in my pajamas. 

Overall, I’d stay here again. I like the location close the subway, park, and close to theatres but not in the tourist central Times Square.

title: No my contact on the pillow
text: Horrible. I checked in, got ready for an event (happy I showered that morning at home) and couldn’t even sleep there the night I was so grossed out. It’s as if they only care about the lobby and not where guests stay. Hope you don’t want to be able to see through the window too - it was like the scene from my cousin Vinny.

title: Terrible Value, Terrible Service
text:
Do not stay here unless you're absolutely desperate, even then, keep looking elsewhere.

Keep in mind, none of these issues would be relevant at $90/ night, but with the rates these people charge their service is disgusting. 

They have a policy not to give guests more than two bottles of water which is insane. They refuse to answer the phone if you call the front desk and are rude when you ask simple questions. 

It's incredibly frustrating to pay so much for a room so tiny that you have to step over the toilet into the tub to close the restroom door.

title: Open?
text: I can't tell whether the hotel is open or not.  I tried calling and after going through the voicemail prompts, and saying make reservation it rings and then disconnects.  ALthough one can make reservations on numerous sites, it is impossible to tell what would happen when I show up.

title: A great place to get back out to The City
text:
Recently met some friends at The Empire Hotel rooftop lounge for some food and drinks.  Great service and excellent food.  Awesome outdoor set up with tables well spaced and plenty of room.  

If you are looking for a place to go to get back to meeting family and friends, I would recommend The Empire.

title: Exceptional food and service
text: Travelling around rural Victoria with three other couples, our dinner at the Empire was an outstanding start! With some of our group subject to dietary restrictions I was amazed at how seamlessly and professionally the front of house team works with the kitchen to ensure we all had a fantastic evening! Glorious sweet chilly prawns and confit duck were my stand outs! Scott and the team do an amazing job! Thanks 🙏

title: Exceptional reception and overall service
text: Sorry for the delay in the review of my favorite NYC rest spot. I have been going to this establishment for several years and at every instant, I was always warmly received and felt like a valued patron. There may not be any room service, but with all the restaurants and coffee shops in the vicinity, who really needs it. The rooms are well-appointed and the service to refresh them on a daily basis is excellent. Check-in is rapid and friendly. The lobby is beautiful and there is a bar in the lobby and for the jet-setters, the is a wonderful rooftop lounge/bar with a spectacular view of Lincoln Center. It is overall cozy and truly comfortable. Excellent location by the way.

title: Greedy people with awful customer service
text:
Like the people in the most recent reviews, I have also been trying to get a refund for my stay that I couldn't complete because the hotel was closed.

I booked a trip in March and have been going back and forth in emails for EIGHT MONTHS trying to get my refund. Each time, I am just told that my refund request has been sent to "upper management". At this point, I hesitate to believe any management exists at this property.

It is just a run-around with no resolution. These people have probably gotten away with taking dozens, if not more, people's money... during a pandemic when people need their money the most. 

Horrible customer service, horrible policies, and most likely horrible people. I never leave bad reviews for places, but I felt like I should warn others. I have been more than patient. Again, it's been 8 months. I wish you luck if you book here.

title: Don’t book here. Horrible Customer Service.
text:
I had booked a trip here for July which got subsequently cancelled. I’ve sent the hotel countless emails which all get the same response. Refund request with ‘upper management’ Absolutely useless. 
I think in these trying times a company’s response is very indicative of what they truly think of their customers and their attitude is shocking. Constantly fobbed off and no one can be bothered to do anything. Never ever book here.

title: Terrible customer service..
text:
We received an email from the hotel reservation department in June cancelling our stay for July due to closing for COVID (understandable). The email stated we could keep the price of the stay as credit for a future stay or take a full refund.

We opted for a refund.

Since then, after countless emails over the past fifteen weeks the decision is still with "upper management" whoever this may be.

Absolutely no update on timescales other than the above reply to each email. The hotel have cancelled the stay and offered the refund, so provide the refund.

Absolutely horrendous customer service, wont be going in future out of principle. Looking online it appears there's plenty in the same boat as us.

title: Schlechter Service, keine Kommunikation (Corona)
text: Das Hotel wurde für einen 5 tägigen Aufenthalt für 4 Personen in New York gebucht und bezahlt. Da wegen des Lockdowns und dem Einreiseverbot in die USA der Urlaub nicht stattfinden konnte, haben wir das Hotel angeschrieben mit der Bitte um Rückerstattung. Trotz mehrfacher Versuche kam von dort keinerlei Antwort. Wir werden mittels eines Anwalts den gezahlten Betrag rückfordern.

title: Money not refunded even though they aren’t open.
text: We booked in February for a stay in July. With COVID our flights were cancelled and we asked for a refund for the hotel stay in March. It has been months and countless emails that just tell me they are waiting on the approval from upper management.  Literally, probably 15 emails back and forth asking for status updates and refunds. The hotel was not even open for the stay we had paid for in July!! I am very disappointed. Completely ridiculous that they will not refund our money when they weren’t even open. To me, that’s stealing... I have paid for a service and it was not given to me.

title: Favourite Hotel in NYC
text: I loved my stay at the Empire. It's in a great location, the room had everything that i needed & the staff were helpful throughout my stay. I'll 100% be going back at the first opportunity. The barman makes a great cocktail.

title: Supposed to be holiday but cancelled by hotel
text:
Don't book this hotel. Shocking Customer service. Had 6 nights booked for July 2020. They cancelled have failed to give a refund. Cant get response, being told by reservations that our request is being "referred to upper management!". Refused direct email contact to them. Wont provide complaints procedure. Diabolical. Book somewhere else for peace of mind of better customer service! 
Would have given zero circles but wasn't an option!

title: Empire Hotel
text: My daughter goes to college in Nyc . Every time we visit for the past four years we stay at the empire hotel. Great location. Right near college, Central Park , restaurants and lots of shopping.?Staff and management are fabulous. I miss nyc and our little getaways.

title: New York Place to be
text: The Empire Hotel is ideally situated for walking distance to lots of major attractions.   Central Park is virtually minutes away , the subway is also close by - and the subway allows fast transport to all areas of New York.  The rooms are reasonable sized, bed was very comfortable and the staff were available when required

title: Disappointed guest.
text:
Absolutely loved my stay here, couldn’t have picked a fault with location / hotel etc until I arrived at the airport realising
my airpods were gone from my bag.  i did not check if my airpods were in my bag as they had not been used or left my bag in the whole time i was in NYC.

I contacted the hotel and they weren’t helpful at all - airpods have been removed from Find my iPhone which after speaking to apple support means someone has them and has reset them. Extremely disappointed with the response as they were removed during my stay I would have thought the hotel may have been more helpful.

We 10000% checked everywhere in the room so they were not left at all - checked under the bed and every possible place things could’ve been left.

Very unhappy guest!

title: Custo x benefício
text:
Excelente, fomos em fev/2019 e ficamos uma semana
Foi sensacional! Do lado do Central Park e 10 min da time Square a pé.

O clima na época, era final do inverno rigoroso, mas chegamos a pegar - 15 C, mas vale a pena...

Atendimento muito bom e limpeza do quarto!

Sem reclamações, recomendo!!

title: Does the job perfectly :-)
text:
The location of this hotel is great! We went for a run every morning in central park and it was only a couple of mins to get to. We walked pretty much everywhere from the hotel. 

Our room was cosy, but that's totally to be expected in NYC, it was clean and everything functioned fine. A perfect base to explore the city from.

The doormen deserve a special mention as they were always warm and welcoming.

We found the rooftop bar a little fancy for us...but it might suit others better!

title: The best part of our trip!
text:
Amongst all the madness going on worldwide, I have to say that this hotel has continued to give ‘normal’, friendly and outstanding customer service. Tommy one of the doormen I can honestly say made my whole trip! His attitude
Was just so refreshing. Being a foreigner in NY and especially during this crisis a lot of people aren’t treating you the same as during normal periods yet our time spent with Tommy felt Asif the craziness wasn’t happening. He took us up to the Empire Hotel’s sign which unfortunately had been closed and was one of the main reasons we chose this hotel. He even took pictures of us which has been a huge challenge on this trip as no one fancy’s holding your phone! He showed us some other sites as seen on GG and just overall was lovely to speak with. Even managed to get us in the bar and have a signature “Chuck Bass” cocktail! 
He is honestly one of the hotels best assets. This is our first day here and I have to say will be one to remember- when everything returns to normality we will be back and most definitely returning to this hotel. Thankyou Tommy for making our trip that extra bit special :)

title: Accommodating Staff
text: I stayed in the hotel for a few nights before important meetings. I wanted to make sure I could sleep early and well, and the staff was extremely accommodating to make sure that I had a quiet room. I appreciate the stay and will definitely stay again.

title: great location, small rooms and bathrooms
text: The location is wonderful near Lincoln Center.  The lobby is beautiful, and staff is very helpful.   The rooms are super small and the bathrooms are even smaller.   The bathroom needed some attention with caulking and the door was warped from the moisture in the bathroom.  Otherwise, everything was great!  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Luis was great! Great stay
text: Luis was great! He made the stay great, he upgraded us to a Suite with a city view for our honeymoon thanks to Luis. The room overall was great. Good location, great waitstaff. The two head shower was a nice touch. The pool area was closed, which is where the iconic Empire Hotel sign is located. The city was great and Hotel Empire was centrally located.

title: Good stay, great service
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel before the rest of my party hadn’t. We had two rooms booked for two couples. The rooms are small but more than adequate for a city, it’s what you would expect. Bathrooms are very clean but could do with a lick of paint but I’m sure it’s in the plan. We had an issue with one of the rooms and noise which was quite loud and significantly disturbed sleep, my husband popped down to reception at 7am to see if we had any options while I was getting ready and by 710am we were moved and another quieter room arranged - never known service like it! 
Really great stay, perfect locations for walking in the city and jumping in the subway! Stayed before, would stay again - definitely recommend ! 
Thanks for a great trip!

title: First Time Visit but Won't Be Our Last
text:
Located directly across the street from Lincoln Center, the Empire Hotel is a charming, friendly, convenient hotel in the thick of NYC. We were greeted immediately as we drove up, given quick directions to check-in while receiving our pickup ticket for Valet Parking. At check-in, Luis welcomed us, thanked us for coming and asked the reason for our visit. When I explained we were there to see our son's performance at the Met Opera (his first) we we congratulated and he said he'd upgrade us and gave us a room overlooking Lincoln Center Plaza.

Everyone from Bellman to Maid service were friendly and professional. 

We will certainly return!

title: Worst hotel
text: Very rude staff Small rooms they don’t face anything nice you just look at a wall overpriced breakfast management that can’t call you back or do their job worst hotel I’ve ever stayed or will never be going back to this hotel ever again they should not call at the Empire Hotel that’s an insult to the USA

title: Good price and right out front of The Metropolitan Opera House
text: Hotel is dated and in need of an upgrade, but it is not bad overall. Doormen are so friendly and helpful. Best place to stay if you are going to the opera, it's virtually across the street from the front doors.

title: Bien placé, service de qualité
text: À 2 pas de Central Park et de columbus square, donc de plusieurs lignes de métro permettant de se rendre dans tous les quartiers de NY, cet hôtel est extrêmement bien situé. Les chambres sont spacieuses et le ménage est bien fait quotidiennement. En revanche il y a du bruit, à cause de la rue et d'un fenêtrage d'un autre âge. Ne pas oublier ses protections auditives. Le Wifi était faiblard et très rapidement à ma demande, a été très sensiblement amélioré. Le petit petit déjeuner au dernier étage est assez satisfaisant. Restaurant non testé. Le roof-top offre une vue agréable mais n'est pas vraiment un plus. En effet la piscine est minuscule et n'est plus exploitable sereinement au-delà de 4 personnes, ce qui arrive quasiment systématiquement. Bilan positif, rapport qualite/prix correct. Je recommande.

title: Upgrade
text: I have stayed here before, and enjoyed it so I decided to book again. My original room was small which would normally be fine, but I'm staying for a week. Randy at the front desk was very polite, helpful, and even upgraded my room for free.

title: Excellence at every turn
text:
First, Jeffrey, at the front desk is amazing.  He remembered my favorite room and asked if I could wait about 15 minutes for it to be pre-paired.  Sure, I'll go to the bar and the bartender was very friendly and we chatted about jazz.  Jeffrey came by with a card for a free drink and true to his word, my room was ready.
I love this room because it has a view of the Lincoln Center Plaza, fountains and all.  The room is across the street from many restaurants and of course LC.
The bellman has, in the past, retrieved  items that I had left in the room and always greets me with a smile.

title: Pésima elección
text:
Lo único verdaderamente rescatable de este hotel es su ubicación, muy cerca de Central Park y a escasos metros de la estación de metro. También diría que el personal de recepción lo intenta, hace un esfuerzo extraordinario por tratar de cubrir los problemas que genera un deficiente mantenimiento y la decepción que se experimenta al pagar una tarifa excesiva para el tamaño y estado del cuarto y para los servicios que se le proporcionan al cliente.
El verdaderamente DIMINUTO baño de nuestra habitación no contaba con agua caliente, tuvimos que bañarnos con agua fría para no perder un tour que ya teníamos pagado ese día, dimos aviso a recepción y prometieron arreglarlo. Por la noche, efectivamente el agua caliente salía, pero salpicaba todos los rincones del baño y no habían hecho la habitación. Nos cambiaron de cuarto. Al siguiente día, nuevamente nos encontramos con una habitación que no habían limpiado para las 4 pm. Se atascó la puerta del baño, los muebles viejos y descuidados. Te reciben con un "pase a recepción por botellas de agua cuantas veces quiera" y en las noches la excusa es "aún no me las han resurtido". MAL MAL MAL. Cero recomendable.

title: Trés moyen
text: L'hôtel est très bien situé, proche de central park, des métros et bus. Bon quartier. La chambre est de taille correcte. Chauffage difficile à régler qui fait un bruit de soufflerie toute la nuit. Importants problèmes d'eau chaude dans la douche. Bouton de l'ascenceur du 5e étage qui fait des étincelles bleues ! Trés mauvaise communication entre le service Security et la réception. Incapacité à me dire que le sac de ma fille (avec son passeport) avaient été rapportés par le chauffeur de taxi. 4 jours se sont écoulés avant que je l'apprenne part la compagnie de taxi. Pourtant il n'y avait pas affluence mi février dans cet hôtel qui n'a pas voulu reconnaitre son erreur de communication interne.

title: Overall positive feeling
text:
Hundred meters from Central Park South
A little bit more than 1km from Times Square
Swimming pool closed during our stay (winter period)
Breakfast very good but a little bit expensive
Perfect welcome by the personnel
Perfect property

title: Our experience at the Empire Hotel
text: We were in town for a wedding. The staff was wonderful, our housekeeping did a fabulous job. I was very happy with everything and plan on coming back! We had so much fun. The food in the rooftop was delicious. A little pricey though. But it was very good. The hotel bar made the drinks perfectly. It was a wonderful experience and I look forward to coming back soon.

title: Great hotel and location
text: Wonderful hotel - standard queen room is quite small, but that's par for NYC.  Comfortable bed, amenities, very nice and courteous staff. Being in same hotel as the beautiful rooftop lounge/restaurant was a bonus.

title: Girls Weekend
text: This hotel is in a great location, very convenient to get to many places in the city. The lobby is beautiful! The room was a good size, had a jr. suite with two beds and a sitting area. The furnishings were a bit worn and some things broken, the bathroom wasn't very clean (especially the bathroom door which is a frosted glass that was filthy). The front desk staff was less than friendly and not very welcoming, just seemed bothered at any interaction. Not sure that I would stay again, with a little effort on customer service, cleanliness and updates to room furnishings.

title: Convenience to Lincoln Center Unbeatable
text: If you are traveling to New York to attend concerts at Lincoln Center, the location of the Empire is unbeatable. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Rooms are a little small, but not unexpected for New York. Overall a great value.

title: Home away from Home is the The Empire Hotel
text: In my opinion , one of the BEST hotels in the City.  Location is perfect, entire staff is perfect, room is very comfortable! I LOVE this hotel - always consistent with service, value, and welcoming feeling.

title: Great room for the price!
text: Excellent view of Lincoln square,  great location, (we walked to everything, in the rain-just take a taxi), great restaurants across the street, (Fiorello and Smith), excellent  service and friendly staff;  clean, comfy room!!!!! We had a blast!

title: The Empire Hotel is Convenient and Comfortable
text: If you are going to the Met, the Empire Hotel is across the street from Lincoln Center.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable.  There are a variety of good restaurants close by.

title: 2 steps from Lincoln Center
text: The Empire Hotel's rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished, despite the fact that the building is old.  They have done a wonderful job of modernizing the lobby with a great bar and the restaurant/lounge on the rooftop offers a great view of the city.  The bathrooms are a little small but you have everything you need and the shower is wonderful!  The staff is very accommodating and I was checked in by Jeffrey, who is polite, friendly, very helpful and remembered me from prior visits.  I was in room 1016 with a great view of Lincoln Center, one of my favorite parts of the city.

title: Fine stay, nice location.
text: It was pleasant stay in this hotel.  The room was clean but there is no bathroom fan, which is strange. You have to open the bathroom door to be the steam out. Otherwise, it’s good hotel. Liked the bottle water service a lot.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
Perfect location near Columbus Circle. Close to many restaurants. Has a bar on site. Parking is off site about 2 min walk away. Clean, good bathroom. Bed was very uncomfortable. Honestly will likely stay here again.

Only issue was I couldn't get in touch with front desk before the trip and I called about 8 separate occasions.

title: 3 day break in the big apple
text: First time travelling to America and it was the most incredible experience.  We were amazed at how we were looked after by the native Americans.  The city itself was astonishing, so fast paced but you can fit in very easily.

title: Awesome Front Desk
text: I had a meeting at the ABC building in NYC and chose this hotel based on reviews and proximity.  Location was great - right next to the Lincoln Center and quick walk to restaurants and the ABC building.  Check-in was smooth.  I was given a room on the 11th floor (their top floor).  Upon walking into the room, I noticed it was hot and stuffy.  The thermostat wasn't working so I called down to the front desk.  They sent up an engineer, who wasn't able to fix the problem.  He let the front desk know I wanted to change rooms.  Luis from the front desk called me right away, was super nice, asked if I needed any help with my luggage, and asked me to come down to get a new room assignment.  He explained that the 11th floor does get a little warm.  He was about to assign me a room on a lower level, but when I mentioned the great view from the 11th floor he had another idea.  He actually upgraded me to an amazing room on the 11th floor.  The new room was amazing - living room, 2 bathrooms, bar, etc...   Truthfully, it was still a little warm, but not nearly as warm as the first room.  Unfortunately, I am a light sleeper and there was a lot of noise coming from above (the rooftop bar??) so I didn't get a great night's sleep.  But that's not really the hotel's fault.  In the end, I would recommend this hotel.  However, if you like your room on the cooler side, I would request a lower floor.  And again, special shout-out to Luis, who went out of his way to make sure I had a good experience.

title: Great Stay
text: I checked in and got a upgrade ,deff a plus. Front desk staff was very helpful always had answers for my questions and needs. Rohan stood out to me always having food options and solutions, my room was not serviced for a day and I did not leave the DND sign on door but Rohan ensured I got fresh towels and toiletry replacement. Bell staff Denise was amazing friendly and welcoming also. Would stay again.

title: Empire Hotel
text: A very well located hotel, clean, with friendly helpful staff. It's starting to show its age in places and a refurb would be welcome. However, it is clean and housekeeping good. A great location just off Columbus Circle and the No1 subway line. We would stay again.

title: Lovely hotel with a great location!
text: Such a lovely hotel with very helpful and initiative staff. We had booked a triple room for 3 adults but the first room we was in wasn't even big enough for 1 there was no room to put clothes a tiny hole to put a few clothes also no where to put any suitcases... especially because all three of us had taken large suitcases with us as we were due to stay in the hotel for a week. So originally we were very disappointed with the room because it was lacking in space for general living space! Also being three adults we were happy with two double beds but when we entered the room we then realised that the double beds are small double beds... which we were not aware of as the website does not specify, so if you are planning on sharing a bed in a triple room DONT, as the beds were basically a large single! As we were unhappy with our room due to the lack of space we headed down to reception just to ask if they had any other rooms available that were bigger as we didn't have anywhere to put anything let alone being able to even open our suitcases in the room. The receptionist Louis was very helpful and kind, he managed to transfer us to a bigger room as he explained that we were there for my daughters 21st and he wanted to make it as special as possible for us, he also did not charge us for the upgrade do to agreeing that our particular room could not fit 3 adults in comfortably. Our new room we were transferred to was a lot more spacious and actually had a walk in wardrobe to put our clothes in and to store our suitcases in! So that we didn't have to leave them on the floor and potentially trip over them! This is the type of room you should stay in if there is more than 2 of you or you actually want space to put your items, the only thing about the bigger room was that the beds were yet again a 'small double'/'large single' which is not ideal if you have to share... apparently all those rooms had the same size beds which isn't great especially as there is room to put a larger bed. But apart from the room drama the hotel was amazing the staff are very helpful and friendly! From letting them use the reception phone to call out or giving you directions round NY or hailing you a cab they were just great! If you stay at The Empire Hotel you need to check out the rooftop bar and restaurant the breakfast is great and the views up there are just amazing, you could sit up there all day just watching New York fly by!!! Overall The Empire Hotel was great and would recommend

title: Great employees at The Empire Hotel
text:
It takes more than location, nice beds and a reasonable price to make a great hotel. It takes a friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff. The Empire has it all !!
At the front door you are greeted by Eugene, Brian, Denis, Chris, Denise, Naz, Jose, Brendan (Depending on the hour and the day). At the front desk Maggie relieves any concern that this will be a wonderful stay. She is warm, experienced and even if she is overwhelmed with customers she makes you feel that you are the only one. guest.

title: Reasonable stay
text:
On arrival we were early so rooms were not ready, however they offered to upgrade our room for free if we wanted to have separate rooms rather than interlocking which was fine as these were ready. Room was OK but needed a bit of updating, especially the bathroom. The main issues were the noise from the road outside and the cold due to poor windows. We had to have the heating on most of the time which made just as much noise as the beeping horns and sirens. We were on the fourth floor. However room was clean and comfortable beds and the staff were polite and helpful.
Hotel was in a great location, 5 minutes from central park and 20 minute walk to times square. 
Beware of the residence tax before booking as this is an extra £25 per room/night. This had been included in our holiday booking but basically for us this paid for 2 small bottles of water a day. Ensure to check their website for details of this.

title: Gross
text: We arrived late to our room after a night out. I have stayed here numerous times so this last visit was a surprise how dirty our room was. I didn’t notice until the next morning when I was in the bathroom. The bathroom door was grimy with finger prints all over it an some kind of spillage on the bottom of the door, the cabinets didn’t look like they had ever been wiped down,but the truly disgusting thing was the toilet seat lid. RealIy really grimy! I sent  a letter to the hotel manager, and to her credit, she called our room right aware and assured me everything would be taken care of right away. When we returned to our room there was a hand written note with an apology and some treats. But the room was still dirty.the bottom of the door had been cleaned. Dirty fingerprints still on the door and toilet seat still disgusting. That will be my last stay there ever.

title: Affordable, but nothing special
text:
The location of the hotel is perfect. It's close to shops and restaurants, a few blocks from subway station and a pleasant walk from Times Square. Hotel lobby is charming and check-in was quick and easy. Rooms are safe and clean, however too small and dated.
The main problem during our stay were low outside temperatures that weren't compensated by proper heating. The air-conditioning was actualling cooling our room which meant I has to sleep in jumper and socks to stay warm.

title: Weekend getaway
text: Great location. Close to subway lines. Staff was extremely helpful. We arrived early and we were  able to check in and even got a room upgrade. Rooftop lounge has great drinks and views of the city. Would stay again

title: Unique location, steps from Lincoln Center
text: A renovated older property with friendly management, large rooms for NYC, many nearby restaurants -- and Lincoln Center across the street.  Comfortable, not luxurious.  Close to subways, Central Park, museums.  Rosa Mexicano, around the corner, is an outstanding Mexican restaurant.  Many more on 9th Ave.

title: Lovely hotel, great location
text: Lovely big rooms with comfortable beds, slightly noisy from the corridors however. Staff were very friendly though, certainly felt at home here. The rooftop bar was beautiful, but unfortunately we weren’t able to access the terrace the two times we tried due to private events. Overall I had a great time at the hotel and will definitely stay here again!

title: fairly priced
text: decent size room and a good location. The bathroom was very small but the shower worked well; bed was comfortable; staff offered waters to couple next to us checking in but not us-- I had to ask for water. I did not like that first impression.

title: Good NYC Hotel I would stay again
text: this was a good choice for one night. It was close to were i needed to go. The hotel was clean and everyone was friendly. Restaurants and Bakery are nearby as well as Lincoln Center. My only complaint is no in room coffee maker and no USB ports.

title: Linen
text:
I have stayed at hotels across the world and this is the first time I have ever had a room that doesn't offer top sheets on the bed unless requested. Not informed of this when I checked in. 

Absurd and a cheap way to save a few bucks. 

First and last time in this property.

title: Fab location - great hotel!
text: We recently stayed in The Empire Hotel on a 4 night stay in New York. I was a bit dubious after reading mixed reviews but I can honestly say I can’t fault the hotel. From the helpful lobby staff to the room service, we had an amazing stay. The rooms are generous in size and the beds are amazingly comfy - perfect after a full day of site seeing. The location is perfect, situated only a 1 minute walk from Central Park and you can easily walk into Timesquare in about 15 mins or jump on the underground. As some other reviews state, it can be quite noisy at times with the traffic but where isn’t in New York! The noise didn’t stop us from sleeping or enjoying our stay. Ignore the poor reviews, we loved it and would definitely be recommending to friends and family planning their trips to New York! Thank you for a fabulous stay.

title: Nice but noisy
text:
The Empire Hotel is beautiful hotel. The designer boutique style hotel is located in the heart of Lincoln Center. If you like classical music, ballet, opera and art cinema-Lincoln Center is the place for you and your family. Just a short walk over to Central Park and some great restaurants in the area. 
If you are a light sleeper I  don’t recommend this hotel.
The windows in the hotel are outdated and you can hear everything outside.

title: Quick family trip
text: Nice overall. We were in a very small room when told it was a deluxe superior. I think they messed up because when we extended a third night, our room we were moved to was much bigger, similar price. They are not the most kid friendly. Overall we had a great visit with family. Very close to Central Park and great site seeing!

title: Great location....
text: Nice hotel, good location.  Small room. No coffee in room. High priced. No frills. Nothing to really write home about.  I would not stay here again.  Basic, basic, basic...too much money for nothing special.

title: Nel centro di Manhattan , gentilezza italiana
text: Ottima la posizione, tra Central Park, l' Opera, Broadway, la V strada, tutte da visitare a piedi, e nella vicinanza a metro e bus. Struttura accogliente, servizio efficiente, Pasquale alla concierge una sicurezza per noi italiani, gentile e competente.

title: Highly recommended
text: Perfect spot, excellent service, clean and comfortable room. I highly recommend this hotel for a weekend. The staff is very friendly, especially the receptionists. Close to many metro/bus stations. Thanks!

title: Great central location
text: Great hotel in a lovely and convenient location—one block from Central Park, on train line, long but doable walk to Broadway shows, and right next to opera and symphony. Room was clean and quiet. No view but we only slept and showered there. Will definitely stay again.

title: Amazing Views, location, and staff
text: Our room had the most amazing view and the staff was always so kind and helpful. The location was perfect and the hotel was so easy to spot from far away! We will most definitely be back to Empire Hotel.

title: Old and hot hotel
text: First room was 85 degrees. Maintenance came in at 3am to fix it and said they couldn't. Second night we were moved to another room. Loud loud loud clicking noises all night! We called the front desk and told them and they were like "yeah this is just an old building it makes loud noises at night" THANKS FOR NOTHING

title: Super recommend this hotel!
text: The hotel is located in a good spot in New York. Really easy to go everywhere. It close to Central Park and subway. There are a bar in the hotel near the front deck and Starbucks next to the hotel. Classy decoration and nice staff!

title: Empire stay
text: I always love staying at the Empire but the hotel rooms are tired.  Bathrooms are super small and I dislike a shower curtain.  Other than that, I still love staying there bc the people are so nice and the location is wonderful.

title: Great Value and location
text: Small but cozy place in Upper West Side. I was there for Westminster so it was conveniently located and the online price was pretty good. I went in with pretty low expectations as I had never stayed there. I was please to be greeted (and helped throughout the stay) by very friendly door staff and very accommodating desk staff. The lobby was very warm and relaxing. Almost  a throwback to another time. I ended up with a king room with a view of a small park and Lincoln Center. Although it was on the "first floor" (not lobby level)  I noticed very little outside noise. The carpet and wall paprer were kind of interesting choices but very boutique hotel type. I thought it was different but cool. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable but low to the ground, as were the chair and desk. The room was small but I think that's a NYC thing, although it was bigger than the Doubletree that I also stayed in. The bathroom was extremely small but clean and efficient use of the little space It did the job. They have a super cool roof level bar. Definitely not a place for a cheap drink but apparently very popular. Over all a great stay.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Door man was friendly and helpful as was all staff.   The lobby is welcoming and contemporary and a great place to hangout.   The room was clean and inviting with a small desk for work and a very comfy bed.   My room faced the main street and it did get a bit noisy late at night and early in the morning - primarily taxi/traffic noises and horns blowing.  Additionally, the room needed a couple more easily asseible outlets for plugging in electonic devices.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: Excellent hotel!  We have stayed here many times.  The staff was very accommodating to our needs and we love the trendy decor. Super cool vibe!!! We also think the area is the best place to stay in the whole city.  We will be back!!!

title: At least the location is good. . . .
text: We booked this hotel for its proximity to Lincoln Center, and it did have that in its favor, but that was the only thing.  The heating unit in our first room was so noisy that we could hardly hear ourselves.  We went to the front desk and had to persuade the person there to give us another room.  In that one, the heating unit made a clanking noise that kept up awake at night.  We also asked the front desk person where to buy a bottle of wine and were sent on a wild goose chase down Columbus Ave.

title: Poor customer service, security issues
text: I booked my room and paid in full online, all fees included according to the contract, but was charged an additional resort fee.  When I inquired about the additional charge, the manager was rude and dismissive and offered no explanation.  Also, hotel staff entered my room unexpectedly, without knocking, while I was in it .  I had not called for any sort of room service.

title: Great stay
text: Great place to stay.  Wonderful location, close to many wonderful attractions, plus great service and reasonable price.  Staff was helpful and friendly.  Will stay there from now on whenever we go to NYC.

title: Great hotel in a great area
text:
Location simply cannot be beat. Steps
 ( literally) from Lincoln center. Uptown, downtown, crosstown busses and subway within a block. And 6 restaurants, grocery, takeout, Duane Reade and Starbucks all right there. Why am I telling you this? All the rooms will probably be booked for my next visit!

title: Will never stay anywhere else
text: Best hotel in NYC - great value, location, staff is second to none - all around great experience time after time!! Easy access to all the great experiences in the city, Lincoln Center, Fordham University, the restaurants are fabulous and easy to get to, let alone the access to Broadway.  Again - I will always stay at the Empire!

title: Love this hotel, very clean and comfortable!! Have stayed here many times.
text: Love this hotel, very clean and comfortable. The rooftop bar and views are great. I love the location as it’s near Fordham University. Excellent restaurants near here. Hotel staff make you feel welcome. Bathrooms can be small but that is expected in New York City.

title: At least I could see Lincoln Center
text: I was in New York on business and the closest hotel to the venue at which I was working was The Empire. The place is nice and my checkin went smoothly. I slept pretty well. I woke up and went to the gym located within the hotel. Half the weights were missing and the treadmill kept getting stuck. This may seem inconsequential for most however I travel quite a bit for work and book conditionally on the fact that there is a gym on the premises so I can maintain a modicum of normalcy while traveling. So when the equipment was not so great, I was a bit displeased. However I kept up my optimism because I figured it wasn't all bad. Then I got to my room, and decided it was time for a good old fashioned shower. That idea quickly fell flat because the shower head was busted. It did dispense some water, but however it was remarkably slow. I packed my things quickly and made my way out of the hotel.

title: Excellent!
text: Overall my stay at Empire Hotel was excellent. The staff was great and the rooms were wonderful! The hotel is located in a great location. It was very easy getting to our destinations. The staff exceeded my expectations.

title: Helt ok!
text:
Vi valgte The Empire Hotel i hovedsak pga historien med Gossip Girl. Det ligger sentralt mtp subway, Lincoln Center ect. Restauranter og frokostbarer i nærområdet. 
Rooftop bar var helt ok, dyre cocktails. 
Selve lobbyen var oversiktlig, ryddig og godt atmosfære. Vi hadde rom i 5.etg mot Lincoln center. Mye trafikk utenfor hotellet, men man merket veldig lite til det om natten. Vi hadde bestilt deluxe room, som var ok. Litt trangt i inngangen av rommet, sengene var ok mens badet var litt lite. Funket greit, men lite. Overkommelig pris

title: Hotel in sehr guter Lage
text:
Wir haben uns aufgrund der Lage für diese Hotel entschieden. Man ist in kürzester Zeit am Columbus Circle und viele Sehenswürdigkeiten sind auch zu Fuß zu erreichen (Central Park, Times Square, Museen...). Das Personal war stets freundlich und bemüht und kleine Probleme (Dusche, WC) wurden umgehend behoben. Unser Zimmer bot einen Blick auf die Straße, war immer sehr sauber und wir haben uns wohl gefühlt. Leider ist das Badezimmer unlogisch angeordnet, das hätte man auch bei dieser "Größe" besser machen können. Die Dusche hat uns einige Nerven gekosten, da der bewegliche Duschkopf nie richtig gehalten hat und man zwar die Wassertemperatur, nicht aber die Stärke des Wasserstrahls einstellen konnte. Die Klimaanlage ist wirklich sehr laut. Zum Glück war es Feber und draußen kalt, sodass wir sie nur selten in Betrieb genommen haben. Straßenlärm gehört zu NY wahrscheinlich dazu. Wir waren aber meistens so müde, dass wir trotzdem immer sehr gut geschlafen haben.
Der Fitnessraum ist gut ausgestattet, allerdings wäre etwas Musik nicht schlecht.
Gegessen haben wir immer außerhalb des Hotels. Frühstück gibt es gleich beim Stand um die Ecke super lecker und günstig (wer braucht da Starbucks?) und bei Melissas Deli (ebenfalls ganz in der Nähe) haben wir uns öfters ein Mittag- oder Abendessen einpacken lassen.
Wir finden, dass das Empire Hotel jedenfalls Charme besitzt und empfehlen es weiter.

title: Bra hotell !
text:
Bra hotell med veldig fin beliggenhet. Kort vei til alt, inkl. Subway stasjonene Columbus Circle og Lincoln Center. Eiendomsprisene i dette
 området er svært høye, men en gulvflate på badet som er under 1 kvadrat, det er spesielt. Anbefaler frokost på Fluffys, ut døren til venstre og venstre igjen.. Etter noen hundre meter er du der.

title: Helpful staff. Great locations
text: The Empire Hotel is in an excellent location to walk to all sorts of venues and restaurants.  It is right across the street from Lincoln Center.  When we arrived, our room reservation had a problem due to a booking company's error, but Pasquale not only took care of the mistake but gave us an upgrade to a corner room with views of Lincoln Center and streets leading uptown.  We walked to our evening comedy show and to a fabulous restaurant, again just a couple blocks from the hotel.  We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: The best location
text: On the upper west side overlooking Lincoln Center.  One block from Central Park.  Near lots of restaurants and subways.  Very clean and efficient.  More like a European hotel.  Small bathroom.  We got a great deal.  Nice rooftop lounge and nice lobby bar.  Starbucks on the corner.  Great place for visiting NYC.

title: Average
text:
Uncomfortable bed
Fitness room needs to be updated drastically. It was atrocious. Outdated equipment!
Utilize the space on the roof top with such a glamorous view. It would be perfect for a fitness center!

title: Nice place.  GREAT location!
text: The staff was, for the most part, friendly and helpful.  Lovely rooftop breakfast.  Location is awesome - right across the street from Lincoln Center.  Very handy for arrival and departure via LaGuardia.  I recommend the bigger rooms.

title: Like being at home only better
text: I stay often at the Empire when I travel for business.  The staff is excellent. The room comfortable and the neighborhood is wonderful.  I stay there weekly and it is like being at home.  Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Empire Hotel Awesome
text:
This was a great find. We have stayed all over NYC and always appreciate a big beautiful room, great shower, beautiful lobby/bar and of course the amazing roof top bar. Lincoln Center views ;))
The staff was very friendly as this was a last minute decision. 
Downstairs there was one of our fav restaurants, PJ Clark’s and we got take out from The Smith across the street. 
Highly recommend The Empire Hotel !

title: Good but needs attention to details
text:
Positives - great shower! There’s nothing worse than a bad shower in a hotel, it’s not the case here!
Great location, Comfortable bed, pleasant view, friendly and helpful staff.
Negatives - front of hotel has scaffolding, walls of rooms are not sound proofed, you can hear too much from the room next door. Some tired looking details need updating.
I’ll mention this on every post...I booked through my Chase Reserve and always get a room next to the elevator! Why?
Overall a good experience, great location and would consider again.

title: Great hotel in a very convenient location!
text: Nice hotel right across the street from Lincoln Center.  Excellent restaurants nearby and easy access to the subway.  Very friendly and helpful staff. You can also park overnight right under Lincoln Center.  Room was spacious for NYC and the bed was very comfortable.  Powerful shower also!  Only issue was that the heat was a bit challenging to adjust. Overall, it was a great place to stay.

title: Excellent hotel with a few easily fixable issues
text:
Pros:Excellent location, excellent service, excellent valet, excellent housekeeping, excellent engineering, excellent hotel lobby bar and rooftop lounge, rooms facing courtyard very quiet despite no view
Cons:none of the handicapped rooms have comfortable beds - avoid if possible, be mindful of step-up to shower stall in regular rooms, towels need fabric softener

title: Great location
text: Yes, the rooms are small, but it's New York. And what are you doing in your room anyway, besides sleeping and using the restroom? There is no coffee maker in the standard room, but we discovered that if you call the front desk, they'll bring up an electric tea kettle, cups, and tea. We loved the location, as it was close to where we needed to be. This was our second time there, and we will definitely stay again!

title: Great Stay
text: Great experience during our 4 day stay at the Empire for my wife's birthday.  Friendly, helpful staff with modern amenities.  Restaurant and bar were both well maintained.  Slow WiFi however a small issue in the overall stay.

title: Average Stay
text:
I am a long time customer.

 The room I got needs an upgrade although it has a great view. The bed was uncomfortable and felt old and the carpet needs to changed and upgraded. I was too tired to request a change and it was late. Needs refreshing and an upgrade. Too dark.

The staff at the front desk are great.

title: Good and comfortable but many improvements needed.
text:
The bed was comfortable and room was nice. However, there is the need to improve many things. 
1- TV was badly placed. If two people were in the room, the person on the left side of the bed would not be able to properly see the TV. Specially, with the curtains open. 
2- Air conditioning was very loud. No matter which level it was, the air was just making too much noise. 
3- Toilet seat was not attached to the floor. When you sit, the seat will tilt and make noise.
4- Windows were not very sound proof and I was on the 10th floor.
5- The dresser's top drawer did not close. You close it and it would very slowly reopen and stay like that.

On the good side, the bed was very good. The personal health products were also good and many. Towels and sheets were good and except for the points above, all was fine.

title: Wonderful stay at Empire!
text: It is nice to know that there are still places in Manhattan that make you feel safe and at home (away from home). The location is super. Right next to Lincoln Center, Equinox and a long list of entertainment, Including transportation. Highly recommended! A shout out to Frank the bartender and Jeffery at the front desk!

title: Excellent value and location, location, location!
text: Great value for a fantastic location right next to Lincoln Center.  Beds are perfect and rooms are neat and unique. The staff is friendly and very helpful.  Surrounded by great restaurants and walking distance from many more.

title: Excellent value for the price
text: This was the third I have stayed at the Empire Hotel.  The location is ideal and the rooms are comfortable and excellent value for the price. The staff is also very friendly and helpful.  I will definitely return to the Empire on my next visit to New York. Highly recommended!,

title: Our go to...
text: This is our go to when we need a night away. Convenient, clean and a good breakfast. Wish there was a mini bar in the room and room service. Overall, it’s worth it during off peak days. We’ll definitely return.

title: Excellent staff
text: We have stayed at the Empire hotel a few times and have always enjoyed our time. This time was was no different, however we interacted with the staff a bit more. Daniel was wonderful at the front desks when we asked to change our room to a larger option as there were 4 of us. We upgraded for a very reasonable cost to a corner suite. Very roomy and totally comfortable. Leilani one of the managers, checked in that all was good with our room. All staff was kind, pleasant to deal with and made us feel like we were home. We are New Yorkers and live out of state now so anytime we can feel like we’re back at home in the city, we are very happy! Thank you Leilani, Daniel and the entire staff at “The Empire” we will see you soon again !

title: Four night break
text: Visited here with family over three rooms. All staff were courteous friendly and helpful if needed. Rooftop bar only visited once but was lovely area. Location is good away from hustle and bustle of other areas of nyc and near good restaurants for breakfast and dinner if needed. Our room that we were sharing was particularly small and dark , nowhere to store cases and one very small high rail for clothes that could not reach. The bathroom is in major need of a refurb as is showing lot of wear and tear. Overall a clean hotel, lovely staff and great location .

title: We love this hotel!
text: This is a great hotel!  We love the location and the rooftop restaurant/bar!  It’s clean and comfortable with a great staff!  The lobby is super cool-looking too.   We love the proximity to some great restaurants and attractions and will definitely stay here again!

title: Wonderful stay!
text: We had a terrific experience at The Empire Hotel while visiting NY with our two children. The room was well appointed and had everything we needed for our stay. We appreciated the price point and the excellent service we had from everyone we interacted with. Be sure to visit the rooftop bar at sunset and then cap off the night at the lobby bar! You cannot beat this location for easy access to the Subway line to the Battery, theater district, and museums. Walk across the street to Lincoln Center and have great food at nearby restaurants and bakeries.

title: Excellent value and exceptional service
text: This is a very well run and staffed hotel in a perfect location.  My room was ample, pristine, and modestly priced.  I can't say enough about the helpfulness of the staff, from the doormen to the desk to housekeeping.  Many thanks.

title: Will stay again for sure
text: Clean, spacious rooms, very friendly staff and great location in the city.  From the valet, to guest check in, to the housekeeping staff, all extremely very polite, helpful and beyond friendly. I highly recommend this property!

title: Deserves way more credit than it gets!!!
text: Me and my girlfriend visited in January and it was absolutely brilliant. The staff are brilliant, especially the front desk staff and doorman. Hotel rooms were very tidy and could not find a single thing to complain about. Already looking to book our next trip! Location is extremely exceptional!

title: Perfect location
text: We had a great stay as we were in town for the opera and the ballet. The hotel is steps from Lincoln Center. Great restaurants and Starbucks are nearby. Central Park is a short walk. We will definitely be back.

title: Great Location for Lincoln Center
text:
I booked this place specifically to be near the Lincoln Center as we had tickets to the opera and were going to be in formal wear.  It's excellent for being right across the street.

The lobby was beautiful, the front desk was very efficient checking us in and the room was nicely appointed and clean.  The front door staff (bell hop) were very friendly and helpful getting us both unloaded and loaded coming and going.

Yes, the room was typical New York small but for the price and location, I thought it was a great deal. The rooftop bar was pretty cool but too loud at night so we decided on going to the lobby bar instead.  Good service and nice craft cocktails.

As mentioned in other reviews, there was no ice machine so we had to request from the front desk but no big deal and it was delivered timely.

To get anywhere by subway, the 66th Street Lincoln Center station was pretty close but a short walk to the 59th Street Columbus Circle station eliminated having to transfer sometimes.

title: Excellent hotel. Pricey, but worth it to us.
text: Convenient to Lincoln Center, good restaurants & subway. Worth the price to us to be able to walk to Lincoln Center.  All rooms are noisy (it is New York, after all).  Rooms on the inside are quieter than on the outside.

title: Great location
text: This hotel was a great location. We enjoyed the short walk to Central Park and shopping. The rooms are rather small so we got a king suite which was great. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was clean and quiet.

title: Great spot
text: Ideal location to get around NYC with access to the subway taxis or walk to without being in the full on hustle and bustle of being nearer to times square. Highly recommend. Will be going back and possibly stay here again

title: Hotel is lovely... but rooms are poor!
text:
Visited here late January... hotel reception it lovely, staff are very friendly, which is a big shock as everyone in NY are rude! But every staff member we spoken to was so nice! 5 minute walk from central park, 15 minute walk to time square! So great location, they also have a roof top bar which was very nice but expensive, HOWEVER the rooms are VERY POOR! , so small no where to store any clothes, dated heating system blows out cold air for 5 minutes and then blows out cold, bathrooms are tiny and not very clean, although the shower is very powerful that was probably the only good thing about the room, and also the hall ways are very dated, i feel like all the money they have they have put into the lobby and roof top, looks like two completely different hotels 

Wouldnt stay here again!

title: Only if you get a good deal
text:
This hotel is in a great location and the staff is very helpful. I was, however, unprepared for how ugly the room was! Perhaps they have better rooms but mine was on a lower floor and it was very dark. The furniture was quite tasteless. There was only one lamp in the room (by the bed) so if you wanted to work at the desk you couldn't.  There was a large TV but no remote control!  I am glad I didn't pay too much for this room.  It was so depressing that I decided to brave the snow storm on my check-out day rather than spending one more night in that room.
You may want to hire their photographer, though.  They did a great job with the photos of the rooms!

title: Décevant
text:
2.5/5 étoiles

Pour un séjour de 3 jours à NYC, c’était un petit hôtel correct sans plus.

Très mal insonorisé, nous entendions le va-et-vient des gens qui séjournaient également sur l’étage. Malheureusement, nous avions des voisins de chambre fort fêtards et très peu respectueux des lieux. Des gens qui hurlent à 2am...

Eau chaude et pression de douche quasi-inexistante.

Taxes surprises chargées sur la carte de crédit au retour à la maison, sans explications...

title: Lovely Hotel Steps from Lincoln Center (Upper West Side)
text: We stayed here for a night after an opera at Lincoln Center. This hotel was quiet and clean and decorated quite nicely.  There is a lovely lobby that you can wait or relax in (also a lobby bar). We got a slightly early check-in with no problem. The staff was attentive and efficient. This hotel is very close to many good dining options at several price points. We enjoyed our short stay and are definitely putting the Empire Hotel on our list of good NYC hotel options.   (One caveat: no in-room coffee, but there is a coffeeshop--Starbucks--around the corner)

title: Disappointed because the pictures on the website wasn't what I saw when I got there
text: Well my girlfriend and I decided to stay at the empire hotel in Manhattan but before we decided to stay she showed me pictures of the hotel and it looked amazing the colors were bright and beautiful i told her i didnt want to stay at  a place where the colors were dark and dull so the empire was definitely not that from the pictures that I saw and it looked updated and the rooms looked modern  and well kept so before we got to the hotel my girlfriend called to ask if we can check in early our check in time wasn't until 3pm they said that they couldn't tell us over the phone we would have to go to the hotel so we drove from Jersey to Manhattan only to find out that we have to wait for an hour and half to check in so we sat around because we had no where to go and nodded off because we both were tired from working the night before so I went back to the concierge to ask her can we check in now she said the room that we ask for isnt ready yet but they have a room on the 2nd floor at the time I was like I dont care I just want to rest my head because I was exhausted so we took the room on the 2nd floor and the first thing I noticed was the bathroom it wasnt what the pictures showed and then how small the rooms were and how dark the light were in the hallway was disappointed.and because we were in Manhattan you can hear the honking of the taxi horns through the windows and that made matters worse because we were so exhausted. I dont mind spending alittle more if the hotel is modern and if they make an effort to try and help there customer and I wish the concierge lady tried to help I dont think I'll be staying there again.

title: Surcôté par rapport aux prestations
text:
Réservation pour 5 nuits dans cet hôtel, nous avions une chambre avec vue sur le bâtiment d’en face, un bruit de soufflerie constant même avec le chauffage éteint. Nous avions encore l’impression d’être dans l’avion. Seulement 2 petites bouteilles d’eau à notre arrivée pas les autres jours, pas de peignoir comme annoncé lors de la réservation.
Super lobby bien décoré. Rooftop fermé à moitié, piscine non accessible.
Salle de bain très petite et qui aurait besoin d’un coup de frais.
Sinon la chambre rien à dire confortable.
Dommage nous avons été déçus dans la globalité.

title: The Empire Hotel NYC
text: Great location for shopping, restaurants, food, and Lincoln Center. The Empire Hotel is our standard hotel for NYC visits because of the proximity to our business locations, Lincoln Center, prefered restaurants and shopping

title: Sad to say - a poor room assignment results in a downgrade
text:
Usually in previous stays in the Empire, I have been pleased with the room and never experienced such a disaster as a heater that would not turn off.  I felt like I was at a stifling summer camp. This room and other rooms on the same floor that were west facing all had issues with overheating.  Windows were inoperable.  I have in the past praised this hotel, but watch out for a miserable room assignment.
I will go back because of the proximity to the Met Opera and the opportunities offered for entertainment at Lincoln Center.  Next time, I'll be on guard against a raunchy room assignment, as you should be!.

title: Classic NY place
text: I often travel to NYC from Belgium for seminars. Of all the places I have stayed at I like the Empire Hotel the best... kudos to the friendly and helpful staff, rooms are clean and location is great, right next to the iconic Juilliard school!

title: Beautiful Interior & Customer Centric Focus
text: Had an excellent time staying at The Empire Hotel. Cleanliness, support, & ammenities were just as I needed. Price was very reasonable and location was convenient. Will definitely be looking into staying here again next time.

title: Great Hotel in a perfect location
text: We have just returned from visiting NYC and stayed at this lovely hotel. Although the rooms are quite small there is enough space for what you need when visiting this very busy city. The rooms were clean and tidy and you could not hear the noise from the nearby Times Square. The hotel is perfectly situated away from the madness but close enough to walk to Central Park and Times Square. We did not eat at the hotel as our schedule was so busy but would definitely stay here again.. we want to visit again soon!

title: Great place for a night at the opera!
text: I took my wife to Lincoln Center for her birthday and even though we live nearby in the suburbs we decided to stay for the night at the Empire. The hotel is PERFECT for this purpose. I was very thankful that Jeffrey made check-in a breeze and accommodated a very special request for ust. We had dinner at Rosa Mexicano around the corner, then a great time at La Traviata and finally spent a couple of hours in the beautiful and chic  rooftop lounge.HIGHLY recommended for comfort, convenience and fun! We will be back!

title: Horrible stay
text: It was terrible air control quality. There is no water given and you’re charged for extra toilet paper. Room smelt of mold and was the size of a shoe closet. $150 refundable deposit on room in case of any damages when everything in the room is worth less than stuff you’d find in a dollar store.

title: Stay away at all costs
text:
Stay away at all costs 

Valet broke my windshield, hotel gave me their number. Can only speak to a “manager” who apparently only works a couple of days a week. The guys there just hang up on you. Hotel manager doesn’t return phone calls. Stay far away from this horrible establishment.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Empire.  I would highly recommend staying here.  Can’t wait to come back.  The location of the hotel to points in walking distance is great.  There’s even a Starbucks on the corner.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: Great location in a lovely area, very close to Central Park, metro and opera house. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms kept very clean by housekeeping staff. Everywhere in walking distance, doormen really friendly and great characters indeed.

title: Location Location Location
text: This is a moderately priced hotel with an elegant lobby and comfortable, nicely decorated rooms. It's prime feature is its location - immediately across the street from Lincoln Center and right on Broadway with the subway nearby and buses across the street a 5-10 minute ride to Times Square The Upper West Side is lovely.

title: Amazing
text: Stayed here from christmas day until 29th december. Check in was fast and pleasant the man on the desk (who's name I cannot remember) was extremely polite and helpful. We were in room 231 on the 2nd floor. The room was extremely warm. But I figured out within around 2 minutes yow to adjust the heater. We slept with the window open and did not suffer with any noise trouble at all. The beds were extremely comfortable. However. Many of the furniture items are old and tired and could do with replacing. The bathroom is tiny but does its job. The lobby is amazing and every gossip girl fans dream. The hotel is in an amazing location. 2 mins from central park. 2 mins from subway station. We had an amazing time and I would 100% return. Thank you

title: Love this Hotel
text:
We’ve been to this hotel three times over the last 4 years, from Ireland.
The staff are great and the location is perfect for exploring NYC.
