Central Park is a stone’s throw away.  The shops at Columbus Circle are great for high end shopping, head the other direction and you have Centry12 and Bloomingdales Outlet.
Great food around with the local restaurants, and a short walk to both Hells Kitchen and Harlem.

We will be back!

title: Excellent stay.
text: Had a great stay here over Christmas, room and bed comfortable, staff helpful, friendly and courteous, some excellent restaurants close to the hotel. Spent an evening at the bar great service and cocktails, also had breakfast at the rooftop good service and food and great photos under the Empire Hotel neon.

title: had a wonderful stay
text: This hotel stay was a gift from our daughter and we couldn't be more impressed the locadtion was great and close to the things we wanted  to see. The building and rooms were beautiful and the staff was helpful and friendly. Who could ask for more?

title: Great location, nice lobby, nice rooftop
text: Great location, nice lobby, very nice rooftop views.  Safe and clean.  In an upscale area with great entertainment and eateries.  Comparable hotels in the area have heavy price tage, so nice price for the area.  Recommended ,

title: Positive Suprise
text: Last minute decision to spend the night in the city.  Had matinee tickets for Lincoln Center and brunch at P.J.Clarke's.  Booked a room at this hotel as it is across the street from Lincoln Center.  They were able to provide a room earlier then normal check in and the desk staff were wonderful.  Had a conversation with the gentleman and he upgraded my room.  The service was great and the roof bar, even in January(indoors) was a comfortable place for lunch.  A true find.

title: nice place
text:
a very good to stay for a pleasant travel
very good location near central park and colombus circle
room are very clean and beds very confortable
The bar and lobby are very nice, the roof top was closed, dommage
I recommand this place for eveyboby

title: Great Location at a good price
text:
Location of the Hotel was great, Concierge was super friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, no real viewpoints from windows just looking at other near building windows. Room was OK, Comfortable Beds, No light in the Closet / Fridge / Safe Area too dark. TV could use an update.  Carpet has wear and tear in some areas. Room could have been cleaned a bit better before we arrived, was fixed by the next day. Promised Daily Water never arrived. The room has some items that need to be fixed, Heater and Shower Fixture.

But for the price we receviced, comfortable beds, location and staff I would stay again.

title: love this Hotel
text: Love this Hotel, the Location is very central. Beautifully Furnished Lobby and Rooms. Very friendly staff very helpful. Would definitely recommend it to my best friends and family. Kind regards Aleksandra

title: If you like a noisy room for $250 that's the place for you
text:
I dont understand how they even sell such kind of rooms. 

Horrible noise. The worst 500 usd i spent for two nights. 

Tried to change rooms, the registration person said that what my rate gives. 

Make your own decision on this

title: Good stay
text: Great hotel. Convenient to where we need to go.  Personnel was very helpful. Clean and great shower in our room. Breakfast was a let down as it was overpriced and not very good.  Room was clean and noise was a minimum  but we had ear plugs

title: Staff friendliness
text: Compared to other hotels in the area the staff stands out as the most friendly! Besides, this hotel is just steps from the Lincoln Center. There is NO other hotel that is that close. And this is important when season-ticket holders like us just walk to the Fiorello or Lincoln restaurants and then to the Center.

title: Just okay
text:
The room was adequate, had a bed and bathroom.  Late on clean-up each day.  NO ICE MACHINE,had to take Ice bucket and find some one at desk to fill it.
Elevator to outside bar area not always operating. We were attending a graduation at the Lincoln center which was close by. 
Would not put this at the top of my do overe list.

title: Mediocre,Bit tired and run down but nice location
text:
No tea and coffee making facilities in rooms despite what website says or mini bar but get 2 very small complimentary water bottles each morning.
Billed as mid range 3 star hotel but carpets hard and well worn,,low lighting masks some very tired decor posing as "boutique "...in the U.K. This would definitely not pass as a boutique hotel.
Booked in Feb 2019 for new year 2020 asking for them high floor room and a bottle in the room for partners birthday,got neither,told that hotel was too full.
Got 4th floor with a view of the back of the other rooms and a very noisy air con outside that NEVER goes off so take earplugs.
Roof top bar great place to relax but this is NOT part of hotel so no special discounts or treatment. Nice views of the Lincoln centre and broadway.
Good location but be aware if youve never been ,food is very expensive and you have to add tax to everything pls tips.PJ Clarkes bar/restaurant is nice right next to hotel.

title: Great NY hotel
text: Love the Empire! extremely friendly and helpful staff, GREAT location (near park, subway, etc), clean, spacious rooms for price. My only hesitation in writing this review is it spoils my little secret!

title: Aaaah - sunset from the Rooftop Lounge......
text: Lovely to spend a couple of days in this great city - right next to Lincoln Center! As soon as we got there, we headed up to the Rooftop to relax and enjoy a cocktail and watch the sun go down in the December sky. What a treat!

title: Great stay
text: Very nice room and very friendly staff at this hotel. Good location with some shops nearby. We had a great time in New York for my wife’s birthday. We would definitely stay here again and we would definitely recommend

title: A comfortable NYC stay
text: The Empire is close to several good restaurants including The Smiths which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Reservations needed. Shops are within walking distance as well as Fifth Avenue. Central Park is a short walk as well as Fordham University and Lincoln Center is across the street

title: First rate service and beautiful hotel
text: From the very friendly and helpful check in staff and doorman to the quick responsiveness from housekeeping - this was a wonderful easy experience. Our room had a beautiful view of Lincoln Center and the overall positive vibe of the hotel was testament to the energy of the staff and beautiful setting.

title: Opera trip
text:
Heat ran the entire time we were there even after it was supposedly fixed. The bar in the closet and hook on the bathroom door are impossible to reach unless you are 7 feet tall.
Location for patrons of Lincoln Center is great.
Several good restaurants nearby.

title: Would stay at the Empire again
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a beautiful corner suite overlooking Lincoln Center. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the rooftop bar and there were several other eating options within a block.

title: Great hotel!
text: I was get happy with my stay here. Great room. Clean, warm, comfortable. Right across from Lincoln Center. The check in staff were really nice. The lobby is gorgeous and there's a nice bar. Old New York elegance with modern touches.

title: Great location, great staff
text: Wonderfully situated in midtown, just a stones throw from central park and columbus circle. Wonderfully pleasant and accommodating staff. We felt we really got our money's worth on our booking for a five day stay over Christmas.

title: Great Hotel & Location but eat elsewhere!
text:
The location of The Empire hotel is perfect. With close links to the Subway, shopping in the Columbus Circle and a short walk away from Times Square and Central Park. 

The interior in the lobby and mezzanine area is beautiful.
The Rooftop bar is another area with great interior and views. 

We tried the breakfast buffet In the rooftop bar on our last day and to say I was disappointed is an understatement. The breakfast available is not satisfactory for $28 per adult. Children are charged as an adult above the age of 10. $95 for a family of three for breakfast is a bit too pricey for the standard of food being offered. It really needs to be looked at as the breakfast available at the Rockefeller is the same price. 

Overall we had a great time in NYC but the disappointing breakfast has left a sour taste in my mouth!

title: Great Location, Great Stay!
text: Great value hotel, located on the upper west side. Walking distance to Central Park and Times Square.  This served as a perfect place to set out and explore NYC.  Rooms are clean, updated.  Front desk service was wonderful.  All needs were attended too with a smile.

title: Decepcionados
text: Supongo que en NY todo está vendido y todo caro. Nosotros elegimos este hotel porque sin estar muy abajo, no está mal situado y su precio era algo más barato que hoteles un poco más abajo. Lo cierto es que nos equivocamos en la elección. Nos dieron una habitación en la tercera planta pequeña que da a un patio interior por donde suben ventilación de diversos aparatos con un ruido tremendo las 24 h. Para dormir con tapones. Habitacion súper justa y desde luego nada que ver con un 4*. Sin armario, con dos colgadores. El baño enano y el agua caliente y la ducha funcionaba de culo. Dentro del lavabo hay atascado un tapón de pasta de dientes con moho. La caja fuerte uno de los días se atascó y tuvimos que llamar para que la repararán. Otro de los días no hicieron la habitación. En definitiva, que si fuese mucho más barato pasaría por un hotel de 2* pero me parece excesivo el precio que se paga para el tipo de habitaciones. La nuestra cama de 135. No volvería y pienso reclamar a la agencia.

title: Comfy, clean, and convenient
text:
We’ve stayed at the Empire a few times on trips to New York for Broadway and concerts. It’s got a great location and you can walk anywhere you want to go in about 15 minutes or just hop of the subway down the street. Rooms are cozy, showers are great (water pressure is nice), and staff are always friendly.

Plus you get to stay on Sesame Street! 

Will stay here again.

title: The Place to stay
text:
Excellent hotel.  We stayed from 24th December until the 29th of December and could not fault the hotel in any way.
All of the staff were perfect in every way, courteous, pleasant, helpfull and very efficient.

I struck up a great rapport with the two guys in the lobby bar so i will give them a special mention. two great guys....
We would highly recomment the hotel to anyone who csres to visit New York.
I do know we will be back......

title: Super location with comfy beds
text: Hotel was lovely and the staff were great upon check in and in the bar. The rooms were a little dated but after staying in nyc over 5 times this was one of the comfiest beds I have slept in. The housekeeping were lovely and couldn’t give us enough shower gel, shower caps etc. If I could change anything it would be the heat of the room. It was boiling and when we opened the windows it was really noisy from the air conditioning units. I would 100% stay here again but would maybe ask for a room on a higher floor away from the noise as if I was a light sleeper I would have been up all night. The hairdryer provided was a good one compared to other hotels and there is a small fridge to store drinks in etc. The cocktails in the hotel bar are lovely and the location is great. Columbus circle shopping centre, a subway stop, Duane Reade and a Starbucks just outside the hotel. What more could you want. We were also able to store our bags on the last day as our flight was later on we had an extra day exploring without having to worry about checking out.

title: Excellent hotel- perfect
text: Just arrived back from staying at this hotel and it was so lovely, rooms clean and tidy, beds so comfy, slept really well. Staff very friendly, polite and helpful.  Walking  distance to Time square, Central Park and Empire State, Would highly recommend this hotel, would definitely stay here again. Thank you 😊😊

title: Beautiful view and convenient to Fordham University
text: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times . My daughter goes to Fordham University. The empire is right across the street from Fordham. The staff is very helpful and attentive. And the view and food is delicious.

title: Filthy Rooms!
text: This was the filthiest room I have ever stayed in! The shower was so gross I didn’t even use it. I was so surprised that hotel of this type at Lincoln Square would have rooms like that. Unacceptable!!

title: Excellent Location
text:
We travel to NYC twice yearly.  Over the last couple of times, we have booked our stay at the Empire Hotel.  It is near a subway stop, across the street from the Lincoln Center, lots of restaurant and shop all within easy walking distance - there is even a Starbucks around the corner!  

The hotel is a bit older, which makes it charming!  How I rate the room are by the cleanliness  of the room and bed comfort.  The bed is very comfortable and clean.  But one point I want to make it the level of service from the staff, especially the front desk staff.  We booked the wrong date, on a busy weekend for NYC.  The front desk staff got us a room, rate stayed the same, and quickly got the room ready!  We plan to say there on upcoming trip in May 2020.

title: Not bad, but not the service you expect for the money
text:
So we stayed in a Junior Suite for our trip to New York recently, which was booked for our first anniversary. On paper this is quite a premium New York City hotel. Just off Columbus circle, minutes from Central Park and a short walk or cab drive to broadway. 

I’m not sure if we were a bit unfortunate because we had a huge flight delay which meant we arrived at 4am, but the welcome was a bit underwhelming to say the least, especially for a city that doesn’t sleep apparently as there was no one to greet us at the door or help with luggage and the guy on the front desk wasn’t hugely welcoming either, I hardly got two words out of him.

On getting to the room it was freezing, so we put the heater on which was the noisiest thing ever. I had messaged ahead to see if they had synthetic bedding which they say they do, but what they actually mean is they have synthetic pillows and a blanket, which is useless in December lets be honest.

The next morning after very little sleep we went to try breakfast, which is served in the rooftop lounge. There was no signage anywhere to say that this could only be accessed from the hotel reception, and we got pretty lost in the hotel side trying to find it. I had asked in advance if they had gluten and dairy free options which they said was no problem, but when we got there the guy offered me omelette and chips at 9am, and they didn’t have gluten free bread or any specifically gluten free options which wasn’t what I was informed. We gave up on eating at the hotel and found somewhere else, which was actually much better and less expensive.

I asked the guy at the desk if there was any chance of moving to a room with a less noisy heater and also if we could get a duvet, he was quite abrupt to be honest and said ‘look lady were fully booked, I’ll see if I can g set a guy to look at the heater but it will be later I get around to it.’ When we got back to the hotel they had sorted the noisy heater  but still no duvet which I chased up with housekeeping and they were much more helpful.

We had a room on the sixth floor. The room itself was ok, it could do with a lick of pint if I’m honest and some of the plug sockets were loose which wouldn’t happen in the UK because of our laws, but the size was good, the bed was comfy, and it was quite a decent view of Columbus Circle. The shower was good, but the bathroom would have benefitted from an extractor fan.

We had another issue with the standard of service was when we were late for dinner, had got locked out of the room because our keys had stopped working and needed an umbrella. We went to reception to explain and he gave us a new key, but even though he had them available would not lend us an umbrella to stop us being any later through no fault of our own which ended up costing us an extra 40 dollars keeping an Uber waiting by the time we had waited in line for a new key and then had to go back to the room. This to me was pretty basic, they could have easily left a note on our room about the extra umbrella if they were so worried about it going missing.

We managed to grab a drink in the hotel bar on the last evening and the service was much better here, as too was it on the rooftop bar in the evening when we went there afterwards and the waitress was very clued up on allergies and what was on the evening menu.

Overall I’m told this is a good hotel experience for New York, but for me I found it quite a disappointing experience and I’m not sure I would stay there again.

title: Ottimo Hotel
text:
Luna di miele con 5 notti a New York City, hotel in posizione comodissima, a due passi da Central Park e comodo per raggiungere qualsiasi metà in città ma lontano dalla confusione del centro di Manhattan.
Ubicato vicinissimo a Columbus Circle e il Lincoln Center ,zona sicura e tranquilla. 
Hotel molto pulito dal gusto retró e raffinato, servizio impeccabile sia per quanto riguarda le stanze, sia da parte del personale di reception, struttura  ben frequentata, confortevole con letto molto comodo e doccia molto spaziosa. 
Esaudita ogni richiesta da parte del personale. 
Piccola “chicca” il bar dell’albergo molto raffinato è stato utilizzato per girare gli episodi di una nota serie televisiva. 
Ci tornerei oggi stesso!!!

title: Satisfied
text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights everything is good busy weekend because of the holidays but everyone is a professional whenever I ask something at the front desk they will give ot to us right away. Just sad I didn't get the chance to see the empire hotel sign

title: 立地「は」よいが・・・
text:
2019年12月21日～26日までの5泊で利用しました。徒歩350mほどのところにホールフーズがあるので便利です。また、コロンバスサークルが近いので、地下鉄に乗るのも便利でした。しかし、部屋は狭く、ホテルの窓からは隣のビル。ホテルの照明も暗め（これはそういうコンセプトなんだろうなぁと思うし、好みの問題でもありますが・・・。）。アメニティも充実しておらずやや残念でした。

＜良い点＞
立地（駅地下、スーパー近い）

＜悪い点＞
アメニティが充実してない（スリッパなし、電子レンジなし（部屋というかホテルの中にないと言われた）、電気ケトルなし（フロントに言うと貸出はあり））
部屋が狭い
部屋の照明暗め
ホテルはリノベ？してあるのだろうけど、建物は全体的に古め

title: Family Vacation
text: Room was extremely hot and right next to laundry staff did move us to another room on third night. Each night it reached 80 degrees with the windows open and 35 outside and it was too hot to sleep at all

title: Great Location! Amazing views if you get one!!!
text: Great location if you're in town for the Christmas events !! Close to everything without dealing with the hustle of time square Rockefeller center*. Bell staff and front desk was friendly and very welcoming, we had some early mornings and some late evenings, somehow we kept meeting Rohan at the front desk and he always greeted us with a smile and always had adventure options for us to check out. You get two fiji waters daily which is cool because not many hotels offer that anymore. Thumbs up Empire and thumbs up Rohan !!

title: Perfect Place to stay!
text:
This is very well situated near Central Park and 2 mins form the nearest Subway station. Very easy to get around and staff very friendly. Air-con can be a bit on the loud side however bedrooms are a good size for NY and beds very comfy.

Bathroom really clean and nice with toiletries and hairdryer (good quality) provided as well as safe and coffee making facilities.

Very handy Starbucks just on the corner for your morning coffee.

title: Great Location and Service
text: Super friendly and attentive staff. Clean room and bathroom. The location is great; few blocks from two subway stations, Central Park and Columbus Circle. The only downside is the shower pressure was not that good, and someday, water wasn't hot enough in the morning.

title: Loved it!
text: This hotel was awesome and Luis and Randall hooked us up fat with the deals and room! 10/10 would come back! It is near so many things and my fiancé and I had a great time!! Thank you, The Empire. Beautiful!

title: Good people
text: Rooms were aight. Not really luxury at all.  Kind of reminded me of a Ramada Inn inside the rooms, but the building is very beautiful. Luis and Randall hooked us up fat and so those factors balance the mediocre rooms.

title: Brilliant hotel in NYC
text:
Stayed here with my husband and our two young children for a few nights last month. We were really impressed. The location is obviously brilliant, but the rooms and main areas are fab too. We slept well on comfortable beds with no noise from the busy street outside. I loved the lavender toiletries that were supplied, and the rooftop restaurant for breakfast was lovely - great view and delicious food and super service. 

The only things to be aware of is no room service (however we were given the go-ahead to get takeout delivered to us via Uber Eats which made up for this!) and no baby cribs - however we were able to arrange for a crib (and stroller) to be delivered to the hotel ahead of our stay from a baby equipment rental company, and the hotel staff helpfully accepted the delivery before we arrived and got us all set up which was really appreciated. 

We had such a good stay that we wouldn't consider anywhere else next time we visit NYC, we would automatically choose The Empire Hotel again.

title: Great Hotel
text: Amazing location and friendly staff.  Beautiful rooms, great views and wonderful roof top bar.  Close to central park to walk around for a morning or afternoon stroll.  Just blocks away from 5th avenue and Broadway.

title: Terrible experience sadly
text: Stayed here as part of our honeymoon visit to New York and felt compelled to write a review. The location of the hotel is fine and the rooftop bar and lobby area are good however would never stay here again. Our room and bathroom were tiny, our AC didn’t work and when a member of staff told us he would get it sorted, we were greeted to a knock at our door an hour later and another member of staff holding a tiny heater - no explanation given and he just walked off! We were also in a room that had what sounded like a generator running constantly and it was unbearably loud. We decided, at 12.00am on our first night in New York, that we couldn’t stay there as we knew it would likely ruin our entire trip so we arranged to go to another hotel that night. On checking out, the staff at the desk did not seem interested in discussing our issues or how they could best try and help which summed it all up. Really take no pleasure in writing this but the hotel seemingly has a lot of issues from our brief experience.

title: Empire Hotel perfect location for Lincoln Center visitors
text: Our group of six friends loved this hotel, recommended by another friend. We were right across the street from Lincoln Center, 1 block from Central Park, and were surrounded by excellent and varied restaurants. We walked to Times Square, Rock Center and enjoyed the Christmas time decorations and festivities. If you want a quieter room, ask for one that opens into the interior of the hotel. A beautiful view of the street and Lincoln Center means you'll hear every wailing siren all night long, so keep that in mind when asking for your room. No coffee pots in the rooms, but Starbucks is 1 storefront away. There were little refrigerators in the room too, so we were able to keep a bit of food and beverage cold.

title: Kind friendly staff
text: Hotel it not bad it about 15-20 mins walk from Times Square staff helpful and very kind. Rooms not very big for double room bathroom was very small we didn’t like it personally clean and tidy hotel. Not ideal if you want to be closer or in Time Square

title: Birthday weekend
text:
Had another great visit at the Empire. Love the location, and the rooftop lounge. Special thank you and shout-out to Mike and Gerard at the Lobby bar. They made the weekend extra fun and my birthday special. You only turn 21 once. 

PJ Clarke's is great and having a Starbucks so close is handy. 

We did have to move the fridge in the room as I dropped something, and the carpet could use a bit of a cleaning back there - but overall we loved our second stay and will stay again. 

Thanks again,
The Canadian girls

title: Great value for the area!
text: This hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly.  They store your luggage before/after checkout so you don't have to lug it around the city .  Right across from Lincoln Center and a block from Central Park.  I would stay here again without hesitation.

title: Amazing value, great location, cool hotel
text:
Was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Swanky vibe upon entry, great location, room was clean, posh, small. Only issue was the housekeeping was VERY excited to service the room even with the do not disturb on the door. Problem? I mean if that’s the worst that we experienced then I call it a win. 

Bed was super tough, though. It actually helped by back but my husband was in agony. 

Overall I totally recommend it. Out room overlooked the Lincoln center and it was pretty perfect for our stay.

title: Prime location, good room, so-so service
text: Prime location, large and clean Jr. Suite, quiet room (10th floor). Spartan breakfest, no coffee machine or tea in the room, WiFi router next to the room was broken, poor to none AT&T cellular reception in the room. Took 3 days to fix WiFi after numerous complains to front desk and Housekeeping. Overall - OK but I will look for something better next time for $3,500 per 7 nights.

title: The Empire....of Kindness!
text: We choose this hotel for our first time in New York and all was perfect. The room was big enough and very clean. The breakfast was vary and taste! All people at the reception were very kind especially Pasquale and Merylin, that we thank so much! Thank you for all and we hope to see you again as soon as possible! Thanks!!!

title: Sgt Daniel McCaughan LOVES Empire Hotel!
text:
The Empire Hotel is the BEST “Hidden Gem” in New York City! Luxury hotel at modest rates. Location is perfect for everything NYC! Best walking distance hotel for Met Opera, Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park, Tavern on the Green, Carnegie Hall, and everything uptown or midtown Manhattan. Great views of Lincoln Center in a spacious room, larger than the typical NYC hotel room. Great lobby waiting area with complimentary luggage storage, and the least expensive area overnight parking rates in NYC. Thank you Empire Hotel!
Sgt Daniel McCaughan

title: Great hotel, affordable
text: Very nice hotel for the price. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Its in a good location on the west side of Central Park. My only complaint was that there was no coffee pot in the room, but it was easy to go upstairs to the reastaurant and get. Would definitely stay here again

title: The Empire Hotel
text: Hotel molto di moda e posizione eccellente per vedere New York a piedi. Menzione d'onore a Pasquale che è stato a nostra completa disposizione durante il soggiorno rendendo tutto più semplice. Grande Pasquale!!!

title: Don’t stay here because you saw it on gossip girls
text: Worst experience I’ve had at a hotel. They lost our reservation from booking.com and when we finally checked in the room we got was very obviously the room that’s never been updated since this hotel opened. The bathroom door was molding and falling apart and the shower never actually got any hotter than lukewarm. The thermostat was ripped off the wall and when we turned on the heater manually it started spewing smoke, we notified the front desk who had maintenance come and say there was nothing they could do. Hotel staff was rude and very obviously would rather do anything but help you. You’re much better off staying anywhere else but here.

title: Changed my opinion on New York
text: I had been in New York before and I didn't like the city. Found it very difficult to find food and drink. Turns out the problem was the location. This hotel was across the road from some really good restaurants and was close to the metro. Really enjoyed my stay this time. We had a lovely view from room the staff were fantastic. I really enjoyed my stay here and would stay again.

title: Christmas Trip to NYC
text: Great hotel great location friendly staff great roof top bar noisy air conditioning unit needs updating would not turn off was making strange noise Tommy door man was very friendly gave us great advice nice cafe across street for breakfast

title: 4-star service but not a 4-star hotel
text: For a 4-star hotel, the amenities are subpar: The provided refrigerators don't cool down below 50°F (I had a thermometer on my keychain), which management should make clear to guests. In fact, I had them send up a second after the first didn't cool down enough, but all are of the same model, which are only suitable to "chill" drinks and candy bars typically found in a mini bar. I had counted on the fridge to store breakfast items (e.g,. yogurt, cold cuts, etc.) as well as leftovers and basically all of them were of questionable safety after one night in the fridge. No coffee maker or hot water kettle were provided. The fitness room was left unkempt: no towels and no wipes on the two days I visited. Subpar lighting and insufficient outlets, especially near the bed. Doors slam loudly and revererabate, which threaten peaceful sleep for light sleepers like myself. That said, the location cannot be beat and the housekeeping was very good. Reception staff were helpful and efficient.

title: Meh
text: The sink didn’t drain, ac didn’t cool even in 40 degree weather.  Lighting was horrible, couldn’t even find clothes in the suitcase with the lighting.  The light over the shower was completely exposed, and a fire hazard.  Every pillow we had was horrible.  Housekeeping was amazing and always helpful.

title: Ticks!
text: I found a tick in my room. The manager refused to compensate me saying, "We'll have to investigate it first." This is after I handed here a plastic bag with a live tick in it. Earlier, when I told my colleagues I was staying at the Empire, my colleagues asked me if I had bug spray. So this is a well-known issue. I recommend you stay there if you like tick-borne diseases.

title: Great find in NYC
text: Very happy with my recent stay at the Empire Hotel.  Check in was easy and they graciously upgraded my room and allowed me to check in before the 3pm usual time.  Very much appreciated.  I plan to make this my regular business hotel in NYC and have already booked a room for next week.  Hopefully the same room and staff!

title: Amazing stay for my first NYC stay
text:
Apon reading other people reviews i was orignally a bit worried about staying here but all these worries went straight away and had an absolutely amazing stay!!!! We arrived about 9pm on a Monday and was greeted by several memebers of lovely staff. Check in was quick and simple, we was told about how we get our 2 free bottles of water each day.

Our room was on the 6th floor next to the liftt but not once could you hear any noise coming from it. Our room was perfect size for me and my partner and the bed was the most comfiest bed i have ever slept in and i wish i could take the mattress home with me. Although we kept our rook clean and tidy every day after a long day in the city we came back to find the room spotless and bathroom supplies topped up.

On our lasy day we finished our day of early and went back to the hotel to sit in the lobby to wait for our transfer the hotel had no issue with this we also got a drink from the lobby bar while we waited. The hotel stored our suitcases for us for the day which again was another simple and quick process.

The hotel is in a great location with lots of shops near by and a subway station with less then a minutes walk, central park a few minutes walk away and times square was about a 10 minute walk

Overall i was gutted about leaving the hotel and will 100% stay here again on my next vist. amazing hotel ,lovely caring staff and great location what else do you need.

title: Super friendly staff in a great location
text:
Every staff member I came into contact with was friendly, helpful & genuinely seemed to care if guests were having a good visit.  They all deserve a raise (and, no, I don’t know anyone who works there). Consistently high customer service like that is rare. 

If you want a lot of nightlife in the immediate area, this might not be your spot.  Same is true for restaurants—not as many as some other neighborhoods.  If you want a well-located, relatively (for NYC) quiet area near Lincoln Center, subway line 1 and kinda close to Central Park, this may be for you.

title: Great location and very nice place.
text: We just happen to pick this hotel due to the location near Central Park.  It ended up as a perfect choice near great restaurants & shopping and away for the craziness of the Time Square & Rockefeller Center during the Holiday Season,  It was an easy walk to any of these venues.

title: Location ok, but rough stay
text:
We had a suite, so the room size was good, and location is ok, but based on the following issues, I would not recommend this hotel:
- Heater - the first night one of our heaters was broken, so they came to fix it.  However, the other heater made such a horribly loud noise that it kept us up all night, which with a 2 year old was a nightmare.  We asked for it to be fixed, and they said that is just the way the old steam heaters work, so we ended up sleeping without heat the next 2 nights.  It was better to be freezing that not sleep due to the horrid noise.
- Check in - room was not ready until 30 min after check out time.  Would not have been a huge deal, but in combination with everything else, it was just one more negative
- Bathroom - Felt dingy, and there was a rusty wall/side of shower that I suppose was to make it look "industrial," but it stuck out oddly and you had to be extra careful not to stub your toe on the rusty area that jutted out
- Room - Everything seemed a bit dingy and old.  There was no trashcan and we had to request ice delivery, which came the first night, but never arrived the second night.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: This is our second trip to NYC and we again find ourselves joyfully staying at the Empire Hotel, for one simple reason...it is at the cultural ground-zero of the Big Apple.  It is the only hotel across the street from Lincoln Center (Met Opera, NYC Ballet), one block off the south end of Central Park, and within easy walking distance of literally everything you could want to see in New York.  Not to mention that it is a beautiful property staffed by some wonderfully helpful people and you will find that you will not want to stay anywhere else...as we have!

title: A return visit
text:
Traveling with two couples and this hotel
pleased us all. Especially grateful for an adapted room as I have back injury and knee issues.  We all loved the location and even though we visited other neighborhoods for sights and eating, coming “home” at night is always pleasant and welcoming.  Comfortable beds but next time I’ll ask for a choice of pillows. Standard ones are too firm.  Would love to have in room ice buckets.  We will be back next trip.  As many mentioned the location is great.

title: Todos problemas
text:
Habitaciones: me asignaron una habitación en el primer piso que daba a un patio con los equipos de aire acondicionado, que hacen un ruido tremendo. A uno de mis compañeros le robaron el cable del IPhone, a otro nunca le repararon la cortina y estuvo toda la estadía a oscuras.
Para rematar, a dos de nosotros nos hicieron cargos en la tarjeta que no correspondían y nos llevó mucho trabajo que nos hicieran el reintegro. No volvería!

title: Good Stay for While Visiting NYC
text: Being someone who has visited NYC numerous times, this was a good choice of property to stay at this past Weekend (Dec 5-8) especially for someone who wants to do some Christmas shopping, and see all the decorations. upon arrival they had a room ready for my which I was Impressed. The room was very clean, the only complaint I have is I found the pillows to be uncomfortable and abit flight with no substance to them I would suggest updating them in the rooms to allow for better sleep quality. This hotel is in an amazing location near Columbus Avenue, short distance to Central Park and close to subways. I will be staying here again

title: Thoroughly Enjoyed!
text: From the lovely lobby to our beautiful corner suite room, we truly enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and efficient. We enjoyed cocktails at the roof top bar and a really delicious breakfast buffet with so many options! We will be return.

title: Rooms need maintained better. Otherwise it's great
text: Rooms are a bit rough and poorly cleaned. Very loud. Staff was great. Location is convenient. Ran out of hot water one morning. Beer choice is limited. Door men are exceptional. Front desk is very friendly.

title: Romantic trip
text: Short and sweet review. I thought this hotel was very very good upon entering for first glance expectations. Decor was lovely, staff were really helpful and was very professional. For me it was a great location very close to Central Park. Not too far away from Times Square either. Room was lovely but really really small.. a lot smaller than I had anticipated which wasn’t ideal as we had two cases of luggage. I love a hotel shower and this hotel shower was amazing but yet again the bathroom was tiny. I would definately stay again... infact when I return in 2020 I will be staying here again :-)

title: Excellent place
text: I love the atmosphere of the reception area and the comfortable, cozy rooms with great bedding. The location is also very convenient for my work. just a quick note, there is no coffee machine in the room but Starbucks is at the corner.

title: Lovely hotel step from Lincoln Center
text: We just stayed in room 1124 at the Empire hotel. We were seeing an opera at the Met Opera; 50 feet away. Wonderful service at check in, fabulous room, great views, spacious, comfortable room. A delight. Wish the city was slightly quieter but that can’t be helped.

title: A great little hotel
text: The Empire Hotel is a chic hotel with a great location. Just a few minutes from the new Nordstrom and many cute restaurants just steps away. Very helpful staff! Our room was clean. Bathroom is small and I will remember next time to ask for a tub but overall just a great little hotel.

title: Amazing Experience at Empire
text: My family and I needed a place to stay for Thanksgiving weekend and the Empire Hotel was a fabulous choice. The hotel Manger was truly fabulous along with the front desk staff. Everyone helped to make our stay a memorable and comfortable experience. We will definitely be back again!

title: Awesome hotel
text: The hotel and staff were very attentative to the needs of the clients. And it was great to be just a block away from the Macy's day parade. Literally under a five minute walk...Columbus Square. We were on the second row!

title: The Empire Hotel
text: We recently stayed at the Empire Hotel for business.  I was familiar with the hotel from the famous sign (of course!), and seeing the property on several blogger's Instagram feed.  The hotel is located steps away from Lincoln Center, and convenient to the Columbus Circle metro stops.  The interior is beautiful and sophisticated, with a great vibe to the lobby.  Front desk crew and valet are all warm and extremely helpful.  As with many NYC older hotels, the rooms can be stifling in the winter.  We couldn't cool down our room from 76 degrees, so the front desk executed a switch right away.  The updated rooms with doubles have a clever sleeping arrangement, with each bed placed apart, and the sq footage was a welcome surprise.  The fitness center needs updating if that is an important part of your stay.  But plenty of places to run right outside, not a deal breaker.  If you need a quiet upper west side  stay, I highly recommend The Empire Hotel.

title: Shabby but not chic
text: Old and getting older. Great location next to the MET. ( This is getting comical, I have said what I wanted but it is not 200 characters so that leads me to rant about discrimination against people who have difficulties with written language )

title: Preis Leistung stimmt nicht
text: Die Lage ist direkt neben dem Central Park. Die Zimmer schön allerdings blättert hier und da ordentlich die Farbe ab und die Lüftung / Heizung ist ziemlich laut. Ausblick = 0 ein düsterer Innenhof. W-Lan funktioniert nur in der Lobby. Auf unser Befürchten hin das könnte nur bei uns so sein antwortete der Mitarbeiter des Hotels, dass es serwohl in den Zimmern funktioniere. Der Anblick der vollen Hotellobby jeden Abend mit Leuten die alle in ihr Smartphone starren lässt uns allerdings gegenteiliges vermuten. Zusätzliches Ärgernis nach langer Anreise war die Schlampigkeit des Personals uns das falsche Zimmer zuzuweisen in dem jemand anderer bereits wohnte. Wie das passieren konnte frage ich mich da mein Reisepass und meine Kreditkarte ca 10min überprüft worden sind, obwohl alles im Voraus bezahlt wurde. Schade da wir uns wirklich drauf gefreut haben.

title: Festività a New York
text: Abbiamo soggiornato presso l'hotel nella settimana del Thanksgiving, posizione perfetta per muoversi a piedi,ben curato ed elegante nelle zone comuni,avrebbe bisogno di essere rimodernato nelle camere.Molto pulito,staff gentile e cordiale nota di merito assoluta al signor Pasquale gentilissimo e punto di riferimento nei nostri giorni di soggiorno. Struttura sicuramente consigliata.

title: Horrible
text: This hotel is a disgusting rip off. I just checked into a tiny room that is not  clean.  A former tenants bathroom articles are still on the shelves in a bathroom so small that I have to go out of it in order to turn around. If I hadn’t booked a non refundable ( but still expensive!)  Expedia price I would leave immediately, but I’m stuck here for 6 nights

title: Wonderful Location
text: Across the street from the Lincoln Center, quick walk to Central Park. Coffee and pastry shops close by. Subway entrance quick walk, hop on for a quick subway ride to anywhere. Came in for a show at the Beacon Theatre, a nice 13 minute walk, plenty of people around. The room needs work, our view was a wall with air conditioning units everywhere. Sun has no way in your room and the conditioning units always had water coming down from them so it was always looking like a rainy night! The bathroom was tiny, no place to put your things. The staff were very nice. You get free bottle water everyday but you have to ask at the front desk. We stayed on the first floor, took the stairs up and down-that was convenient. The location was perfect for us.

title: Great location, average room
text: Great location, average room.  Spacious king suite but bed was very hard and window was broken which allowed a lot of outside noise and smells to come inside.  It was never fixed during our stay.  Bell staff was very friendly and helpful.  Lighting is a little dark in rooms and hallways.  Food in their restaurant was delicious.

title: Wonderful stay, location can't be beat
text: Love this hotel and staff, and proximity to the Opera. Also across the street from the Smith restaurant & bar which was fab. The rooftop lounge at Empire has a wonderful hot cider and inviting space to enjoy it. Nearby is Le Salle soup dumplings with next door package store to pick up wine. An awesome weekend.

title: Wonderful stay at The Empire Hotel
text:
My wife and I went to see "To Kill A Mockingbird" in NYC and stayed at The Empire Hotel while there.
Convenient location across the avenue from Lincoln Center. Starbucks and P J Clarkes only steps away. Extremely friendly and helpful staff.

title: Noisy and no water in the morning
text: Was there for WOBI Conference across the street at Lincoln Center. Didn’t sleep a wink as the street noise from the 7th floor was as if we were actually on Broadway and not in an expensive hotel. Woke up to shower and get ready for the big first day and there was no water! Called the front desk, but they never picked up the damn phone! Went down to complain and they said they had no idea as they hadn’t received a complaint. No kidding! You didn’t answer the phone! Had to go to battle with management to get refunded. No one wants to unpack and then change hotels, but that is exactly what we did. The place is small, dark, and in need of maintenance. Front desk and door staff were polished, but it seems like they know the place kind of stinks. Too bad as it’s a great location. The profit margins must be huge as they are definitely not pumping anything back into their property. Must be a nightmare for the staff to always deal with all the angry customers.

title: Maureen
text: Loved my visit to NYC.  It’s nerve racking finding an affordable hotel hoping the photos on site match your experience. Well, Empire delivered!  Lovely modern decor and friendly helpful staffing. Have already planned another trip to NYC with my girlfriends!

title: Location
text: A friend and I stayed at the Empire Hotel for the first time and enjoyed the comfortable beds and perfect and safe location for the purpose of our trip. Proximity to Central Park, eateries, the Lincoln Center. Walking distance (15 min) to MOMA and shopping made it a perfect choice for us. The staff was helpful and friendly and mostly responsive to our requests. Bathroom lighting was passable, room pleasant and clean. Would stay here again.

title: 憧れのホテル
text:
海外ドラマ「gossip girl」で有名なホテルです。このドラマに夢中になってから
いつか泊まってみたいとおもっていた憧れのホテル。
ホテルの周辺にはセントラルパーク、メトロポリタン歌劇場をはじめ、飲食店やスーパーマーケットもあり立地最高です。タイムズスクエアまでも徒歩圏内で、ミュージカル鑑賞後でも歩いて帰れる感じ。お部屋は少し古いけれど雰囲気あり、バスルームは特に古さを感じましたが口コミでチェックしていたので了解済。フレンドリーなスタッフと何よりも憧れのホテルだったので 心満たされました。

title: Don't let the Lobby fool you!
text: The lobby is very nice and of course the location is great but the rooms suck and the manager and staff simply don't care. Was put in a handicap room with this weird diagonal shape and the worst bed you've ever slept on with tears in the bed skirts. Asked for a new room and the Manager simply told me that in 3 nights from now the hotel is oversold and didn't want to move me 2 nights later.  Do yourself a favor and just stay somewhere else.  Your back will thank you!!

title: My go-to hotel
text: I've been staying at the Empire Hotel since it's conversion from an apartment building in 2008 to the wonderful hotel it is today. The place just keeps getting better and better, if that's even possible. I would recommend the Empire Hotel to even my most finicky friends. It's spotless. Sexy and hip without pretense.

title: Spotted: the most awesome Gossip Girl experience in NYC
text: If you're a fan of the show Gossip Girl, you MUST stay at the Empire and have your own Blair Waldorf moments. The Gossip Girl cocktail on the rooftop lounge is a little pricey but so worth it. Plus,you're just a short walk through Central Park to where Chair got married and then venture a little north to sit on the steps at the Met. My only disappointment was that I couldn't get a photo of the iconic sign because the pool deck was closed for the season and that's the best angle to get the photo (come on Empire, at least open a little section of it for a couple hours a day for that photo op!)

title: NYC trip
text: the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The location is outstanding, right near Central Park on the west side and right across from Lincoln Center which is beautiful.  It's a great area in the sense that it's busy, but not crazy busy like Times Square can be.  for the price I don't think you can do better than this hotel

title: My go-to hotel
text: I’ve been staying at the Empire Hotel since 2008. The place just keeps getting better and better, if that’s even possible! I would recommend the Empire Hotel to my most finicky friends. It’s spotless. Sexy and hip without pretense.

title: Second stay
text:
This was my second stay at this property . It won’t be my last. I was on vacation traveling alone. The staff was excellent from front door on
Rooms are relatively small, but clean and comfortable. House cleaning is great, love the shower.

Location is excellent, you can walk almost everywhere you want to go in the city. Great steak house next door.

title: Sold us a dream!
text:
Booked online through ‘last minute.com’ first time visiting NYC as a family and I am appalled! 
The lobby is beautiful which draws you in however the rooms we got were awful! Not 4 star at all....
The curtains are dirty, the walls had marks on it, the pillow cases had marks of makeup left on it, the mirror in the bathroom is rusted and the mirror in the room was not cleaned at all and the door in the bathroom needs to be repainted.
I feel that I have wasted 5days here and wasted money that could’ve gone towards a better hotel and a much better room. 

When I put the complaint to the manager they showed me alternative rooms which were EXACTLY the same as the room I currently have and in he exact same state! I felt insulted and quite frustrated as we was on a flight for over 8 hours and it took us over 2 hours to get to the hotel due to traffic. 
I wouldn’t stay here again even if it was free!
They then offered us free breakfast for 1 morning bearing in mind we were there for 5 mornings in total....
1 free breakfast that costs around $28 does not come close to having to stay in the state of room that we we’re in for 5days.

Not happy one bit!

title: A great location for full a New York City experience
text: We stayed at the hotel for my husband’s conference. I like running, the hotel is only a couple of blocks away from Central Park, I had an excellent run there. Columbia University is short subway ride away, and the station is 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Tons of great restaurants within walking distance. The front desk staff and the lobby bartenders are really friendly, a special shout-out to Pasquace at the front deck!!

title: Very well located, friendly staff and clean!
text: Empire hotel is very well located, across Lincoln Center and various restaurants and cafes accesible in the area. Although the room was very small, I was surprised about the cleanliness of the room and bathroom upgrades. The staff is very kind and helpful also. Things to improve: room hearing/ac equipment and offering a coffee maker as a room amenity would be a real plus!

title: Ok hotel
text:
First the good things: Friendly staff and nice location between Midtown and the Upper West Side. Particularly good if you are planning on going to a concert/opera at Lincoln Center as it is right opposite it.
We were given an accessible room  and the size was good, which is pretty rare in New York.
However, the furniture was dated and in some instances broken.  The wardrobe was tiny and the bathroom was in bad condition. The shower wasn't working properly and needed patience and care to make it work.
There is no room service as apparently the restaurant doesn't belong to the hotel. Didn't try the restaurant but had a look and wasn't impressed.
All in all an OK experience, but i  expected a bit more from a 4 star hotel.

title: Mini vacay at The Empire Hotel
text: The  iconic Empire Hotel is a fantastic hotel to stay in for several reasons. The hotel has a fantastic location with transportation very close as well as restarants and coffee shops. It is just a block away from Central Park and across the street from Lincoln Center. When you arrive you immediately feel so welcome because the staff is fantastic from the doormen, front desk, bellman, housekeeping and even the engineer department. They are very friendly and go above and beyond to make sure you are happy with everything in their hotel. The ambiance is lovely and the iconic bar/ restaurant on top is awesome. The rooms are really nice and the beds and bedding are so comfortable. We feel like this is our home away from home especially now since we have stayed there a few times and plan to go back.

title: Fabulous Hotel!
text: One of the best Hotel experiences I have ever had.Truly fabulous. Definitely be back. Such a comfortable and welcoming environment. From the moment I arrived I knew this was a great choice. Fabulous all round experience.

title: Beautiful Empire
text: The Empire Hotel is a magnificent Hotel , with a great location and wonderfull Staff. Very kind, present and always there to help. i will high reccomanded to anyone love the spirit of the upper west side of Ny, Museums, cinemas. Theathers shops .. restaurants are around the corner . Very nice, safe and quite at night. Loved being there.

title: Location, Location Location!
text: Hotel across from Lincoln center is close to shopping, dining, public transportation and entertainment. It is an older building with small bathrooms and very small closets.  However, the room was spotless and the hotel had everything I needed.  I will stay there again.  The few problems I had were promptly addressed by housekeeping.

title: First time in New York and America
text: We booked this hotel through Virgin holidays, who we also booked our trip to New York through. We had never been to New York or America before so were unsure what to expect on both accounts. When we arrived at the hotel, there was a door person to assist with our luggage straight away who took us straight to reception. We were greated warmly at reception and given complementary bottles of water. The room we stayed in had two double beds and a bathroom with a toilet, basin and shower. Although the decor is slightly dated, we could not fault the hotel on cleanliness. The room was cleaned every day, with towels changed every day and the sheets were changed at least once during our stay. The hotel also had a turn down service which was a bonus. As for location, you cannot fault the hotel at all. It was about a 10/15 minute walk to Central Park and about 20/25 minutes to Times Square. We wanted somewhere that was not too central, but not to far out of the action either and this hotel was perfect. Directly surrounding the hotel, there are a number of places to eat and drink, and if you are looking for something quick for breakfast, I would definitely recommend breads bakery which is directly accross the road. The hotel will also store your bags for you on checkout day if needs be. Checkout time is 12pm, and our taxi wasn’t until 1pm so we choose to have one last walk around that morning before it was time to depart to the airport. The hotel was more than happy to keep our bags for us until we returned. Depending on traffic (and New York traffic can be pretty hectic) a ride to the airport can take anywhere from 1 hour to 2 hours. I would 100% recommend this hotel whether it’s your first time in New York or your a regular visitor.

title: Very good locación, nice ambiance and service
text:
Birthday celebration trip with my boyfriend. Very good and practical location near to Central Park, Columbus Circle and 20 min walking from Times Square.
The hotel services are very good as well, lobby bar, rooftop lounge and breakfast.
The rooms are nice! Apart from the room that we were given the 1st/2nd night, which had a problem with the air conditioning system, we tried to turn it off several times but didn't work, it was very noisy and vapor was coming out all night, the technician didn't solve it and was very rude. Fortunately they were lovely at the front desk and they solved the problem efficiently.

title: Wonderful
text:
I arrived at the Empire Hôtel hôtel , after visiting my prior hotel and disappointed... I decided with my friend to try to book a room at the front desk... of the hotel.
14 h flight ... we were so tired . we arrived at the front desk and by chance Pascalle attended us.
He was so friendly, professional and most of all tried to help us. He suggested to book a room via booking as the hôtel was full completely. We got a room with 2 large beds and quite big for New York. Pascalle made everything to make our stay comfortable and pleasant: he also upgraded the room .The hôtel is nice and very close to all places and subway , few minutes from Central Park and around very nice restaurants.
Thank you Pascalle for your excellent service, it was nice meeting you🙏I will definitely return to this hotel and I hope you will be there to attend us...
Very grateful 
Linda Amar

title: Fantastic hotel and great location
text:
I spent a week at The Empire Hotel for business and I thoroughly enjoyed my experience.
I had issues with any aspect of the hotel. New York is an expensive place to stay, so nowhere is going to be great value for money, as you would spend a lot for just a 2* in Midtown.
The location was key for me, very close to Central Park and a few minutes from Metro Subway stations, close to shops. 
A very nice and welcoming hotel lobby and rooms that were perfect for someone travelling solo and on business. 
If you have the budget, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and I would have no issues staying here again.

title: Excellent
text: Nous avons passé un magnifique séjour à NYC. Cet hôtel est le meilleur que j’ai eu l’occasion de tester. Les chambres sont extrêmement confortables et le rooftop magnifique. La situation tion géographique est parfaite

title: Upper West Side Success
text: Great room, great location next door to Lincoln Center, great bar in lobby and a raw bar @ PJ Clark right next door!!! Walk across Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art or down to Times Square and the theatre district. Empire is perfectly located for my taste. Rooms are a bit small but "get over it". Food all over the place and a friendly staff. There is no coffee maker in the rooms a Starbucks around the corner but I prefer the guy on the corner selling coffee from his cart. Parking one block south directly behind the hotel worked very well and a fair price. I'm coming back next Opera Season.

title: Pretty awful
text: It’s nothing fancy. Or posh that’s for sure. It’s a place to lie your tired body down. This was one of the places offered to us at a discount for HSS. It’s not that much of a discount either. Nor close to HSS. It’s a 2 hours walk and 35 minute ride with the traffic. Rugs and window blinds pretty but very very dirty. Very tiny room. Very tiny bathroom. Vanities are cheap wood and tiny being so tiny they should be water proof or steam proof. No coffee station in the hotel. There’s Starbucks next door. Wasn’t an enjoyable place to stay for me at all.

title: Great Room - Great Location
text: I have always liked the hotel because of it's location, convenient to Columbus Circle, Lincoln center, easy access to subways, and close to good restaurants. Their staff has always been very helpful. If there has been any negative it has been the smaller size of the rooms. This time we stayed in a great room, much larger than we had stayed in before and a great value for the money relative to other hotels in the same area. Great stay and quite comfortable.

title: Sick from dirty a/c vents
text: I woke up with a very sore throat and painful sinus.  I checked the a/c unit which was filled with grime and dust.  I was spending the day at auditions with my son - I felt awful the entire day.  Someone needs to check this stuff!!!

title: Excellent Location
text: Great staff, friendly service, nice Rooftop Lounge.  Downstairs restaurant (attached to the hotel) was excellent for late night dinner after the opera.  The best location for Lincoln Performing Arts visit.  Rooms a bit worn and small.  Overall great hotel.

title: Location , Location and Great  Service
text:
This is the closest feeling to " Home away from Home "
Great Hotel, incredibly friendly Staff, no better place I rather be while travelling.
Every time I come to NYC, this is my place of choice.
So conviniently located, near everything you can possibly want, yet , secluded enaough to avoid the crazyness

title: The Empire (Hotel) strikes back
text: Great location. Steps from the Lincoln Centre. Close to Central Park  & Met Museum. Easy subway access to all major attractions. Hotel room style was chic compact modern to match the design decor of the building interior and very quiet. Quality buffet breakfast available. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.

title: Perfect Location for Midtown
text:
We came for a few days and loved it. The lobby and mezzanine is great for checking in to the free WiFi and having a drink. The roof top cafe and bar is great for a view and for breakfast buffet (at usd28)
Our room was nice and big but we had to keep lowering the temperature time and again as it was a bit too hot. 
The location is perfect for visiting midtown museums and the Central Park. All within close proximity. It’s also walking distance to shopping and entertainment at Columbus square or the new Nordstrom.
And it’s right next to Lincolncenter with opera house, ballet and the philharmonic orchestra. Totally perfect!!

title: NYC Lincoln
text:
Exceptional service and room
Great location and value with a very polite friendly staff from the reception to the room attendant .
The helpful doorman and very welcoming attitude was appreciated .
Breakfast was on a rooftop, coffee was hot and smooth .
I would definitely come back. This was my second stay here.

title: Cool Hotel
text: Price are cheap and the structure is very nice. The location it's quite and the close to subway stations. The staff is friendly and the food is pretty good. I suggest it to families and couple looking for a relaxing place.

title: Poor service
text: Ridiculous. I booked a room and canceled it almost immediately using Booking.com and the charged me for the full price if the room. I even asked if I could just have a credit for a future stay and according to Booking.com, "the upper management declined." Completely unreasonable. I'm out about $200 for a room I never stayed in.

title: Lincoln Center Area Gem
text: The Empire Hotel is a wonderful option for a NY stay for Lincoln Center performances as well as a general NYC visit. This was our first time staying there. Great NYC value for room and buffet breakfast. We will return.

title: Very clean, but shabby room
text: I spent 2 nights at the hotel; Staff was pleasant and facility clean.  On the other hand, the room was very shabby, especially the bathroom. The beds were fine, but the bedding was sparse and I needed extra blankets. Nothing felt luxurious here, but everything was adequate.

title: Custo benefício excelente!
text: Hotel bem localizado, ao lado do Linconl, com metro a menos de 50 metros... o quarto é espaçoso e o banheiro tem um tamanho bom. Limpeza ok! Atendimento excelente e o restaurante no rooftop é lindo e a comida deliciosa. A única coisa que me incomodou foi que o ar condicionado fazia muito barulho!

title: Empire Hotel
text: Muy recomendable. Excelente ubicación. Buen servicio. Precio-calidad acorde. Habitación amplia, con todos los servicios. Personal que habla español.  A 3 cuadras del central park. 3 cuadras del metro. Lugares cercanos para comer.

title: Wonderful staff service and great location
text: The Empire Hotel is a very fashionable, stylish hotel that exudes an energy and vitality that reflects its location. The location is wonderful and the staff always happy to assist. After finding our first room was noisy due to air conditioning, we were given a complimentary upgrade to an amazing room by the wonderful Luis. This is a hotel to celebrate in!

title: Sleep well
text:
While there may be a little too much fresh paint here and there and our room did not have a bathroom fan, the staff is very pleasant and the sleep is restful. 

The location is remarkable. Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, Central Park, The Smith for breakfast and Buloud’s bar, epicerie and restaurant. The Subway is also blocks away which is super convenient to get to Times Square and Penn Station.

title: Lovely staff, terrible corporate safety policy
text: I prepaid for three nights but was unable to arrive timely due to hurricane, flash flood, and severe thunderstorm warnings in the area.  Despite the manager being totally lovely and understanding, corporate refused to refund the first night.

title: Great Location
text:
Luis at front desk is awesome!  Our room was musty and without a view but Luis switched us easily to a beautiful room.  I've stayed here a couple of times before; very clean.  They could use more outlets near bedside and better bathroom lighting.  This is a great location-close to subway, Lincoln center, great shopping and many restaurants--and one of the best rooftop bars in NYC!
If you plan on imbibing in your room, however, bring your own glassware!  Bartender in lobby lacked customer service skills.

title: Outstanding Property
text: Gem of a facility in prime location.  We enjoyed the Empire and her charm.  The rooms are smaller (as expected in an earlier NYC hotel but, very well cared for,  Recommend avoiding the Rooftop Breakfast.  Not a god representation of the quality of this hotel.

title: Menos de lo que esperaba
text: Según las fotos, parece una cosa, después es otra. La habitación muy justa, la puerta del baño tocaba con la de salida. La vista de la habitación a las otras habitaciones. Hablan español algunos de los recepcionistas, lo cual fué lo más acogedor de todo el hotel. La wifi da problemas constantemente y por el precio, no incluye desayuno (no es barato). La zona está muy bien y los conserjes de la puerta, amabilísimos. Gastan más en diseño que en espacio. El rooftop cerrado con plásticos aún no haciendo frío.

title: Comfortable overnight stay
text:
Knowing that the cost was almost 1/2 a chain hotel stay, I booked a larger room than I normally do- the junior suite. I thought that booking a larger room may increase my chance of a comfortable room on a higher floor with a good view. I was not wrong.

The room was clean, comfortable bed and pillows, good clean bathroom with all standard amenities and at the end of the hall- quiet (still had some outside noise as expected with any hotel in NYC). There were 2 A/C units in room that provided a good continuous movement of air. I enjoy the white noise of the A/C units as it does help cover street noise easily and helps me sleep better. What was especially nice was the A/C units ran continuously so I didn't wake up like I normally do when typically hotel A/C units kick on and off and yet the temperature stayed constant as well.

The only thing I didn't like was the ironing table. It was one of those little ones you put on top of a regular table. But, there are no regular tables in the room. It made ironing business shirts difficult. Iron itself was fine.

As for the hotel and roof top lounge- clean, nice people, good hot breakfast buffet. I ate "dinner" late because of flight. So, no real entrees, just appetizers. Good food though. Note: no beer on tap.

title: Not very good value for money
text: Stay was just average with lot of niggles (air conditioning, bathroom condition, etc.).  Stayed only one night - so wasn't enough time to complain and get anything fixed.  But certainly not worth the price/night.

title: Worst customer service in NYC
text:
Issues at check in, and getting card holds refunded. Front of house staff and manager aloof, admitted they are doing differently to their hotel policies, but didn’t seem remotely bothered 

No effort at all to help resolve the issue. Plenty of other good hotels in NYC that are easy to stay at

title: Didn’t meet my expectations
text:
Hotel ok, room was tired and in need of a make over. 
Shower curtain in bathroom sticks to you when using the shower.
Tea/Coffee making facilities would be nice.
Noise from street below was loud.
Late checkout was expensive.

title: Another great trip!
text: The Empire hotel does not disappoint.  Traveling from California, early check in was a great add-on - we were able to occupy the room early and the room was wonderful.  The location, great service from the front door to the front desk to the housekeeping staff, all very adept and polite.  We are ready to go again!

title: great staff and FABULOUS location!
text:
It's hard to beat the location of the Empire Hotel in New York City, directly across the street from Lincoln Center, and a few blocks away from Central Park and Columbus Circle. 
The staff was great from making reservations right through to getting our car from the valet. I had a big event nearby and had family coming in for it, and we all decided to stay at the Empire, and everyone was very happy we did.
The rooms and bathrooms are somewhat small and the wifi was out for a little while at night - but the staff apologized and explained they were doing maintenance. The "resort" fee seems a little silly, but in general the price is very competitive for NYC, and for the location, great rooftop bar (a perfect spot for a small party after my event), and the fantastic staff, I know it will be our choice again in the future!

title: A fuir absolument
text:
Hôtel méritant à peine trois étoiles....malgré la bonne volonté de la personne responsable des clients à nous surclasser,il semblerait que cet établissement soit surtout un piège à touristes !!!!hotel extrêmement sale ,chambres détériorées et ménage plus qu’aléatoire...très bruyant du fait d’une climatisation inadaptée ....normes de sécurité inexistantes( fenêtres non condamnées au 10ieme étage!!!)petit déjeuner minable...
J’ajouterai pour finir un manque d’amabilité du personnel de la réception dont l’attitude est ni courtoise ni serviable.

title: Come and Stay
text:
Amazing place, good atmosphere, great staff and best position near by Central Park and very close to Lincoln Center. Room clean 👏🏻
Suggestion: 
- having “aperitivo” in the pool deck
- going to the gym 
- spending relax time in the hall with its charming design

title: Great location, hotel needs a bit of a face lift.
text:
We had a very enjoyable stay at the hotel.  It is literally a 30 second walk from Lincon center, and the 1, 2 and 3 line underneath.  The hotel has a rooftop restaurant/bar, with finger foods and drinks, which were a bit expensive, but par for Manhattan.  Two biggest things:  condition of the rooms and the resort fee.  the rooms, most specifically, the bathrooms, need updating.  Paint is peeling, doors and roughed up, etc.  There are several pictures from other guests, so you can find them on here.  Also, the resort fee is a joke.  I will be challenging them, as $22 for a hotel that does not have a pool open, and I don't intend to use the gym is basically charging you for internet (which they aren't allowed to do) and water.  

OTHERWISE, this was a good, albeit a bit expensive, stay.  If you want access to the Lincoin Center area, I would stay again.

title: Classy & Fun
text: Loved the room, loved the bar and rooftop lounge. The drinks were outstanding. Food was delish. Prices were fair. The bartender at the lobby bar was outstanding, and he even remembered me from a previous trip. The bed was cozy and the room was very quiet. I would highly recommend the Empire!

title: Not worth the cost
text: Upon arrival I requested a room on a higher floor and was told the hotel was sold out which was a lie.Upon entering the room I immediately noticed some small stains and hair on the sheets.  My husband called to inform the front desk and we were quickly moved to a different room which was tiny my husband and myself couldn’t fit in the bathroom together as we needed to get ready for our dinner. we requested a different room because the new room was just to small. The third room was better but the bathroom outlet didn’t work so I had to do my hair in the bedroom. We stay in the city almost every weekend and expect to enjoy our room and hotel amenities. this was a disappointing experience and we will definitely not return for a stay. The manager was also rude he came upstairs to complain about noise when we just returned from dinner in the lounge I felt they were just annoyed because we complained. The security also denied our guests entry because it was after hours which I’ve never experienced. We stay at so many amazing hotels and this one is definitely not on the list. The best part of our stay was the upstairs lounge but I wold not recommend this hotel.

title: Bueno!
text:
Las habitaciones cumplen, pero solo con lo básico de cualquier hotel de su nivel.

Su ubicación excelente, muy cerca del Central Park y del Museo de Historia Natural! 

Las botellas de agua se tienen que solicitar en recepción diariamente ya que no te dejan en la habitación. 

Saludos!

title: Run-down and inadequate information.
text: Beware for 'specials': they still total what the original price is. Location is great, the staff is wonderful. the hotel, past the entry, is very poorly decorated, run-down. Tiny room ($750/2 nights!), a bathroom too small to change your mind in and a 'view of the courtyard....' which doesn't exist. (Room 910) Temp set for 78º day which could not be changed. Enormous equipment noise with the window open for air, stifling when closed.  I was told, by phone, that parking, 'all in' was $55/24hrs no in/out. Understood. At check out we were told it was over $150 incl taxes. "Do you remember the name of the person on the phone you spoke with (last week)?". I thought I did, but that doesn't make it not true! A typical evasive way to deal with this. Yes, I travel a great deal globally and am aware of a wide variety of prices. The location by Lincoln Center couldn't be better which is why we stayed there. but the room given was not the 'view' that had been advertised for this choice and the heat was inexcusable. nice, Fast elevators :-D, great staff all around.

title: Location, location, location!
text: The Empire is across the street from the Met where we went to the Baron Fund Conference on the 25th.  The hotel room was small but the convenience was great, because it was so close. The staff were exceptional from the time we checked in with Emir who was very helpful, polite and patient, to the rooftop bar staff who were exceptionally in their service. Can’t leave out Ray whose friendliness and sense of humor made us all laugh.

title: Do NOT stay here!
text: AWFUL experience. The beds are extremely small and uncomfortable. The room is so gross. Lampshade has a stain all over it. My sheets had a stain. The wood in the bathroom was molded and chipping. By far worst experience.

title: Terrible experience
text: Booked a King bed deluxe room with my partner, we were given 2 separate beds, we were not told about it - with a 10h flight and arrival at midnight it was a very bad surprise. We were promised the room we booked next day and told to pack and store our bags until the room was ready, when we were back to check in to our new room we were told it was not available and that we had to go back to our old room. Terrible experience, over rated over priced terrible hotel. Fortunately we were able to find a much better replacement nearby.

title: Great location marred by poor service and mediocre food
text:
This bar on the top floor of the hotel has some wonderful views. The issues are very inattentive service and appetizers of poor quality. 
They do have happy hour pricing but getting service is clearly an issue. I would return except for the very careless manner in n which it runs. I am frankly surprised that this place functions at all. The personal  here  are hired  firvtge it looks snd certainly not fir brains. Very disappointing

title: Lipstick on a pig
text: Great reception area that’s it , room are stylishly decorated to within an inch of their life but entirely dysfunctional , street noise is continuous service is slow , renovated recently on a low budget, cheap and a bit nasty

title: Gem in NYC
text:
From the moment you walk in you know this is not a typical hotel.  The atmosphere is one that you don't see in a chain hotel.  There is a New York posh feel, but not stuffy.  It looks like a lobby is supposed to look.  Inviting and not just the 1st floor.

I stayed in a Junior Suite, so I cannot complain about space, though I chose this to have plenty of room.  The bed was comfortable and the furniture was a nice change of pace.  The only downside is that the desk is directly below the TV.  It's uncomfortable to work on a laptop and watch, so I just turned the TV off.  There is noise from the street, but my room was facing Broadway, so honking can be expected at all times of day.

The food options are limited, but you are in New York City.  Finding a restaurant is not a problem.  You can always order in if you don't mind going to the lobby for a pickup.  Overall, I would stay here again.  But, these rooms are not for families.

title: Excelente ambientación y atención
text:
Hermoso hotel, buena ubicación, excelente atención, quiero destacar la atención de Luis y Danny, pase hermosos días y seguramente voy a volver! El barrio en que se encuentra es hermoso, un Starbucks’s en la esquina, Walgreens, Best Buy..
Enfrente de Dante Park, y el Lincoln Center, a dos cuadras del Central Park, y 3 de Columbus Circle! 
Excelente rooftop y bar! 
Me encantó!!! 
Viaje con mi hija, que veía Gossip Girl y estaba emocionada de estar ahí!

title: Very Nice Quiet Hotel
text: Terrific service from the doormen, front desk, and housekeeping. Very clean, very fair price, and PJ Clarke’s (adjacent bar and restaurant) was terrific service and very good food. Excellent experience and I’ll definitely be back.

title: Probably one of the worst hotels in the world.... Watch out for the obviously fake reviews!
text:
Would give a zero if I could, the lobby and position of the hotel is lovely.... and misleading the reception area was filled with guests complaining, the expensive rooms were tiny, dark and unclean even toilets had not been flushed, hair-clips on window sills, carpets old worn and grotty not at all like the pictures on the website. 

Its noisy (not the usual noise from New York City Streets or even other guests) but the  humongous cluster of ancient AC units outside the windows that were so earsplittingly loud they sounded like aircraft engines and literally shook the rooms. 
 The hotel is very aware of the problem which looking on this site it was reported in 2017. It is now 2019. 

They thoughtfully use the tiny rooms and noise problems to scam unfortunate guests into paying for different rooms - which was as noisy as the first! Just more expensive.... Other family members were shown different rooms and suffered the same fate.  

Upon joining the unhappy throng of disappointed guests to complain, we met a delightful female manager who along with being generally unhelpful aggressively claimed that she "did not build the hotel" refused to refund so we could book elsewhere (we had only spent one hour in the filthy building) . Our first night of a family holiday in New York was ruined along with lots of other guests so very surprised to see any good trip adviser scores I can only assume they were written and paid for by the hotel to scam the unwary traveller.

title: Empire Hotel!
text: Beautiful and friendly atmosphere and it truly felt like a get away from heaven! The roof top lounge was amazing, drinks were delicious and my girlfriend and I had totally complete silence, which is the main thing we were looking for

title: Family Trip to NYC
text: Our experience with Empire Hotel was superb!
