When we got to the hotel we realized our room was small for our family of four so we requested that we change rooms to a bigger room and the front desk-- Jeffrey to be exact was very helpful. He showed us other options right away and we changed room. Althought the room design was abit dated, the cleanliness was on point. The bellhop, housekeeping and everyone was very polite and helpful as well. Even the hotel manager was very personable, extremely helpful and service oriented. Aside from the service, its location to all the places we wanted to go to was easy. Central park was only a few blocks away! We loved our stay so much we booked our last leg of the trip with this hotel again.

title: Lovely hotel, great location
text:
Check in was very quick and easy when we arrived and we had Queen rooms booked which were small but enough room for 2 people. The room had a massive flat screen TV, fridge, hair dryer, iron and ironing board and the alarm clock had USB charging points in it which I used to charge my smart watch and phone each night. The small clothes hanging area is in beside the safe and fridge and was ok for shirts etc but no good for long maxi dresses which had to hang over the edge as they were too long for the space - no great inconvenience.   

The bed was comfortable and everything worked as it should but the noise from the AC system was deafening at times. My husband had to wear ear plugs but I was so tired from the walking I managed just fine.  The bathroom was very small but the shower was large and really powerful which I've never experienced in the States before. Bathroom was a bit tired and could do with a revamp but was clean.  Housekeeping in general was very good, room was cleaned, towels restocked, never ran out of toiletries etc.  They give you soap, shampoo, conditioner and body wash in the bathroom.

We used the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast most mornings which is $25 per person for a buffet breakfast which includes the usual continental items such as cereals, fruits, pastries etc but there are also hot options such as french toast, pancakes, sausages, eggs and bacon and there is an omelette station too. We were very happy with the quality of the breakfast items and the view out of the restaurant is amazing.

Hotel was close to a couple of subway stations as well as some lovely restaurants and was only a block away from Central Park. Having a Starbucks next door is a big plus for us too - we love a wee coffee in our rooms at the end of a long day.  

We were travelling in a group of 3 couples, we had no issues with our room (apart from AC noise) but one couple's AC didn't work but they spoke with reception and it was fixed very quickly. The other couple had an issue with their TV remote and again it was fixed very quickly - no complaints about the service.  

I certainly would stay here again - but make sure we request a quieter room :)

title: Exclente
text: Ubicación privilegiada, el personal muy amable, limpieza, la habitación muy linda,la terraza es espectacular, recomiendo 100%, tuve una experiencia muy buena con el hotel!La pileta algo chica pero se puede aprovechar, en la noche se puede disfrutar tomando algo viendo NY de ensueño...

title: Lousy
text: I arrived at the hotel at 630 pm.  My room was NOT READY.  No offer of a drink at the bar while I waited almost 45 mins for the room to be available.   Bathroom needs a complete redo.  Don't work out in the fitness center.  The smell of mold is OVERWHELMING and the treadmill shuts off repeatedly during attempt at a workout.  Turn the heat down.

title: Great location
text: We stayed here for 4 nights. The room was fairly small but very clean. The room had a safe, small hanging space, hair drier, tv, iron and ironing board & AC. The AC was really quite loud during the night but we were so tired we were able to sleep through it. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar has nice views and good cocktail menu. Great location beside the Lincon Centre and with a short walk to Central Park and subway. Would stay here again.

title: review
text:
no working blow dryer
ac unit noise level unbearable, 
rooms are very small
overall experience diminished by no response to obtain a dryer and very loud and barely functional ac unit. good rooftop bar and location.

title: Don't Go!
text:
If you want a room where you sleep next to the equivalent of a jumbo jet's motor then this is the place for you. The room was right next to the hotel's engine room.  I complained and they told me to go to the shop next door and buy some ear plugs!!!!!!!!!  The roof top is good though.  They advertise a pool but check that it has water in it at the time you have booked for. Wasn't in use when I was there even though it was hot. All the staff that rely on tips are absolutely delightful.  The others are fair to woeful. 
My new room's air-conditioning was hot in the night and freezing during the day.  A technician came but didn't fix it.  I got fed up with complaining and decided to give up getting my phone and my air-conditioning fixed and concentrated on having a good time and finding another hotel to stay in.   GO TO THE BEACON HOTEL ON BROADWAY AND 83 STREET.  IT IS FANTASTIC.  EVERYTHING WORKS AND ALL THE STAFF IRRESPECTIVE OF WHETHER THEY RELY ON TIPS ARE WONDERFUL.  It doesn't have a roof top but the rooms are bigger and cleaner with a small kitchenette and the evening bar is great with good bar food.  Ask for a room facing Broadway and away from the elevators.   It is also in a great area across the road from the famous Fairway Supermarket and with lots of cafes nearby.  It is one block from 72 station which has express trains which is a real advantage.

title: UN DESASTRE
text: Hace diez dias, tenia una reserva via Expedia, puse una tarjeta de credito en garantia, meses de anticipacion, y cuando llego me dicen, RESERVA CANCELADA, intentaron cobrar la reserva 20 dias antes,  las personas que me atendieron muy mal, maleducadas, groseras. Un hombre calvo y una mujer morena. Ambos groseros respondian sin siquiera mirar a los ojos. Expedia me pidio disculpas y termine en el Sheraton Time Square diez puntos. Habia ido antes. Jamas volvere.

title: Good value for excellent location for Lincoln Center
text: We go to the Metropolitan Opera a few times a year and always stay at the Empire. Excellent value for the location, always clean and the staff is always very helpful and welcoming. We don’t see a reason to stay anywhere else.

title: Recommended, both the hotel and the rooftop bar
text: I stayed here for three nights.  Staff was very friendly, got us into our room before lunch on check in-day. Great location, right across the street from Lincoln Center.  Room was quite large for NYC.  They offer same day laundry which I enjoy. The lobby bar is nice but the hidden gem in the rooftop bar, it’s a great spot.  Groovy retro feel and look, partially open air.  Solid cocktail served, staff seemed pleasant.  Had a rooftop yoga thing happening in the mornings.

title: Hotel Empire
text: This hotel is in the best location in Manhattan, many of restaurants near by and directly across from the Lincoln center, access to the subway and walking distance to Columbus circle and the Hudson river.

title: Empire Hotel
text: The Empire Hotel is still a great place for conferences and convenient to Lincoln Center and Broadway. I enjoyed my stay, with only one exception: the heating and cooling system needs work. P. J. Clarke’s is a wonderful restaurant for dinner. The Rooftop Lounge is delightful.

title: Wonderful, Wonderfuk
text:
The Empire Hotel is fantastic, the location near Lincoln Center is ideal.  I have stayed several times and have booked 3 more in the coming months. The rooftop is amazing with beautiful views and attentive staff.  Valet parking is an added plus, and once after driving  away, I realized that I had left my phone in the room. I drove back and the doorman told me to stay in my car and he retrieved it for me.  That is extraordinary service.
The room is comfortable and nicely appointed and I had a refrigerator for my meds,
Check-in and out is super easy and the agents are most kind,

title: Renovated lobby
text: This hotel is in a great upper west side location.  Right across the street from the Lincoln Center and very close to several good restaurants and close enough to other good UWS restaurants and attractions.   We were happy to see that the lobby and mezzanine were redecorated.  Although the rooms are cozy (read small), if offers good value for the price.  And if you require more room book a deluxe king.

title: Bien situado, falta de mantenimiento
text: El hotel tiene muy buena situación, en zona tranquila pero a la vez muy céntrico. La habitación justa de tamaño, el baño excesivamente pequeño,  ducha muy complicada de manejar y con falta de mantenimiento. En general  el hotel se ve antiguo  y un poco abandonado. En la recepcion no fueron especialmente amables, dejemoslo en correctos.

title: Travel with Grandson
text: The hotel is very comfortable. We enjoyed the roof top very much, and the lobby bar with it's small plates.  The location is great, because we could walk to many things, and there are two metro stops very close by.

title: Noisy and unclean
text: Staying at The Empire Hotel was so noisy, it felt like you were sleeping on the street, we did ask to move to a quieter part of the hotel but the staff weren't very helpful or accommodating at all even though the housekeeping told us other rooms were available in the quieter part of the hotel. The bathroom was unclean with mould on the shower screen and bath, there were toiletries for only 1 person even though there were 3 people in the room. the curtains were badly stained as was the bedsheet and my daughter was bitten after sleeping in one of the beds. I also noticed they over charged us as we have a food bill for the lounge which we never ordered, so overall very poor. Lastly we had problems as we couldn't get wifi in our room, we wasted a lot of our time having to wait in our room for it to be fixed eventually two days later they fed a wire from the hallway with the router hanging from the wire and balanced it behind our door.

title: Great stay & location
text: This hotel is wonderful for the explorer type and Gossip Girl fanatic. Overall a great stay. Very close to Times Square, Central Park and next to a couple really good food stops. If you want to explore more it's also very close to the subway. I would also recommend going to the rooftop at night for drinks and a late night snack.

title: Nice, comfortable and friendly staff!!!
text:
Nice Staff, Excelent location, near Central Park, Columbus Circle and lots of shop!
Special thanks to Maggi... friendly, Nice and cordial!
Recommend...clean, quiet and very nice Hotel! Our home in NYC...

title: Swanky digs and central location
text: Hotel decor is tres chic, prices awesome, location central to the best of the city. Empire Rooftop serves magnificent views of the city, great food and drinks on comfy leather couches. Staff pamper you and coffee magnifico, too! Make a weekend of it.

title: Great hotel just across from Lincoln Center
text: My wife and I have stayed at the Empire Hotel twice now when traveling to see the Met Opera at Lincoln Center. It's reasonably priced for its location. The rooms are nicely appointed and the staff is friendly and helpful.

title: Buon Soggiorno
text:
Ho soggiornato 6 giorni, nella Junior Suite King, stanza ampia, pulita, letto molto comodo, dock station con sveglia e carica usb molto comoda.
La posizione è fantastica, giri New york a piedi!!!
Migliorabile nei dettagli, ad esempio le lampade sui comodini erano di basso livello,  nel bagno nella vasca in un albergo  di questo livello ( in una junior suite )non mi aspetto la tendina.  
Ad ogni modo consiglierei questo albergo e ci tornerò sicuramente.
Piccola pecca, potevano avvisare che mi avrebbero addebitato 25 euro di commissioni per cambio valuta.

title: Comfortable and classic
text: Hello, my wife and I spent a total of 10 days at the Empire Hotel. First of all, I have to say that we felt very comfortable there and recommend the hotel to everyone. The hotel and decor has come down a bit but it has a little more charm. The rooms are clean and the staff is really more than friendly. We had two special concerns and they were both fulfilled. Especially Nohan, the friendly front desk manager, was very accommodating and gave a lot of good tipss for our stay. The location is perfect, you are not right in the loud core of the city but can also have its peace. You get along well everywhere.

title: Location isn’t everything
text: Perfect location, nice lobby, easy check in. However, room too hot, room looked into air shaft above center air conditioning machinery. Constant loud din. Blanket too heavy and hot with nothing in between. For the price, even in NYC, a beautiful lobby doesn’t make up for those conditions in the room.

title: Pretty good - not great
text: This is a 3 star hotel directly across from the Lincoln Center and 3 blocks from Columbus Circle.  15 min walk to Times Square, 1 block to Central Park.  Surrounded by good restaurants.  The staff is great, professional and friendly.  The decor of the hotel can be described in a lot of ways - eclectic, odd, bizarre, ugly?  Rooms are NYC small, although comparable to the competition.  It's not great value for money, but not bad either.  You just have to get your head around that in NYC $200 doesn't get you the same as in a lot of other places.  Some details of the finish were shoddy - the bathroom door had been repaired with drywall mud or wood putty and not sanded, as had a large section in the main room.  Not terrible, just not quite the quality of details I would expect.  Internet was variable - sometimes great other times not.  Would I stay here again - I would probably try to find somewhere else to try.

title: Great staff and location, but a little tired
text:
We stayed here as part of a package with TUI and while the photos show it as quite glamorous,  the rooms and decor are a little dated.  We had booked a twin queen room,  but on arrival were shown to the smallest room I have ever seen with a single queen bed squeezed in.  Needless to say, we turned straight around and spoke to reception,  who confirmed we had in fact been booked into a queen room as per the request from TUI.  There was no problem upgrading and luckily they had a junior suite available, which is what we wanted in the first place.  I Can't fault the staff as they were always friendly and very helpful.  

The location is very good and for first time New Yorkers like ourselves, wasn't too much of an assault on the senses.  We arrived late on the first day due to customs taking 3 hours!  Yes, 3 hours at JFK.    Anyway,  by the time we arrived and were able to sort out our room,  we were so tired,  we just wanted somewhere local to have a bite to eat.  Luckily,  there is an American style restaurant just on the corner called PJ Clarkes and we had a very pleasant beer and a burger.  The next morning we had breakfast just across the road at The Smith,  which has great reviews and while we were there was always very busy.  If you're staying in the area,  I would suggest you eat here at least once as the food is excellent and sets you up for the day. 

Finally,  if you need a quiet room to sleep,  I would s suggest staying somewhere where the air conditioning isn't so loud.  My wife had to were eat plugs it was that loud.  I find it hard to believe that you can go to what are considered 2nd world countries and they have whisper quiet air con and this hotel has what sounded more like an industrial fridge rattling around in the background!

title: Fall Week in New York
text: Found this hotel on a recommendation from someone that works at Lincoln Center. We were going to New York to see an Opera and a Broadway show. It is literally across the street and very convenient. Really nice hotel. It was clean and well maintained. The room was very nice. The building is old but it is kept in excellent condition. The staff was friendly and helpful.I will most definitely stay here again.

title: Very friendly staff, good base for NY visit!
text: Only stayed for 2 nights, but the visit was well worth the money. The hotel is located on a key spot in Manhattan, walking distance from Central Park, Columbus Circle and the Lincoln Center (Opera, Ballet, Music). I especially liked the friendliness and flexibility of the staff (reception, restaurant, etc). For example: I lost my keycard, and it was no hassle getting it replaced, in 3 minutes I had a new one. My room wasn't big, but that is no problem; I was only there to sleep. Bathroom ok - very good 'rain shower'. One thing for improvement: the airconditioing is old and its noise can be a nuisance. Tip: bring earplugs (which I always have with me during traveling)

title: Cool hotel
text: The Hotel Empire is right in the middle of everything we wanted do do in NYC. Close to the park, museums, Times Square, etc.. The decor is funky and hip, not at all boring. The bellmen at the front door are extremely helpful and friendly. Overall a great stay.

title: Over priced
text: Check-in was poor. Staff left me standing for 5 mins while she went somewhere with no explanation and no apology when she returned. Rooms do not have coffee makers and there is no coffee in the lounge. Rooms do not have functioning thermostats. Location is great for Lincoln Center but that's about the hotel's only virtue.

title: A bit shabby.
text: Stayed on the first floor with inward facing room. The noise from the industrial ventilation system which was outside our windows was completely unacceptable. Exit to roof top bar needs a bit of a refresh. Staff were very friendly.

title: Great hotel, stunning rooftop bar and close to Central Park!
text: Lovely hotel, comfortable bed and quiet (even for Manhattan!). The roof-top bar has wonderful views and position for sunsets. Close to Central Park and north Manhattan. Times Square in walking distance. Across the road from one of the best restaurants - The Smith!

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC!
text: LOVE the location - right across from Lincoln Center!  Well appointed room and very friendly, helpful staff. This is our go-to hotel for our yearly New York City adventure. The rooftop lounge has an amazing view!  We’ll be back....

title: A bad experience
text: On a positive note the hotel is in a great location in front of the Metropolitan Opera. The room is in serious need of updates and the carper was dirty. The heating/cooling unit was very outdated, had buttons which did not function. In my last night the cooling unit stopped working, began to heat in a dangerous way and the temperature in the room rose to 85 degrees. The technician fixed it but he did not clean the filter that was completely dirty and could be the cause of overheating.

title: Definitely recommend!
text: The hotel has a great location. All workers were very nice and friendly. The room was clean, quiet, it was pretty small but we had everything we needed there. We sure enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Definitely recommend!

title: No coffee in room or in hotel and no room service
text: This pricey hotel has a cool lobby bar and rooftop bar but otherwise, skip it. Tiny bathrooms, small rooms, dark, claustrophobic hallways with strange wallpaper that makes you feel uneasy. Staff doesn't seem to know what is going on when you ask questions. No coffee machine in rooms and no free coffee anywhere in hotel and no room service....big mistake.

title: A gem of a hotel thanks to fantastic staff.
text: Highly recommend this hotel. I don’t often write reviews, but when I do it’s to celebrate a real find. Our exceptional experience here was due to the outstanding staff. From the moment we arrived, I felt welcomed and appreciated. Lovely Maggi at the front desk is the epitome of graciousness. You knew right away you were in the good hands of someone who really cared about you and making you feel comfortable. Her natural elegance elevated the check-in experience. I also enjoyed the humor and courtesy of Chris at the front desk that morning. We came in after a red-eye which can be a grind. The professionalism and personal touch of each member of the staff helped start my stay in New York off right. Eugene at the front door was the personification of hospitality. He continued to be a valuable resource for me throughout my stay – recommending some outstanding options for morning coffee and other helpful answers to my many questions. Best of all, when I needed some service outside of his hours on duty (like car service for our trip to the airport), he connected me with his colleagues Brandon who, along with Naz, continued the standard Eugene set for me of excellent service from the Empire Hotel staff. The hotel building is over 100 years old and I enjoyed the charm of the vintage touches. The pushbuttons inside the elevators have a patina that remind you of all the history in the building. The main lobby is dark and cool (perhaps in keeping with the bar area it encloses), but still comfortable with lots of seating and a grand staircase to the mezzanine. Our 6th floor room was cozy, but included a large bed, dresser, desk, and two chairs. I loved the bold choice of the dark print wallpaper in the hallways. Our room had a big window with a nice view of the street. I never heard noise from adjacent rooms and only the occasional activity in the hallways. The bathroom had a terrific shower! It had both an overhead rain-shower and hand-held wand options. Not much counterspace around the sink, but lots of shelf space nearby. There was a small refrigerator in the closet. Also in the closet – a sturdy full-size umbrella the hotel provides for you to use during your stay (you can take it home for an additional $30 charge to your room). No in-room coffee, but you do get two free bottles of Fiji water each day (which you pick up yourself from the front desk). An innovation I really enjoyed was the magnetized “do not disturb/please make up the room” sign. You just stick it on the outside of your door with the appropriate message facing out. No more annoying door-hanging signs fluttering away when you close the door. Be sure to visit the rooftop restaurant!! Stunning views from multiple levels. Coffee and a menu as well as a full bar. The Empire Hotel location is outstanding – across the street from Lincoln Center and a Duane Reade drugstore right around the corner. We had terrific meals at restaurants on the same block. You can quickly connect to all the city has to offer via close by subway or a cab. A tiny park across the street is a welcome oasis when you want a break. The Empire Hotel is a gem that shines bright thanks to the good people who work there.

title: Nice room.  Noisy hallways. Ugly hallway decor.
text:
Nice but noisy hallways. Doors constantly slamming all night.

 Comfortable bed. Nice shower. Plenty of hot water. Good for an overnight stay. Decent price.  

Hallway decor is disgusting. Loud and distracting.

title: Great location and staff
text: Our last stay at the Empire was highlighted by excellent service and attentive staff.  After a long couple of days moving a family member, we arrived late to helpful valet and door staff, as well as a very kind front desk representative who upgraded our room and went out of her way to take care of our family.  We have had spacious and quiet rooms every time we stay at the Empire, with fabulous views!

title: Excellent West Side Hotel
text: We have had a thoroughly enjoyable few nights stay at this hotel. It is modern, comfortable, attractive and ideally situated to explore the New York City attractions. It also has a great roof top bar and outside roof area. Its situation on W 63 St is located close to the Lincoln Center and nearby subway stations. Front of desk representative Pasquale was particularly helpful to us

title: August Break!
text:
We stayed in NYC for two weeks this summer mostly visiting friends but wanted a few nights with a pool in a good location so our boys who are 6 and 9 could take a dip to escape the heat. Entrance and doormen were very lovely and welcoming, great lobby and a good start to our stay. We were given a very nice room overlooking the street with a slight view of central park and lovely buildings opposite. Bathroom was smallish but nice enough. The pool however was disappointing. We all laughed out loud when we first saw it as it was much smaller than we had anticipated but was happy enough and not overly surprised as the hotel seemed good value for a pool and the UWS location. Annoyingly however the pool had such high levels of chlorine that after half an hour on day 1 our eldest son couldn't even swim in it as his eyes stung so badly. Throughout the day other children visited the pool and complained of the same thing-burning and stinging eyes. It was so bad that their eyes totally puffed up and they didn't even want to go in it. You could smell it strongly on their swimwear. We did complain about it to the pool attendant but nothing was done. it remained that way throughout our stay. Although sadly, he was filling in for someone else apparently so he was pretty disinterested. Such a shame as that was the point of us staying in a hotel and not with friends. 
The deck itself was small but fine and the bar/roof top was very nice with fantastic views and helpful staff. All in all I would recommend this hotel but do not book here for the pool, especially if it's for children. It's fine if you literally want a plunge pool to cool down in.

title: One of the best
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights. 
First impressions of this lovely hotel was good, looked a little shady from the outside, but when you walk in, you are greeted by a concierge who welcomes you, the inside is very modern at looks exclusive. Front desk personal are helpful og and very nice. You get a free Fiji water every day!! 
The hotel position is great, nearby subway will take you any where, at is minutes from the hotel. Central Park and Columbus cirkel is right outside. Great area. 
We got an upgrade on our room, so we got at superior room with 2 queen size beds 👍🏻👍🏻. Unfortunately there is a big noisy ventilation-tube right out side our window. The staff was understanding and offered us a new room. 👍🏻. 
The bathroom could use and major update. 

I would definitely stay here again. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. 👍🏻👍🏻🇺🇸

title: Where to start
text:
Four star but should be three stars. It took us 3 attempts to get a decent room. The first room was the size of half a shoe box with a night stand that kept toppling over. Room 2 was bigger but was like being in the bowels of a ship with a horrendous noise from a kitchen extractor fan and sewage coming out of the bath tap. Room 3 was passable, that's the best I can say. The internet is NON existent in the rooms.
The roof terrace is nice but you get told repeatedly that ALL the tables are reserved. The only good thing about this place is it's proximity to the Lincoln Center and Central Park.

title: Not TOTR, but great still.
text: Think of New York, think of the Empire State Building, and rightly so. Although not as tall as expected and the views not as spectacular as the TOTR, the ESB us still a must when it comes to NYC. Unfortunately you can't do the button pressing scene from Elf as you go up in different elevators, but the build up and views are worth a journey.

title: excellent hotel in lovely neighbourhood
text: really enjoyed the stay, very nice hotel, lovely rooftop bar, excellent service ! would definitely say there again, lots of restaurants in the area, subway only a few steps away... lovely Lincoln Center just behind the corner, very nice

title: Run down
text: Very good service. Hotel is in desperate need of renovation. Location is excellent. Staff is very good. The condition of the hotel is deteriorating. They no longer have coffee pots in the rooms which is totally unacceptable.

title: Kelly and Ryan show
text:
Overall the Hotel was expensive, but that is expected for NY. The rooftop very nice view.
We had 2 drinks only and price was $40. Bathroom was not comfortable. couldn't figure out the shower set up and the sink was designed with not much space between the faucet and the basin.

title: Racist hotel‼️‼️‼️‼️‼️
text: The Hotel security Manager is racist and a coon do not ‼️‼️ Stay here unless you are white ‼️‼️‼️ I was told my guess should’ve went to the hood hotel ‼️‼️‼️... this not the hood ‼️‼️ Embarrassing disrespectful he followed me in the elevator he is a Disgrace he got us kicked out ‼️‼️ Over nothing ‼️‼️‼️ He refused to leave us alone ‼️‼️‼️‼️ Every 5 mins he knocked on the door 🚪 making things up we had no music playing no more we were playing truth or dare ‼️‼️ This was a ugly 2 bedroom suite no Microwave horrible ‼️‼️

title: Oy!
text:
I can’t say I was disappointed in this hotel, because I had read the comments on TripAdvisor before arrival (someone else booked for me) and was warned. But I can say that everything negative that has been written about this hotel is true – and more.

I was originally given a room with an air conditioner that did not function. But it was the middle of the summer! The temperature outside was 35 degrees celsius / 90 Fahrenheit. The room needed a functioning air conditioner desperately. The curtains were torn and the shades were broken. Not good for a room full of afternoon light. I complained, but was told there were no other rooms, I complained louder – and they relented, but only when someone went up to see if I was telling the truth. Go figure.

The rest of this review is about the new (second) room and the hotel itself.

There is Good, there is a lot of Bad and some Ugly.

THE GOOD: The lobby is spacious and quite hip in its tackiness. I liked the lobby bar, although expensive, and they don’t offer complimentary peanuts or pretzels.  You have to buy snacks and that, too, is pricey, but all in all, it was a comfortable place to hang out in and have a drink after a busy day. 

Most of the receptionists were quite nice – if you weren’t complaining. Unfortunately there was so much to complain about that in the end it tried their nerves and mine. But there were a couple who kept their cool and remained charming.

The location is excellent. My room looked out over Lincoln Center.

Once I finally got a room with a functioning air-conditioner, the air conditioner worked fine and was not at all loud, thank goodness.

The bed was great, as well as the assortment of pillows.

My room was spacious (it was more expensive than a standard double, a Deluxe King).

Housekeeping did a good job.

THE BAD: The roof-top bar was extremely loud and crowded. It was hard to carry on a conversation. The pool was tiny. Actually, ridiculous.

The rooms I and my friends occupied were VERY tired, almost shabby. The switch on the standing lamp was broken, so it was hard to turn on and off. The window shades were hard to pull up and down, but they did work. The furniture was chipped, the rug had stains, the bathroom is tiny and there is very little shelf space. The safe was placed at the bottom of the night table, cramped in between the bed and the window. You had to get down on your knees to open it and put things in. Very uncomfortable. 

THE UGLY:

The windows were filthy!

The Internet was a joke and was integrated into the stupid resort fee of $25.00 a day! The Internet was sloooow and I and my friends were continually, any time of day or night, bumped out – right in the middle of reading something or writing an email or whatever. We complained. And complained. And finally they did not charge us the resort fees.

All in all: if I didn't have to, I wouldn't come here again. It was chosen because it was a five-minute walk from where we had to be and was reasonably priced. But in the end, I would rather pay a bit more and feel like the owner of the hotel really cared.

title: Gute zentrale Lage
text:
Waren 1 Woche im Hotel Empire. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich & hilfsbereit. Täglich kann man 2 kleine Flaschen Wasser bei der Rezeption holen. Die Lage ist super. 
Leider hat es einige negative Punkte:
-kleine Zimmer / sehr kleines Bad (jedoch nomal für NY)
-sehr laute Klimaanlage im Zimmer
-Klimaanlage funktioniert nicht richtig
-Kühlschrank vorhanden, funktionierte auch nicht
-Zimmer ohne Aussicht (Innenhof)/ dh. Preis- Leistung stimmt absolut nicht
-Pool/Dachterasse war jeden Tag geschlossen, obwohl wir bis 32°C hatten, nur die Rooftop Bar war offen. Man kann die Aussicht nicht geniessen - ohne etwas zu konsumieren

... mache sonst immer Fotos vom Hotelzimmer, diesmal kein einziges... dass bedeutet schon was..:) greiffe das nächste mal noch tiefer in die Tasche...

title: Great location, not a great hotel
text: My granddaughter and I stayed at the Empire hotel because we were attending the NYC Ballet.  The room was a “Superior double bedded bedroom”....hardly superior, very mediocre.  Very dark, one lamp in the room, 75o and could not adjust temp.  Bathroom very tired and really no amenities.  Staff was great.   Fairly expensive for one night.

title: Classy hotel in premier location!
text: Opera fans take note!  Top your evening off after the performance at the Lincoln Center with a First Class night if sleep. Be sure to stop by the beautiful rooftop restaurant before or after the show for the stunning views and ultra cool vibes.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This has been my third stay at the Empire Hotel and I have to say, from the moment you check in, the staff are fantastic, the rooms are clean and lovely, the showers are the best, the products they give you make you feel like you are at a spa, the housekeeping is kind and helpful. I highly recommend staying here.

title: Location, Large Rooms & Staff Outstanding Property!
text: While working at Lincoln center my company selected the Empire due to its location was across the street. I generally stay when in NY on the UWS this was perfect! Close to everything! Without that overwhelming sense of a touristy area. The rooms are large I had upper level and a great view of Lincoln Center The staff were amazing unlimited bottle waters at the desk kind fast professional service at every hour it was a pleasure to be a guest at their property. Door people were attentive helpful and extremely pleasant. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return. Great bakeries coffee restaurants and drug store within steps of the hotel. Uber and cabs available quickly at all times. Great experience!

title: Tolles Hotel mit Charme
text:
Das Empire Hotel habe ich aus Serienfan Gründen gebucht. Es hat mich soo sehr an „Gossip Girl“ erinnert. Der Check in und check out verliefen reibungslos. Das Zimmer ist sehr geräumig und ich hatte einen tollen Blick zum Metropolitan Museum of Art. Das Personal war auch sehr freundlich. Direkt nebenan findet man einen Starbucks und kann sich toll in die Sonne setzen zum genießen der Umgebung.
Auch die Subway Station (66th Street) ist nur 3 Minuten zu Fuß weg. 
Kann das Hotel empfehlen.

title: The Empire Hotel Manhattan Ny
text:
El hotel presenta una ubicación inigualable 
Pero el mobiliario como la silla del cuarto roto , las cortinas gruesas sucias e igual la Black out .  La puerta del baño por dentro muy maltratada .
Se ve que tiene sus años .  Que pena que lo estén dejando caer

title: Comodo, piacevole e bello
text:
Hotel bello, pulito comodo e al centro di tutto.
Nota di pregio il Sign. Pasquale che ci ha fatto sentire come a casa non facendoci mancare nulla.
Stanze un po' piccole ma veramente belle e pulite.
Utile la sveglia con porte usb per ricarica smartphone che vi eviterà di portare adattatori di alimentazione corrente

title: Fall Trip
text: Wonderful location, easy access to shopping, subway, taxis etc. The lobby is chic and rooftop lounge served delicious food. Very friendly staff. Clean room. Bed is very firm, but bedding is comfortable.

title: Good location
text:
Overall we had an amazing time in New York! We spent very little time in the hotel.

The staff st the hotel and the bar and rooftop area are definitely worth a visit. 

The only downside is that the rooms were extremely small and the air conditioning was soooo noisy! 

The breakfast was also not great, it was like warm

title: Great little jewel
text: This hotel is the west option in the opera district. Surrounded by great restaurants and cafes, try Cafe Fiorello’s Bar across the street! Clean rooms, friendly staff and reasonably priced for NYC.. additionally it has a very happening rooftop with a swimming pool, which is very rare in New York City. An absolute plus. Highly recommended it

title: Bello ma..
text: hotel pulito e carino, staff gentile e molto disponibile. nel prezzo del soggiorno è compresa una bottiglia d'acqua fiji che vi consegneranno ogni mattina facendo vedere la tessera alla reception, ma data la hall molto bella e curata, la location usata per Gossip Girl, mi aspettavo la stessa cosa per le camere. (piccole e "vecchie")

title: Great hotel with superb staff
text:
Had a wonderful few days here.  Room was spacious and bright and clean.  Comfortable bed with nice bed linens.  Front desk staff were incredibly nice and helpful.  My only negative comments are:
1. the pool area..  the reason I chose the hotel was because there was a pool with loungers to relax by.  But there was very loud music playing continually so I couldn’t use this area.  What a pity.  It could be so nice up there.  My friend and I went up to have lunch but didn’t stay because of the loud music.  I understand having music in the bar on the floor below, but why not make the pool area peaceful and relaxing?  Surely It’s what people need in a busy city like NY?
- Twice I found a small cockroach in my bathroom.  The bathroom and bedroom were very clean so cleanliness wasn’t an issue, but the hotel needs to do something about its pest control.  I don’t want this to spoil my review as I was very happy in the hotel (apart from the pool). But just something they need to deal with.

title: Is this renovation?
text: Poorest quality renovation both in terms of decoration and amenities! Tinny rooms, poorly decorated with no taste or intention. Room light switch hard to access; door could not be open as it hit the closet which displayed deep scratches in its poor quality. (forget wood!). Actually the doors of the closet could not fit to close completely.

title: Beautiful and clean hotel/terrible bar service
text: The hotel and rooms are very clean. The front desk staff and bellmen were very nice and knomlegeable.   The security can use some serious work.  I was only asked once in passing  if I was staying at the hotel upon entering and was never asked to show a key.  Anyone can walk right into the hotel and get on the guestroom elevators.  The hallway lighting outside our particular room 415 was very dim, almost dark.  The rooftop bar service was terrible.  Had trouble getting a seat on the outside patio when the patio was near empty and our waitress had to ask us twice for our drink order.  She also neglected to place our appetizer order so we cancelled that.  We had planned to have dinner at the Hotel but after receiving terrible service in a near empty bar we went elsewhere.

title: Great place to stay for sight seeing
text: We were very pleased with our choice of hotel for sight seeing in New York. It was very close to, Central Park, the Metropolitan Opera House, shopping on 5th Avenue, Times Sqare and the Empire State Building. The hotel was very comfortable, and the staff were very helpful.

title: NYC Experience
text: The location is good. A couple of stops on the subway $3 or 15 min walk to times square. Very helpful staff  room was very clean. Roof top is lovely but happy hour on Thursdays doesn't extend there. Lobby is beautiful and good wi fi.We had the most amazing cheesecake at the Italian over the road, try it!  Highly recommend  a stay here.

title: Rundown hotel
text: Poorly maintained hotel with poor amenities. Wardrobe and carpet were in very bad shape. Room lighting was bad. Location good. Bell staff good. Rest of the hotel was horrible. Skip it. Not worth the money paid.

title: Tre
text: I went to this hotel with my partner for 4 days, room okay but no kettle to make tea or coffee which was a disappoint as most hotels have this was advised  when booking the pool would be open that's why we booked the hotel in the first place but to our disappointment it was closed, when checking out we never got asked if wee enjoyed our stay, just took our key.

title: Location
text: Excellent location central to the subway and park. Rooftop bar was excellent and an extensive menu to match. Could not fault the service or rooms. Short walk to delicious other food options and a good supermarket right below

title: The Empire Hotel
text: As you walk in, The Empire Hotel almost feels like a 5 star hotel.  The service and staff at the front desk were excellent.  The rooms are ok.  Nothing to brag about, but if all you need the room for is to sleep then it's acceptable.  The room and bathroom were very clean.  The issue with the room is the poor lighting and the very loud air conditioning unit.  The WiFi was not reliable.  The coffee in the room was not complimentary and the price for the coffee ($3.00 US per coffee pod) was not included in the price list of items available in the fridge.  Hence why I assumed the coffee was complimentary and only found out on my invoice.

title: Not good value for money
text: Location is all Empire has going for it. The rooms are very small, bathroom very basic and cramped, and ACs are super loud! Defitnitely not great value for money! The rooftop has a very cool view though.

title: Eccellente soggiorno
text:
Siamo stati con mia moglie in luna di miele in questa struttura, neanche a dirlo attirati dalla serie tv “Gossip Girl”. Le aspettative sono state rispettate al 100%. Struttura molto centrale (laterale al Lincoln Center e a due passi da Central Park) e curata, le stanze molto pulite e il personale cordiale e disponibile a qualunque orario. Una menzione speciale a Pasquale, sempre gentile e pronto ad aiutarci.
Il rooftop è mozzafiato e la colazione, sebbene costosa (25$ a persona), merita davvero di essere provata.
In poche parole un ottimo soggiorno.

title: The worst Hotel in New York
text: The overall experience was not a good one. The Hotel is very dark and the rooms are not maintained to any reasonable standard.The pictiures on their website makes it quite misleading. Staff are well rehearsed in their manner and do not make quests feel they are happy to stay at this Hotel. I was highly disapointed with the overall experience and would certainly not  be a returning guest. I would not recomend this hotel.

title: Très bonne adresse dans Manhattan
text:
Après avoir séjourné dans plusieurs hôtels de Manhattan, The Empire reste sans aucun doute dans les listes hôtels  bon rapport emplacement/qualitè/prix.
La chambre standard est correcte en taille pour NYC et la sdb bien que toute petite est fonctionnelle. 
Le personnel est dans l’ensemble très accueillant et souriant, dans l’hôtel où au roof top qui est super agréable avec sur la première terrasse ou dedans une belle offre de cocktails.
Chambre et sdb très propre, lobby, mezzanine très beaux.
Majeur reproche : le système de Clim pas tout jeune et très bruyant même en position low mais c’est malheureusement le cas de bon nombre d’hôtels.
Le quartier est très agréable et très animé. A deux pas de beaucoup d’endroits mythiques de la ville : 10min à pieds de Broadway/Timesquare, Deux pas de Colombus Circle, en face du Lincoln Center etc...
A conseiller sans hésiter pour une (première) découverte de NYC

title: Problems at The Empire
text: I love the location of this hotel and have stayed her many times.  There are many problems with the air conditioning, internet cleanliness if the carpet and bathrooms.  I will likely not return to The Empire.

title: Do New York not know how to do 4 star?
text:
The first room was spacious, bath in the bathroom, Room 822. No bed!!! Are you kidding me, a pull out sofa bed, is this a hotel or a hostel. Second room offered has a bed, very small but that's okay, downside is that could here the aircon outside, constantly. Too late to bother a third attempt but don't ever accept 101 either if you prefer less noise. 

Lobby showed great promise but let down by the rooms.

I have yet to find a decent hotel in New York!

title: Weekend in NYC!
text: The Empire Hotel was in a great location to visit family, Lincoln Center (right across the street), and easy subway access.  Although the hotel was on the older side, our room was very comfortable and quiet.  Our window overlooked Lincoln Center which was very pretty to see in the day and night.  Check-in took a little longer than expected, but they did add another desk clerk which helped.

title: excellent value for the location
text: This gem of a hotel is conveniently located at Lincoln Center area.Excellent door staff and very friendly reception staff. Very clean, comfortable, and  well appointed rooms. Many restaurants and shops in the area. Close to subway access.The lounge bar has excellent service and so does the roof top bar. I highly recommend this establishment as the value is worth the stay.

title: Central position ,expensive ,small poorly designed rooms poor management
text: Central hotel but the rooms small and unsuitable for long stays .Let down by relatively minor defects whic with good management could be simply corrected .Bathrooms tiny and awkward to use . To have washbasins without a plug in a fir St work city is anomalous.

title: Voyage
text:
Belles chambres mais salle de bain assez insalubre et pas d isolation phonique. Le Prix est bcp trop cher pour la qualité de la chambre et salle de bain
Petit déjeuner 25 dollars très cher pour la qualité et la variation des produits...

title: Good location and great staff
text: The front of the building had scaffold up which is a little off putting when you first arrive however the entrance and lobby are beautifully decorated and give the wow factor, reception staff very friendly and helpful, the rooms are large however the bathroom was tiny and very outdated, missing tea/coffee making facilities. The roof top bar was a little shabby and dirty, the pool was closed and yet said open till end of sept. The location is very good for enjoying the sights of New York and is close to underground stations and cafes/bars

title: Needs updating
text: Nice location and great employees buy property overall is in need of updating. Looks like shortcuts are taken to keep restrooms up but overall decor is dark and dated. Windows don’t appear to be double paned as the noise level was extreme. I feel that money is better spent at a more up-to-date hotel.

title: Gem Across from Lincoln Center
text: Amazing accommodations in the center of the UWS.  Thanks to a 35% discount advertised on its own website, you couldn’t beat the value for the stylistic and well-appointed rooms. My wife and I stayed in a King Bed Junior Suite for her 50th birthday and celebrated with out-of-town friends at the rooftop bar that showcased amazing views of Lincoln Center and the bright lights of Broadway.  In addition to the city views, the drinks, food and service was unbeatable.  The drinks were perfectly mixed and the food was expertly prepared (and I’m a food snob).  I highly recommend the shishito peppers, deviled eggs, pork bao buns, and baby back ribs (literally fall off the bone).  After feasting on the delicious bar cuisine, you’ll feel no guilt cancelling your restaurant reservations to spend your night stop the city.  The bar was hip and sleek and the style and volume of the music allowed for comfortable conversation and laughs among friends while promoting just the right ambiance.  With PJ Clarke’s right outside the lobby, The Smith across the street and Rosa Mexicana around the block, there was plenty of places to eat easily right outside the doors of the hotel,   But honestly, I almost didn’t want to leave my beautiful room because the bed was so comfortable that I never slept so soundly.  It was an amazing weekend at the Empire Hotel!

title: Convinient Central Park Location
text: Beside the dark hallways, smelly room, low quality bathroom. It is a good value and central location to stay. Walking distance to Hop on Hop off buses, shopping, food, and subway. Employees are very helpful and courteous.

title: Great Stay
text:
This Hotel is clean, friendly and in a perfect location. Our stay was comfortable and all the staff were helpful. We had breakfast on the rooftop garden which was really lovely.
A few minutes walk away from Central Park and a great shopping centre in Columbus circle .
There are some nice restaurants nearby.
We will definitely stay again.

title: Bad experience
text:
I stayed here last spring and had a bad experience (see prior review). a manager reached out to offer me a free night to reevaluate. When i attempted to redeem, managers had changed and the new manager didnt get back to me(after her initial response). I wrote a review concerning this response and was contacted again. They wouldnt honor the free night (despite having the correspondance agreed to refund me a portion of my original reservation), but agreed to refund me part of my initial room ( a percentage) and to reach out for an exclusive deal/upgrade on a future visit (in exchange for removing the 2nd review) I reached out last week (in our email chain) and was quoted a price that was at least $40 per night higher than the published rates (never mind what they would be direct with a AAA discount). 

I asked about the pricing, etc and have not heard back. 

Of note: many things were wrong with my initial stay-including tat the bathroom sink backed up and that the shower BROKE while I was using it and fell down. When I told them at the front desk I was kindly assured I wouldn't have to pay for the damages (what?). 

My reviews are mostly positive ( i think). It has to be BAD for me to bother. 

My feeling is this hotel isnt worth it, and the response is poor.

The rooms were small and rather dingy. Bathroom teeny. Nice location, and while their staff were nice-but not proactive at making amends.

title: Luxurious Stay
text:
We stayed here for four days and had such an amazing time, the beds are something else - have not slept that well in years!! 

The staff are first class, every single member of their team greeted us smiling and happy, always wanting to help! Can’t wait to stay again!

title: Weeks Stay
text: We recently visited America for the first time, the Hotel was at a brilliant location for everything, the decor was outstanding, staff very friendly and helpful, and the rooftop sun terrace was brilliant, a great bar was also there

title: Great service
text: Great staff, excellent service. Hotel location very convenient in distance to museums, Broadways, Timesquare, etc. Very clean and nice decor. I would definitely recommend it. We enjoyed our stay there.

title: Perfect location, in need of a little spruce up
text:
2nd visit to Empire, perfect location for CP.. room good although a little tired, pool open seasonal months - watch out, I went in mid September and couldn’t use it, very disappointing.

Overall for a the location, value is good and rooftop bar / lounge very appealing.

Would recommend.

title: VERY WELL WORTH IT
text: The hotel is msall and charming, the rooms are not big but spacious enough. Bathroom is tiny, but works well. The staff is very very friendly and amicable willing to solve issues and help out at any moment. Location is perfect if you like the are and if not, you are so close to subways which makes everything close.

title: great staff, small rooms,spotty internet
text: Great location and wonderful staff. Rooms are so small it's hard to move around in them, to close curtains and such. Very clean. Internet was spotty. A/C sounded like something was loose-loud at night.  For the price, rooms were small

title: Fabulous location, great price for this $ star property!
text: Cannot beat this location on the upper west side, adjacent to Lincoln Center, 2 blocks from Columbus Circle and a short taxi ride to the Museum Mile and Broadway theaters. 3 excellent restaurants and a Citi branch across the street. All of the staff; front desk, bell and housekeeping are first tier. Intend to return for a week or more every year. It's a 10.

title: Great Service
text: As a first time NYC traveler, getting around town was worrisome. Rohan's smiling face at the desk and friendly demeanor made the task much less so. He made sure we knew exactly where to go. Thanks Rohan!

title: A terrific stay
text:
Surprisingly top notch

I had no complaints; excellent service from the time I stepped out of the cab until the time i climbed back in.  Great staff and excellent location.  Very good room rate too.  I've stayed all over midtown, the Empire is the best deal and the service is amongst the best in the city.  without a doubt 5 stars.

title: NIce hotel, great location
text:
I would have given this hotel a top rating except for two things:   Shower water pressure is pathetic.  I don't know if this is a New York City thing or not.  Also, my in room internet service was spotty at best.

Other than that...it's a nice place.

title: Empire Overnight
text: Hotel accommodated an early check-in room was fine, no view. Staff was very helpful. Bed was comfortable. Great rooftop. Easy access to to up and downtown. Great restaurants in immediate area and Starbucks and convenience store just outside entrance.

title: Widoki jak z pocztowki
text: Wpadłam tam tylko na drinka ale za to na tarasie na dachu! O hotelu nie mam opinii ale bar na dachu pierwsza klasa,super widoki,pyszne drinki i extra obsługa. Znajomi którzy zatrzymali się w hotelu mieli że sobą psa,czyli miejsce przyjazne futrzakom!

title: У отеля хорошее расположение, пару минут ходьбы до метро, сосвем близко центральный.
text: Сам отель старый, в номере очень шумно и постоянно гудит система вентиляции, что очень мешало спать. Комната не большая, но аккуратная, чистая, но в комнате очень темно, света почти нет. Убирали все отлично. Ванная комната очень старая, ободранные двери, душевая тоже старая, 2 крана всегда работали одновременно. Полотенца всегда были чистые, ванные принадлежности каждый день приносили новые.

title: Hotel rooms are tragic!
text:
Unless you plan on living in the lobby -which is truly gorgeous) (and love the bad 80s music), don't stay here. The rooms are super overpriced for what you get. I am from NYC and was blown away by the nastiness of the rooms. The room amenities are literally falling apart. The beds are uncomfortable, the wallpaper is peeling off the walls, the bathroom frosted door was drawn on and covered in mold not to mention the handle broken and toilet runs constantly. The a/c rattled and was covered in water and mold, the coffee make didnt work, the carpet was shredding and had crazy sticky stuff on it that stuck to your feet like gum. The internet also when in and out and was as fast as old skool dial up. 

I know the hotel is old and that is fine but for over $400 a night, the rooms should not be in this condition and this should not be considered a 4 star hotel.

title: New York short stay
text: Our East Coast tour finished in New York at the Empire Hotel. The location of the hotel made very easy to get around NY by the subway which is very close to the hotel. Rooms and staff were very good as well plus there are a lot of good restaurants close by.

title: Great stay, wonderful hotel & staff, loved the location too.
text:
I stayed from the 29th Aug to the 2nd Sept, the staff were so helpful, from the guys at the entrance 
Through to reception & Management.  Friendly atmosphere, had a double double & a junior suite for the last night.
Couldn’t fault a thing.  Gossip Girl was filmed here so it was a bonus for my girls, roof top cocktail bar was great with fantastic views.  
Didn’t use the rooftop pool.  We would go back any day.  The location was Upper West side, one or two 
Blocks from Central Park & the John Lennon memorial.  We had breakfast everyday in Central Park.
Daily complimentary water, toiletries were lovely. Wi-fi was good too.
Thank you for an amazing stay, I’m a travel agent so happy to answer any questions

title: Do Not Go Here
text: The hotel is beautiful but the front desk is awful and there is always hidden fees to your room.When I spoke to the manager she was so rude.  I recommend to go anywhere else because in NYC there is so many beautiful hotels.

title: Excellent service
text: Great service made this hotel stay highly enjoyable.  Loved the location.  Easy to get to the theater district and within walking distance of whole foods.  The mattress was excellent, and the room was very clean.  I didn’t get a chance to check out the swimming pool or rooftop deck, but looking forward to taking advantage next trip.  I will definitely return.

title: Nice Property
text: Nice location, literally across the street from Lincoln Center. Lobby is very cool. Nice staff. Bring extra gold for the tab on the Rooftop. I would definately stay here again. Staff was very nice and helpful.

title: good experience
text:
Localization the hotel is perfect , 
Os atendentes da recepção do hotel não falavam outras linguas e em meu caso atrapalhou um pouco nossa comunicação, porem nada que impeça ou atrapalhe nossa estadia , a cama permitia um bom descanso, a qualidade dos moveis do quarto um pouco antigos e a iluminação do quarto muito fraca.

title: Great Hotel to explore NYC
text: Located @Columbus Circle The Empire is great Home Base for all kind of activities. Central Park is near by and all other tourist attactions can be reached via subway from Columbus Cirle. And if you come back in the afternoon/evening don't forget to stop @ the rooftop bar.

title: Awesome stay
text:
We were most impressed with the accommodations and services at the Empire!
Wonderful location; close to Central Park and subways.
Although we really enjoyed the rooftop restaurant/lounge and the tasty food, we were disappointed with the service (forgot our napkins and utensils until after eating most of our meal).

title: Great hotel!!
text: My husband and I were so impressed by this hotel. Not only is the close proximity to downtown Manhattan that attracted us but the hotel itself. Front desk staff was very professional. The rooftop lounge was elegant.  We found our bedroom Superior King just right for us and bed was made everyday. We’re definitely coming back to NYC and stay at Empire Hotel.

title: Not a 4 star hotel
text: This was not a 4 star hotel. It was shabby and dated, did not feel clean. No coffee/ tea maker. No bathrobes. Pool was not open. Safe did not work. Location was good. Rooftop bar is nice with good view.

title: Wonderful
text: I found everything above expectations.  From entering to leaving every staff member friendly and helpful.  I love the deco lobby and bar. Room was immaculate.  Never saw a speck of dust. Bed comfortable and nice pillows. Bathroom is on small side but shower has rain shower head and handheld.  They have shelves for your toiletries.  They've done best they can with bathroom.  Great location.  Short walk to Central Park.. Lincoln Center right at front door.

title: Decent place
text: The lobby and roof top is phenomenal.  Location is great as well. The hotel needs a little upgrade nonetheless.  For example, the bathroom is outdated.  The living room contains a closet that you could purchase at Walmart.  The fridge is empty, and water is not even available.

title: Mid-week Stay in September
text:
Midweek leisure trip to see relatives in NYC included a three night stay at the Empire.

Very satisfactory stay all around. We have visited hotels all over the world and can truthfully say that we have never experienced such a friendly staff as is found at the Empire.

Door/bell staff, desk personnel, maids and food attendants were all incredibly welcoming and helpful - a real plus for any hotel in NYC.

A very good value and one of few hotels on the west side this is a fine property. Our "Junior Suite" was spacious and well priced for the city - plenty of amenities and had the look of being recently renovated.

Very attractive desk area and lobby bar as well as a pleasant rooftop lounge/bar featuring nice city views.

Located right next to the Lincoln Center and Fordham U. it is a great choice for those visiting the west side.

We look forward to out next visit.

title: Customer Service
text: My friend and I went to New York for a concert. I had looked for several hotels within walking distance of the venue we were going to. Luis at the desk was very friendly and asked about the concert we were attending. He even went as far and looked up the name of the group we were going to see. Luis upgraded our room to 2 double beds instead of one queen for the same price. I was very impressed with the room and the size of it. When we came back from the concert he even took the time to ask how it was. Thank you Luis for making us feel cared for.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
The desk were helpful and took the time to make us feel welcome. The room was clean with plenty of room. The bathroom was clean with a decent shower. We were surprised that the coffee in the room was not complimentary and it was not obvious that there was a charge, but this was a minor annoyance.
We did not eat at the hotel because we were out all day, we did however have a late drink at the bar. the bar was very nice, but the outside area was smaller than we expected. there was room on the higher level, but this was closed off. That was a bit of a shame because we like to sit outside.
I would stay at the Empire again because of its great location, friendly staff, room cleanliness and ambience.

title: Deliverers where it matters
text:
So me and my wife have just spent 8 nights at the Empire Hotel and we were extremely happy with our stay. We arrived and were greeted by friendly and attentive staff. The gentleman we checked in with enquired as to the nature of our stay, and due to it being our honeymoon he insured we had a room with a view. 

Once we got to the room, we were again very happy with what we had been assigned. The room looked over Broadway and West 63rd. We had air conditioning which was hugely appreciated given the heat at the time. The room was a nice size with a queen size bed, desk, chair and a small chest of drawers. We were allowed to bring our own food in to consume in our room which was nice as some hotels can be a little awkward with that.

Admittedly the decor is a little outdated, and it could in time do with a little bit of TLC. That being said however the hotel staff were all friendly and attentive for the duration of our stay, our room was immaculately clean on arrival and when required during our stay and the location was AMAZING. All in all, we had a fantastic stay.

title: Empire Hotel-Manhatten
text: Location is a plus, close to subways, Central Park, and Times Square.  Rooms are small but clean & comfortable, I think their perfect for a NYC hotel room.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and would come back and stay.

title: NHL Meetings
text: The Empire is a nice hotel in an excellent location (near Lincoln Center and Central Park). The rooms are very small but also very clean. Rooftop bar is nice spot but the service is very subpar (no servers, had to go to a cash register to place an order).

title: A great hotel, perfectly located!
text: Enjoyed a weeks stay at this hotel.  Great location, Starbucks around the corner & plenty of restaurants to keep you going.  Highly recommend The Smith across the street!  There’s a Mexican restaurant opposite the Lincoln Centre that’s fab too. The food in the hotel is not great, kinda non existent & $25 for buffet breakfast for an adult & $10 for a child we ate out all the time. My room was fine. A little small but perfectly formed.  Our view was out onto Broadway. My only suggestion would be some hooks in the bathroom.  There’s nowhere to hang a robe or towel after you shower! The door was fairly water damaged too. Having stayed more downtown before where it’s so noisy at night I was pleasantly surprised with how quiet this area was.  It was so nice to come back to this hotel after a long day.  It’s a nice relaxed area. The rooftop is lovely, great views, looks a little different nowadays to the photos though.  Kids loved the plunge pool.  The service & atmosphere up here felt a little strained though, like they wanted you in & out quickly.  It was odd.  The staff at reception, house keeping & the door men were all so helpful.  So polite & friendly.  I would stay The Empire Hotel again.

title: Hotel has gone downhill
text: Checkin is 3...had to wait past 4 for room. Tv remote didnt work. AC didnt work & Mgr. Didnt believe me even though maintenance was there twice. Called for ice daily front desk transferred me to housekeeping everytime and no one answers. Had to keep telling FD no one answered. Waited 45 mins for ice. No kid food on rooftop menu except tatortots. Need reg pizza or mac and cheese or something added. Safe in room broke. Interior of rooms falling apart. Paint drywall coming off. Mold in bathrooms. We have been coming 12 yrs. No more

title: A great all-round hotel
text: Loved the art-deco appearance of it all. Friendly and professional staff. Fantastic location - on the south west corner of Central Park. Subway nearby. The whole family loved it here. If i had to criticise I would say: We had a tiny bathroom which was in need of a little TLC but nothing major to spoil the experience. The swimming pool and surroundings on the roof was disappointing - not like the photos online. Breakfast is far too expensive to entertain - use cafes/kiosks/restaurants nearby.

title: Fun Hotel with a Rooftop Pool
text: I come to NYC monthly for business. This was the first time I stayed at the Empire and I will definitely be back. A big bang for the buck. The roof top bar where you can lounge with skyscraper views and sip on delicious frozen drinks from the bar was an added plus.

title: Very well located in the city and comfortable
text: Nice hotel, very well located in the city close  many attractions and several public transports, highly recommend for a stay in Manhattan. Rooms are comfy and clean, the staff is really nice. The fitness room is OK. The pool is really small, more for children. The breakfast is over priced, but there is a starbuck just downstairs.

title: Wouldn’t stay again !
text:
Such a shame, we started our 14 night stay in what turned out to be the worst hotel of our stay. The room and bathroom were very tired and in desperate need of refurbishment. The air conditioning was exceptionally noisy and ineffective ! We didn’t sleep well, we also asked at Reception to move room, they offered to send an engineer but it remained broken for our 3 night stay.

Location is good and subway is close by, staff are friendly enough but don’t go out their way to help.

The roof terrace (once you’ve climbed the ugly stairway to reach it) is nice. The pool area is a disappointment ! Tiny, covered over and poorly staffed. We spent less than an hour here with our 9yr old before it was shut because of rain ! It is a covered pool so this seemed a little excessive, the guy sitting at the pool looked miserable, as if he would rather be anywhere else but there.

We would not return here ever I’m afraid to say.  In fact upon our return to the city at the end of our stay we had a much better hotel.

title: Quick trip with the family
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, the rooftop patio was really nice, the pool is small but not busy at all. Great location, 2 blocks to Central Park. Close to shopping and restaurants.

title: Friendly Staff, Great Location, Needs Some TLC
text:
Pros: 
1. The location is perfect - only a block away from Central Park, short walk to the main sights of the city. But still in a quite area so you're away from the commotion of the city. 
2. The staff is wonderful - the doormen and concierge are very helpful, polite and friendly. The front desk staff was friendly and very accommodating. The staff at the pool lounge were awesome. The cleaning staff always friendly when passing them in the hallways.
3. Even though they don't offer parking on premises, they do have a parking arrangement with Icon Parking on 64th/Broadway. You get your parking ticket validated while checking out and present it to the parking attendant at Icon. The only downside is you must pay by card only, no cash accepted. 
4. The rooms are very out of date, but clean. The washroom was cleaned well, no soap scum or rust in the shower/faucets/toilet/etc.

Cons:
1. Like many of the reviews, the rooms are extremely small and they are in need of repair. The wallpaper is peeling off the walls, the lamp lights flicker, the doors are chipped and scratched. My tip is bring over-the-door storage organizers for your toiletries and hang your clothing in the wardrobe. There is barely room to have your luggage open on the floor.
2. We went for drinks at the Rooftop Pool Lounge on a Saturday night - the lounge was not staffed well as they had one server and approximately 30 guests. We only had one drink as the server never came back to take our food order, which was understandable as she was swamped. After an 1.5hr we decided to leave. With such an amazing rooftop location, it was a shame they weren't geared up for a full lounge. 

Tip: 1. Since the room/washroom is tiny, bring an over the door storage for your toiletries. There is no room in the washroom to store your shampoo/toothbrush/brushes/ etc, so this would be really helpful if you're staying there.
2. Breakfast options around: The Smith, Boulud Sud, Starbucks, Fluffy's Cafe & Pizzeria.

title: AMAZING STAY
text: The staff member were very helpful and nice. They were even allowed me a late check out of 1pm on a holiday weekend. The Roof top lounge was a great place to take tons of pictures of the city skyline and enjoy a cocktail.

title: New York, US open weekend
text: Very good location. Very clean and well maintained hotel. Friendly staff. AC very noisy, not possible to set the temperature, it's very cold. Inexistent storage space in the bathroom, even for the normal personal items.

title: Bom.
text: Localização boa. Fica próximo de uma estação de metrô (Columbus Circle). Cama e chuveiro bons. Rooftop bom. Hotel muito antigo, já deveriam ter se renovado faz tempo nos quartos, porém a recepção e o mezanino são muito bonitos.Tem um starbucks embaixo do hotel. Arrumação do quarto ruim e eles tem dó de repor papel higiênico e produtos de higiene. Ar condicionado antigo e mesmo que você desligue fica fazendo um barulho. Cobram Resort por noite.

title: Great location, views, service and bonus rooftop
text: I have stayed here 3 times now originally due to proximity to Central Park for morning runs but I have come to also love the ambience and the service - the rooms are large and have great views and the nearby cafes and bars are a welcome break from the v centre of manhattan - it is walkable to most places and the subway is nearby so the slight distance isn’t an issue - would thoroughly recommend

title: ATMOSFERA UNICA
text:
dallo staff accogliente simpatico smart. 
Pulizia delle stanze impeccabile, 
Posizione  eccellente, 
Bel ritrovo la sera nella hall al bar,
Carino rooftoop e il bar aperto in tarda sera, con piscina piccola ma efficace.
Perfetto qualità-prezzo
Sembra di vivere in un telefilm americano

title: Great Service and Location!!
text:
Great experience!! Location is excellent!!! You have central park one block, less than a block a metro station!!

The service excellent!! Confortable beds and rooms!! Very safe to walk the streets at any time!!

title: Rate change
text: Booked Empire Hotel through booking.com. Upon checkout, rate for second night was almost double the first.  Hotel said that's usual, would not correct, Unable to connect with booking.com. I disputed charge via Amex

title: Excellent hotel in convenient location
text: We stayed at the empire hotel during the Labor Day holiday and we were pleased. Rooms are spacious and the pool bar and roof top bars nice bonuses. Staff is courteous and nice. Location close to subway and met opera. Recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect boutique hotel with great rooftop bar and view!
text: Love this hotel, have stayed several times. Clean and close to Fordham Univ and lincoln center and columbus circle. Love the rooftop bar and seating with a great view. The tuna tostada app is amazing. Would recommend and will stay again for sure!

title: Lovely hotel with great position
text: Excellent funky hotel with a great location. Only complaint is that the corners were not cleaned properly and we kept missing creamers for our morning coffee. Bonus was the lovely roof top bar at the top. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

title: Stay at the Empire
text: My friend & i stayed here mainly because we are huge gossip girl fans. We were very pleased with the gentleman at the front desk who was kind & made checking in easy & fast. The guys at the front door were always helpful with places to eat and directions. I would recommend this hotel & I enjoyed my stay. Thank you!

title: Empire hotel NYC
text: Lovely hotel in great location. Really close to the metro, Central Park, Time Sq, Broadway, shops restaurants etc. Rooms are quite small and no drawer space. Pool is also more of a plunge pool than pool. Only real criticism is that the WiFi is rubbish - got better connection in local restaurants & attractions. Couldn’t upload trip advisor etc which was challenging when planning. But staff helpful and printed tickets off for us etc. Would go back.

title: Hôtel ideal pour visiter New York
text: Hôtel très bien situé, juste à côté du Lincoln Center et à 2 blocs de central park, acceuil très sympa, chambre spacieuse et propre, roof top réservé aux clients de la hôtel avec une piscine très appréciable avec une super vue sur les buildings de Manhattan, un second rooftop avec un bar est également disponible et accessible à tout le monde

title: Terrible Refund Policy
text:
I booked a 15 night,  prepaid stay with them via Hotels.com a few months ago for this coming October.  Since then, I ended up renting an apt in NYC for 2 yrs... and no longer need the hotel in October....
Yet they are refusing to let me cancel and refund me the money... despite October being a high demand month for NYC hotels... and it being super close to the New Yorker Festival.... 
To keep my $5600 is outrageous when they can easily free up the room for another to purchase.  
Most NYC hotels I've used have been cooperative and flexible.  I handed found this hotel's management to be inflexible and at arms length.... not what one wants in hotel service.

title: Very nice hotel - excellent location
text: Lobby and rooms have been recently renovated. Very attractive. Good room appointments. Excellent area - across the road from Lincoln Center - 3 short blocks from Columbus Circle and Subway - 2 blocks from Central park. Several nice restaurants, pharmacy, multiple coffee shops all within one block of the hotel. Very good staff and service.

title: Damp, mouldy room
text:
We moved out after 1 night of a planned 3 night stay as we couldn’t stand the damp and mould in the bedrooms.
It looks like lots of money has been spent on the lobby and superficial decorating in the rooms but providing healthy air to breathe should be a priority!

title: On average
text: The hotel location is absolutely excellent and very nice its rooftop with the bar and pool. But the rooms are quite old, with old pieces of furniture and not as clean as youncould expect. In a nutshell price / quality is acceptable.

title: The place is a DUMP
text: Needs major upgrade. Scaffolding around the building but no work being done. Rooms dark, wallpaper peeling, WiFi spotty and weird spots on the walls in the bathroom. The sink seemed to be falling off the wall. The window faces another building a few feet away. The only good thing is great location at Lincoln Center.

title: Approachable and affordable elegance just steps away from Broadway!
text: The Empire Hotel broke all stereotypes for me!  I go to NYC often, but have stayed in Queens in VRBO's because I thought the hotel rooms on the island would be too much... NOT!  The Empire Hotel is approachable with a definitive New York vibe yet affordable enough to say goodby to VRBOs ! Polite and professional staff greeted you every day at the door and front desk.  The room was NYC small but not TEENY!  Only complaint I would have would be more drawer space.  Shower was awesome with a rainwater main and hand held secondary.  Comfortable bed and solid walls blocked out the noice of the city.

title: Kind staff & convenience
text: The staff was super kind and accomodating and everything was pretty clean but the rooms and hallways were pretty rundown with cracking paint, mildew smelling bathrooms and horrible lighting. Regardless, for the price, I'd definitely stay here again if I was in the area because the price was so affordable.

title: Gossip girl
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel a giugno , zona ottima a pochi passi da time square e dal central park. Appena entrati molto bello L hotel , le camere meno , molto piccole , però considerato che eravamo sempre fuori e tornavamo in hotel solo per una doccia e dormire andava più che bene . Colazione non inclusa è un po’ cara . La vista dal rooftop bella ...  diventato famoso per la serie tv di gossip girl . In ogni caso una buona scelta rapporto prezzo e qualità .

title: The Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location
text:
The Empire hotel provides me the PERFECT Experience. From the moment I arrived through the check in process up to entering my room I have received the WOW Service you desire after a long day.

I will not stay anywhere else as I feel at home every trip.

Thank you for a great demonstration of TRUE Hospitality.

title: Very small rooms and old interior
text: The rooms were small, and it didn't feel clean since most of the interior were rusty and old. We both got sick after having the breakfast buffet also, not very lucky having a plane to Europe straight after 😞The only part that made the stay more enjoyable was the staff, and especially Chris at the front desk! The hotel is very lucky to have him working there!!

title: Good location near Central Park.  Clean room.  Facility has modern decor, but is old, dark.  Average staff
text:
Locations is very convenient to Central Park, Columbus Circle.  Room cleaning service was great. 
 Room furniture seems dated.  

Front desk does not explain anything at check-in and not very welcoming -- did not mention about restaurant, bar, how to self-park, location of elevators, nothing about the pool, or exercise room, ice machines, vending machines.  The complimentary, room temperature, water bottles should be placed in the room, not picked up at the front desk.  Room did not have welcome folder with this information.

Pool water seemed dirty.  I did not like the random floating dirt, hair, and random things in the pool.

title: Excellent service
