text: This hotel is situated in a great area and felt safe. Tony, the bartender at roof top bar was so helpful and kind. He helped us with food, drinks, and overall information about the city. We returned to the bar at the end of each night to discuss New York in the pleasant environment he created.

title: My stay August, 2019.
text: Not good experience. Pool was not available for several hours. The air conditioner was broken in the room, making  terrible noises. Bottle water which was part of the deal daily, was not available. The front desk staff not friendly. When asked a question, they seemed like they were annoyed.....

title: Muy satisfechos
text:
La verdad que bastante satisfechos en general con el hotel que elegimos para pasar diez días en Nueva York. 

Cosas malas...el WIFI, un auténtico drama....un suplicio tener que conectarte una y otra vez desde cualquier parte del hotel, e incluso dentro de la misma habitación. Y supongo que dependerá de los precios (que no son los más baratos, pero tampoco de los más caros, sobre todo para estar donde estaba), pero nuestra habitación era pequeña. El aire acondicionado te lo ponen a nivel ultracongelante cada vez que entran a limpiar, pero bueno, nada que no se solucione dejando una nota. 

La verdad que poco negativo más, porque el resto muy bien....cama muy cómoda, personal muy amable, la ducha de techo muy guay...agua gratis todos los días y pasillos tranquilos para descansar bien....además tiene una terraza en la azotea estupenda. 

Y sobre todo, la ubicación, buenísima...junto a Lincoln Center y a tiro de piedra de Central Park...si vas con niños pequeños es una maravilla tener el parque al lado para que se desahoguen tras un largo día de caminatas.

title: Good hotel, great staff, great value
text: Recently took a trip to NYC with family and stayed at Empire Hotel.  First time there.  Was pleased with location (right across from Lincoln Center) The staff was very helpful, knowledgeable and courteous.  Lobby was nice.  Parking was reasonable considering the location where hotel is located.  Decor was nice.  Room was spacious (had a Junior Suite).  Bathroom was tight but not a huge deal.  Pool was also small but kids still enjoyed it.  Restaurant attached to hotel (PJ Clarkes) was convenient and good food.  Overall great place to stay at a reasonable price and great location in NYC.

title: Excellent hotel with a wonderful view
text:
I got this hotel for family visiting NYC for the first time. Overall, I am very pleased with this hotel. They allowed my guests to check in earlier (because they are seniors, it made a huge deal for them being able to lay down after a long flight), the price was amazing ( especially for an August weekend stay); the room had an awesome view ( I actually think they upgraded my family without even mentioning it), and the staff was very nice and professional. 

I was very impressed with Empire Hotel, I leave nearby and I will be recommending this place to all my guests and friends. 

Tip: try requesting room 919. The view was the best.

title: Nice hotel, have stayed in better
text:
A small hotel situated out the way of the hustle and bustle of the city which is nice to escape from (about 5-10 minute walk from Times Square)

The room was ok, a little small and lacked storage for clothes and other things we get in other hotels we have stayed. The air con unit near the window was rather loud and the surrounding wood was starting to rot with paint peeling. But, the room served a purpose and the shower was fabulous!

The rooftop bar isn’t worth a visit as when walking in, the staff make you feel as though you are inconveniencing them and were not at all welcoming. At one point, we were sat having a drink admiring the view when a rather rude lady who had a miserable face approached us to ask if we were staying. When we said “yes” she huffed off and proceeded to return with a load of ‘reserved’ table signs and loudly put them on EVERY table around us. We took the hint and left. It wasn’t as if it was busy, there were 3 other people in there!

A nice hotel that served a purpose for our stay but we have stayed in better in NYC.

title: Unhappy business traveler
text: Great location. the initial front desk clerk was able to get me in my room quickly. Not as clean as expected. There was a cockroach in the shower. It was not resolved during my stay. The carpet on the floor was continuously dusty. The rooftop bar was nice but again not as clean as I thought it would be and food was just okay.

title: New York trip
text: 5 star advertised though the rooms were more like 3/4 star. The pool was advertised but closed when we were there for refurbishment. Staff were helpful & friendly. Good location but a poor view from our room.

title: Checked all the boxes when travelling with a teen and an adolescent and a picky traveller dad showcasing the best of NYC
text: Location, roof terrace and pool and the rest was top quality. Best stay in NYC I have had over the 6 times I have visited the city. Feels like an oasis in the city with great connections and proximity to Central Park. Lincoln Centre is a surprise gem also.

title: Deludente
text: Appena entri nell’hall hai una bella sensazione di essere capitata in un bel hotel. Invece no. Appena saliti in camera la bella sensazione è stata azzerata. Stanza piccola e piena di polvere. Il condizionatore vecchio sporco e rumoroso. L’abbiamo spento per disperazione e non era nemmeno regolabile, una macchina vecchissima. I letti non hanno un copri materasso direttamente le lenzuola appoggiate sul crudo materasso. Il bagno piccolissimo la porta vecchia e sporca, che dire una delusione, peccato perché ha delle buone potenzialità. Basta rinnovarlo!

title: Our "home away from home" in Manhattan
text: One of my favorite places to stay in New York City! Clean, friendly, elegant, classy, courteous, an amazing location. I highly recommend the Empire Hotel as a preferred place to stay in NYC. Their staff is super friendly, their lobby is gorgeous and comfortable, the Rooftop Bar, Restaurant and Swimming Pool are amazing, the rooms are well organized and comfortable, and I especially love the rooms with that awesome city view!

title: MUY BUENO
text:
todo excelente,ubicacion, limpieza, si viajas en famila tipo 4 personas las habitaciones son muy pequeñas quedas muy justo.
la atencion del personal es muy buena, simepre atentos.
A UNA CALLE ESTA CENTURY 21 SUPER RECOMENDABLE

title: Best price and location in NYC
text: Best part of this hotel besides the staff is the location and roof top pool/bar.  Conveniently located to the subway terminals you can go anywhere in NYC easily. Columbus Circle is a short walk from the hotel and central Park's a block away.  Fluffy’s pizza right down from the hotel had amazing pizza! Starbucks is next door too. The rooms were on the small side but for the price they were perfect. I would definitely retrun!!

title: Sub Par
text: The room was extremely small for the price. The "closet" is a tiny hole in the wall with a curtain. A grown adult can barely fit in the bathroom. They give no option to check in early. If you're trying to get a hold of the front desk, good luck. I was on the phone while it was ringing for 10 minutes and still no one picked up.. twice. The service at the rooftop bar for lunch was not good at all. The waitress seated us, took our order, and never came back. We were sitting there with no drinks, and finally had to track someone down to get our bill. Once nice thing was complimentary bottles of water each day.

title: Awesome in so many ways
text:
Great hotel,  great location,  great staff.
Family of 5 stayed for one night and had a great time.  Parking close by,  great view from rooftop restaurant,  minutes to cent park in foot.  Super friendly doormen ( Tommy was great).  I’d stay again for sure.

title: Empire Hotel was Amazing!
text: Love the Empire Hotel! Friendly staff! The lady at the front desk gave me a room with a view. The room was clean and big for a NY hotel! Near a lot to do within walking distances! Loved the rooftop bar and pool! Will be back!

title: Awesome and Great Hospitality
text: This hotel is totally awesome! We were pleasantly surprised particularly in light of some of the "not so great reviews". Because we travel a lot, we know that reviews can be skewed depending on the person and their experiences. We are glad that we gave Empire a chance. The room was great (we stayed in a king jr. suite to get the view). We were not disappointed and the roof top restaurant/bar/pool areas were very relaxing with wonderful views (and they stay open late). Additionally, the staff was very accommodating. We will be booking this same hotel today to visit our son in law school in September.

title: Gutes Hotel in zentraler Lage
text: Gutes Hotel in zentraler Lage. Subway nur 3 Minuten entfernt. Central Park auch direkt in der Nähe. Personal sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Zimmer sauber und  täglich frische Handtücher. Tolle Rooftop Bar mit schöner Aussicht.

title: Uncomfortable stay
text: No service. Bell service are not helpful. Unclean moldy room with old used soap stuck to sink. Small room can’t get luggage around beds . No luggage racks no hangers in closet. Front desk unpleasant no knowledge on NYC.

title: A Great Experience!
text: I was pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness and friendliness of this hotel! The location to the subway was good and the surrounding area was nice to visit!  I will absolutely return the next time I am in the city. Well done, Empire Hotel!

title: Great property
text: Walking distance to B'way theatre district - Whole Foods - Lincoln Center - Apple store - Recovery meetings. Easy access to west side buses & subways.  Rooms comfortable. Staff very accommodating and professional.

title: Happy with this all rounder
text: Third time to NYC, first time at this hotel. One block to the west of Central Park, lovely restaurant at the property and several places across the road. Roof top bar/restaurant was stunning. Even had a smoking area, very rare in NYC.

title: Perfect Family Trip
text: We spent 3 nights at the Empire Hotel.  It was a perfect place for the 4 of us: great art deco design, lots of restaurants and food stops nearby,  2 blocks from Central Park.  We really enjoyed the rooftop with it's spectacular view and red light sign.  The pool is very small, but after a day of walking around NYC, we were very happy to be able to jump in.

title: Enjoyed my 2 week stay very much at the Empire
text: I have been at the Empire Hotel for a two week stay.  I am an NYC native and know the city inside/out. The hotel is a special landmark. Almost 100 years old. With that comes fabulosity and also some challenges of course as well so one must take that into consideration and have an open mind. I will choose to focus more on the positives here. :) The bed and pillows are very comfortable. The shower hot and strong. The in room wifi very good. The bath products are great! The neighborhood is close to everything and very quiet for sleeping at night. The air conditioning works well and is quiet enough. The room is clean enough.   The mini refrigerator is cold. The pool deck and little pool are terrific! Made my stay as I am sun and pool person. The food and drinks are fine. Much of the staff are terrific and very willing to help. The new manager of the hotel is fabulous and so caring! Really want to make the hotel as great as it can be and is working on implementing lots of good changes! On my wish list are ice machines on the guest floors for the guests as ice is not readily available.  Room service which is not available at this time. Bathroom sink stoppers would be nice too for any hand wash one might want to do. Towel hooks in the bathroom that are lower for shorter people as myself. A bit of paint in the rooms to freshen them up. Overall though my stay was great! I will be back, am sad to leave and am looking forward to next time. I hope you enjoy your stay here too!

title: mini séjour!
text:
Un bel acceuil très cordial et attentionnée.
Un beau hall d'entrée qui sent super beau.
Un super service valet.
Un magnifique rooftop.
Une très petite chambre mais fontionnelle.
Superbement bien située.
Propre.
XX

title: Cool but not perfect
text:
I was excited to stay in a room with a view but I would only pay extra for that again because the room is larger but not for the view.  The windows do not face the fountain.  
The internet is the room is great.  When I needed to print a page not so good.  I skipped the print because as I understood I had to pay a minimum of $5 to get online and the pay to print.  I went somewhere else to accomplish that task.  
This hotel is a short distance from Columbus Circle Subway station.  VERY convenient.  
Overall, great place for a leisure trip!!!

title: Bon hotel mais un peu surcoté
text:
Nous étions 3, la première chambre affectée était juste minuscule, même pas la place d'ouvrir les valises et circuler autour. La salle de bain est très petite, douche, lavabo, toilettes dans le même espace, pas de place pour ranger les affaires de toilettes. Au final nous avons pu changer mais avec supplément. La chambre Deluxe pour 3 était plus grande mais la sdb était idem. Ne vous attendez pas à des salles de bains confortables, c'est niveau camping (installations peu pratiques et vieillissantes, interrupteurs d'un autre âge !)
Nous étions au 8ème étage vue sur la fontaine du MET, très agréable et aucun souci de sonorisation.
Le roof top est sympa mais les consommations sont chères (compter 15$ hors taxe et tip le verre, 60$ la "carafe").
Lobby luxueux qui donne une bonne impression.
La piscine fait réver en photo moins en vrai ! C'est une piscine surtout pour enfant et se rafraichir, impossible de se baigner dedans.
Personnel correct, certains compréhensifs d'autres non (je me suis vue refuser 3 bouteilles d'eau au prétexte qu'ils n'en donnent que 2 par jour, tant pis si on est 3...)
L'hôtel est assez bien situé proche de Columbus circle (avec un Whole food market très pratique pour faire ses courses) et proche de central park. le matin nous allions nous chercher un petit déjeuner chez Starbuck et le prenions en face de l'hôtel il y a un petit square.

title: Great Hotel, Great Service
text: Hotel was very clean, convenient location, gorgeous views from pool deck and rooftop. Hotel is within walking distance from a shopping center and Restaurants. The staff was very friendly, professional and helpful. Will definitely be returning.

title: Small room
text:
Nice hotel very well located.

Standard room queen bed was small but very clean. On-suite also small but shower area was well sized. No "off smells" and water was hot with good pressure.

Bed was comfortable, air conditioner worked well (a bit noisy), WiFi was fast. Iron and board in room. No tea/coffee making facilities.

title: Empire Hotel
text: Great location. Rooms small and very dark . No natural light. You could not see what the weather was like. Due to the design of the building. The room was noisy due to air con pipes going past windows. Take ear plugs. We had 5 rooms 3 had to argue for new rooms and managed to after a lot of stress.they were told but this is New York as if that’s a reason for small/dark rooms.  Small bathrooms . Bill way out , had to argue again. Told to go back to booking site! Great roof top bar, but at $9 a bottle of beer , didn’t spend much time there.

title: Great Location
text: The hotel was nice and in a great location. It’s a little dark in the hallways and in the rooms.  The food is a bit pricey, but the staff was very accommodating and there were plenty of useful amenities. There is plenty to do and lots to eat within walking distance of the hotel.

title: Old-fashioned and poorly equipped !
text: Not coming back ! Rooms are old , room cleaning did not come , bathrooms is tiny , street window 2nd floor very noisy, windows dirty , AC from the 80’s . Lobby nice , Consierge nice , Wallpaper in Floor irritating ... aso...

title: Not i pressed at all
text:
The room wasn't well equiped at all. No tea or Coffee, no kettle. No hairdryer.

Outside air conditioning was very loud. Basically we couldn't have a good sleep for 4 nights and we paid enough and had to pay at least $50 just on Coffee from Starbucks.

title: Great Visit!
text:
We stayed here based on the positive TA reviews as well as its great location. It was right across from Lincoln Center and a few blocks away from the Fordham campus. 
We arrived much earlier than check in (because my son had to attend class early) and the staff was great about calling my cell as soon as our room was ready. My very old cell phone had trouble connecting to the complimentary hotel wifi. I was quickly put in touch with their IT Communications team who were immediately able to help me to connect. I was truly grateful for that.  
There are great croissant shops and bakeries nearby to grab breakfast. The rooftop pool here was an amazing addition to our New York experience.  The pool was spotless. Every member of the hotel staff was helpful and attentive: the front desk staff, pool attendants, housekeeping and rooftop waitresses. 
I loved that the rooms include a fridge and safe. The hotel gym is also a nice convenience when traveling. 
We had a great time staying at the Empire Hotel and would definitely love to stay here again.

title: Classy and Close to it all
text: The Empire Hotel in NYC greets you with charm and elegance. As you enter the hotel, you are surrounded by rich textiles and staff that is more than accommodating. Everyone is wonderful and willing to help you have a fabulous stay. The lobby bar is beautiful and the decor throughout the hotel is top-notch.  The pool is a little small, more so a lap pool for one, but it sits upon the rooftop overlooking midtown Manhattan. The Lincoln Center is just outside your door with a beautiful fountain and open area to enjoy. Just around the corner is Central Park where you can rent bikes, or catch the subway to Downtown or Uptown Manhattan. Everything is truly close.  The beds are cozy but the bathrooms could use a little love (fans would be great). The bathroom had a lot of water damage from steam. Other than that, it's very clean and a great location

title: Great stay
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and grown up children (with their other halves). We were all on the same floor which was helpful. Service was excellent, all staff happy to help whenever with recommendations, filling our chilly bottles up with fresh cold water etc. We were given maps and daily complementary bottles of water if needed, just had to get them from reception. Was a trek from Times Square but next door to the Lincoln centre and Colombus shopping centre a tube station and there’s a Starbucks on the corner, which was very handy at the start and end of the day.
Rooms are a little tired but are more than adequate for what you need on such a trip. We didn’t get chance to try the pool and only went to the rooftop bar once at the end of the night and the outside part was full so sat inside, which was still a pleasant experience, Cosey lighting, nice atmosphere, drinks a little on the pricey side. 
Plenty of places to sit in the downstairs lobby and mezzanine with bathrooms and a bar, good for a meeting place for us to start the day or evening.
Rooms cleaned daily, towels and toiletries changed daily, iron and mini ironing board in the room, a fridge and a hairdryer too. Air con a little noisy but as you are so tired from the busy days in wasn’t an issue.
A great stay.

title: Wonderful Weekend Getaway
text: I booked this hotel from Saturday to Monday because I had a concert to go to and figured I would just make a weekend of it. The room was wonderful and I actually had a view of Lincoln Center right outside my window! The bathroom was a bit small, but it was fine for just me, and the shower had a rainfall showerhead AND a handheld option. I utilized the rooftop pool on Sunday and even though it was a bit small, at least 5 people could use it comfortably at one time(there were at most 3 other people using it when I was and we all had our own separate areas). Later in the day I walked over to Central Park for an evening picnic which was only a couple blocks away. The only negative I would say is that there was an incidentals fee that I wasn't expecting(I confused it with the resort fee) but that was just me not doing enough research and in no way the hotel's fault. I also wish I could remember the name of the staff who checked me in, as he was very patient and extremely welcoming throughout the whole confusion with the fee. I usually just stay at one of the cheap hotels when I'm in the city, but I will definitely stay at Empire again the next time I need a Treat-Myself Weekend.

title: Great staff, nice location
text: Location is very good, close to subway. Staff does what they can to help you with what you need. I arrived late night and Chris had a smile on his face and an outstanding good mood. Breakfast is in the rooftop and the view is amazing.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
text:
I have stayed at The Empire Hotel three times in the last few months and have enjoyed my visit each time.
The location is excellent, with easy access to the subway, and many great restaurants and attractions within walking distance. The staff could not have been friendlier. When I had a problem with a broken mini-fridge on my second trip, they replaced it immediately. The rooms are large, clean and welcoming. I feel like The Empire Hotel is my home away from home.

title: Ok
text: Was an ok hotel at best, like most in NYC, small rooms, however we'd booked superior rooms, there was nothing superior about them, unless you class a tiny bathroom and a full sized sliding window coming off in your hands. Nice bar on the roof, what I return, probably not!

title: Noisy rooms with no view
text: The hotel lobby was nice, but the rooms were small and the AC units in the rooms were old and noisy. Also the room we had just looked onto other rooms and the ventilation system for the hotel. None of this was mentioned during the booking procedure.

title: First Timer at an Exclusive Hotel
text: This was my first experience staying within a hotel located in the Manhattan area. It's kind of weird, being that I live in New York City. The experience was phenomenal. The hotel is a beautiful establishment, however the drinks are pricey. You must be prepared to spend a great deal if you plan to drink and be merry. Otherwise, I have no problems to report. Thank you Empire staff!

title: Jennifer at the desk is the best!
text: Jennifer at the desk was amazing! I booked a suit for my daughter's 23 birthday and she upgraded us to a corner suit with a great view of Lincoln center. She made a great start to a great stay! Thank you Jennifer!

title: Terrible Experience
text: Overcharged my credit card, customer service was terrible! Was not contacted by management- no surprise! Fridge didnt work, staff was not friendly at all! Overall they get 0 score from me and my family!

title: Wonderful!
text:
My husband and I traveled from Minnesota to New York City, for our fifth wedding anniversary. Checking in was great and we were there before 3, so they held our bags for us so we could start our vacation. 
The room was perfect for us, bed was comfortable and pillows were even better. Room was cleaned and the air conditioning was great after the "hot" New York days. 
Thank you to The Empire Hotel for making it a GREAT stay! We will definitely be back to stay again!

title: Great location, meh rooms
text:
We stayed here 4 nights. After a long day of driving, we got to the hotel at 4:15 and were told the room wasn’t ready (check-in starts at 3). The front desk staff was nice about it, held our bags, and we went to the rooftop bar. (Note-the rooftop bar was the best thing about our stay here. Great happy hour drinks, tasty bites of food, friendly and fast service, great vibe, and solid view. It was awesome). 

We got into our room around 5:30. It was fine.  The blinds didn’t work so we couldn’t let light into the room which made everything really dark. There was an iron, no ironing board, and no informational booklet/folder about the hotel which seemed strange.  

Second day of the stay were were gone all day out in the city and ran home at 5:30 to shower and get ready for dinner, but the room hadn’t been cleaned. I went downstairs to the front desk and the nice gentleman said he’d take care of it. We left for dinner at 6:30, got back to the hotel at 11 pm, and the room still hadn’t been cleaned. So I went back downstairs and asked for fresh towels and toiletries for the morning. 

The rest of the stay was fine, but for the price I paid for 4 nights, I would expect the details to be better taken care of.

title: Great Location
text: Great location across from The Lincoln Center, just north of Columbus Circle. Although a little north of midtown, this area is convenient to the subway and does not have quite as busy of a feel as midtown. The hotel is very nice, with great staff and a very nice rooftop lounge. The only negative aspect was that they did not have any creamer or sugar packets to put in your coffee (we were told they were on back order), which is not a big deal, but something I had never run into at a hotel before.

title: Great Hotel and Location!
text: I have stayed at The Empire hotel several times and love the place. The staff is very hospitable.  You can check out and still enjoy the pool upstairs while they keep your luggage in their front storage. The  view is beautiful from upstairs, rooms are nice and clean. I will return whenever I am in Manhattan!

title: So very disappointing
text:
I am so sad and embarrassed at the hotel experience that I just had. I have spent the past two days apologizing over and over again to my out of town guest that I convinced to stay in this hotel over others. The rooftop and pool deck experience were nice, and that's all I had known in the past. I assumed that the hotel experience would mirror this. 

It is quite possible the worst hotel stay I have ever had. We checked in to very rude staff who made it clear we were burdening them by taking questions. We had spent a lot of time in advance reserving the perfect suite - and when we walked in it smelled so terrible of chlorine that we couldn't sit in there for more than 10 minutes without a chemical headache. The front desk told us there was only one other suite in the entire hotel with two queen beds... so we moved from the 10th to the 3rd floor, and when we arrived it was clear we had just been downgraded at our own expense, even though it was not our fault the first room was uninhabitable. There was no coffee, food, water. etc. The blinds didn't work. It was musky and the A/C unit didn't work... we couldn't even sleep our first night because the air was so humid. Not to mention the awful lighting and strange noises throughout the night. 

So, the second night the engineer had to come in and physically replace the A/C unit! And it still was not very good. Nobody replaced our towels after the first night, so we had to call twice to get towels so we could shower before check out. Nobody ever came! So we had to fish through dirty towels on the floor to shower, before checking out. 

Never in my life have I had such an awful hotel experience. And especially to have this in NYC at a hotel that touts being a classy, luxury hotel - in an upgraded suite nonetheless! 

It is not easy for working moms to carve out time and money for a weekend getaway. We put so much thought, time, and money into having to coordinate travel, babysitters etc. And what should have been an amazing, relaxing, pampered weekend was all but completely ruined by this hotel. 

More than anything, I am just so sad...

title: Great hotel, exceptional localisation
text: My quilty pleasure is gossip girl, so when I saw the great discount for this hotel de descision was made soon. First of all de location is superb. It's a little bit above de crowded part of broad way. Central park is on walk distence (beautiful to run there in the morning) and the metro stops at your door so you can go whereever you want. Couldn't imagine a better localisation for an hotel. The hotel itself has a great rooftop and a nice pool. I liked the fitnesscenter as well. The room was nice, the bed was very good. There was no view though from my room and the shower was leaking, that were the only negatives.

title: 4 star? Must be a joke...
text: This is a run down, tired and dirty hotel whose only redeeming feature is it is in New York. There the attraction ends. Mould-covered air conditioning units you can’t control; a seventh floor bedroom window that doesn’t shut; a room no self-respecting cat would want to be swung in; a toilet that, bizarrely, wasn’t fixed to the floor; and filthy carpets. It would be a mystery to us if this place received a two star rating. We moved after one night to the excellent Grand Hyatt on East 42nd street, with little price difference. To The Empire Hotel’s credit, they agreed to refund the two nights we didn’t stay there.

title: Empire Hotel 25-07-2019 / 02-08-2019
text: Empire hotel is located right next to Central Park in New York. The hotel has a very good location near Fifth Avenue and you can get everywhere with the metro. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and the rooms were cleaned well every day. I was with my 2 daughters in a room with 2 double beds. The rooms are beautiful.

title: Nice NYC Hotel
text: This is a nice hotel in a great location. Within a few blocks of a subway entrance and within walking miles of good restaurants. My only complaint is that my shower was missing its door so it caused water to get all over the floor. Also, the TV was not mounted on the wall (though there was a wall mount) and was instead on the desk, which meant there was no desk in the room to work. Other than that, overall, it was a good room.

title: GREAT HOLIDAY.
text: The hotel was excellent. Reception staff were very friendly and very helpful nothing was to much trouble. Room was very clean and comfortable.Would fully recommend The Empire Hotel and perhaps return one day.

title: Ms
text:
I had 0 min sleep the first night! so much noise, those people next door slammed the door loudly  in and out their room since middle night, talked loudly in the hall way, other people couldn’t stand and yelled out: shut up!, the noise continued at 1am,  front desk was called at 3am for security to come, same noise happened at 5am, absolutely 0 sleep for me.
Complained to front desk, they offered $75 compensation!! It is not acceptable!!
 I don’t what to expect for my 2nd night...

title: I like this hotel, but it might not be for everyone
text:
This is my second time staying at The Empire. For some reason, I like it. It has a great vibe, it is a "darker" hotel that almost feels somewhat steampunkish. The overall look and feel of it is what mostly attracts me.

The rooftop cocktail lounge is nice, but it gets very busy as does the lobby bar. The lobby can get incredibly loud with large groups of younger people having drinks.

Rooms are very small and this is where the biggest shortcoming of the hotel is. Space in NY comes at a premium, so it is somewhat expected, but they are tiny. I was alone and had a suit case and a carry one. That is enough to make it feel crowded. You can't sit on the toilet without closing the door, that kind of cramped.

There is no room service so you either have to eat at the cocktail lounge, or buy stuff outside and bring it in. Be warned, the cocktail lounge is expensive and they don't serve full plates, it is more of a tapas type of thing. You'll need to eat between 3 to 4 plates before you feel satisfied, which will bring your bill to around $70 or so, just for the food. Drinks average at around $20. So you can see how you can rack up a bill fast.

There's a Starbucks on the corner and a convenience store/pharmacy around the corner. There is a Rosa Mexicano Mexican restaurant which is superb as well. Dry cleaners around the corner, but they do not do 1 hour service.

I'm debating if I want to return or not. Aesthetically, I like it, but lack of room service or restaurant is a turn off. I also did not like that it gets so incredibly loud, although it isn't an issue once you're in your room.

WiFi is stable, but VERY slow. I was getting 2 mbps down and 0.5 mbps up on average. Enough for email or YouTube, but dreadful if you need to do any larger file transfers.

The TV in the room looked like an older model, but I didn't even turn it on so I can't comment on programming. And yes, like others have commented, the AC units show their age and are on the loud side, which I actually use as white noise to drown some of the other sounds of the building and street.

title: Uptown Funk and class in dynamically modern Hotel
text: Very pleased with the accommodations.  Exquisitely appointed modern interiors, lighting, and details.  Concierge very helpful.  Mixologist/Bartenders very knowledgeable and gregarious.   Roof top parties, dining and lounging “off the chain”.  Great place to stay.  Not a great gym in the basement - the only downside ( not congruent with the accolades above) but back to the positives 2 complimentary water bottles in your room each night    4.8 stars out of 5

title: Another great stay
text: Been visiting The Empire for a few years now and it always delivers the goods. Really comfortable beds, great location, and top-notch staff - especially in the Lobby Bar. The rooftop has a great bar, small pool, lounge, meals, and a view

title: Improved!
text:
Stay here quite a bit as it is the only reasonably priced hotel adjacent to Lincoln Center. 
Much improved lately, newer senior management who really care. Looking forward to seeing what the new mezzanine restaurant space will be. Already has a great rooftop bar and restaurant. 
I’ll be back.

title: Frais de résidence exorbitants et piscine minuscule
text:
Clim hyper bruyante et on ne peut que supporter dormir avec ce vrombissement toute la nuit
La piscine est minuscule rien à voir avec les photos et prise d'assaut donc impossible de se tremper
Très cher payé malgré une bonne localisation près de central park

title: Great weekend stay!
text: My husband and I loved staying here for a long weekend.  The bed was comfortable, rooms very clean, and great location!  The pool is very small but is in a great location overlooking the city.  There are many chairs and loungers to sit on next to the pool that is quite relaxing.

title: Awesome hotel
text: We had a junior king suite, which was much larger than I would have expected for NY. The bathroom was a totally normal size as well, which means it was big for an NYC room. The room was really clean and the furnishing/decor was great. The lobby had a cool vibe without being inappropriate for my 14 year old daughter. The room was quiet and not a lot of street noise at all. The location is AMAZING. We could see Lincoln Center from our room. I will definitely be staying here when in NY again. I don't understand the mediocre reviews here.

title: Disappointing 15th Anniversary
text:
We came for 1 night on 8/6 to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary. We’re locals and wanted a night out in the city. We really wanted to love this place but just couldn’t. 

More than 1/2 the rooftop bar was closed and they wouldn’t open it up for us or others that asked despite the fact that there was no event going on at 11pm on a Tuesday night and we were hotel guests.The few seats that they had were taken by couples or sleeping children there with their parents. So we left. This was a HUGE disappointment given that the rooftop bar was a big reason we booked here.

I called down for extra pillows when we checked in at 4:30, but by 10:30pm nothing had been delivered to our room. We went to the front desk and were assured we would receive 2 feather pillows, however instead we got lumpy foam filled pillows.

Our bed was rock hard, to the point that it felt like we were sleeping on a box spring. 
The room was worn and not cared for. Paint was chipped on the bathroom door which would not stay closed at all. The base of the bed was ripped and frayed. 

I’ve wanted to stay here for years, but unfortunately the Empire Hotel was a disappointment.

title: Amazing location!
text: Great experience. Great customer service. I had troubles opening the door and came downstairs for another room key. The front desk was very pleasant and sent security upstairs to ensure I was about to get inside. Definitely staying here again.

title: Very clean hotel with welcoming friendly staff.
text:
When we first arrived in reception we were welcomed by a guy on the desk called Louis. He was very pleasant snd cheerful congratulating us on just getting married he upgraded our room. 

When we arrived in the room it was very clean and had a aroma of freshness. The bed is mega comfy and your head just sinks into the pillows. 

Bad points if the room: air con has no controls so cant switch off if to cold whilst on it rattles, only on ceiling light in room which is at door making room dark in the evening.

Roof top bar is amazing even though it was covered. Ordered our drinks at the bar to be told there was no Corona early evening but then another guest got on at other side of the bar minutes later!!! 

Breakfast was a bit disappointing for the price and selection on offer. Tried it once then had breakfast out after that.

The staff are very helpful and are happy to give you directions and advice aswell as recommend eateries.

title: Disappointing!
text:
Unfortunately the negative elements of my stay at the Empire outweighed the positive. For that reason, I won’t be returning and wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

The location is great, just off Broadway and close to Central Park and the Lincoln Centre. The hotel staff were very courteous and the check-in experience fairly efficient. The rooftop bar is a really cool place to hang out, good food and drinks, great views, not cheap but as you would expect for Manhattan. That is where the positives end.

The rooms are small, old and tired. In fairness the bed was comfortable enough however the aircon so noisy I had to switch it off to sleep and the (free) broadband dropped out so frequently it was impossible to work. I am so pleased I had booked a Superior King Room because anything less would have been unbearable. The gym is in the basement and smells of damp and the photos of the swimming pool are a joke – it’s really a plunge pool!

Now for the part that really soured my stay – the hotel lost my laundry. Whilst I accept mistakes happen I don’t accept the lack of care or the extremely poor communication by Housekeeping and then the Hotel Manager. Bottom line, an express same day service took two days and, in the process, they wasted several hours of my time. I got a meagre apology and the cost of the laundry knocked off my bill - which is a good job as it eventually turned up via TNT in a crumpled mess.

title: Summer Family holiday
text: The Empire met our needs and was perfectly located next to Central Park and the subway.  The hotel seems like an old lady but has plenty of New York charm and sass.  Rooftop bar is great and the beds and linen are good.  Not much noise from street and our ac worked perfectly fine.  The bathroom was small but clean and adequate for 3 nights.

title: Love the location and service
text: Across from Lincoln Center,  two blocks from Central Park, a few blocks from Columbus Circle and subway lines. The hotel is clean and our room, a corner suite, was spacious-- can't vouch for the rest. Busy restaurant on rooftop. Pool is just a "bathtub with style."  We are always treated with courtesy and helpfulness. Maid service is top notch.

title: Holiday visiting family in New York
text: Lobby is lovely that's the biggest positive. States its a 4 star actually would rate as a 2/3 star. Dated surroundings. Room very small and bathroom even smaller. Paper peeling off walls, paint work dirty. There was a power outage whilst we were there very few emergency lights worked the management resorted to putting glow sticks in stairwells. For a Health & Safety conscious country the hotel didnt appear to have an emergency plan. Pool is more of a plunge pool full of children. Bar don't serve coffee only alcoholic drinks. Would not stay here again.

title: Daughters birthday treat
text: Nice hotel in middle of New Yorkers, would definitely recommend the hotel. Staff in hotel very nice rooms basic but clean. Stayed on room only basis so we could dine out for meals. Bar prices ok about £6 for a pint of beer.

title: Summer Vacation
text: Overall it was a nice stay.  The bed was very hard and it was quite noisy at night.  But the location was spot on...close to the subway, bus and of course Central Park.  The room was cleaned daily and the staff were all very pleasant.  We went to the roof top bar the first night and most of it was roped off for some reason.  Price seemed fare for Manhattan Island.

title: Well located and very welcoming
text: I went with 3 grand children (11, 9 and 8 yrs old) and they enjoyed the swimming pool very much after visiting NY. The rooms were clean, the beds very confortable. We enjoyed our 5 nights stay very much.

title: One night at Empire hotel .
text:
Good location, nice bed, that’s about it.
Old, small room , not in a good shape, A/C unit was noisy, not a great value. There are better options for the price out there. I’m not going back there again.

title: Old and moldy
text: The front desk staff were rude and very unhelpful. The television in our room did not work due to a poor internet connection and there was mold in the shower. Housekeeping was extremely slow to makeup the room daily.

title: Location and common areas are the reasons to stay here
text: I have stayed here twice in the past 5 years.  As above, those are the two reasons to stay at this hotel. The lobby and the rooftop bar area are super and great places to meet up with friends and hang out for drinks. The location, directly across from Lincoln Center, can't be beat. The service was good. BUT...if you are expecting a welcoming, bright room (forget spacious, that's not happening), set your expectations accordingly. The lowest price category has super tiny rooms.  One price level up, is OK (no views).  Mattress was firm/good; linens just OK.  The quality of the room/bathroom renovation is poor and evidence of the old bones of the hotel is everywhere (and not in a good way), if you look--whether it is the peeling paint on the doors or the dingy back hallways and stairwells outside of the swank common areas. The "splash pool" is a joke. It's maybe 5 x 15 feet in size, tucked into an alcove.. So--stay here if you need to be close to Lincoln Center, if you want to hold court at the rooftop bar (which is a fantastic, giant space with outdoor and indoor options), and if you plan to spend minimal time in the room.

title: 3 nights in July
text: Hamburger shooters with french fries in roof lounge expensive and not too good. View there was nice. Hostess and service very good. Nice little park right outside hotel with tables on wide sidewalk for you to drink your Starbucks which was just next door.

title: Exceptional Hotel on West Side
text: In the heart of Lincoln Center neighborhood, the Empire Hotel meets all your needs for day-tripping or business.  Rooms are clean, efficiently meet your needs, and unbelievably quiet for being in the heart of performing arts and the city-life around it.  Roof Top Bar is beautiful to start your journey into the city night, or to end it in a city that never sleeps!  I stayed here for both business and fun and it is my best choice on the west side!  Close to Columbus Circle and subways (not to mention shopping, theatre, and Central Park) it's convenience cannot be beat.  Staff are exceptional, and wise in assisting.  Beds were comfortable, ac unit worked great (and not noisy) and the bathroom had a power shower to get you awake and ready for city-fun/work or wind down after a day putting miles on your feet!

title: Tiny, dark room
text: Do not stay in a "41" room.  They are tiny and dark, as the curtains can not be opened due to being an interior room.  These rooms should only be used for storage, and not of humans.  Upon check-out, no one inquired about my stay.  I clearly know why.  When you can't fit your knees in the bathroom, it may be too small.

title: Relaxing Stay
text: Steps away from Central Park! How New York can that be? I had a pleasant stay with family. The service was great and staff were hospitable. Lewis provided us with great recommendations for my teenage grandkids. Dennis was gracious delivering our luggage promptly. Food was good in The Empire Rooftop and Pj Clarke's, and the servers were friendly.

title: My Go-To Manhattan Hotel
text: This is my second time staying at Empire. First one was longer and for business. The staff is always friendly and competent. I've stayed almost two weeks total and never had one issue with service. Check In/Out is simple and rooftop bar/restaurant has a great view and value. Price is very reasonable. Location is perfect for anything NY not just Manhattan. $10-15 Uber ride to Penn St, which I took both times, lets you get anywhere in the city or state. If I had one small criticism, it would be that the rooms are a little older, but it's an older hotel/building and not that big of deal. Overall I love this place and combination of everything described would be hard to find.

title: Wonderful staff; major structural hazard in my room
text:
The staff is great - reception desk, rooftop bar hostess and waitress, cleaning staff. The location could not be better - right across the street from Lincoln Center. It’s very convenient to the theater district, but much calmer than those humongous Times  Square hotels. The bedding is comfortable and light-blocking curtains that I love. I was in an ADA accessible room because that’s what was available when I arrived at night. 

The safety problem is that the floor of the bathroom (Room 837) completely floods - like over an inch of water - when you run the shower. Instead of having the shower floor slope towards the drain in the shower, it slopes towards the center of the bathroom. It’s very slippery! I stepped out of the bathroom to use the hairdryer for obvious reasons.

All you personal injury lawyers out there - I notified the hotel staff about this and they said the staff knew about it and the hotel was going to install some sort of bumpers along the edge of the shower to keep the water in. In the meantime, if you get someone who is injured in a fall because of this (thank goodness I wasn’t), I’m your witness that they had notice.

I assume they’ll fix it soon. Otherwise it’s a great place.

title: The Name Defines It
text: The Empire Hotel rules when in comes to location, service, decor, and most of all, staff were pleasant and professional.  We had an excellent experience at The Empire Rooftop And Pj Clarke’s as well! Food was wonderful, service was on point and staff were pleasant. We will definitely return and recommend to anyone visiting NYC!

title: Fabulous location in The heart of NY!
text: I spent 3 wonderful nights here during my first trip to New York and found this hotel to be centrally located to all I wanted to do and see. My room was very comfortable with a beautiful view and excellent air conditioning. The staff are all friendly, helpful, and very professional. I had no issues with noise, and the bed was perfect.

title: Amazing bartender!!
text: Andrea was SO personable and accommodating during our stay. We had to wait for our room after check in time, but Andrea gave us tips on where to go out at night, and immediately felt like a friend. Highly recommend stopping for a drink with her!

title: Loved it!
text: We just got back from staying at the Empire. After reading some of the negative reviews we weren't sure if we had made the right decision. I loved this hotel!  Staff was wonderful and check in was quick and we got our rooms right away.The location is perfect. Walking distance to pretty much everything. We were in Room 104, no view but we were ok with that. Room was a pretty good size and was very clean. My friends rooms were next to us and was smaller but honestly you are not in NYC to stay in your rooms. My only small complaint was that they don't have a coffee maker in the room but we found a really nice deli place just around the corner and would get great breakfast sandwiches, muffins, yogurt, fruit and coffee and go sit across the hotel where there are tables and chairs set up and have our breakfast there. It was perfect.We went to a very nice Italian restaurant across the street and also next door to the hotel for dinner  Very reasonable The closer you get to Time Square the more expensive it gets. We love this hotel and NYC. We would defiantly stay here again!

title: My stay
text: There was no complementary coffee or water the fridge wasn't working the towels weren't enough the room and bathroom was not completely clean, Bathroom services are not enough such as shampoo, soap and paper towels.

title: Awful Experience
text:
I have never had such a bad experience in a hotel in NYC before. The hotel is old, dirty, dark and understaffed. The standard rooms are awful, more like a closet with noisy air conditioning which works sometimes. I had a hard time to get the phone answered by the front desk and when my ac didn't work their solution was to send someone to fix it three times and I ended up sleeping without it in the heat of the NYC summer!!! and do not think that they would even give you a tiny water bottle for free every day, because they charge you for it at the end of your stay. 
Very poor hotel indeed.

title: Amazing location!
text: Great hotel for location and price. V nice common areas. Rooms quite snug and bathroom very tight, but do you care in NYC - when you are out all day/evening anyway? Gorgeous view of Lincoln Center from room. Location cant be beat. Rooms nicely decorated. Will stay again, definitely.

title: Christmas in nyc!!
text: Had an amazing Christmas in New York and couldn’t of picked a better hotel to stay in!! Right next to the tube, or you can stroll through Central Park... Lovley service and the rooms were 10/10! Would definitely recommend.

title: Excellent find, great location
text: Great location, friendly staff, very affordable, great rooftop pool, bar and restaurant! Right across the street from The Met and Lincoln Center. Many great restaurants nearby. Excellent views from rooftop. Nice size rooms.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: The hotel staff goes above and beyond to accommodate all of your expectations.  The location is perfect...close to everything but not in the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  The Rooftop Lounge is awesome and a great way to spend the night after a long day of sightseeing.  Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Très belle Hotel
text: Très bien situer, agréable ,  employées poli chaleureux. Le roof top ...wow génial la vue et les ....drinks....La musique un peu forte mais que voulez-vous...nous sommes plus de l'âge de faire la fête....;-) Mais un bellle hotel agréable friendly et assez abordable. Ils sont style pour toutes les bourses ou presque....

title: Wonderful Experience
text: The Empire Hotel is an overall wonderful experience. The hotel is in a great location to experience the city. The staff was polite and helpful. The room is small but all you need when you just need a place to sleep and rest. The cost is a great deal for everything you receive and the location.

title: My stay at Empire Hotel
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Empire Hotel it was very clean and quiet ,staff was very accomidating and helpful from door man to desk. Enjoyed the view's and sittimg area on the roof. Check in and out was an easy process.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Excellent hotel, great location and wonderful service. It even has a pool in the rooftop.  At check in Jeffrey helped us out and  was amazing throughout the whole stay. He helped is out a lot! Really the best hotel!!

title: おすすめ！
text:
平日18時過ぎに行きました。
人が多くなく、ゆっくりと過ごすことができました。店員さんが優しく、お酒も美味しくて一人でも楽しめました！

title: hotel qui ne vaut pas son prix
text: certaine chambre minuscule sombre avec vis a vis de deux metre de distance sur le lit de l hotel d en face ! tout est payant et tres cher (petite bouteille d eau a 6$) hotel qui se montre de luxe mais loin de l etre . le personnel du rooftop femme n est pas commode mais le rooftop est magnifique malgres qu il ne soit pas haut.la vue est superbe et le couche du soleil aussi . les chambre sont relativement propre mais pas plus confortable que dans un hotel normal

title: Good stay but unfortunate incident
text: The hotel is good and well located unfortunately I left a pair of sandals after checking out and when two hours later I came back for them they were never found. I was left angry as I felt betrayed by the room staff and housekeeping seriousness.

title: Extreme hospitality
text: Celebrating our 5 year wedding anniversary every body from the front desk to the lounge were extremely nice and accommodating roof top bar and pool services were excellent will definitely come back next year

title: Lovely NYC Location
text: My daughter lives in the area around the Lincoln Center and we are always spending a night in the city. We choose the Empire Hotel this past week and were pleased with the hotel. The rooms are small but well appointed and set up. They are, like most hotels in the area, heavily used so the rooms show some wear and tear but are clean and comfortable nonetheless. Our mini fridge was not working but the staff were extremely responsive and came right up to fix it. The hotel staff - from the door man to the valet, to the reception desk, room service and the upstairs lounge - were all very courteous and went out of their way to be helpful and engaging. The upstairs bar is lovely with great views esp. of Lincoln Center. We would stay here again. Enjoy!

title: Great location, value and service
text: The Empire is in a great location with plenty to do in the Lincoln Center area; keep checking for specials, the Rooftop lounge is really nice and a happening place, and the front desk staff, esp Marilyn, were very helpful and great

title: Pleasant stay.
text: Solo female traveler, spent 3 nights on 5th floor, room 509, a standard queen room w/ small bathroom.  Bed was extremely comfortable, room was not large but adequate for one person.  Bathroom was tight, and in need of a new paint job.  That's not a spoiler, though, just an observation.    I met the GM when she called to see if a prior guest had left a shoe in the room (yes, it was there), and she was so pleasant over the "interruption" of my stay that she graciously comped my breakfast for the next morning.  The bellmen greeted me each time I came and went, the breakfast staff were also polite.  My only thumbs-down was the pricey daily "residence fee."  For that I was to be given 2 bottles of water daily plus wi-fi.  I never used the wi-fi and received the Fuji water bottles only once during my stay; I even asked for them on the second day and was refused as I didn't have a water bottle card, only my room keycard.  The GM was  not available at that time so I let it go, but as far as customer service goes, the hotel flopped on this.   If you are going to an event at Lincoln Center this hotel is smack dab across the street. Central Park West is one or two short blocks away.  Very convenient for upper midtown, too.  I would stay here again but that residence fee stinks.

title: Great Hotel
text: Super nice clean staff, modern clean baths and rooms, walk in showers with rain heads and sprayers. Very comfortable new beds, great views directly across from Lincoln Center and a multi level indoor and outfoor rooftop bar with 2 bars !!!

title: Empire hotel!
text: We had such a great experience here! All of the staff members were so kind and friendly. Hotel was very clean. So much to see and do right near by! You can walk to Times Square and Central Park. Very close to the subway as well. Great hotel!

title: Avoid
text:
Birthday celebration trip to New York were marred by poor service, noisy air con, tired hotel which claims to be 4 star but isn’t. It’s a great location but overpriced for what it has to offer. 
Bathroom shower was poor & dilapidated, hot water was variable- breakfast at $25 was poor and much better available outside of the hotel.

title: Avoid!
text:
No control for air con so either hot or cold. 
No advice on what charges were taken at check in. 
No ventilation in bathroom making whole room hot. 
No stocked mini bar or glass shower screen as stated in booking. 
No shampoo had to wash hair with shower gel. 
No natural light blinds always pulled and view of building right next door. 
Very dim lighting. 
INCREDIBLY noisy in hallway ie other guests. Can hear people in rooms 3 doors down yelling and slamming doors. 
Called front desk three times (via housekeeping as they never answer). 
Security didn’t do much. When complained was told by incredibly rude older man at Reception I just have to keep calling all night till they stop. 
Worst 4 star hotel I’ve ever stayed in. 

Only good thing was comfy pillows. And manager Marilyn who cancelled the rest of my stay after I booked another hotel to move to.

title: Stay at The Empire for Amazing service, value,  location and pool!
text: I checked in around 9:30 at night and Jeffery was fantastic.  He was very kind, helpful and was able to upgrade my room.  I stayed for just one night but have stayed there before a few years back.  The location is excellent! Just enough away from the hustle and bustle but still close to everything.  The pool and deck are amazing, such a gem in NYC.  The bell staff was equally helpful and very friendly.  I love the decor in the lobby with plus it has a full bar.  It's right around the corner from Starbucks but if you just walk a couple blocks more, there is a Bouchon in the mall.  A little Napa Valley in NYC never hurt.  I also noticed families with small children so I will definitely be back here with my family.  Great value, service, location and pool!

title: Buen hotel en una buena zona
text:
Es un hotel bonito, situado en una zona cercana a Central Prak, con una parada del metro muy cercana y permite el descanso después de un día de paliza visitando la ciudad.
Tiene una terraza espectacular con un pequeña piscina. Muy recomendable para tomar una cerveza, un poco cara, al anochecer.
Las habitaciones son amplias y una baño con una buena ducha.

title: For Work and Pleasure
text: My stay at the Empire was for a business trip.  The location of the hotel was perfect.  It's within easy distance to attractions via foot, taxi (uber), or subway.  There are multiple restaurants and a Whole Foods nearby.  The staff was very prompt when there was an issue; however, dealing with those issues was at times complicated and took multiple staff members and a couple of days.  I also arrived early to the hotel (they graciously stored my bags).  They were supposed to notify me when my room was ready, they never did.  It's not truly that big of an issue, but if you state that you are going to do something, follow through.  The only issue we had with the hotel room was that our 11th floor room air conditioner was unable to keep up with the temperatures of summer time New York.  The thermostat was set at 65 degrees, but the room temperature never dropped below 85 degrees.  The outside air temperature had to drop below 80 degrees for the room temperature to finally drop.  As I'm writing this with an outside air temperature of 68 degrees, the room temperature is 73 degrees, and the thermostat is still set at 65 degrees.  If you choose to stay here during the summer months, request a lower floor because their fist-come-first-serve policy does not guarantee you one (I arrived at 9 am on my check-in date).

title: Location location
text: A great location to see the highlights of New York. My only criticism would be that overall it is starting to show a bit of age. That said it does however offer great benefits like a pool, which other do not.

title: Beautiful entryway/lobby
text: Staff was very nice.Upon checkin we were told I had a second reservation however, it could not be found which 3rd party company. With that,  they offered an upgrade to a King Suite very spacious in compared to most hotels in Manhattan. After spending about 45 in the upgraded suite we noticed the air conditioning wasn’t working and it was very uncomfortable in the room. Maintenance guy said it was shot and they changed our room however, no more King Suites .. we were not happy but the Queen room did have air which was better. My husband complained some and they gave us each a drink voucher for our inconvenience. Over all the place is nice close to subway and Central Park. Quiet part of the city and away from the touristy areas. The lobby is really pretty and the bartenders are super friendly.

title: Perfect location
text: Great location - right by Central Park and the subway. You can also walk to most of the areas except maybe Chinatown and Battery park. Pool is small but does the job. The pool deck is nice and relaxing. I would recommend staying here.

title: Fantastic stay
text: This was our first visit to New York and we will certainly come back and would highly recommend the Empire Hotel.  It's ideally situated for central park and uptown.  The service was exemplary and nothing was too difficult for the staff.

title: Nice location but old and slow
text: This is a classic old NYC hotel in a terrific location. Rooms are typically small and a bit tired but well cared for. I arrived early for check-in and my room wasn't ready. No problem. But I came back when told to and it still wasn't ready. Twice more I came back when told to and the room I was supposed to get had been given to someone else. If you are in Manhattan for business or the night life and need a handy place to sleep, this is a very good place for that.

title: Not as good as it was in gossip girl 😏
text:
Got 2 rooms for 2 nights one of the room the ac was not working properly.
The other room he door doesnt close right you have to slam hard to close and pull hard to open. Complained & argued before they gave me another room.

title: Great location, right across from Lincoln Center
text: It's hard to beat the location, especially if you are doing cultural events on the upper west side. Our room was a bit dark, having windows to an unattractive inner space, but this is NYC, so that is to be expected, especially for the price. The breakfast and roof areas are lovely. Staff were very accommodating.

title: New York Visit
text: We found the Empire Hotel perfect for our needs.  We had 2 rooms and the front desk staff worked to put us on the same floor.  All the staff were helpful and courteous.  Particularly so in the power outage.

title: HVAC Issues 2 years in a row
text:
Sure, we got lucky and booked our weekend trip to NYC on the hottest day of the summer two years in a row. This year, I booked a junior suite because the rooms are tiny otherwise and my thought was that “nicer” room would not have the issues we experienced last year. Needless to say, it was 100 degrees outside and our junior suite on the top floor never got below 80 degrees. Which for the record, is not a comfortable sleeping temperature, at least for me.

You can’t beat the location and the pool is a fun space that is full but never crowded. 
Having the room on the 11th floor was very convenient to the pool. The pool is really the only reason we booked here again. Next year, we will find a different, more updated hotel, with an outdoor pool in Manhattan.

title: Empire Hotel
text: Excellent hotel with perfect location for Central Park activities and Lincoln Center.  Pleasant staff.  I cannot report on how the staff handled problem situations because I didn't have any problems! I will stay at the Empire when I visit NYC on my future trips.

title: Empire and Mackenzie- Top of the Town!
text: Our entire experience at the Empire was excellent. The service, everyone’s attitude and personality from Dennis at the front door, to the security elevator man, and especially Mackenzie(front desk)! Mackenzie was so kind from the time we checked in and all little questions and inquiries we had. She was the top of the town as was our entire experience at the Empire! Thank you! We’ll be back!

title: Great Bartender
text: Celebrating our anniversary turned out to be a scorching heat wave in NYC but Andrea in the Lobby Bar was a pleasure from the first day. Relatable and easy to make you feel welcome.  Friendly, professional and makes a great drink too!

title: Loved our stay at the Empire Hotel ...
text: Wonderful hotel.  Clean, quiet.  Staff was always helpful, room was ready right at 3 and was bright and had everything we needed.  Beds were comfortable, pool was perfect for two adults to take a quick dip.  Cabs always at the ready outside.  Will definitely stay there again.

title: Empire Hotel
text: I loved the location. While we were there, the power went out. Staff did a great job in servicing the needs of guests.It was close to Central Park, subways, and Lincoln Center. They were accommodating.

title: Good location at a sensible rate
text: Seated in a good position, the hotel also offers some valuable facilities (roof garden with great view, small swimming pool, gym). Kind staff. The only flaw was the low brightness of rooms and the common parts due to mild light and dark walls.

title: Pratique mais un peu cher
text: nous avons eu de la chance et nous sommes allés dans cette hôtel grace à une vente privée nous avons payé 1900 avion +hôtel en regardant le prix si nous avions pas le prix de la vente privée l hôtel aurait été à 2700 euros pour 7 nuits. le prix est assez cher par contre nous sommes très bien placés vers columbus short en bas de central park côté midtown à 20 min à pied de time square et il y a tout les métros qui passent à côté de l hôtel ce qui est très pratique. par contre nous avons pas eu de bouteille d eau tous les jours dans la chambre il n y a pas de service de thé ou café si besoin. il y a un frigo coffre fort.  la salle de bain est minuscule c'est pas pratique du tout. le lit super confortable et immense c est agréable. le plus c'est la piscine sur le toit mais par contre c'est la plus minuscule qui existe donc si vous y allez c'est juste oour faire un plouf et ressortir.

title: Trop NY en famille
text:
Hôtel hyper bien situé. Personnel impeccable et agréable.
Les mauvaises surprises: simple vitrage (donc bruyant), des taxes de séjour de 19€/nuit.
Roof -top très sympa.
Piscine sur le toit, mais minuscule

title: Great customer service!
text: Great customer service. All the staff was very friendly and courteous. The rooms were clean and was able to get a good size room for a New York City hotel. The location is great as well as the food. It was also nice to be able to spend time at the rooftop bar. Our group enjoyed the outdoor rooftop but then we were able to come in when it got too hot. It also rained but the staff was patient with our large group and catered to our every need!  Thanks Anjan!!

title: Deceptive pricing and rude front desk ruined an otherwise okay stay
text: I stayed at this hotel for a conference and initially was quite pleased with the rooftop bar. There definitely were some drawbacks: the "pool" is more like a narrow wading track, my room was tiny (and the hall smelled like ganga the first night), and my bed was very hard with lumpy pillows, but for the price and location I thought I had gotten what my company had paid for. The real problem came at checkout. I was confronted with a bill for $91 for "residency fees" of over $22 a night. I had not been informed of this fee when I checked in. I was told, very rudely, that I had signed something to this effect but when I looked at what I signed, it essentially seemed like I was signing for incidentals, which I was careful not to rack up while I was there, and the "fee" was completely buried in fine print that I only saw once I knew to look for it. I was also told "incidentals" when I was checking in--no indication that this was a fee I was going to have to pay no matter what. I've since been doing some reading on SmarterTravel and apparently this is a racket many hotels are using to list at low rates on places like Expedia and then get back to their real rates with hidden fees. It was bad enough to have to deal with these deceptive practices, but the gentleman behind the counter was so rude and dismissive that I was shaking by the time I had finished the encounter. And apparently this is his usual mode of operation when any trouble arises, because he was equally rude to the poor German tourist after me who had not thought to book the airport shuttle 24 hours ahead (who would have?) and was brusquely told he should have known and he was basically out of luck. So yeah, not going back to this hotel again.

title: I'm engaged!
text: We booked the room for the weekend to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday and during our stay she became my fiancee. because of the special occasion management gave us a nice upgrade. Unfortunately we experinced a brief blackout {the whole neighborhood} but the hotel was up and running quickly.

title: Mother and daughter trio
text: Loved this little hotel, it was in a great location, for walking, catching public transport, shopping. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful.The room was really big, had two double beds, and the beds were really comfortable to sleep on. The only thing which was disappointing was there was no kettle in the room to take a cup of tea( you no us English love our tea) so had to go down to starbucks to get a tea in the morning. But apart from that little thing, every thing was lovely

title: Fantastic
text: Fantastic vacation.  The hotel is centrally located in Manhattan with exquisite views from the rooftop terrace. Good breakfast and friendly service by the frontdesk and the doormen. Nice and clean all over.

title: Empire hotel
text:
Excellent...the remodeling and fresh look throughout the hotel is impressive
I have witnessed the changes Ad love the, especially the roof top bar. Wow what an amazing change
Now we Ed a decent rest at the Empire

title: Great location and nice accommodations!
text: Everyone was friendly, the rooms were more spacious then I imagined for NYC. I loved the soaps and shampoo stuff too! Thank you for a lovely stay!the rooftop pool is tiny, but fun place with rooftop bar. The gym is in the basement and happy to have found it!

title: A little odd
text:
I have never stayed at a 4 star hotel without room service. And there was not a kids menu. The pool is tiny, only 2 meters wide, and not very long- its really just full of kids. But it was not that clean, I found black hair floating around and bits of plastic...
The receptionist who dealt with us was not that friendly. 
The door men are really nice.
The rooms are nice, but old, they are in need of some love.
The view from the roof terrace is awesome. Nice food
Awesome location! 1 street away from Central park, and across the road from a awesome Italien restaurant and a small Century 21

title: Im großen und ganzen gut
text: Kleines Zimmer, alles sauber, täglich 2 kleine Flaschen Wasser kostenfrei, sehr guter Service, Hotel sehr zentral gelegen (ca. 5 Minuten Gehweg zum Central Park und zur Subway, ca.15 Minuten Gehweg zum Times Square)

title: Great Value - Large Space - Excellent Location
text: First time staying at Empire Hotel after years of coming to NYC for business and fun. The room was large, quiet, air conditioning white noise made for a super night's rest. Great rooftop bar & restaurant. And the location next to Central Park and Columbus Circle makes this a great find. Wish my wife would have been with me as last trip made the mistake of staying at the Hudson and she won't let me forget it.

title: Empire Hotel, NYC
text:
Great hotel and superior location. Directly across form Lincoln Center  and so close to Central Park and great restaurants.
Staff is welcoming and service is terrific. Wonderful off top bar with great views.

title: Great Location and pricing for NYX
text: Stayed here July 9th - 12 2019 with my family of 4 (2 Adults and 2 kids). The hotel was very welcoming upon arriving, check-in was fast, effective and went without an issue. Rooms are small - but expected it based on other reviews and searching for properties. The rooms are worn and could use some freshening up. Pool and rooftop patio are very nice bonuses. Kids loved the pool after trotting around NYC in the heat. Check-out was simple and the bellhops and all the staff were extremely friendly and attentive.

title: Great location but very noisy room
text: The hotel is in a great location just by Central Park and the Lincoln centre. Unfortunately our room was a little bit disappointing, The bathroom door looked like it had been quite badly damaged, the blind didn’t work (my husband eventually fixed it!) and the AC was so noisy it stopped us sleeping well at all. We didn’t really use the roof terrace but the breakfast was good. We had a small coffee machine in the room which was really appreciated.

title: Delighted with the Deluxe rooms!
text: Have been staying at The Empire every year for one week. This year, we decided to book the Deluxe rooms.  These rooms are well worth the extra price from booking either a Standard or Superior rooms. All rooms have a very good view. Our two rooms booked both overlooked the Lincoln Center. The staff was very helpful. The hotel now has a dynamic Hotel Manager Ms. Leilani Nocon, and I could feel the positive change she has brought about in the hotel! Highly recommend staying at this "Best location in UWS" hotel that is also very welcoming.

title: You pay for what you get!!
text: It was great for the money, the hotel is beautiful on the inside, the pool however is way smaller than it looks in the pictures, and there is also a rooftop lounge with an awesome panoramic view..  i stayed only one night but it was worth the money

title: The Best Stay?
text: Our family trip to NYC for the first time was amazing! But let's talk about the hotel. It is an older hotel, do not expect any clamor or glitter, the hotel smelled old if it was damp, so I purchased a couple of room refreshers for the rooms. (Pick some up at your dollar store before you travel) The rooms are small and cramp as well as the bathroom, and the carpet looks as if this has seen better days. The important questions are would I stay here again, Yes. Why the location and the price. The location is fantastic, a few blocks walking to Times Square, two blocks up is Central Park and Columbus Circle, also across the street is the Lincoln Center, (catch a free concert) The subway entrance is also across the street. Across the street from the hotel is a nice sitting area with trees, tables, benches so you can relax or enjoy a meal or sip your coffee, no need to do any of these things in the room. Back to the hotel, the staff was very nice, the lobby is clean and enjoyable. You can go to the rooftop and enjoy a drink, $$.

title: Week in NYC
text: The Empire is  a great location if you are planning a stay in NYC. East access to Lincoln Center, Time Warner and public transportation. Prices are reasonable and the staff was fantastic from check-in through checkout. A great alternative to big hotel chains.

title: Very good price for location
text: Stayed here for 4 nights in August and it was a very good vacation. Hotel is located 2 blocks from Central Park and is approximately 15 minute walk to time square. Less foot traffic and much much cheaper than staying right in the centre. Very nice room with king bed and nice roof top bar, only major issue was the bathroom was extremely tiny, I don't need much room to get ready but it was a struggle to shower or do anything in there. Would also skip the lobby bar as cocktails are very expensive. Besides that I would gladly stay there again.

title: Great Service
text: We stayed at the Empire Hotel on a short trip to NYC and loved the location and the staff here. The front desk was always helpful and I wanted to mention Pasquale in particular who made every effort to make our trip memorable. This location is ideal for traveling up and down Manhattan and Broadway.

title: 3 days in NYC
text:
Friendliness of the staff was exceptional, great room and shower ....bathroom are a bit tight but useful 
Love the free Fiji water everyday and a good WiFi in and out of the room.
Rooms are very quiet although the hotel was full,I didn’t feel the noise or the crowds.

title: My choice, unquestionably
text: I just love this hotel. The location is excellent, opposite to The Lincoln Center, next to the Central Park and in walking disctance to the countless shops. Perfect! The Staff has been very kind every time I've visited the hotel during seven years. Empire is my hotel in New York. I'm coming back again this fall.

title: Close to Fordham University,Lincoln center
text: Our daughter is a junior at Fordham University Lincoln center, the Empire Hotel is directly across the street.Perfect location , close to Columbus Circle, Central Park and walking distance to all the theaters. The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and great views. The staff is very attentive and helpful. Many restaurants, stores and Lincoln Center. You won’t be disappointed with this hotel. Also just did some major renovations.

title: Second Stay Better Than the First...Will Stay Here Again
text:
This was our second stay at the Empire Hotel. The location is very convenient and off the major tourist routes. Located across from Lincoln Center and just down from Columbus Circle it is near two Subway stations and within walking distance of Central Park. You are two subway stops away from Times Square. 

The Hotel is a classic 1920's building with a beautiful dark wood lobby. The rooms are a good size (for NY standards) with a small refrigerator (mini-bar). 

The staff is courteous and friendly and housekeeping had our room cleaned quicker than just about any other hotel that I've stayed at (and I'm a frequent traveler). 

The pool is tiny but the rooftop deck where it is located is really nice in the evening. The same goes for the rooftop bar. 

We will definitely be back.

title: Stunning Style and Perfect Lincoln Center Location!
text: The ambience of the Empire Hotel is absolutely stunning! My son is at Juilliard, and the location of the Hotel across from Lincoln Center is ideal. I also want to remark on the extraordinary professional and welcoming staff. From the complimentary Fiji water to the glorious rooftop pool, lounge, and restaurant, the Empire Hotel is a rare gem.

title: Fantastic Experience
text:
Incredible value for the location. The Friendliest most professional Staff you will find in the industry.
From arrival through checkout, never stopped wowing me.

Door staff super attentive, exceeding my needs and expectations.

Front Desk Agents and Managers, made me feel at home and welcome.

title: Rooftop with a view
text: Wonderful friendly staff. Comfortable rooms. Lovely rooftop pool and lounge. It was a great location for shopping or just a walk in Central Park.
