It was great having Starbucks close by to grab and enjoy at the little park across the street, which we did each morning. Empire made our trip awesome!!! 😊

title: Our Stay at The Empire Hotel
text: We recently visited NYC & chose to stay at The Empire Hotel. We picked this hotel for their room selection which offered rooms with 2 beds.  The lobby of the hotel was beautiful.  The location near the subway & Central Park was super convenient for us.  The staff at the hotel in all departments were great!

title: Great service and location
text: This was our first trip to NYC and we guessed at a good location...and we did well! Just a short walk to Central Park and Trump Tower and plenty of good eats close by. Service at hotel was great and rooftop bar and pool were fabulous! Rooms were small but expected.

title: Training in dire need! Fail fail fail
text: After attitude my colleague and I were accommodated again with attitude and it was not busy (no surprise). The room door opened and I we were smacked with stench, only to find a floating turd in the toilet. Cleanliness is a big deal and this was unreal. I truly still can't believe it. The staff googling about it was more disgusting than the poop. Staying here was my suggestion, we were tired from work and a long flight and had to gather our things, find and stay at another hotel. How embarrassing. To think we we're going to return in August. Never even got to see thrre rooftop. What a fail.

title: Love That Location!
text:
Spent three days at the Empire over July 4 Weekend.  As in the past I chose it for its location opposite Lincoln Center, convenient to events there and surrounded by terrific restaurants and good public transport to other areas.  I work in theatre, so I love how close it is to Broadway - I can get to theatre and back again easily without having to actually stay in the hell that is TimesSquare-Land.

This is an older hotel, so if you're looking for super-sleek surroundings, wide open spaces, and the latest and greatest amenities you won't get that here; also if you don't like the colour orange, you're not going to care for the room decor, which is sort of Asian Revival Meets Scarsdale in the '60s.  That being said, my King bedroom was clean, the bed was firm and comfortable (though I imagine it might be too hard for some), and the bathroom small-ish but spotless.  The bathroom lighting is pretty harsh, and there's not a lot of surface to put things on, but there was plenty of really hot water and the pressure was great,  particularly impressive for a rainfall shower. (Be aware that there seem to be upgrades in progress to the bathrooms, so it's a bit luck of the draw what your experience will be - in a previous stay I was less happy, dysfunctional drain, low pressure, and wobbly showerhead.)

The cooling/heating system is ancient, and there's no thermostat in the room; the below-window unit  limits your control to on/off, heat/cool, low/hi. The 4th was a brutally hot and humid weekend in the City, and the a/c was only just able to keep the room on the right side of comfortable during the day, but effective enough at night that I could sleep without a problem.  It is quite noisy, but if you live with any kind of air purifier or humidifier, or window unit a/c, it shouldn't bother you much once you get used to it.

Rooms on the west/northwest side of the hotel have great views of the Lincoln Center plaza; East/Northeast look out on the restaurants opposite on Broadway; and some (I've stayed in one) have views of the utility airshaft, so...it's worth pressing for some information when you reserve.
Staff (especially on the front desk) are friendly, welcoming, and very helpful.

Overall for culture vultures, foodies, and West Side lovers, the Empire is a solid choice and good value for the money if you're prepared to deal with its quirks.

title: More shabby than chic
text:
The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful and it's in a good location near Columbus Circle. They have a validation agreement with Icon on 63rd that will shave about $20/day off your parking, if you're driving (unless you want to pay the hotel's $70/day valet fee.) The bed and pillows are comfortable. However, it's one of those hotels that looks nice at first glance, but upon closer look, it's a little shabby. The internet was unreliable enough for me to use on my phone's hotspot instead. The fridge was nowhere near 40 degrees. No coffee maker in the room. The bath needed a solid vacuuming (hair in the corners) and the grout needed a good scrubbing with bleach. The shower system in the bathroom was broken (but still usable): the controls were loose, the drain cover was not fixed and a large amount of water flowed down the wall from the handheld device even when it was turned off. And the drain backed up, even after they tried Liquid Plumbr. (It was eventually fixed by our 3rd day.) The toiletry bottle caps are the perfect size to fall into the sink drain -- which they will -- and clog that up, too. 

Again, these are things you don't notice until you're there for a bit and start looking around. Would I stay here again, even at the reasonable (for NY) price I paid: no. (And eff those "resort fees" the hotels are all charging; this was $45 for 2 nights, and I can't explain why.)

title: Horribly Dirty Hotel
text: Place looks good until you get to your room which is dirty with really dirty bathrooms and fridges and old fashioned tv. Really needs a good overhaul. Was originally staying at the Hilton but changed to the Empire because it was the Gossip Girl Hotel. Big Mistake!!! Expected so much more

title: Don’t bother
text: We were so excited to be staying at this hotel being Gossip girl fans ! However the staff were not pleasant, friendly or well mannered . We went up to the rooftop to have dinner and enjoy the view but were only allowed to sit In one area, as the rest of the bar area was reserved (it was 10:30pm and not a busy night) We walked to the enclosed area to sit and finish our drinks, but were told by Karen that the area was closing . Not more than a minute later a man and women walked in and sat down and were not told to leave!!! As paying guests and visitors to your hotel, we expected more . To top it off , on checking out we waited at the front desk to hand our keys in and the two women would not even acknowledge us . This was a very disappointing experience and we will tell our friends NOT to stay here !!

title: Do not recommend!
text:
Terrible Hotel. They can't borrow you scissors. That is their policy. You can walk into hotel with gun, but the won't borrow you scissors, because you can hurt someone. 

When asking the manager for help, he turns away and starts to walk away from you to elevator. In the middle of your sentence. Very rude language and behavior.

I was charged for minibar use which was false. When i pointed out that mistake and wrote a ticket to resolve the issue, nothing happened. Still didn't get any response after 3 e-mails and two weeks of time.

title: Loved our stay
text:
I stayed a week with my teenage daughter. The staff was friendly - our room spacious and clean- the pool on the top was very small (don’t expect to swim) but quite refreshing after a day in the city.  Wifi came and went. Very cool lounge area on the roof. (White wine was served in a disposable water glass (come on ... that is a no-go at 15 usd)). But in bar area on the floor below,  good cocktails and wine were served (in real glasses). 
But basically good location and value.

title: Over rated price and low quality service
text: I was very disappointed. It was not worth if its price. No microwave available to warm up any food and no coffee in the room. Rooftop service was one of the worst. When you need a servant you had to go look for one yourself. When you placed the order, it took forever and they kept coming at different time. The best service was the towel guy, handing the towel and picking up after everyone and cleaning the pool area so that it didnt look so bad.

title: Quiet interior room!!!!
text: Perfect location to Lincoln Center and Central Park.   Interior rooms with no view are super quiet.  Staff is perfect.  Love the modern setting.  My three teenage girls would go back!  Close to subway!  Small pool but still a luxury in NYC.

title: Don't bother
text: The only thing good about this hotel is the location.  The staff here are rude, unhelpful and patronizing.  We had dinner one night on the rooftop restaurant and no one greeted us, no one bothered to say hello, welcome. Nothing.  It seems that you have to "be someone" or look a certain way otherwise they pay you no attention. I also asked for our air conditioning to be turned down (there are no controls to do it yourself) and this was never done, needless to say we all ended up with the flu. Worst hotel experience of my life and I travel a fair amount.

title: 😡
text: Very disappointed.... Unless you have plenty of money don't bother going... No coffee tea in rooms and didn't even get complimentary bottles of water... Couldn't use the top deck or pool (was it even  a pool) as there were parties up there and closed off to the public...

title: A lot more to be appreciated
text:
We have chosen to stay at the Empire hotel mostly because of the location. We were going to spend most of our time at the Lincoln center. We really liked the open feeling from the building in addition to the convenience of the location, which is rare to find in Manhattan. 

The rooftop bar is not to be missed. 360 degree view of the city and the giant light up ‘Empire Hotel’ sign really give you the feeling of you’re in the middle of NYC! We knew we were having a great time.

The kindness and friendliness of the staff is really what moved me the most. They almost seem to exist every corner of the hotel building to offer you help even before you realize you need one.

title: Hotel deixa a desejar
text: Hotel decadente:  excelente localização. Mas o hotel precisa se reinventar e precisa de uma reforma e investimento. Os quartos deixam a desejar pois estão muito antigos.  E o atendimento já foi bem mais cordial.   O front desk é bem antipatico salvo raras e honrosas excessões (Em nossa experiência Randol e Luis, que foram muito atenciosos). As mulheres são péssimas, antipáticas e  com má vontade.

title: Nice clean room and location
text: I stayed here for a night at the end of my business trip and was pleased with the clean, quiet room and nice bathroom.  Centrally located between Columbus Circle and the Upper West side this hotel has a friendly staff, especially the valets who educated me on the cheapest way to the airport.  😀

title: Location and view were amazing
text: We had lovely view of Lincoln plaza and the room was very spacious compared to other rooms we have stayed in NYC. Shower had wonderful water pressure! Really great experience overall and we are already planning our next stay.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: Very enjoyable stay, great location to shops, Central Park and Times Square! Would definitely recommend for anybody visiting New York. The facilities are clean and all staff are very friendly and helpful!!

title: Great staff, deteriorated & dirty facilities
text:
I stayed 2 nights in this hotel because my graduation was across the street at the Lincoln Center. First, kudos to the staff, the doormen and front desk staff are super nice and quick to help. 

My only complaint is the actual facilities, having paid just under 1k for 2 nights I feel my room was too dirty and deteriorated. My bathroom door looked like it had exploded and someone spackled it back together, however, my biggest complaint is about the MANY white crusty stains throughout the room, especially above BOTH beds, the pics are one of each of the two beds; if you use a black light I'm sure the room would light up like a Christmas tree, gross! Please, if you're going to have fabric headboards and/or texturized wallpaper, implement appropriate cleaning routines.

title: I enjoyed my stay
text: I can definitely recommend and I’ll definitely return. My family can contest to this as well. Thank you for your hospitality. My trip was well worth every minute spent. The food and drinks were delicious and if I didn’t have a budget, I’d definitely try everything on the menu.

title: Empire Hotel
text: Nice, comfortable hotel with a great location to see New York. Had a lovely room at the front of the hotel, quite spacious and with a comfortable super kingsize bed. All hotel staff were pleasant and available at any time of day. The subway was 2 minutes away with easy access to all the major attractions we wished to see. Central Park was a 5 minute stroll away. Stayed for 5 days and would definitely return to this hotel if visiting New York again.

title: Best Experience at Upper West Dide
text: Very nice hotel. Extremely clean & comfortable.. Beautiful rooftop with amazing views. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the friendly reception staff. Shops,restaurants bars and the Lincoln Center, are within walking distance..Would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody! It's a sample of excellent hospitality.

title: Very nice hotel with a great staff
text: We stayed here recently and could not be more satisfied. The rooms are very nice and comfy. This hotel is in a great location to enjoy NYC. As I mentioned in the title the staff were very attentive and friendly. Andrea in the lobby bar was exceptional and very welcoming.. a real pleasure.

title: Hotel bem localizado perto central park
text:
Hotel bem localizado. Em frente ao lincon Center, há duas quadras do Central Park. Varios restaurantes proximos. Duas estações de metro bem proximas, uma a Columbus Cicle, permite que acesse o aeroporto de Metro, se tiver pouca bagagem. 
O Hotel é um pouco antigo, mas em NY todos são assim. Quarto de bom tamanho.
Me hospedaria novamente neste local.

title: Nice location
text:
We originally booked a standard double queen room. The room was small and dark it was also on the 11th floor near the lift, which after the 1st night realised it was the floor to the rooftop bar. Lots of noise of people going back to rooms from the bar and had loud noise of fans or generator outside. We asked for a different room and with the wonderful assistance given by Danny at reception, decided to upgrade to a king size on 8th floor. Well worth the upgrade the room was very light and spacious (no comparison to the double queen box room). Great shower plenty of hot water and good WiFi. The room was at the side of the building with view of the Plaza. The only strange thing was that the cheaper room provided a coffee machine and free bottles of water which was not provided in the more expensive room? The hotel lobby bar was relaxed and staff very attentive. Prices are expensive but only what you would expect from hotel. We did not have breakfast at hotel as $30 seemed high Starbucks round the corner and a delicatessen Mellisa’s which had fruit pots yoghurts pastries etc was a better and much cheaper option. The immediate area is quieter but still has a selection of restaurants near by & only few minute walk to Columbus circle where you will find Central Park and lots of shops and restaurants. You will also find the Wholefood Market located at Columbus Circle in shopping centre just take the escalator down. Fantastic selection of fresh food great place to get a picnic to take to the park or buy then eat at the cafe. 
Metro ticket to use on buses and underground is a great way to get around Manhattan. We would stay at the Empire again the majority of the staff cannot do enough for you.

title: Empire Hotel needs an upgrade.
text: Hotel rooms in need of an upgrade. Some rooms are so small you barely have room for a suitcase. Closets are not full length so if you have a gown to hang, forget it. AC didn’t work in two different rooms.

title: Know the hidden costs before staying..
text:
Upon arrival we had to pay a $150 deposit that wasn't initially stated anywhere before arrival. No confirmation email from hotel to confirm details and let us know this information.
We got the keys for the room and we paid for a Junior king suite, the keys didn't work twice and twice we had to go up and downstairs to get fresh keys with finally the third working. The receptionist said it can be altered by phone and electronics but neither of ours did as I didn't have mine on me whatsoever. We get into the room and find ourselves disappointed to be on the third floor with no real "stunning city views" which Is what we paid the money for in the first place in buying a Junior King Suite instead of a normal Double room. 
We looked around for an information welcome book which we had usually found in every hotel we have stayed in, detailing the prices of different services, room service menu, information regarding bar opening times, food service times etc. but we couldn't find any info whatsoever, not on the tv welcome menu either.

Overall over the week we ordered food and found one day we would get more wings than the other which made the price we paid only worth paying half the time.
We ordered takeout on one of these nights and left the pizza boxes on the table with another bag of rubbish we had cleaned up and on two occasions these weren't taken. The second day we left a nice note asking the cleaner to please take the pizza boxes and rubbish bag and for the second time they didn't take either.
we then found on the last day that coming back from dinner, the bed was made as usual but only 3 towels in the bathroom out of 6? No hand towels whatsoever, 2 Bath towels and one small towel was all that was on the rack and the towels didn't seem to have been turned over at all, just folded and put back on the rack. 

Then upon checkout was our worst experience of all, finding out that we owed $162 for residents fee. Again, nowhere at all did it say anywhere about this fee, and nor was it ever mentioned to us during checkout or our stay at all. We were looking forward to the $150 refund which is what we were told, that it was a damage deposit we would get back but we knew this wasn't true as they immediately liquidated that money into the $162 we owed for the residents fee and they did that before even checking the room to see if it did have any damages. This just seemed like a ploy into making people happier into paying the huge residents fee because they already have $150 "credit"

Overall, we were really dissatisfied and will not be choosing to stay again not for the same price anyway.
All bar and restaurant staff were very polite during our stay on the whole and the food was also good but very overpriced.

I hope these issues can be raised so that other people don't have to experience the same we did.

title: Good location, room leaves much to desire
text:
We spent 2 nights here at the tail end of a long vacation in other 4 and 5 Star hotels. When checking in, the room wasn’t available at the checkin time. We had to wait a bit, but they held our luggage so it was fine.

The room was a mess and just felt grimy in general. The carpets look like they have never been cleaned. In the nook where they had the mini fridge (on the carpet) the surrounding carpet was so filthy you can see a thick layer of grey dust all over it. Wallpaper was ripped, doors and walls had grimy smears and dents and paint chips. The caulking in the bathroom was smeared all over and the fake plastic wooden laminate flooring was used as tile in the shower with the same weird smudges caulking. The shower has mildew all around it. 

We stayed in room 1023 and the bed closest to the door was so loud and creaky. It makes a loud popping sound with even the tiniest movement, as if the springs were broken? It was a very uncomfortable bed and I hardly slept.

The location is nice, we were close to the park and places we needed to be. 

The front desk staff at checkin was really nice and the man who held our luggage was also very nice.

If the rooms were cleaner, it would have gotten a better review.

title: Great location
text: We enjoyed our stay here after a long flight from Rome. Check in was fast and super friendly although they were very busy. The lovely woman at the front desk  was wonderful and had great recommendations. The rooms were clean and a nice size. The location was very convenient and check out was a breeze.

title: cramped quarters, loud a.c.
text: Room was very small, even for NYC. Air conditioner was noisy. Bathroom door was rusty and peeling paint in places. Hallways were kind of dark. The location is about the only thing going for this hotel. The lobby is pleasant enough, but the rooms are disappointing.

title: Lovely
text: I spend a lot of time in NYC and this hotel exceeded my expectations. Location was terrific, staff courteous and helpful. I will definitely return. Be certain to check out the rooftop views - I didn't catch them until I was checking out. Don't forget your bathing suit in the summer - pool is small but fun!

title: нормальный отель , но...
text:
Останавливалась в июне, в целом оценивала отель как нормальный, с идеальным местом расположения, но очень маленькими номерами, отсутствием минибара и требующий реновации.
Но! До момента, пока отель у меня не списал неправомерно деньги с карты через несколько дней после выезда и полной оплаты!!! Ну бывает, что-то могли перепутать, могли забыть. К сожалению выяснить в чем причина не удается, менеджмент отеля вопросы игнорирует, на письма не отвечает. Будьте внимательны, проверяйте свои карты на предмет списания отелем

title: L'accoglienza italiana a NY
text: Posizione strategica e centrale ideale per visitare la città. L'albergo è bellissimo e il suo roof top è davvero spettacolare! La gentilezza e professionalità dello staff sono state encomiabili... nota particolare a Pasquale che con la sua gentilezza ci ha fatto davvero sentire a casa.

title: Business Trip
text: I stayed only one night at the hotel. The room is very small, the bathroom is even smaller. There are an annoying noise outside of the room and the air conditioned also makes too much noise. The only solution was to use earplugs.

title: Empire Hotel
text: The Empire Hotel was enjoyable except for the fact that there was way to receive coffee in the room.  No coffee maker, no room service, nothing but "leave the hotel and go to Starbucks" is what we were told.  We will never stay there again...

title: Fabulous!!!
text: Loved our stay at the Empire. Check In was so easy, room was always spotless. The door men are SO great at helping you with directions and getting a taxi. We felt very safe and the location can’t be beat. I wish we had control of the thermostat but that’s my only complaint.

title: Terrible place in a good location downtown
text: The whole experience was terrible.  So I booked this because I’m a gossip girl fan and all I have to say is chuck bass is a liar lol. Hotel made us wait hours for the room to be ready, they were unapologetic about it.  Got to the room with a view of a brick wall and it was filthy dirty.  Bad smell and we wouldn’t dare shower.  Overall just a huge disappointment.  Booked for 2 nights and checked out after the first night, wouldn’t stay there again if it was free.  One positive is the location is fantastic.

title: Great location but...
text: Bed were too firm and the rooftop bar doesn’t allow you to bill food to your room, so if you just run upstairs for a quick meal or drink be sure to bring entire wallet. It was an not convenient at times.

title: Empire hotel - good location main selling point
text: Great great location and very comfy bed and good wifi. Very very noisy and small room. Not provided with daily water which is charged for and when this was brought to attention at reception still did not receive it. Also they take a 150 euro deposit when you arrive. Light in room broken and little space to store clothing.
